item.title: 00130Gallery
item.description: Gallery's profile has been from the beginning an artist-run and a non-profit space. The main idea behind the gallery´s ideology is to support young contemporary artists and a non commercial projects in all mediums.

item.title: 2 OR+ by Yat
item.description: In addition to the brand´s own 2or+ by YAT collection, the boutique also carries international lines such as Junya Watanabe, Comme des Garçons, A.F. Vandevorst and Maison Martin Margiela as well as shoes by Trippen. Simple and minimalist clothes with a twist.

item.title: A. Tillander
item.description: Jewellery shop, also exhibitions

item.title: A21 Cocktail Lounge
item.description: Awarded as the worlds best bar, A21 Cocktail Lounge is a must place for anyone interested in Finnish cocktails and drinking culture. The amazing cocktail list includes a Suomi / Finland -section that captures the tastes of Finland in a glass. The venue is very stylish and the evenings experience is finalized with personal service. Table reservations recommended during weekends. A21 organizes cocktail schools / cocktail parties for groups.

item.title: A21 Dining
item.description: Welcome to the Finnish nature in the heart of Helsinki. A21 Dining presents the best stories and flavors of Finland. Here you're invited to experience Finland's beautiful nature as a concept created by A21 Cocktail Lounge in form of Mind Dining. For each season you will find a theme menu which will lead you onto a unforgettable journey. These menus can be found in three, five or seven leg journey sceneries.
item.matko:groups: Suitable for groups - one menu set per group - chose between 3, 5 or 7 courses.

item.title: Aalto University School of Economics
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km

item.title: Aarikka Factory Shop
item.description: Wooden jewelry, interior design and gifts.

item.title: Aarikka-shop
item.description: Aarikka Oy is a family business founded in 1954. The company designs and manufactures design products, jewellery and decorative items mainly in wood. Each product is a unique item handmade in Finland using Finnish materials.

item.title: Academic Bookshop
item.description: Interior planned by Alvar Aalto in 1961-1986.

item.title: Acolyth fashionstore
item.description: Finnish and international designer fashion for men and women. Clothing, shoes, accessories. Products are available also in the webshop: www.acolyth.com. 21 Finnish and international fashion brands, such as Ann-Sofie Back, Closed, Christopher Shannon, Stephan Schneider, Won Hundred, David Andersen, Puma by Hussein Chalayan, b Store, Joomi Lim, Yvonne Koné.
item.matko:location: The shop is located approximately 100 meters to the southwest from the crossroad between Fredrikinkatu and Iso Roobertinkatu.
item.matko:groups: Groups get a 10 % discount on shopping that exceeds 300 €. For orders in our webshop you have right to a 10 % discount as well, by code aco10.
item.matko:services: 21 Finnish and international fashion brands, such as Ann-Sofie Back, Closed, Christopher Shannon, Stephan Schneider, Won Hundred, David Andersen, Puma by Hussein Chalayan, b Store, Joomi Lim, Yvonne Koné.

item.title: Adams - Club & Restaurant
item.description:
Adams is a nightclub located at Erottaja, in the very heart of Helsinki. Opened in the spring of 2012, its program focuses on contemporary dance music and features interesting Finnish and international artists such as Ellen Allien, Andrew Weatherall, Apparat and Jori Hulkkonen. A modern Mexican kitchen and bar Shanghai Cowboy operates under the same roof. The kitchen has a fresh and innovative menu and it is open until late in the evening.
The stately building was completed in 1886 and served as a cinema between 1915 and 1987. Adams revisits this tradition with occasional film screenings on Friday nights.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Total including foyers and corridors c. 400 sq.m.

item.title: AEL Hotel
item.description: Accomodation in a quiet environment, AEL-Hotel is situated close to the AEL Center for Technical Training in Malminkartano, approx. 10 km from the Helsinki city centre.
item.matko:location: In Malminkartano, approx.10km from Helsinki city centre, by M-train ~15 min., buses 45, 39, 39A (to/from Kamppi). Approx. 14 km to the Helsinki Airport (30 min).
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 30 single rooms, 40 double rooms, non-smoking. All rooms are equipped with shower, hairdryer, TV, telephone and refrigerator. The price includes breakfast, sauna and the possibility to use the gym. WLAN.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The AEL Restaurant serves the students of AEL, hotelguests of the AEL Hotel and convention guests. 230 seats. Breakfast served at the restaurant, otherwise for private functions.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The AEL Hotel reception is situated in the AEL main building. Free parking space.

item.title: AEL-auditorio
item.description: Auditorium with modern AV equipment for 215 persons.
item.matko:location: City centre 12 km, airport 14 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: AEL-Hotel, 30 single and 40 double non-smoking rooms with wireless connections
item.matko:restaurantinfo: AEL-Restaurant for 230 persons (Mon-Fri)

item.title: Aero
item.description: Aero Design Furniture concentrates on modern design of the highest quality in aesthetic and use. The collection includes classics, now almost icons, and contemporary designers' products. Besides new models the shop also sells old masterpieces from the golden age of Finnish design.

item.title: Agros Vault
item.description: The Agros Vault (Agroksenmäen holvikellari) has a history that dates back around 150 years. This old brewery building has been renovated respecting its history and the original handicraft. A banquet hall with beautiful natural granite stone walls offers unforgettable surroundings for your event. The Agros Vault has proved to be an excellent location for seminars, dinners, theme parties and exhibitions. Also perfect for private events, such as weddings and anniversaries. There is unrestricted catering in the premises. Also furniture and decoration rental services available.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 16 km

item.title: Ahjo Bar & Night Club
item.description: Ahjo is a combined bar, lounge and night club in the life style hotel Klaus K.

item.title: Aino
item.description: Finnish distinct design clothes for different body-types in high-quality fabrics made mainly out of natural fibres

item.title: Airport Hotel Bonus Inn
item.description:
Independent, friendly Airport Hotel Bonus Inn offers you quiet and relaxing accommodation between flights or after a long business day. Each room offers an en-suite bathroom with shower, international TV, free wireless WiFi, and digital Quadrigan Genesis system for fast internet access and movies, direct-dial phone, fridge or a mini-bar and coffee/tea making facilities. Standard rooms also have a kitchenette. Superior rooms are located on top floors.
Family operated, contemporary Airport Hotel Bonus Inn is a member of WORLDHOTELS, Comfort Collection and of Private Hotels, Finland.
item.matko:location: Close to the Helsinki Airport, Helsinki City centre 19 km

item.title: Akvart Galleria
item.description: Art gallery

item.title: Aleksi 13
item.description: A department store specialized in clothes, shoes and accessories.

item.title: Alexander Theatre
item.description: The Alexander Theatre is a beautiful building completed on the Bulevardi in 1879. Former Finnish National Opera. Visiting music and theatre performances.
item.matko:location: Tram 6
item.matko:admission: Different price groups. Detailed information about the tickets available on the programme pages.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs to main stage, assistant needed, lift and Inva-WC, please notify in advance.
item.matko:services: Interval refreshments: Sodexo, tel. +358 (0)40 755 3065, Mon-Fri 12-15.

item.title: Alhovuori
item.description: 11 different slopes.

item.title: Allergy House
item.description: Allergy house is an example of a healthy building. In the centre of the house there is good space for exhibitions and cocktail parties. In the house there is an auditorium for 130 persons, sauna and swimming pool.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Lunch restaurant for 80 persons
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Foyer for exhibitions

item.title: Allotria
item.description: Restaurant Allotria is a cozy neighbourhood restaurant in Vallila distric. Music Theatre Kapsäkki next doors arranges musical events in the restaurant regularly.

item.title: Alppipuisto Park
item.description: Located between Linnanmäki amusementpark and the traintracks. The history of Alppipuistopark streches back to the 1800's. The park is popular among locals of Alppila. The green grass, ponds with fountains, small sightseeing terrace and the rough rocky environment create a unique atmosphere.
item.matko:ingress: The park is popular among locals of Alppila.

item.title: Amado
item.description: Classical and trendy second hand -clothes.

item.title: Amarillo
item.description: Texmex restaurant and bar in two floors with restaurant, Street Bar and Amarillo Nights nightclub. Age limit 20years (Street Bar after 18.00 age limit 22years).
item.matko:open: Ground floor open Mon-Thu 11-23, Fri 11-04, Sat 12-04, Sun 12-23, (kitchen open Mon-Thu & Sun until 22, Fri-Sat until 23.30) Amarillo Nights open Wed, Fri-Sat 21-04, Sun 22-04.

item.title: American Bar
item.description: The American Bar at Sokos Hotel Torni is one of the most international cocktail bars in town. A bold combination of the spirit of our times and the traditions of the 1930's. The bar is the right choise when you're in a mood for a sophisticated party, perhaps drink or for the wine/ bier. Seats for 75 classy customers.

item.title: Amigo
item.description: Spanish style restaurant Amigo, founded in 1971 in Ullanlinna, still serves classical Amigo dishes, such as eg. steaks served on a cutting board and Paella Valenciana. Lunch Mon-Fri 11-15. It is also possible to just pop in for eg. tapas or a glass of wine. The bar is open every day 14-02.

item.title: Amos Anderson Art Museum
item.description: Amos Anderson Art Museum is the biggest private art museum in Finland. Its collection comprises mainly contemporary Finnish art, art and furnishings from Amos Anderson's private collections and Finnish and foreign art from the collection of architect Sigurd Frosterus. The museum arranges 8-11 changing exhibitions every year.
item.matko:open: Mon, Thu & Fri 10-18, Tue closed, Wed 10-20, Sat-Sun 11-17.
item.matko:admission: Adults 8€, children under 18 years free, students 2€, seniors 6€
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, 2 lifts, Inva-WC, assistant needed.
item.matko:groups: Guides can be booked in advance, weekdays 50€, Sat 75€ and Sun 100€. Schoolgroups Mon-Fri 10-16 40€. Schoolgroups are kindly asked to inform their arrival in advance. Admission: children under 18 years free, senior groups (min. 15 persons) 4€/person, other adult groups 6€/person (min. 15 person).
item.matko:services: Café Amos, tel. 09-6844 4636, ca 30 seats , open Mon-Fri 9-18, Sat-Sun 10-17. Museum shop tel. 09-6844 4635. Parking at P-Forum.

item.title: Andorra
item.description: New cultural and recreational complex Andorra is comprised of four distinct spaces: Corona Bar & Billiards and Kafe Moskova on the ground floor, plus movie theatre Kino and Dubrovnik Lounge & Lobby in the basement. We have reconstructed the basement's movie theatre, formerly known as Andorra, for new use. Hall number one has been left as a theatre and named as Kino. Hall number two and lobby have been renovated as Dubrovnik Lounge & Lobby bar, named after a neonlight from Aki Kaurismäki's movie "Drifting Clouds".
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km

item.title: Anna K. Karaokebar
item.description: Popular karaoke bar and pub in the city centre.

item.title: AnnaK
item.description: The AnnaK conference facilities are situated on the top floor at Annankatu 24. There is one larger conference room for up to 50 people and four smaller meeting rooms.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Annala Garden
item.description: Garden
item.matko:location: Tram 6. Buses 68, 71, 71V and 73B from the Railway Square, bus 74 from Hakaniemi.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups by appointment.
item.matko:services: Happenings

item.title: Anne's Shop
item.description: Anne's Shop, situated next to the Temppeliaukio church ("rock-church"), is one of the oldest souvenir shops in Finland.
item.matko:open: Open in summer daily at 9-18, in winter 9-17. Open also during holidays eg. midsummer and new year.

item.title: Annikki Karvinen
item.description: Annikki Karvinen's business idea is to manufacture high-quality garments to people who value unique design. Developing the handwoven 'poppana' fabric is Annikki's innovation, which has made her known as a brave and creative designer both home and abroad. Annikki has turned handwoven fabrics into international fashion. In 2008, it was 40 years since Annikki Karvinen started her design business. Nowadays, both production and the head office are located in Jyväskylä, central Finland. The company's flagship store is located in Helsinki on Pohjoisesplanadi. Oy Annikki Karvinen Ltd. is a family business.

item.title: Ansa
item.description: Selected second hand clothes to fit the fashion trends of today.

item.title: ANT gallery
item.description: art gallery

item.title: Apartementos Helsinki
item.description: Apertementos Helsinki rents modern, fully furnished and well equipped apartments in the heart of Helsinki. The surroundings are quiet and within walking distance from the city centre.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 17 km. Kulmakatu 6, Kirjatyöntekijänkatu 14 and Iso Roobertinkatu 3-5
item.matko:admission: The minimum reservation period is four days, price per day 100-115 €.
item.matko:services: In addition to the double bed, both apartments have a convertible sofa for additional guests. All linen is included. Both apartments have a TV, broadband internet connection washing machine, a dishwasher, a microwave, a coffee maker etc.

item.title: Apartment Hotel ESSEXhome
item.description:
Beautiful and totally modern, just renovated apartments are located in a magnificent art nouveau milieu on the quiet Luotsikatu-street (Katajanokka), only a short walking distance from the downtown area of Helsinki.
Each apartment has a dishwasher, refrigerator/freezer, microwave, coffee and kettle, toaster, tableware and cooking equipment, washing machine, ironing equipment, vacuum cleaner, TV, wireless internet connection, parquet floor, etc.
Cleaning is performed and linen & towels are changed weekly.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, tram stop 200 m, airport 18 km

item.title: Apartment hotel Huoneistohotelli Gella Oy
item.description: High standard apartments in all sizes varying from smaller one and two room apartments to larger, up to four room apartments with separate bedrooms. All apartments are fully fitted up with modern conveniences and fine quality furniture.
item.matko:location: Apartments are located in the city centre. Apartments also in Lauttasaari, Espoo and, down the subway towards the east, Kaarikuja. Airport 20 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 50 apartments; from studio apartmets to apartments with three rooms

item.title: Apartment Hotel Niko
item.description: Fully furnished apartments in downtown Helsinki.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:admission: 45-173 euros/day. The minimum renting period is seven days. The daily rate may vary if your stay lasts for more than 4 weeks. Tailormade offers for monthly stays.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Apartments from studios to 4 bedroom apartments in the city centre.
item.matko:additionalinfo: TV, VCR, basic appliances, a washing machine, crockery and cutlery. Many of the apartments also have a dishwasher, the possibility to use the telephone and a car parking space. Of interest to foreign guests will also be the possibility to connect up to cable TV, through which Helsinki receives satellite TV channels.

item.title: Apartment Månsas
item.description:
This modem 2 rcoms apartuent, which accommodates 4-5 people ,was firlly rcnovated in 2012 and includes ftee Wi-Fi access, a home theaier system nand a firlly equipped kitchen. Paloheinä Golf Course is 4 krn away. Parking is ftee on site.
A seating area is featured in the bright living room . Kitchen facilities include a stove, fiidge, fteeze, toaster, microwave oven aud cofee machine. The tiled bathroom includes a shower, washing machine and fte€ toiletios.
Leisurc facilities include a bookable sauna in the building and a private children's playgoundjust outside. The nearest grocery store and restaurant are 100 metres away.
Pirkkola Reoreational Centre is 1.6 km away. The ski trails at Paloheinä arc 3 .5 km ftom the apartment.
item.matko:location: City centre 15 min, airport 10 min.

item.title: ApartmentHelsinki
item.description:
This very recently renovated studio apartment has a fully equipped kitchen and a bathroom with shower. Accomodating up to 3 persons. Smoking is prohibited.
In the apartment there is a dish washer, washing machine, TV, stereo equipment, w-lan, linen, towels and kitchenware, all included in the room rate.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 14 km
item.matko:admission: 1 to 2 persons 65 € per night. 3 persons 85 € per night (with extra bed). On weekends the minimum stay is 2 nights, i.e. from Friday to Sunday.

item.title: Apollo Live Club & Cafe
item.description:
Built into an old movie theater Apollo live club is an event restaurant that has been operating inside Forum shopping center since 2007.
During weekend nights Apollo live club merges with Forum's inner court yard creating a large unique venue setting as a nightclub and a live club. With top-of-the-game Scandinavian cover bands Apollo live club's live music playing 'till 3 am, the nights at Apollo are something nobody forgets.
Apollo live club also has a cellar called THE PIT that serves its customers with Heavy / Hard rock atmosphere, roasted with sports screenings.
item.matko:open: Street Café: Mon-Thu 11-21, Fri 11-04, Sat 14-04. Live Club: Fri-Sat 22-04
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Week nights and early evenings during weekends you can find versatile events from Stand Up nights to theater performances and gigs by well known artists.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The sales services of Night People Group are open Mon-Fri at 020 7759 814, myynti@npg.fi. Apollo Live Club & Café is part of Night People Group.

item.title: Arabia Factory and Factory Outlet
item.description: Stylish products for the home can be found at the Arabia Factory Outlet, the largest single sales centre for Arabia, Iittala and Hackman products. The store includes special discounts and mark-down prices. Taxfree and export service.
item.matko:location: Tram number 6 from the city centre.
item.matko:open: Factory shop: Mon-Fri 10-20, Sat-Sun 10-16. Arabia Museum and Gallery: Tue-Fri 12-18, Sat-Sun 10-16 (Mon closed)
item.matko:admission: Entrance fee for the Arabia Museum and Gallery: adults 3€, children(under 12years), students and pensioners 1,50€.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair, assistant needed, lift, no Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Entrance fee for groups to the Arabia Museum and Gallery: 1,50€/pers. (min.8persons). Guided tours of the factory (during office hours for the factory) and museum by request, inquiries mon-fri 12-15, tel.+358(0)204 39 5326, e-mail:arabia.visitors@iittala.com.
item.matko:services: Arabia Museum and Gallery, also other factory shops in the building.
item.matko:ingress: The largest single sales centre for Arabia, Iittala and Hackman products.

item.title: Arabia Museum and Gallery
item.description: The permanent exhibition of the Arabia Museum displays Arabia utility and art ceramics over a period of 130 years. The gallery is devoted to special exhibitions, historical and contemporary ceramics and glass. The museum is a part of the Design Museum.
item.matko:location: Tram nr. 6 from the city centre.
item.matko:admission: Adults 3€, children 1,50€. The admission fee includes access both to the museum and the gallery.
item.matko:groups: Entrance fee for groups 1,50€/person (min. 8 persons). Guided tours by request. A visit to the Arabia factory and Iittala Group's show room can also be included in the tour. Bookings and inquiries: Taina Grönqvist, (Mon-Thu), tel.+358(0)204-39 5326, fax +358 (0)204-39 5180, e-mail: taina.gronqvist@iittala.com.
item.matko:services: Factory's retail shop. In the building also other retail shops and eg. lunch restaurant May.

item.title: Aralis Gallery
item.description: The Gallery exhibits the works of artists from the school of Art and Design.

item.title: Armas Design
item.description: Armas Design is a shop in the Punavuori district selling textiles, small furniture, ceramics, glass and other designs for interior decoration. Brands include e.g. HAY, Muuto and Tom Dixon.

item.title: Art Poster Gallery
item.description: Gallery.

item.title: Art Salon Piirto
item.description: The Art Salon/Art Gallery has two floors and is comprised of the permanent exhibition of Tapani Piirto´s works and monthly changing temporary exhibitions of visiting artists - both Finnish and foreign.

item.title: Artek
item.description: Finnish design furniture (eg. designed by Alvar Aalto Artek was founded in 1935 by four young Finns led by the visionary modern architect Alvar Aalto. Alvar Aalto began designing furnishings as a natural and important extension of his architectural thinking. His first modern furniture was created in 1931-32 for the tuberculosis sanatorium in Paimio, which proved to be his international breakthrough. Artek was set up in 1935 to market Aalto's furniture, lamps and textiles, particularly on international markets where Artek focused its operations from the initial stages
item.matko:services: Artek is renowned as one of the most innovative contributions to modern design. Long-term durability and high quality combined with a clean-lined form language are the essential elements in the creation of every single product that bears the Artek name. Artek's comprehensive furnishing system can be used in all kinds of situations from public spaces to offices, museums to schools, hotels to homes.

item.title: Artisaani
item.description: The Artisaani arts and crafts shop was established in 1975. Today a group of craftsmen run the shop where 60 artists' works are presented. All products are unique Finnish handmade items and high quality studio products. In Artisaani you will find eg. clothes, accessories, interior textiles, pottery, glass, graphics, jewelry and wood products.

item.title: Artists' Studio
item.description: Artists' Studio is a gallery for young contemporary art in the centre of Helsinki

item.title: Aschan Café Jugend
item.description: The Aschan Café Jugend is situated in the premises of what originally was a bank designed by architect Lars Sonck. Also a winebar.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:open: Café: Mon-Fri 9-19, Sat 10-18, Sun 11-18. Winebar: Wed-Sat 16-20

item.title: Asoka
item.description: Asoka is a grocery store specialized in vegetarian products. All products are vegan.
item.matko:location: In Sörnäinen

item.title: Astialiisa
item.description: Astialiisa is a design, home decor and dish shop in Töölö. Its collections include selections of Finnish dishes from the last 100 years: Old and new pieces from Arabia as well as glass from Iittala and Nuutajärvi. Astialiisa also has a generous Moomin department: dishes, toys, magnets and more. Astialiisa arranges exhibitions and events together with collectors.
item.matko:open: Mon 12-17, Tue-Thu 10-18, Fri 10-17, Sat 10-14 (closed on Saturdays in July)

item.title: Astiataivas
item.description: Astiataivas.fi is the shopping place for all the friends of old dishware! You will find arabia, kupittaan savi, art glass and lots of other lovely products.

item.title: Astoria Ball Room
item.description: The centrally located and historical Astoria-sali (Astoria Ball Room) offers great facilities for various events like auctions, conferences, seminars and meetings. Astoria-sali has been functioning since 1929. Originally the venue was designed to be a movie theatre, but since 1993 it has been working as functional ballroom. Neoclassical Astoria-sali offers spacious and distinguished venue, with the height of 9 metres, oak parquet and wall and sealing ornaments. Besides the main ballroom, the facilities include i.e. the loft of the ballroom, street level bar and lobby with spacious wardrobe amenities, cabinet and bar facilities in the ground floor. Time for tea catering Ltd. will take care of all the practical arrangements from decorations to catering with the help of the experienced staff.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, easier entry from the gateway.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Own café and first-class catering service by arrangement
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Total including foyers and corridors c. 600 sq.m.

item.title: Asuna
item.description: Asuna is a modern designers clothing store. Strong Finnish designers together with international high class brands (eg. Marithe & Franqois Girbaud, Comme des Garcons, Mary Katrantzou, Y-3 Yohji Yamamoto, SLVR, Rick Owens) bring an interesting and impressive touch to Asuna's collection.

item.title: Ateljé Finne
item.description: The sculptor Gunnar Finne had his ateljé at Arkadiankatu 14 in the 1920's. In the 1960's the place was transformed into a Restaurant. The menu of Atelje Finne focuses on Finnish ingredients.

item.title: Ateljee Bar
item.description: The Ateljee Bar with its famous terrace is situated at Sokos Hotel Torni, on the 14th floor. There's a unique view over the Helsinki skyline. The artistic bar, opened as early as 1951, also workes as an art gallery with monthly exhibitions. This intimate and romantic location has room for 30 customers indoors and 12 on the terrace in summer. A great view over Helsinki can be seen from the Ladies and Gentlemen's rooms. Age limit 20years.

item.title: Ateneum Art Museum
item.description: Ateneum Art Museum houses the largest collections of art in Finland with more than 20,000 works of art from the 1750s to the 1950s. The changing exhibitions are on display on the ground floor and in the exhibition halls on the second floor. Ateneum also organises various workshops, guided tours and other programme. The Ateneum building was designed by the architect Theodor Höijer and it was completed in 1887. Ateneum Art Museum is part of the Finnish National Gallery.
item.matko:admission: Admission fee 12/10€, children under 18 free admission.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair, entrance from Ateneuminkuja. All exhibitions accessible by lift. Wheelchairs for loan, further details from the info desk during museum opening hours. Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Guide booking, tel. +358 (0)9 6122 5520 (Tue-Fri 9-12). Max. 25persons/group. Languages available: Finnish, Swedish, English, French, Italian, Spanish and Russian. Also sign language available. Advance tickets are available from Lippupalvelu's ticket offices and Lippupalvelu's online shop.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The premises can be used for banquets and private events, the museum's own activities permitting. The museum's facilities can be used for private purposes for more than 200 people outside the museum's opening hours.
item.matko:services: 2 museum shops with a wide range of art products and books, café-restaurant Tablo Ateneum serves lunch and bakery products.
item.matko:ingress: The Ateneum Art Museum is the basic part of the Finnish National Gallery.

item.title: Aussie Bar
item.description: We are a crazy group of Australians and New Zealanders who've been in Finland for many years. And we thought it was time do do something that Helsinki needed - give it a ripper of a time! We are here to make you feel like you're in a home away from home - the Aussie Bar! Apart from the drinkin' and eatin', there'll be great music, dancin', and live sports on the big screens.

item.title: AVA-gallery
item.description:
AVA Galleria is a small and cozy gallery located in the Helsinki city center, behind the Tennispalatsi on the Pohjoinen Rautatienkatu. The gallery organizes exhibitions and takes part in several art fairs all over the world. Besides introducing Finnish contemporary art, the gallery also brings international exhibitions to Helsinki. The exhibitions change every third week.
AVA Galleria cooperates with The Arte Vida Arte Association and supports CASA (Centro de Assistência Social e Artística/Centre for Social and Artistic Support), an art school located in Cidade de Deus, a shanty town in Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: Baarikärpänen
item.description:
Baarikärpänen is just perfect in size: never too small to feel like the place is overcrowded, but not that big to lose your friends into the club. Baarikärpänen also has a big terrace which is open during the summer season.
The building where Baarikärpänen is located at is called Fennia-block, which has gone through broad renovations within last few years. Although the building has been modernized it has still kept its historic value. This is exactly what Baarikärpänen has also been aiming to do.
Age limit: 18 years
item.matko:restaurantinfo: In the year 2001 opened Baarikärpänen is a classic of Helsinki's nightlife. The nightclub is easy to access, also without having to worry about being bankrupt. The relaxed atmosphere is taken care by the friendly staff.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The sales services of Night People Group are open Mon-Fri at 020 7759 814, myynti@npg.fi. Baarikärpänen is part of Night People Group.

item.title: Baker's Bar & Restaurant
item.description: Baker's offers diverse restaurant facilities right in the heart of Helsinki opposite the Stockmann department store. Baker's is one of Helsinki's oldest restaurants (est. 1915). Baker's is divided into 7 functions: CaféBar, Steak restaurant, Bar, Nightbar, Pub and Sauna & Meeting facilities. At steak restaurant Baker's a lunch buffet and a la carte lunch is served Mon-Fri 11-14. Baker's also offers the Helsinki Menu. CaféBar offers lunch Mon-Fri 11-15, Sat 12-16. The CaféBar is open daily. The laid-back and rock spirited Baker's Pub is Monday to Saturday. The Bar and Nighbar is a relaxed atmosphere for mingling with people.
item.matko:open: Kitchen open Mon-Thu 11-21.30, Fri 11-22, Sat 13-22. CaféBar: Mon-Fri 8-02, Fri 07-04, Sat 10-04. Bar: Tue-Thu 16.30-20, Fri-Sat 16.30-04. Nightbar: Fri 22-04, Sat 22-04. Tempo:Tue-Thu 17-24, Fri 16-04, Sat 18-04. Age limits: Bar & Nightbar 24years, Pub 22years.
item.matko:groups: A separate cabinet for 60 persons available.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant seats 210 persons, also a separate cabinet for 60 persons.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna on request, Sun-Thu 15€/guest, min.price 90€ and Fri-Sat 20€/guest, min.price 120 €. Extra hours 40€. The sauna seats 8 persons. The sauna cabinet seats 20 persons (equipped with a 42" plasma tv)
item.matko:services: Sauna and meeting facilities.

item.title: Balderin Sali Hall
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:services: Café

item.title: Bank of Finland Museum
item.description: The Bank of Finland Museum's main themes are the history of money, central banking, monetary policy and banknote art and artists. Multimedia presentations. Changing exhibitions.
item.matko:location: In the corner of the Senate Square, trams 1, 1A, 7A and 7B. Parking slots, also for buses, in the Senate Square.
item.matko:disabled: Door with ramp for wheelchairs. Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Free guided tours can be arranged upon request. Languages Finnish, Swedish and English.
item.matko:services: A small café (approx. 15 seats) and museum shop.

item.title: Bar Bäkkäri
item.description:
Voted as the best bar in Helsinki in 2013, Bar Bäkkäri offers awesome rock spirit with big attitude. Bäkkäri's good reputation and excellent atmosphere has been heard far also in other countries, which is the reason for the place to be full of tourists and other people outside of Helsinki. The place is also often visited by big national and international artists, if they happen to be having a gig in Helsinki.
The interior and music at Bäkkäri is obviously rock-related. Different kind of theme nights, such as pool-and crayfish parties the bar constantly succeeds to surprise their customers. One of the specialties found in the bar is a list of drinks, which has been named by favorite drinks of rock stars like Nikki Sixx, Lemmy Kilmister and Aleksi Laiho.
Age limit: Weekdays 18 years, weekends 20 years
item.matko:additionalinfo: The sales services of Night People Group are open Mon-Fri at 020 7759 814, myynti@npg.fi. Bar Bäkkäri is part of Night People Group.

item.title: Bar Loose
item.description: A rock music bar in the city centre. From 60's soul music to rock music of today.

item.title: BBQ House
item.description: In the BBQ House latino music and the scent from steaks on a grill builds the easygoing atmosphere in this steak house.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 11-22, Wed-Thu 11-23, Fri 11-24, Sat 12-24 (Sun only on Sundays when shops are open). Kitchen closes one hour before closing.

item.title: Beamhill
item.description:
Ben Sherman, Resteröds, Whyred, Acne, April 77, Cheap Monday, Edwin. J. Lindeberg, Nudie, Surface to Air, Tiger, Velour, D&G Underwear, Carhartt, Ctrl, Evisu, Spiewak, Supra, Zoo York, Wood Wood, 2K t-shirts, Analog, Altamont, MHI, Mishka, Sixpack, Volcom, Levi's Vintage, Won Hundred, Clae.
Converse, Karhu, Paul Smith, Reebok, Swear, Adidas, Alife, Gravis, Lakai, Nike SB, Pointer, Reebok Vans, Creative Recriation, Emerica, New Balance.

item.title: Belge Bar & Bistro
item.description: Belge bar&bistro is a Belgian beer restaurant in two floors that offers Belgian beer and food. The upstairs library creates an easy-going atmosphere with its big couches, dark wood interior and fire place.

item.title: Best Western Hotel Carlton
item.description:
The Best Western Hotel Carlton is a hotel in a 1930's building located in the very heart of the city. Whether travelling on business or pleasure, Carlton is the choice for you if you want to spend your night securely and comfortably, yet surrounded by the lively environment of one of the main streets in Helsinki city.
Single and double rooms all come equipped with shower, hairdryer, mini-bar, trouser press, LCD TV and wireless high-speed internet connection.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 17 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Robert's Coffee and Iguana Restaurant are located on the ground floor of the hotel building.

item.title: Best Western Plus Hotel Haaga
item.description:
Best Western Plus Hotel Haaga is a cosy hotel with newly renovated comfortable rooms and friendly service. The hotel offers a wide selection of modern meeting rooms and versatile restaurant facilities.
The hotel is situated within easy reach of the Helsinki Airport and downtown Helsinki. Parking possibilities are also good. All guest and meeting rooms have a free high-speed internet access. The 17 meter long swimming pool and three saunas also offer relaxing moments for both business and leisure travellers.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 km, airport 12 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 122 rooms of which 34 single, 85 double/twin, 2 suites, 1 apartamento.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurants: Haaga Inn á la carte restaurant has a good selection of beverages and seasonal menus. The banquet restaurant is a good place for larger groups. It seats up to 250 persons and is a perfect place for banquets, cocktails, theme events and conference luncheons.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna, swimming pool, easy access parking, wireless internet connection (WLAN) in all rooms.

item.title: Best Western Premier Hotel Katajanokka
item.description: Best Western Premier Hotel Katajanokka fulfils the expectations of travellers looking for an exceptional quality. Inside the old brick walls, a fascinating world of contrasts opens up; a modern premier-class hotel built in a historic prison setting. The red brick walls house 106 magnificent and luxurious rooms. Stylish decor and unique atmosphere effectively take your mind away from the busy working day and intensive travelling. The thick walls ensure a good night's sleep and first class conveniences are available to meet even the most demanding requirements. The hotel is located in a beautiful, quiet park surrounded by the old prison walls.
item.matko:location: City centre 0,5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Jailbird Restaurant, Oluthuone pub and Lobby bar, Summer terrace
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna and gym

item.title: Bicyclean Helsinki
item.description: Bicycle rental.
item.matko:location: in Katjanokka, in the center of Helsinki

item.title: Bio Rex
item.description: Cinema theatre since 1936.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km

item.title: Black & White
item.description: Largest selection of second hand records, everything from jazz to rock.

item.title: Blini
item.description: Genuine Russian fastfood, blinis, pelmenis and different kind of pastries. Cheap prices.
item.matko:location: Alppila district
item.matko:ingress: Genuine Russian fastfood for cheap prices

item.title: Blue Peter Seaside Restaurant
item.description: Blue Peter, established in 1976, is situated on the island of Lauttasaari in Helsinki, in the middle of the Helsingfors Segelklubb HSK yacht club area. Blue Peter lends you a modern but still original atmosphere to enjoy delicious food and to arrange festive occasions and gatherings in a unique yacht club surrounding.
item.matko:open: Open all year round. Mon-Thu 11-22, Fri 11-24, Sat 12-24, Sun 12-18.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Private occasions for 20-250 persons.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Á la carte, lunch and childrens menu. Parking area and own quay.

item.title: Bock House
item.description: The Bock House was originally built in the 1700s and modified according to Engel's design in 1816-1818, after which it served as the Town Hall. Nowadays the premises host a new handicraft and arts & design shop by the collective Made by Helsinki. One of the 13 collective members is always present when the shop is open.

item.title: Bonnie's Canadian Club
item.description:
Speakeasy is hideing in an old flour mill which were built during prohibition time. This old brickhouse lies in an old industrial area that generates strong contrasts between the exterior and the interior.
One room hall (h=5,5 m, area 330 m2), capacity 120 during dinner, 150 during cocktail. An estrade (6m x 4m) and light & audio system for speeches. If you need any AV equipments for your event, we are at your service.
Wares and equipments are easy to carry through double doors. You can bring your own goods or we can tailor an offer including only the services which you are externalizeing.
The venue is well suitable for immediate, easy-going social and theme events, meetings and promos.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 25 min
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Interior can be easily changed from one arrangement to another in order to serve better the customer and to back up the goal of the event . Capacity is 120 during dinner and 150 during cocktail. You can bring your own beverages but the catering is exclusively of Crepperie Oy.
item.matko:services: All the necessary services, from catering and decoration to rentals and technical applications, are available under one roof.

item.title: Boutique Freda
item.description: Full range of beautiful shoes, bags and accessories. MadeInSpace ecological shoes also available.

item.title: Boutique Kaarina K
item.description: Labels such as Versace, Emilio Pucci, Giuseppe Zanotti, Herve Leger, Giambattista Valli, Balmain and Temperley.

item.title: BR-Toys
item.description: International toy store chain
item.matko:location: Forum and Kamppi Shopping Centre

item.title: Brasserie Kämp
item.description: Kämp restaurant has charmed people from all over the world since 1887, when it was still customary to come to restaurants to see, be seen, and hear the latest news from abroad. The Kämp quickly became the preferred café in Helsinki for the notable political and cultural figures in Finland at the time. The new Brasserie Kämp honors this history, and the traditions are a matter of great pride, but the overall style is more modern and easily accessible. This classy and elegant Helsinki restaurant has a relaxed and welcoming way as a café in the heart of Helsinki. The colorful international atmosphere at the Kämp offers a wonderful way of breaking away from everyday routines. Drop by the Kämp bar any time: for a café or lunch at Helsinki center, a glass of champagne, or whenever you want to treat yourself with an exquisite meal. In summer, the Kämp Bar extends itself out into the beautiful Esplanade promenade and becomes the best summer terrace and outdoor restaurant in Helsinki.

item.title: Bravuria
item.description: Italian interactive restaurant where the customers place their orders directly to the chef. Even bar & terrace.
item.matko:location: In Kamppi, in the center.

item.title: Break Sokos Hotel Flamingo
item.description: Break Sokos Hotel Flamingo is situated near the airport. The hotel brings a relaxing break to the business traveller's workday as well as action and entertainment to leisure time. This is guaranteed by the versatile selection brought to you by the Flamingo Entertainment Centre and water park, including its care and well-being sections, wellness services, cinemas and comprehensive world of restaurants. The hotel boasts a relaxed restaurant, Amarillo as well as Bankett Flamingo, a restaurant available on a reservation basis. Conference and festive premises offer fantastic facilities for successful meetings.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 17 km, airport 3 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 309 rooms, all non-smoking, 5 suites. Wireless broadband internet access in all rooms.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Amarillo and a private restaurant for 300 persons.
item.matko:services: Business Center, spa and water park at the Flamingo Leisure complex (spa treatment reservations tel. +358 (0)20 7785 201 or +358 (0)20 7785 210)

item.title: Bruuveri
item.description: A brewery restaurant in the new Kamppi shopping centre that serves products from their own brewery and eg. Saimaan Panimo.

item.title: Bulevardin Kahvisalonki
item.description: The small Bulevardin Kahvisalonki, that has served customers for years, have now moved to a new location to the corner of Mannerheimintie and Bulevardi. Outdoor terraces on both streets, a piano (and occationally also music) and cosy big sofas, also for bigger partys. A saladbar at lunchtime.

item.title: Cable Factory
item.description: Finland's single largest cultural centre, the Cable Factory is an ideal setting for a wide range of events and happenings. The building has five unique venues for festivities and events and their total floor space is more than 5000 m2. These venues are used for fairs, parties, gala evenings, meetings, conferences, training events, seminars, photo and filming sessions, concerts, festivals, theatre and dance performances, and exhibitions. The Cable Factory is located by the sea, yet almost in the centre of the city.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km (0.2 km from metro station), airport 20 km; public transport connections to the city centre are excellent
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, inva-WC in the Merikaapelihalli, Puristamo and Valssaamo, parking for disabled in the inner yard of the building, lift does not meet the spatial requirements of a wheelchair, easy access for blind or partially sighted. Assistance needed.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Free catering is permitted at all rented spaces in the Cable Factory. Restaurant Hima & Sali at the Cable Factory has also catering services.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The most suitable spaces for exhibitions are Puristamo (the former pressing hall), Valssaamo (the former rolling hall) and Merikaapelihalli (the former sea cable hall).
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Cable Factory provides an excellent setting for a wide range of events. The building has five unique venues for festivities and events and their total floor space is more than 4000 m2. Also available for renting are three conference rooms. All the rentable facilities allow for unrestricted catering. The Cable Factory is located by the sea, yet almost in the centre of the city. Excellent public transport connections.

item.title: Cable Factory Gallery
item.matko:services: Museums and a restaurant.

item.title: Café Bar No 9
item.description: Cafe Bar No 9 has been a livingroom for culturel city folk from 1996. People, as in staff and customers, are the most important thing behind our restaurants success. Some of our kitchens classics are the Chicken Coriander Wok and Pollo Limonello pasta. The popular breakfast is served the whole day.

item.title: Café Bar Valimo
item.description: Valimo is a café-restaurant and quay facility in a stylishly renovated grass-roofed ammunition foundry. To get to Valimo you pass by the old wooden sailing vessels being repaired in the docks.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 22 km

item.title: Cafe Carusel
item.description: Cafe carusel is a cosy cafe and restaurant by the seashore near kaivopuisto. Cafe carusel serves fresh pastries, delicious lunch and a la carte portions. During the summer carusel also has one of the most popular terraces in Helsinki.
item.matko:location: Cafe carusel is located on the seafront of eira district in helsinki. You can get to cafe carusel by busses 14 & 18 and tram number 3 or by foot (it's only a 1,5km walk from the center)
item.matko:open: Mon-Sun 9-22, if the weather allows the terrace is open until late in the evening
item.matko:admission: For example a capuccino and a cinnamon roll cost 6,30€ and a salad portion 12,50€
item.matko:disabled: Toilet for the persons with reduced mobility

item.title: Café Cavalier
item.description: Café Cavalier is an elegant Gay bar & café in the middle of Helsinki near the Kamppi Metro station. Enjoy the nice atmosphere with live performances, cold drinks and delicious pastries.

item.title: Café Ekberg
item.description: The classic café Ekberg still serves the Napoleon cake and the Champagne Cork, favourite to many of its customers. The breakfast buffét is also a popular place to meet at. Weekdays a soup lunch is served (from 11.00-)

item.title: Café Esplanad
item.description: Café Esplanad is well known for its central european atmosphere and style and especially for its huge cinnamon rolls (a Finnish sweet pastry called Korvapuusti) that are baked in the cafés own bakery. On the outdoor terrace one can also enjoy the sun. Restaurant Bistro in the back of the café offers inexpensive lunch.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 8-22, Sat 9-22, Sun 10-22. Bistro is open Mon-Fri 11-16

item.title: Café Kahvila Suomi
item.description: A small lunch café that serves Finnish homecooking style lunch. The Kahvila Suomi café became popular after beeing the setting to a Japanese film (Kamome Shokudo).

item.title: Café Krypta - summer café
item.description: Café Krypta is located in the city centre, in the stone base of the Cathedral. The café is run by different voluntary organizations . There are also exhibitions at the café.
item.matko:location: Situated in the Helsinki Cathedral crypt
item.matko:open: Summer café Café Krypta is open daily 11-17 during 4.6.-2.9.2007.

item.title: Café Köket
item.description: A cosy café by the Senate Square, that serves breakfast, lunch and brunch during weekends.

item.title: Café Mieritz
item.description: Café Mieritz is located on the right side of the wooden bridge to Seurasaari island.
item.matko:open: Open during 16.8.-14.5. Sat-Sun and on public holidays at 12-17, during 16.5.-15.8. daily at 12-17, Wed-Sun until 19.

item.title: Cafe Neuhaus
item.description: Chocolate shop selling Belgian Neuhaus chocolates. Also a small cosy café.

item.title: Café Piper
item.description: A wooden-villa café in Finland's oldest English-style park. For eighty years visitors and the inhabitants of the fortress have been able to enjoy a cup of coffee and something to eat in the beautiful Piper's Café with its marvellous sea view.
item.matko:disabled: Not suitable for disabled persons.
item.matko:groups: Café Piper serves also groups by reservation and private partys. Also school groups. Ehrensvärd Society group-reservations: phone +358-(0)9-684 1850 (Ehrensävrd Society) or +358-(0)9-668 447 (during Café Piper's opening hours), e-mail: guidebooking(at)suomenlinnatours.com

item.title: Cafe Piritta
item.description: This cosy café by the sea offers you a sunny terrace, delicious cakes and à la carte dishes. Lunch is served from Monday untill Saturday. You may start your day with a luxorius breakfast during the week or enjoy brunch on Sundays.

item.title: Café Strindberg
item.description: An international café with an open kitchen, where the delicacies served in the café are prepared. The separate coffee sales point offers a variety of delicious drinks from espresso and cappucino to more exotic flavors of coffee and tea. On the second floor is Strindberg à la carte and Strindberg's Bakficka.

item.title: Café Tamminiementien kahvila
item.description: Enjoy a cup of warm tea or a glass of wine outside on the idyllic terrace or inside beneath the chandeliers. The café is situated close to Seurasaari.
item.matko:location: Bus 24

item.title: Café Tin Tin Tango
item.description: Interesting bar with art displays, a self-service laundromat and a sauna. Age limit: 20.

item.title: Café Ursula
item.description: Café Ursula was founded in 1952 in the Kaivopuisto park. Café Ursula has grown from a small café kiosk to a café-restaurant.
item.matko:open: Open daily in summer 9-24, in spring and autumn 9-22 and in winter 9-20
item.matko:services: Jazz evenings every other Wednesday at 19-22, table reservations needed.

item.title: Cafe Vanille
item.description: A small café in the Russian merchant quarter. Home made pastries.
item.matko:open: 2008: 1.-6.1. daily 11-16:30, 12.1.-27.4. Sat-Sun 11-17. Closed for renovation in early summer 2008.
item.matko:disabled: Not suitable for disabled persons.
item.matko:services: Special coffees, beer and cider, cakes, filled rolls and pies.

item.title: Café Veganissimo
item.description: Vegan restaurant and lunch cafe with home-made food made mostly from organic products. Lunch is served on weekdays, brunch on Saturdays.

item.title: Casino Helsinki
item.description: The international Casino Helsinki is the city's number one gaming and entertainment venue.
item.matko:location: In the center of Helsinki. Next to the railway station.
item.matko:open: Every day from 12 noon to 04 a.m. Closed on 25th of December and on Good Friday.
item.matko:admission: Free entry to the Casino. Cloak room service 2 euros.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible for wheel chairs.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Experience the top class show and enjoy a delicious dinner in the charming 1920´s glamour and atmosphere of Fennia salon. Fennia salon has room for 150 dinner guests. Combined with Fennia bar and Piazza you can invite up to 500 guests. Casino Piazza in heart of the Fennia block serves lunch from Monday to Saturday.
item.matko:services: Fennia Salon: Casino's show restaurant, Fennia Bar, Fills Kitchen & Bar: a la carte restaurant, Bar All In, Casino Piazza, Summer terrace.

item.title: Central Park
item.description: Covering a thousand hectares, the Central Park runs ten kilometres from Töölönlahti Bay in the centre to Haltiala on the northern outskirts of the city. In the city centre, it consists of urban cultural parks, its extensive central section is mainly recreational forests, while in Haltiala there are primeval forests and agricultural landscapes. There are four nature reserves in the park: the deciduous forests in Pitkäkoski and Ruutinkoski, Haltiala primeval forest and Niskala arboretum.

item.title: Central Railway Station
item.description: The Central Railway Station was designed by Eliel Saarinen in 1909 and the station was opened in 1919. The station is mostly clad in Finnish granite, and its distinguishing features are its clock tower and the two pairs of statues holding the spherical lamps, lit at night-time, on either side of the main entrance. The station is used by approximately 200,000 passengers per day, making it Finland's most-visited building.

item.title: CheapSleep Helsinki
item.description: With a mix of 10 private rooms and 118 dorm beds, this affordable and contemporary hostel, located in Vallila, Helsinki, offers superb transport options, with all parts of the city easily reached. There is a fully equipped kitchen and a dining and lounge area for guests to enjoy. Free WiFi throughout. This newly renovated hostel offers a complete package of price, location and style.

item.title: Chef&Sommelier
item.description: Chef &Sommelier concentrates on organic ingredients but also uses ingredients from the nature and from Fairtrade.

item.title: Chez Dominique
item.description: Chez Dominique's kitchen aims to create new innovations based on Nordic and French flavours. Dining room with 50 covers and a cabinet with 14 covers. The only restaurant in Finland with two stars in the Michelin Guide.

item.title: Christine's Design
item.description: Unique Finnish design glass, ceramics,collectibles and furniture from 1930's until today.

item.title: Circuit.fi
item.description: Circuit.fi is a racing based entertainment and conference center designed for a realistic simulated driving experience. Enjoy a fun and relaxing atmosphere, high tech style and club type of experience all in one place.
item.matko:location: Pitäjänmäki, Helsinki, easy access with A- train from Helsinki Central Station.
item.matko:disabled: Inva WC/lift not availaible.
item.matko:groups: Groups should book tickets in advance.
item.matko:services: Racing simulators and many other activities. Catering kitchen - good food and service, P-area.

item.title: City Apartments
item.description: Furnished temporary housing in the Helsinki city centre. City Apartments offers a combination of all that is best about hotels and a home of your own.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km.
item.matko:open: Open all year round. Office open on weekdays 9am-3pm (during summer 9am-12pm).
item.matko:admission: Rates 95,00 - 348,00 EUR / apartment. Ask our offer for long term stay.
item.matko:disabled: 3 elevators.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: All apartments located in the same address in downtown Helsinki are fully furnished and equipped (renovated 2011). Kitchen; table ware, microwave oven, stove, coffee maker, kettle, toaster, refrigerator, dishwasher. Washing machine, direct dial phone, spacious work area, iron/ironing board, hair dryer, wake up alarm, towel heater. Bathroom with complimentary toiletries. Broadband Internet Access (no time restrictions or limits on amount of data transferred). TV with international satellite channels. Indoor parking.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Apartment rates includes: bed linen and towels, weekly maid service, movie channel and broadband internet access. Free public-Internet. Secured underground parking (extra charge).
item.matko:services: Parking garage.

item.title: City Hall
item.description: The City Hall was designed by C.L. Engel as a hotel in 1833, the building has been the City Hall since the 1930s. The Helsinki coat-of-arms can be seen on the tympanum. With the exception of the facade, it was completely rebuilt in 1967-1970 under the architect Aarno Ruusuvuori.

item.title: City of Helsinki sports department / Rastila Camping Helsinki
item.description: 4-star Rastila Camping Helsinki has a wide range of accommodation services, maintenance buildings, saunas, a restaurant and a beach. Winter swimming and equipment rentals are also offered.
item.matko:location: Driving directions: take Ring 1 (Kehä 1) or Itäväylä (170) to Itäkeskus. Proceed about 2 km towards Vuosaari. Turn right from ramp and the turn left.
item.matko:open: All year round. Summer hostel Karavaani during summer season.
item.matko:disabled: Some of cottages are suitable for disabled. One of the service buildings is equipped with ramp and shower/toilet for disabled.
item.matko:groups: More information about group prices and reservations from the reception.
item.matko:services: In the are 165 modern caravan pitches with electricity hook-ups. A slop sink, a waste water disposal system and fresh water points. Service buildings. 80 tent pitches on grass. Saunas are in use all year round. Family saunas for single bathers, couples and families. The seaside sauna is for groups.Cottage accommodation: Holiday cottages for 6-8 persons, Log cottages for 4-6 persons, family cabins for 4 persons, modern camping cabins for 4 persons.

item.title: Citykoti.com Downtown City Apartments
item.description: Fully equipped Citykoti Apartments are from 20-32 sqm and they are situated in the very heart of Helsinki. We can offer accomodation services for longer as well as for shorter periods. Apartments are fully equipped including f.ex. TV/DVD, CD-radio, the change of bed linens etc.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Cloth Gallery
item.description: Cloth Gallery offers clothes of highest quality, timeless yet unique. Leena Ikonen, the owner of the company, creates the tailored fitting outfits. Cloth Gallery uses natural fabrics - silks, wool and linen. New designs are produced weekly and kept in small quantities.all of Cloth Gallery's collections are made by Finnish professionals in small workshops.

item.title: Club Liberte
item.description: Club Liberté offers live music 6 nights a week. Liberté's big screen shows all the main sport events from Canal+ and on club nights live feed from the stage. On sundays at Naulaamo Klubi, Club Liberté's own House Band + guests groove you up with fantastic versions of old and new classics. Club Liberté have FREE Wireless Internet connection and pool table for customers to use!

item.title: Club Playground
item.description: A new place in town for a quality night clubbing experience with electronic dance music. Located in Punavuori district.

item.title: Club Prkl
item.description: Rock Club

item.title: Club Venue
item.description: Nightclub and concerthouse

item.title: Colorado Bar & Grill
item.description: Colorado Mts. Bar & Grill is a unique restaurant in downtown Helsinki offering a wide variety of classic American dishes from its South-West menu. In Colorado you can also just stop by for a drink and enjoy the famous interior design that sends you back to the Wild West like no other restaurant in Finland!
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 16-23 (kitchen open -22) Wed-Thu 16-01 (kitchen open -23) Fri 14-02 (kitchen open -23) Sat 12-02 (kitchen open -23) Sun 13-23 (kitchen -22)

item.title: Comodo Apartments
item.description:
Comodo Apartments provides fully furnished and comfortable self-catering apartments in Helsinki region. We offer apartments in different size and quality depending on your needs. The minimum stay is 4 days or as long as you desire. . Our Comodo team is looking forward to helping you make the most of Helsinki.
For more details, rates and availability please visit our website (www.comodo.fi/en) or contact us.

item.title: Conference hotel Siikaranta
item.description: Conference Hotel Siikaranta offers hotel, conference, restaurant and sauna facilities in the border of famous Nuuksio National park. On the shore of clean and beautiful lake Siikajärvi hotel provides versatile meeting facilities, 3 saunas, swimming pool and gym. The hotel is located in Espoo, 30 minutes from the Helsinki city center.
item.matko:location: In Espoo, in the border of famous Nuuksio National park.

item.title: Corona Bar & Billiards
item.description: Corona Bar & Billiards is a combination of a street bar and billiard hall. Nine pool tables and one snooker table.

item.title: Cristal Bar
item.description: The stunning Cristal Bar, right by the Esplanade Park, provides classic, trendy cocktails and an extensive selection of champagnes and wines. Tables with some snacks can be reserved for parties in advance, for up to 50 people. The adjacent Cristal Bar and Members Lounge can also be joined with restaurant Kämp Signé, resulting in a room to seat up to 80 people for dining around one long table.
item.matko:location: Kämp's second floor.

item.title: CrossFit Central Helsinki
item.description: The only CrossFit gym in Helsinki!

item.title: Crowne Plaza Helsinki
item.description: The Crowne Plaza Helsinki is an upscale hotel with high-quality services and a four-time-winner of World Travel Award "Finlands Leading Hotel", 2008, 2009, 2010 and 2011. All guestrooms offer first-class conveniences, including amenities and services of the Sleep Advantage program and free high-speed internet. The Club Floor on the top floor features Club rooms and Suites and the Club Lounge.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 18 km. Hotel is situated opposite the Finnish National Opera, close to the Finlandia Hall and Olympic Stadium.
item.matko:disabled: Crowne Plaza has two rooms for persons with physical disability. There is an induction loop system at the reception and guests with hearing impairment can borrow a portable vibrating alarm system.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 349 rooms of which 270 Standard rooms, 33 Club rooms, 42 Junior Suites, 4 Suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo:
Restaurant Macu - Mediterranean cuisine a la carte restaurant, elegant and with contemporary decor, 180 seats.
Bar Code - International lobby bar next to restaurant Macu.
Pub Fidel - Casual and down to earth Gastropub with relaxed athmosphere and unpretentious eats & drinks, 120 seats.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Lounge 80 m2, Winter Garden 212 m2.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Crowne Plaza Helsinki offers exhaustive banquet and meeting services. Forever Health Club & Day Spa, at the ground floor, is an unique place to treat and exercise your body and soul. Use of sauna, swimming pool and gym is included in the room rates.
item.matko:services: Crowne Plaza Helsinki offers extensive banquet and meeting services. Forever Health Club & Day Spa, at the ground floor, is an unique place to treat and exercise your body and soul. Use of sauna, swimming pool and gym is included in the room rates.

item.title: CUBA!
item.description: CUBA! is a bar where partying doesn't need a dance floor. It is not a theme restaurant, CUBA! stands rather as a statement of the feeling. 250 seats.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:open: Opens at arounf 17 and closes later, at 04 on weekends

item.title: Cultural Magazine Gallery
item.description: The gallery features around 170 journals published by members of the Finnish Association for Cultural, Political and Scientific Journals (Kultti ry) and the Swedish language Journal Centre (Tidskriftscentralen).

item.title: Cumulus Airport (Restel)
item.description: The Cumulus Airport is an efficient and pleasant hotel close to the Helsinki-Vantaa Airport. A comfortable night's sleep, a good kitchen, and quick and friendly service ensure that your trip will go smoothly. Complimentary airport shuttle bus, which runs according to a set schedule, will take you to and from the hotel.
item.matko:location: Helsinki 18 km, airport 4 km. The Cumulus Airport is an efficient and pleasant hotel close to Helsinki-Vantaa airport.
item.matko:disabled: Lift. Four wheelchair accessible rooms.
item.matko:services: Two customer saunas, buffet breakfast, gym, garage, laundry, ironing rooms, rooms service, restaurant Huviretki, parking places, free airport connection.

item.title: Cumulus Hakaniemi Helsinki
item.description: Cumulus Hakaniemi Helsinki is a cosy 152 room city hotel. The modern hotel is located in the Hakaniemi district with good connections and lots of services nearby. All of the modern rooms are equipped with internet connection.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, airport 15 km. Cumulus Hakaniemi Helsinki is located by the Hakaniemi market square, and walking distance from the main Railway station.
item.matko:disabled: The hotel has an elevator. One wheelchair accessible room.
item.matko:groups: The hotel has 32 rooms with three beds, eight rooms with four beds and five rooms with five beds. In addition, 19 rooms with a communicating door.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 152 rooms. Special rooms: non-smokers, combi, superior, extra beds.
item.matko:services: Lobby bar, breakfast restaurant, mini gym and two customer saunas.

item.title: Cumulus Olympia Helsinki
item.description: Cumulus Olympia is favoured by business travellers as well as families on holiday. All rooms, corridor areas and the restaurant HuviRetki have been restyled from floor to ceiling to meet the high standard and look of the previously renovated reception. Traffic connections are good and there are facilities for bowling, swimming and ball games in the Urheilutalo sports centre next door. Linnanmäki Amusement Park and the SeaLife aquarium are nearby.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 5 cm) along the path, essential access, one step, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted, a suite serves as an inva-room when necessary.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 121 rooms: 48 single rooms, 60 double rooms, 3 family rooms, 10 superior rooms.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna, laundry service, wireless internet connection, free Disney Channel for kids (during summer season).
item.matko:services: Next to the Hotel Cumulus Olympia is the sports hall Helsingin Urheilutalo with its gym, swimming pool, bowling alleys and ball courts. Our guests have at their disposal a considerably wider range of services than city hotels can normally offer and the special prices are available with the valid hotel key card.

item.title: Customs Museum
item.description: The Customs Museum is located in the building Curtain Hamilton-Polhem in Susisaari, at the Suomenlinna fortress island. The permanent exhibition tells about the history of customs and smuggling in Finland. Information material on customs matters is also available at the museum.
item.matko:location: The Customs Museum is located in the building Curtain Hamilton-Polhem, i.e. building B 20, on Susisaari Island
item.matko:disabled: Not suitable for disabled persons.
item.matko:groups: Group visits can be arranged at other times by appointment. Bookings during winter tel +358 (0)20 492 1830.

item.title: D'Anna
item.description: International quality fashion, eg. Antonio Marras, Kenzo, Jil Sander & Missoni

item.title: Dance Center Footlight
item.description: Dance Center Footlight gives the education of dance art in Helsinki to children and teenagers as well as training for those aiming to be dance professionals. Own classes for adults. The background organization is Suomen Taidetanssin Tuki Ry. High curriculum consists of a children's education of dance, basic level studies and deepening studies. Dance Center Footlight has long traditions in dance teaching. The school was founded already in 1984.

item.title: Dance Theatre Rollo
item.description: Dance Theatre Rollo is one of the oldest Finnish dance theatres, and it has been active since 1972. Rollo's performances take broad advantage of the means of dramatic expression: movement and choreography, inventive ways of producing sound, rhythm and live music and playing "anti-instruments". Rollo's repertoire includes several performances directed for different age-groups. There are things to see and experience for children, school-children, teenagers, adults and the elderly. Different workshops are also part of the repertoire.
item.matko:ingress: Dance Theatre Rollo is one of the oldest Finnish dance theatres.

item.title: Daruma Sushi
item.description: Daruma sushi is the newest excotic addition to the Helsinki restaurant world. Although Daruma is conctenrated mainly in sushi, it has also exclusive touches from the Japanese cuisine, such as salads and noodles.

item.title: Della Marga
item.description: Clothes, shoes, accessories etc. by eg. Armani, Armani Jeans, Chanel Accessories, Rykiel, YSL Accessories, D&G Dolce&Gabbana and Cavalli.

item.title: DEMMERS TEEHAUS
item.description: A place for tea lovers. Tea, tea accessories and possibility to taste.

item.title: design by katri/n boutique
item.description:
design by katri/n is known for elegance and beauty, enhancing femininity with a skillful play of fabric. Refined drapings have quickly become a signature feature of the label.
The designer behind katri/n is Katri Niskanen, winner of the first Finnish Project Runway competition in 2009.

item.title: Design Forum Finland
item.description: Design Forum Finland in the centre of Helsinki's Design District promotes the latest trends in Finnish design. The Design Forum Shop sells Finnish designer products, from classic names to new discoveries and unique objects.
item.matko:services: Café Kakkugalleria

item.title: Design loft
item.description: Design loft in the Cable Factory, the biggest cultural center in Helsinki. Sea view opens to Lauttasaari neighbourhood. Excellent commuting, great location to explore Helsinki and its surroundings. The loft is fully equipped and furnished. Will also consider short stays. Rent includes wireless internet, recording digibox, Zeppelin dock, 47 inch LED TV and garage for one car downstairs.
item.matko:location: In the Ruoholahti district; city centre 10 min, airport 40 min.

item.title: Design Museum
item.description: The Design Museum illustrates the development of industrial art, artistic handicraft and industrial design from the second half of the 19th century to the present day. Classics of the Finnish design. Interesting special exhibitions. The permanent exhibition of the museum is supported by temporary Finnish and international thematic exhibitions on historical and contemporary design. The building from 1894 offers beautiful surroundings for all events which get additional value from the exhibitions. The exhibition spaces can be hired for events outside the Design Museums opening hours, the lecturing hall (70m2, 60 persons) and conference room (16 persons) can also be hired during opening hours.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 min, airport 30-40min
item.matko:admission: Adults 10€, pensioners 8€, students 5€, children free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift, lightning intensity 50-150 lux. Dark at some places. Persons with wheelchair should notify in advance. Easier entry from the backdoor.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours can be booked in advance, tel.+358 (0)9 622 0540 (weekdays 8-11), at other times info@designmuseum.fi Languages Finnish, Swedish, English, Russian, Estonian and Spanish.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Café. High-class catering services available in the exhibition areas.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Exhibition areas on three floors: Basement 250 m2, height 200-285 cm, max 100 persons, I floor 335m2, height 360-410 cm, max 300 persons, II floor 800 m2, height 420-610 cm, max 500 persons. The exhibition architecture may have an effect on the amount of persons. Restaurant services in the exhibition spaces.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Receptions (max. 700 persons) can be arranged in the exhibition area outside the opening hours.
item.matko:services: Cafe (CafeBar Luomus, tel.+358 (0)9 6220 5423, www.cafeluomus.com) and museum shop open during the museum opening hours.The exhibition spaces can be hired for events outside the Design Museums opening hours, the lecture hall (70m2, 60 persons) and conference room (16 persons) can also be hired during opening hours.
item.matko:ingress: Permanent and temporary exhibitions of Finnish design.

item.title: Didrichsen Art Museum
item.description: The Didrichsen Art Museum is a unique combination of art museum and private home on Kuusisaari island in Helsinki. Temporary exhibitions and permanent displays of ancient Chinese and pre-Columbian artefacts. Modern architecture and art, and a sculpture park by the sea.
item.matko:location: Buses 194, 195 from Eliel Square and buses 503-506.
item.matko:open: Tue, Thu-Sun 11-18, Wed 11-20 (June-August Tue-Sun 11-17). Museum is closed due to renovation from May 2013 till September 2014.
item.matko:admission: Adults 10€, children (7-18 years) 3€, students & pensioners 7€ (pensioners over 75 yrs and children under 7 yrs free of charge).
item.matko:disabled: Please notify in advance. Access to some areas with wheelchairs, assistant needed. No lift. No Inva-WC, but a large WC.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours on request (in Finnish, Swedish, English). Guide fee weekdays 70€, Sun 80€, school groups 30€. Guided tours outside regular opening hours upon request. Possibility to arrange small snack on request.
item.matko:services: Museum shop, coffee and water automat. Car park. Museum also available for private functions.

item.title: Diesel Store
item.description: Diesel flagship store in Helsinki includes the entire collection of the premium casual wear brand for both male and female.

item.title: Digelius
item.description: Record store specialised in jazz- and ethnic music. New and second hand lp:s and cd:s since 1971.
item.matko:location: Viiskulma

item.title: Dipoli Congress Centre
item.description:
Dipoli, part of Aalto University, is a unique venue for meetings, congresses and all kind of festive events and offers over 20 different types of meeting spaces. It is in a prime location, sharing in the diverse services on offer in the capital as well as the innovative atmosphere of the scientific community of Otaniemi, Espoo. All can be used equally comfortably to accommodate tête-à-têtes between just a few people or large gatherings of over a thousand people. Possibility for video conferences.
Possibility for video conferences, more information: www.polycom.com (www.polycom.com/emea/en/products/telepresence/realpresence_experience/rpx_hd.html)
item.matko:location: In City of Espoo, 9 km from Helsinki city centre and 24 km from airport
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Two convenient restaurants during the day time for 600 people and impressive Gala Halls 1-4 for dinners, galas and cocktail parties for up to 2000 people.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The big halls can be used as exhibition space.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Dipoli offers over 20 different types of meeting spaces. All can be used equally comfortably to accommodate tête-à-têtes between just a few people or large gatherings of over a thousand people e.g. a big festival hall for 300-1000 persons, a spacious auditorium for 250 persons, 14 small or medium-sized meeting rooms. The elegant lobbies and restaurants can also be transformed to take on different roles.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Dipoli is easily accessible by the most popular forms of public transport. To Dipoli from centre of Helsinki it takes only 15 minutes by car and Helsinki Airport is just half an hour away. There is plenty of free parking available in and around Dipoli.

item.title: Domin Rental Apartments
item.description: Domin Rental Apartments offers an alternative to staying in a hotel. Around 50 furnished apartments in the Greater Helsinki region to choose from. Minimum charge 5 days.
item.matko:location: Furnished apartments for rent in Helsinki and Espoo.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Prices include use of a furnished apartment, cleaning and sheets. Charges are made on a daily basis. The longer stay, the lower the daily rate. Phone calls and satellite tv channels are charged separately. 20% service premium will be added to the invoice.

item.title: Don Corleone
item.description: A very simple concept of serving great food in a simple and comfortable environment, for reasonable prices, has made Don Corleone one of the most talked about restaurants in Helsinki. After only one year since its opening, Don Corleone was awarded with "the best pasta in town" title by City magazine and is enjoying a sea of smiles and praise from its regular customers. In addition to pasta, Don Corleone offers mouth watering appetizers, fresh salads and delicacies from the grill. All made and supervised by their native italian chefs.

item.title: dtm
item.description: Gayrestaurant. Along the years dtm has grown to be a combination of Gay Cafe, Bar, Disco and Night Club. The fully licensed Cafe/Bar on the entrance floor of the building offers daily fresh baked pastry, snacks, a good selection of teas and coffees as well as a variety alcoholic and non-alcoholic refreshments and cocktails. dtm also offers Wireless Internet connection (W-LAN) for laptops. On weekends it's party time on two floors; Friday nights the first floor is reserved for more traditional dance music lovers, and Saturdays upstairs are dedicated for ladies only until 02.00.

item.title: Dubrovnik
item.description: Dubrovnik Lounge & Lobby is the first New York-style live music and picture venue in Helsinki

item.title: Eat & Joy Maatilatori- farm market
item.description: The farm market focuses on northern tastes and non-processed foods. Organic products from local farms - goods from over 100 producers.

item.title: Ecobike
item.description: Bicycle renting.
item.matko:location: Next to the football stadium.
item.matko:open: Call in advance: tel.+358(0)400844358, rental bikes can be arranged also at other times than official opening hours.

item.title: EDEL City
item.description: Opened to the premises of SECCO Shop, EDEL City has a selection of the best eco-luxury design items.

item.title: Ehrensvärd Museum
item.description: Once the residence of the fortress commandant, the museum is named in honor of Augustin Ehrensvärd (1710-1772), under whose direction most of the fortifications were build.
item.matko:disabled: Accessability with wheelchair difficult, lots of steps, ground uneven.
item.matko:groups: Guide for school groups 95€
item.matko:services: The museum has a small museum shop.

item.title: Ekberg Extra
item.description: Ekberg Extra is a newly renovated hall for private occasions such as conferences, meetings, receptions, dinners and exhibitions. It is situated close to the city centre and can comfortably take 60 persons.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:services: Ekberg Party Service takes care of the catering.

item.title: Ekolo
item.description: Ekolo is a shop selling ecological and organic products and foodstuffs. Ekolo also promotes and gives information on sustainable consumption and production.

item.title: Ekomarket Ruohonjuuri
item.description:
A broad selection of ecological and organic products, foodstuffs etc.
Other stores: Ruohonjuuri Itäkeskus Shoppingcenter Itäkeskus Itäkatu 5 00930 Helsinki
New store starting from 17 th of Sept. Ruohonjuuri Hakaniemi Sörnäisten rantatie 5 00530 Helsinki
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 9 am- 9 pm. Sat 9 am-6 pm. and sun 12 am- 6 pm.

item.title: Elannon näyttämö
