item.description: Theatre and music performances

item.title: Eläintarha sports park
item.description: Sports park

item.title: Eläintarha Villa / Bourgeois Home Exhibition
item.description: Bourgeois home exhibition is shown in one of the few remaining villas (1889) in the Linnunlaulu/Eläintarha district of the city. Three of the downstairs rooms are furnished in the style of the times and providing a glimpse of life in and the atmosphere of the house a century age.

item.title: Eronen
item.description: A record store, founded in 1977, that is specialized in eg.reggae, salsa, afro, latin, classic and jazz music.

item.title: Erottaja Night
item.description: Erottaja Night is both a nightclub and a karaokebar. Dance and sing to the latest hits from Finland and around the world.

item.title: Espa Stage
item.description: Espa is a summer stage located in the Esplanadi park. Over 200 different artist groups perform on the stage during the summer. The performers at Espa include both young artists beginning their careers and well known and respected artists. Jazz-Espa, which has been called the longest jazz festival in Finland, has a well established place in the summer programme. For years, the performers of both Province days and Helsinki Day have brought joy to Helsinki inhabitants and travellers promenading in the Esplanadi park.
item.matko:open: There are events on the Espa stage from 1 May until the end of August. Performances usually start at 4.30 p.m. Monday-Thursday, and at 10.30 a.m. on Saturday. On weekdays during the lunch hour, the stage is also a popular place to perform.
item.matko:services: The stage is rented out to outside organisers, but not for political or religious events. During autumn and winter, the Espa stage acts as an exhibition gallery. Inquiries: Office controller Tuula Miettinen, tel. +358-(0)9-3103 6564, e-mail: tuula.miettinen@hel.fi.

item.title: Esplanade Park
item.description: Situated in the heart of Helsinki, the Esplanade serves as a promenade for tourists and a place to relax for city residents. The park and the Espa Stage host many popular events, including the Marimekko Fashion Show and raising of the midsummer pole accompanied by folk dancing in June and the Jazz-Espa concert series on weekdays throughout July.
item.matko:ingress: Esplanade park is situated in the heart of Helsinki.

item.title: Espoo Golf Club
item.description: Golf course in Espoo.

item.title: Euphoria
item.description: Euphoria is a modern and stylish Banqueting venue owned by the Council of Medical Students in Helsinki University. It is a penthouse and offers a magnificent view over the eastern parts of Helsinki. Euphoria has been recently renovated by famous architects and has a unique and cosy atmosphere. Venue has dining facilities for 120 people, conference facilities for 50 people and can be transformed to a festival hall for 250 people. We also offer a bar, sauna facilities, a high standard kitchen and grand piano lounge. All-inclusive services for conferences up to 50 people.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 14 km

item.title: Eurohostel Oy
item.description: Close to the centre, easy to come by tram and free morning sauna! The city center sights, shops and restaurant are within walking distance and the ferries from Stockholm arrive just few steps away. You can choose a dormitory bed or single, twin or triple room in two different room categories. The hostel is completely non-smoking.
item.matko:location: Katajanokka district - City centre 2 km, airport 18 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 135 rooms: 25 single, 100 twin, and 10 triple rooms. Traditional Backpackers category: bed, single, twin and triple. Modern Eurohostel category: single, twin and triple.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Katajanmarja serves breakfast, lunch, dinner, pizza and a la carte list. Fully licenced. 70 seats. Two summer terracces.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Self-service kitchens on each floor, self-service laundry, Internet kiosk.
item.matko:ingress: Clean and comfortable Hostel at Katajanokka district.

item.title: Event Arena Bank
item.description: This distinctive restaurant at the very centre of Helsinki has been constructed in an old bank building which has been transformed into its current state honouring the original 1950's style. The result is a modern and versatile restaurant and event arena to hold meetings and celebrations. The Party Spot is an extremely versatile banquet space. It can be transformed from a setting suitable for a traditional dinner to an extravagant banquet room which matches any theme you can think of. Most of the 18 meeting rooms can be easily connected and adjusted to various needs.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Lunch Club is a free-flow lunch restaurant for up to 200 persons; Bank Bistro has 80 seats and serves as a private evening restaurant. Party Spot is a private venue for meetings and cocktail parties for 1000 people. The whole Event Arena Bank can be booked for up to 1600 persons.

item.title: Fairytale
item.description: Gay Bar

item.title: Fallkulla Domestic Animal Zoo
item.description: In Fallkulla it is possible to get aquainted with animals in a traditional farm: sheep, goats, pigs, cows, chicken, ducks, geese and horses. In Fallkulla children and the young 9-17years can also take part in animal care and help with work on the farm. Run by the City of Helsinki Youth Department.
item.matko:location: Local train I (or N & T) to Tapanila, c. 10-15min. walk. Also buses 76A and 76B from Malmi and Puistola train stations to the Domestic Animal Zoo.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Bookings in advance, tel.+358-(0)9-3108 9095 (Wed-Fri 13-14). Groups max.30persons.
item.matko:services: Farm Museum in the cowshed loft.
item.matko:ingress: In Fallkulla it is possible to get aquainted with animals in a traditional farm.

item.title: Farouge
item.description: When the Lebanese ask you kifak?, or how are you in Arabic, they are literally asking whether you are experiencing pleasure. Pleasure, or kaif in Arabic, comes from good food, good wine, and good company.

item.title: Fasaani Antik
item.description: A wide range of furniture and other objects, also some Finnish design objects

item.title: Fazer Café
item.description: Karl Fazers French-Russian café&cake shop was opened in Kluuvikatu 17.9.1891. As years have passed by the building, designed by Juslen, has been renovated and the interior of the café has been changed many times. The design of the cupola salon has been designed by interior designor Kaisa Blomstedt, who's well acquainted especially with interiors in functionalistic style. A part of the café&cake shops goodies are still made in Kluuvikatu, and it is possible to see the confectioners at work behind glass.

item.title: Feminett
item.description: Feminett is known for its high quality Fashionable collections from the capitols of European fashion. Feminett was established in 1949 and since then its principles have been unerring style, high quality products and a great service.

item.title: Filippa K
item.description: Timeless simplicity with contemporary edge.

item.title: Finlandia Hall
item.description: Finlandia Hall in Helsinki is the leading congress, event and entertainment venue in Finland. Centrally located, in park-like surroundings, Finlandia Hall is ideal for conferences and exhibitions, as well as for smaller meetings, concerts and light entertainment. A masterpiece by the world-renowned Finnish architect, Alvar Aalto, Finlandia Hall is worth a visit in its own right.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 30 min
item.matko:open: Open only during events and guided tours. InfoShop open Mon-Fri 7.30 - 17.00.
item.matko:admission: Guided tours: Adults 12,50€, senior citizens, students and children (under 16years) 10€
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, Inva-WC, induction loop system (amplification system for people with hearing aids)
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups (max.25pers.) by request, Info-Shop, tel.+358-(0)9-4024 211, guide fee during weekdays 120€, Sat-Sun and holidays 170€. Reservations www.finlandiatalo.fi.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The Finlandia Restaurant is a private restaurant, which serves gourmet food; dinner for 1100 persons, cocktails for 2500. Tel. +385 9 6128 6400
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Main building c. 4,000 m2, Congress wing c. 2,000 m2
item.matko:services: Regular guided tours open to the public. Further information at the InfoShop, tel.+358-(0)9-4024 211, e-mail:palvelupiste@finlandiatalo.fi or www.finlandiatalo.fi (open Mon-Fri 7.30-17). Interval refreshments can be booked in advance from 9 to 16 on weekdays, tel. +358-(0)9-402 4500.
item.matko:ingress: Internationally most notable concert and congress hall in Finland.

item.title: Finlandia Hall
item.description:
Finlandia Hall in Helsinki is the leading congress, event and entertainment venue in Finland. Centrally located, in park-like surroundings, Finlandia Hall is ideal for conferences and exhibitions, as well as for smaller meetings, concerts and light entertainment. A masterpiece by the world-renowned Finnish architect, Alvar Aalto, Finlandia Hall is worth a visit in its own right.
Exhibition areas: Main building 4000 m2, Veranda 2200 m2, Congress Wing 2000 m2
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 30 min
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Main building 4000m2, Congress Wing 2000m2

item.title: Finlandia Park
item.matko:location: Former "Auroran kenttä". Behind Finlandia Hall, in the corener of Karamzininkatu and Töölönlahdenkatu

item.title: Finlayson
item.description: Finlayson has a rich heritage of manufacturing quality textiles since 1820. Even today, Finlayson Oy textiles and Familon bed concepts add a touch of luxury to private homes and public premises. Long-term cooperation with the Allergy and Asthma Federation of Finland guarantees our products are also ideal for people who suffer from allergy.

item.title: Finlayson outlet
item.description: Finlayson has a rich heritage of manufacturing quality textiles since 1820. Also today high quality Finlayson textiles and bed concepts as well as Familon duvets, pillows and mattresses add a touch of luxury and softness to private homes and public premises. In this shop you'll also find special collections and second rate products. In the same building you'll also find other outlets, eg. the Arabia outlet.
item.matko:location: tram nr.6 towards Arabia

item.title: Finnish Academy of Fine Arts / Kaiku Gallery
item.description: The gallery of the Academy of Fine Arts

item.title: Finnish Academy of Fine Arts/Kasarmikatu Gallery
Finnish Academy of Fine Arts/Lönnrotinkatu Gallery- FAFA Gallery
Finnish Engineers' Association Building
item.description: Building planned by Alvar Aalto (1948-1953).

item.title: Finnish Museum of Photography
item.description: The Finnish Museum of Photography is a special museum devoted to the art and practice of photography in Finland. The exhibitions throw light on the Finnish photography, both past and present. Also temporary Finnish and foreign photo exhibitions.
item.matko:location: tram 8, metro to Ruoholahti
item.matko:admission: 2011: Adults 6€, students and pensioners 4€, children under 18 years free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchairs, Inva-WC and lift (opened by request), assistant needed.
item.matko:groups: Group entrance fee 5€/pers (min. 10 pers.). School groups (under 18 years) free of charge. Guidebookings tel.+358 (0)9 686 6360 (Tue-Fri 9-12) or satu.sormunen@fmp.fi. Guidance fee weekdays 60€, Sat and holidays 75€. School groups 36€ (children under 18 years). Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English.
item.matko:services: Museum shop.

item.title: Finnish National Opera
item.description: Surrounded by park, the Opera, built in the beginning of the 1990's, is in the inner city and easily accessible by public transport. View from the main foyer over the sea and city centre. Performances six days a week as a rule: opera, ballet, premieres, concerts and other events. Main auditorium, intimate Almi Hall and impressive foyers. Guided tours by arrangement.
item.matko:location: City centre 1.5 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:admission: Different ticket categories (1.-6.); students and schoolchildren -50% in ticket categories 1-4.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair, Inva-WC, lift (doors opens automatically), easy access for visually impaired, wheelchair seats in the boxes of the 1st and 2nd balcony. When buying tickets for these seats, please notify the Opera at least a week in advance. Parking and entrance in Töölö Bay side. The libretto of some operas available in embossed printing. Induction loop system for people with hearing aids in the stalls and on the 1st balcony.
item.matko:groups: Tickets for groups: in ticket categories 1 and 2 discount -10€/person (Mon-Thu, min. 30 persons). Guided tours of the Opera House can be organized on request for groups. For further information and bookings, The National Opera sales service, tel. +358- (0)9-4030 2210, e-mail: housetours@operafin.fi .
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Opera Restaurant: 200-650 seats; catering in the foyer for 1500
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Foyer
item.matko:additionalinfo: Guided tours on request, regular opera and ballet performances
item.matko:services: Guided tours in Finnish every Wed at 14.30 (8€/adults, 5€/children). Guided tours of the Opera House in English in other languages can be organized on request during the performance season. For further information and bookings, The National Opera sales service, tel. +358- (0)9-4030 2210, e-mail: housetours@operafin.fi . Café Opera in the main foyer is open Mon-Fri 12-17, exhibitions in the café.

item.title: Finnish National Theatre
item.description: Main theatre in Finland performing in Finnish
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchairs, please notify in advance.
item.matko:groups: Group bookings, tel. +358 (0)9 1733 1332, guided tours of e.g. sets possible.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Café and restaurant Morkku (open Mon-Fri 15-24 and Sat 11-24) Restaurant also for groups as well as for private occasions. Small shop in connection to the ticket sales.
item.matko:services: Café and restaurant Morkku (open Mon-Fri 15-24 and Sat 11-24) Restaurant also for groups as well as for private occasions. Small shop in connection to the ticket sales.
item.matko:ingress: Main theatre in Finland performing in Finnish.

item.title: Finnish Toy Museum Hevosenkenkä
item.description: Toys, yesterday´s favourites, attic treasures, exhibitions, memories... Dedicated to the culture of games and play, Finnish Toy Museum presents toys and play situations from the early 20th century to the present day. History and Finnish toys and special exhibitions. Also featured is Löylymäki Station, the winner of several international miniature railway competitions. Welcome to a museum for the entire family!
item.matko:location: Regional buses eg. 106, 110, 194
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups by arrangement.

item.title: Finnish-British Society
item.description: Finnish-British Society has different size of classrooms for meetings.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Finnkino Tennispalatsi
item.description: Movie theatre complex. Under the same roof, you can enjoy movies and the arts, as well as cafés and restaurants.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km

item.title: Fish Foot Spa KutiKuti
item.description: Fish Foot Spa KutiKuti is a relaxing foot spa for a person who cares about animals and who wants to pamper feet.
item.matko:location: Ullanlinna, Helsinki
item.matko:open: Tue-Fri klo 11 am-19 pm, Sat-Sun 11 am-16 pm
item.matko:disabled: Street level
item.matko:groups: 1h 80 € (two available swimming pools), 1,5h 100 € (two available swimming pools)

item.title: Fishing Lords
item.description: Fishing trips.

item.title: Fishmarket
item.description: Located near the South Harbour in the heart of Helsinki, Fishmarket is the place to go for fresh, delicious seafood and crustacean. One of the best fish restaurants in town will surprise you with experiences that you cannot find anywhere else. Fishmarket offers freshly caught, delicious fish and fresh lobster, crayfish, oysters and shellfish, prepared just right, served unpretentiously and enjoyed in the best company.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, 19 km to the airport

item.title: FiskarsForum
item.description: The history of Fiskars Village goes back allt the way to the year 1649. Today the village, a center of Finnish arts and crafts renowned far beyond the country's borders, is a unique place to visit. Throughout the year, its high-quality facilities for conferences, accommodation, and restaurants, together with various workshops and shops, offer much of interest for visitors to see and do. Today, a former cutlery mill houses a conference center which makes a fine venue for meetings, conferences, and training sessions.
item.matko:location: Fiskars is in the city of Raseborg, in Pohja, west of Karis, less than a hundred kilometers west of Helsinki.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Thought to be the oldest inn in Finland to have been in continuous use, the Fiskars Wärdshus has for many years built its reputation and traditions by providing excellent food in a comfortable environment with friendly service and atmosphere. The menu changes with the seasons and always offers some memorable culinary experiences. The original inn was built in 1836, and added to in 2003 when a new hotel was built with respect for traditional methods and using local building skills. The lovely rooms are well equipped to a high standard.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The Kuparipaja restaurant is in a former copper smithy beside the Fiskars River. Downstairs is a café-cum-restaurant, while the hall upstairs seats larger groups for lunch or dinner. Overlooking the river rapids while eating on the terrace of Kuparipaja is an added treat for summer visitors. The interior of the restaurant is modern, the menu contemporary and varied but always respectful of tradition.

item.title: Flamingo Waterpark, Spa & Wellness
item.description: Flamingo Spa consists of a large Water Park and a Spa & Wellness world for adults. The Water Park was designed to entertain the whole family. The luxurious Spa & Wellness world is a centre of well-being and recreation. The Spa's atmosphere resembles ancient Mesopotamia and comprises several themed saunas, pools and luxurious treatments all in a mystical environment.
item.matko:location: The Flamingo leisure centre is built next to the Jumbo shopping centre in Vantaa, only 2.5 km from Helsinki-Vantaa airport.
item.matko:open: Open every day (please see the opening hours, exceptions to opening hours and waterpark service break on the Flamingo webpages)
item.matko:disabled: Accessible toilet.
item.matko:groups: Group discount -10 % (not valid for children). Group discout is possible when reservation is made beforehand and payed as one payment or invoice.
item.matko:services: Cafe, Flamingo Spa Shop, parking hall for 850 cars.

item.title: Flower of Life, artpark for children
item.description: Flower Of Life artpark, a permanent art park with sculptures for all ages, especially for children under three years old.
item.matko:location: Pikku-Huopalahti, catch tram nr.10 to Tilkantori, from where a walk to Tilkanniitty
item.matko:ingress: Flower Of Life artpark, a permanent art park with sculptures for all ages.

item.title: Forenom apartments
item.description: Forenom Accommodation Solutions offers equipped and furnished apartments located all around Helsinki; from the city centre to suburbs. Forenom offers apartments of various levels, from basic to luxury, from studios to houses. All Forenom apartments are available for both short and long terms. An excellent, more homelike and flexible alternative to hotel accommodation.
item.matko:location: Around the capital region

item.title: Forenom House Helsinki
item.description:
Apartment hotel Forenom House Helsinki aims to provide modern, simple and hassle-free accommodation 15 minutes away from Helsinki city centre. The building has been completely renovated in 2012. Brightly decorated rooms include flat screen television, microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker and kettle. Some of the rooms also have a kitchenette with a hotplate. The rooms have a free wireless internet at your use.
The apartment hotel uses easy keyless entry: after making your reservation, you receive an entry code via SMS to your mobile phone. This key code provides entry to the general front door and is unique to your apartment.
Nearby the apartment hotel you can find a supermarket, restaurants, some shops, pharmacy and a gym.
item.matko:location: In Herttoniemi, about 500 meters from the nearest metro station. Helsinki city centre is 15 minutes and the airport 25 minutes away.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 144 Superior-level rooms, ranging in size from 13 m2 to 35 m2. Rooms can accommodate 1-4 persons depending on the room type.

item.title: Formula Center Helsinki
item.description: Underground Karting track.
item.matko:location: Metro to Myllypuro.
item.matko:open: Mondays closed Tuesday - Friday: 14.00 - 21.00 Saturday: 10.00 - 19.00 Sunday: 14.00 - 20.00

item.title: Formverk
item.description: A Finnish company creating Scandinavian design, chairs, lighting fixtures, accessories etc.

item.title: Forum Box
item.description: FORUM BOX is a non-profit artist-run co-operative society, which was initiated in 1996 by sculptor Kain Tapper (1930-2004). Its main purpose is to maintain an art space in Helsinki in order to enrich and support the Finnish cultural life. Currently Forum Box co-op has 36 artist members, all of which are prominent Finnish artists and actors in the field of contemporary art.

item.title: Fratello Torrefazione
item.description: Fratello Torrefazione, located in the Kluuvi shopping centre, serves great coffees, both espresso and filter, supplied by Kaffa Roastery. Italian-inspired lunch, sandwiches, pastries, wine and beer are also available. The real speciality is the syphon bar, first of its kind in Finland.

item.title: Frida Marina
item.description:
Frida Marina is a 138m2 concept store in the Kallio district, offering second hand clothes, bags, shoes, jewellery, home accessories, textiles, tableware and other old and new treasures.
Store also serves Puro organic coffee and high-quality tea, that can be purchased home as well. On sale also a selection of organic cosmetics from Madara and Sante.

item.title: Friends of Finnish Handicraft
item.description: Friends of Finnish Handicraft offer services to both interior design professionals and homemakers. From the Friends of Finnish Handicraft you can find high quality textiles and gift items made with natural materials. For crafters the Friends of Finnish Handicraft offer complete ryijy rug and embroidery kits.
item.matko:open: Sales exhibition and shop. Open Mon-Tue 9-16.

item.title: Fuga
item.description: Fuga, spezialiced in classic music, is located in the center of Helsinki within the Helsinki Music Centre premises. The shops selection consists of about 15,000 cd's and hundreds of dvd's.

item.title: Fun Bowling
item.description: Bowling has become a popular sports amoung different ages.

item.title: G. W. Sundmans
item.description:
This top-class restaurant located in a historic house on the southern side of Helsinki harbour offers a diverse and functional space for occasions of all sizes. G.W. Sundmans has several private rooms and conference rooms of different sizes to choose from, and the restaurant also offers use of a pleasant wine cellar and an up-to-date auditorium. The delicacies offered by the restaurant's high-class kitchen complete the experience.
The restaurant is set in the empire-style house of naval captain G.W. Sundman, which was designed to him in the 19th century by Finnish architect Carl Ludvig Engel. G.W.Sundmans guests can enjoy the best products of the Finnish kitchen, prepared from the finest ingredients.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 11-14.30, 18-24, Sat 18-24; Sun on request for groups.

item.title: G18
item.description: The Grand Ballroom of G18 is nearly 10m high and has beautiful details in harmonious colours - pillars, French balconies, roof and wall panels. The high quality audiovisual equipment and sound- and light systems enable the organising of grand dinners, cocktail-parties, concerts, conferences and seminars. Spacious lobby areas in two floors adjacent to Ballroom are ideal for catering or exhibitions purposes. The Grand Ballroom does not have a license to sell alcoholic beverages, and there is "free catering" i.e. the client can bring their own liquors and choose their own catering company.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The in-house Restaurant G18 (approx. 100 seats) offers Scandinavian specialities for its lunch and dinner guests and can also cater private functions in the Ballroom. A cosy wine bar adjacent to the restaurant is open in the evenings.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Lobby area adjacent to Grand Ballroom (2nd floor) : 150m2 (gross), 130m2 (net). Lobby area (3rd floor) 150m2 (gross), 130m2 (net). Both areas are suitable for both exhibition and catering purposes.

item.title: Galerie Anhava
item.description: Art gallery. Galerie Anhava was founded 1991. In 1997 it merged with Galerie Artek, a pioneer within contemporary art in Finland since 1935. In October 1999 both galleries moved to new premises in the Sanoma building next to Kiasma, the Museum of Contemporary Art. Galerie Anhava's program concentrates on international, mainly Scandinavian and Finnish contemporary art.

item.title: Galerie Aspis
item.description: Gallery

item.title: Galerie Forsblom
item.description: From emerging talents, to established artists, Galerie Forsblom presents exhibitions by leading Finnish and International artists.

item.title: Galerie Vision
item.description: The Gallery purchases, sells and mediates domestic and international high-class graphics, paintings and sculptures. You can have a one-of-a-kind bronze scuplture crafted by the artist (sculptor) Osmi Nyström.

item.title: Galleri Arbis
item.description: Works by student of Arbis

item.matko:location: Roihupelto

item.title: Galleria BE' 19
item.description: Galleria BE'19 was founded in 1989. The exhibition program consists of all aspects of contemporary art including design. Galleria BE'19 arranges 15-16 exhibitions per year. The exhibition period is three weeks. BE'19 concentrates mainly on Finnish contemporary art, but an interesting foreign artist can also be a part of the program. Galleria BE'19 acts as a dealer, agent and an individual consultant.

item.title: Galleria Esplanad
item.description: Galleria Esplanad is an upscale shopping centre with over 50 shops, stores, restaurants and other services located in the middle of Helsinki.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 10-20, Sat 10-17, Sun 12-16 (shop opening hours may vary)
item.matko:services: An underground car park for over 700 cars is located next to Galleria Esplanad. The entrances and exits are located on Kaisaniemenkatu and on the corner of Fabianinkatu and Pohjoisesplanadi (www.europark.fi).

item.title: Galleria G
item.description: The gallery is maintained by the Association of Finnish Printmakers. The programme is focused on graphic arts and artworks on paper, but it also exhibits paintings, photographs, sculptures, and installations. The gallery houses also the sales collection of the Association of Finnish Printmakers which is a representative cross-section of new Finnish graphic art.

item.title: Galleria G12
item.description: Art Exhibitions

item.matko:services: Café.

item.title: Galleria Johan S.
item.description: Galleria Johan S. is an artgallery in Helsinki, Finland. We present contempory art in it´s many forms. Our range varies from modern jewellery art to paintings and ceramics.

item.title: Galleria Kadieff
item.description: The exhibition programme aimes to expose the work of both new and established artists, mainly Russian but also Finnish and increasingly international. The gallery introduces modern artists whose work pays homage to academic traditions and also exhibit painters who work in radically different styles. We are concerned to represent a comprehensive vision and have an educational agenda. We believe that each piece of art in our gallery has a good value and it's images empowered to assist in our personal and planetary healing.

item.title: Galleria Kaj Stenvall
item.description: Well known duck paintings and art grafic

item.title: Gallery / Kamppi shopping centre 5th floor
item.description: Eg. Diesel, Paul Frank, Lacoste, Svea, Fred Perry, Le Temps des cerise, Converse, Vans etc.

item.title: Gallery Arkki / Young Persons Architecture School Arkki
Gallery Huuto
item.description: Galleria Huuto is an independent artist collective located in Helsinki, Finland. Currently Huuto maintains two galleries, both located at the center of Helsinki. Galleria Huuto is not restricted merely within these premises, however, but can also be realized elsewhere in a form of various events, projects and visits. Annually Huuto organizes as many as 50 contemporary art exhibitions.

item.title: Gallery Huuto (Viiskulma)
item.description: Galleria Huuto is an independent artist collective located in Helsinki, Finland. Currently Huuto maintains two galleries, both located at the center of Helsinki. Galleria Huuto is not restricted merely within these premises, however, but can also be realized elsewhere in a form of various events, projects and visits. Annually Huuto organizes as many as 50 contemporary art exhibitions.

item.title: Gallery Sculptor
item.description: The gallery for the Association of Finnish Sculptors shows mainly Finnish sculpture, bul also arranges other art exhibitions of both foreign and Finnish artists. At the same time, there is a sales collection of small sculptures as well as bronze art medals from over one hundred of its various members.

item.title: Gardenia-Helsinki
item.description: A unique tropical garden, Gardenia, was opened in April 2001. It is situated in Viikki, in the heart of Helsinki, next to the Vanhankaupunginlahti Bay nature reserve and the Helsinki Univeristy campus area. The luxuriant tropical garden, covered by glass, is a beautiful and refreshing place to visit all year round. Out in the yard there is a genuine Japanese stone garden. Special exhibitions and events.
item.matko:location: City centre 10 km, airport 18 km. Bus 68 from city centre.
item.matko:admission: Adults 4€, pensioners 2,30€, children (3-17 y.) and students 2€. Family ticket: two adults & max. 5 children 9€.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair, assistance needed. Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Entrance fee for groups 3€/pers. (min. 20 persons), children groups 1,50€/pers. (min.20persons). Guided tours in the garden and other theme tours eg. to the Viikki nature, by request. Guidebooking tel. +358 (0)9 3478 4050/+358 (0)9 3478 400. Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English. Lunch for groups by request.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Cafeteria and lunchrestaurant, 50 seats. During summer also an outside terrace. Offers coffee, refreshments and lunch. Tel. +358 (0)400 601 625.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: 15m long exhibition wall for works of art and vitrine for smaller art objects.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Guided tours in the tropical garden and field trips to the nature.
item.matko:services: Café-restaurant Gardenia, tel.+358 (0)400 601 625., open Mon-Thu 10-16, Fri 10-14, Sat-Sun 11-15, outdoor terrace in summertime. Parking for 120 cars. Facilities for corporate and private occasions.
item.matko:ingress: The luxuriant tropical garden, covered by glass, is a beautiful and refreshing place to visit all year round.

item.title: Gaselli
item.description: Pub Gaselli is the home of all barflies who have a constant flair for listening to old Finnish pop songs over a mug of good beer or cider. Gaselli show also Canal+ sport channels.

item.title: Gastropub Stone's
item.matko:services: Pub food prepared in lavastone grill and cozy athmosphere invites you to Stone's. Wide beer selection includes both Finnish and foreign brands.

item.title: Gaudete
item.description: Gaudete stocks a carefully selected range of womens clothes, shoes, accessories, jewelry, perfumes and scented candles.

item.title: German Church
item.description: The German Church dating from 1864 designed by Harald Bosse and C.J. von Heideken. It is popular with the people of Helsinki for weddings.

item.title: GLO Hotel Airport
item.description:
GLO Hotel Helsinki Aiport is specialized in creating unique experiences for hotel guests staying at Helsinki Aiport. All the public premises and services are available free of charge for hotel guests.
GLO Hotel Helsinki Aiport has 37 rooms available in the heart of the Aiport. You can spend a night in the aiport or rest during some hours during the day in the hotel day rooms. A total of 20 rooms are GLO Standard rooms, 9 are GLO Double rooms and 6 are GLO Twin rooms. There are also available adjoining rooms and rooms for disabled guests at Hotel GLO Helsinki Aiport.

item.title: GLO Hotel Art (Hotel Linna)
item.description: The new GLO Hotel Art is a unique combination of a 1903-built Art Nouveau castle, with its variety of charming meeting and event facilities, and a new modern hotel. The stylish and modern 170 rooms of the hotel have been created together with Finnish designers. The individual needs of the customers have been taken into account when designing the range of services available for business visitors and families.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Cellar Restaurant, Jugend Hall and Tower Sauna and Meeting room are open on request for meetings and private events.

item.title: GLO Hotel Helsinki Kluuvi
item.description:
GLO is a modern and urban lifestyle hotel. The most important idea behind the hotel is customising the stay at the hotel to meet the needs of each individual guest. GLO offers its guests a staggering variety of recreational opportunities including sports, culture, dining, and health services in the hotel itself and outside its walls.
GLO is situated in the centre of Helsinki at a spot which is pivotal for the culture, history, and economy in the city. The hotel has a direct entrance to the first-class shopping centre Kämp Galleria. The Palace Kämp Day Spa is located on the top floor of the hotel, and to reach some of the best restaurants in town you only need to step out of the hotel. Hotel GLO also cooperates with the leading ticket providers in Finland to provide its guests with the best seats in all culture events in Helsinki.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: The hotel has two different room types. 12 of the 144 rooms are suites the largest of which is 200 m2. The wonderfully spacious double rooms are 35 m2.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Hotel GLO's restaurant has been designed in a modern yet timeless style, exuding urban atmosphere, elegance and warmth.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Hotel guests are able to buy tickets from the reception to the P-Kluuvi parking (EuroPark) at the price of 23 €/24h.

item.title: GLO Hotel Sello
item.description:
The Hotel Sello, which was completed in 2006, is an atmospheric and extremely stylish lifestyle hotel at the heart of Espoo. The modern hotel provides anything and everything you could desire - and more - regardless of whether you are a discerning business traveller or just there to enjoy a nice holiday with your family.
The guests at the hotel have greatly appreciated its tasteful interior design and relaxed atmosphere. The Sello also provides rooms with kitchenettes to make longer stays more enjoyable and convenient, and what would a first rate hotel be without rooms perfectly suited for holding meetings and seminars.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 11 km, airport 16 km. Leppävaara, Espoo. 10-minute ride on a local train from Helsinki.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 140 rooms 35 of which have kitchenettes and to make longer stays more convenient.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Hotel Sello houses the famous Paul's Bistro where the menu is filled with delicacies with a genuine flavour from West Coast USA.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Palace Hotel Sello houses modern, comfortable and uniquely inviting conference and party rooms which are managed by Paul´s Catering. The rooms can be modified to perfectly meet the customer's needs.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Business Point which is located right next to the reception desk can be used freely to, for instance, read e-mail and use the internet free of charge. Free parking in the Sello shopping centre's parking carage.

item.title: Globe Hope Shop
item.description:
Globe Hope is an innovative Finnish design company that makes ecological design out of recycled materials. Globe Hope re-defines used and leftover materials, turning them into unique design clothes and accessories. All Globe Hope production relies on sustainable development. Production is done by subcontractors around Finland and Estonia. Selection of SECCO products on sale.
Visit also other Globe Hope store: Kiseleff Shop Aleksanterinkatu 28, Helsinki tel: +358 (0)50 305 1115 E-mail: kiseleff(at)globehope.com Open: Mon-Fri 10 am- 7 pm. Sat 10 am- 5 pm. Sun 12 am- 5 pm.
item.matko:location: Lasipalatsi (Glass Palace)

item.title: Gloria Cultural Arena
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Goethe-Institut
item.description: German culture, concerts, exhibitions

item.title: Good Life Coffee
item.description: Kallio-based coffee bar & shop focused on serving premium coffee from Finnish roasters (Kaffa Roastery, Helsingin kahvipaahtimo, Turun kahvipaahtimo) and interesting Nordic coffee blends. Small snacks, yoghurt, muesli, croissants, sandwiches and juice also available.

item.title: Goofin' Records
item.description: A large selection of eg. 50s, 60s, surf, rockabilly & psychobilly, on vinyl and CD.

item.title: Gourmetpizza Carlito´s
item.description: Carlito's is located in the corner of Aleksanterinkatu and Kluuvikatu in the centre of Helsinki. Its specialities are delicious Gourmet Pizzas and large tempting salads. In this modern restaurant little details make your visit enjoyable - like the city view from the window which makes you feel the beat of the city.
item.matko:open: Mon-Thu 11-23 (kitchen until 22.30), Fri 11-24 (kitchen until 23.30), Sat 14-24 (kitchen until 23.30), Sun 14-21 (kitchen until 20.30).

item.title: GR8 Salmisaari
item.description: Gr8 Salmisaari is not a regular bowling alley, but a clublike entertainment center in Ruoholahti. Here you can try e.g. bowling, archery, segway-driving, golf with a simulator, pool, lazer games, minigolf, boxing. There is also a sports bar on the premises.

item.title: Greenbike
item.description: Bicycle hire in May-August. Various models and frame sizes available. People hiring a bike are issued with a map of Helsinki showing three biking routes. Child seats etc. also available.

item.title: Gumböle Golf GG
item.description: Golf course

item.title: Hagelstam's International Bibliophilic Antiquarian Bookshop
item.description: From Hagelstam's shelves you can find literature on architecture, design, music, philosophy, travel, topography, nautica, hunting and fishing, photography, cinema, gastronomy etc. Also rare books, maps and prints from 16th-21th centuries available.

item.title: Hakaniemi Market Hall
item.description: Hakaniemi Market Hall has approx. 70 shops in two floors. The shops on the 1st floor sell foodstuffs and the 2nd floor shops eg. souvenirs and handicrafts. The Market Hall, designed by Karl Hård af Segerstad, was opened in 1914.
item.matko:phone: +358 (0)9 3107 1388/Market hall warden, +358 (0)9 3104 0377/Real Estate department, Premises Centre

item.title: Hakaniemi Market Square
item.matko:phone: +358 (0)9 3107 1387/market sq. warden, +358 (0)9 3104 0377/Real Estate department, Premises Centre
item.matko:open: Mon-Sat 6.30-15. Sunday market usually on the first Sunday of every month.

item.title: Haltia - The Finnish Nature Centre
item.description:
The ecologically designed Finnish Nature Centre Haltia presents the most spectacular natural attractions of Finland in its modern exhibitions. The centre, located next to the Nuuksio National Park, will open its doors 31.5.2013. Haltia will also host various temporary exhibitions. Haltia offers inspiring meeting space in an ecological building, which is built entirely of wood. With the architecture inspired by a story in the Kalevala, Finnish national epic, Haltia combines the fascinating features of Finnish culture and nature.
Haltia offers a variety of meeting rooms for diverse functions. The venues vary from a smaller, exclusive 10- person boardroom with a sauna, to a 200-seat auditorium. The outdoor function area in the immediate vicinity of Haltia offers unique possibilities for combining an outdoor venue with a modern exhibition centre space. It is easy to combine nature experiences with meetings and events in the nearby nature trails, or in Nuuksio National Park.
The whole building serves as a private venue outside the Nature Centre's opening hours.
item.matko:location: On the fringes of Nuuksio National Park. Helsinki City centre 35 km, Helsinki Airport 35 km.
item.matko:disabled: Accessibility taken into consideration throughout the building.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Haltia's 200-seat restaurant, serves local Finnish food. Different parts of the restaurant are easily divided into smaller sections. Lake view terrace can be divided into smaller parts for private purposes.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Total exhibition space: 673 m2. The whole centre can be reserved for private functions outside the Nature Centre's opening hours, enabling the use of the meeting rooms and auditorium, the 200-seat restaurant, a 150-seat terrace, a large foyer with a fireplace, and exhibition space featuring Finland's most spectacular natural attractions (main exhibition area and Helsinki Metropolitan Green Belt exhibition, 443 m2 and 73 m2).
item.matko:services: Guided tours and other outdoor activities can be combined with meetings both in the surrounding nature as well as in Nuuksio National Park.

item.title: Haltia - The Finnish Nature Centre
item.description: Haltia, opening May 31, 2013, is an impressive modern and ecologically designed Conference and Event Center. The main exhibition will fascinate the visitor with its enthralling visualization of the Finnish nature.
item.matko:location: Haltia is located on the fringes of Nuuksio National Park, just 25 mins from helsinki.
item.matko:open: In summer 15.2.-30.9., Mon-Sun 9.30-19 In winter 1.10.-14.2., Mon-Sun 9.30-17
item.matko:admission: Main exhibition: entrance 7e/adult, 2,5e/ under 18 years old, free entrance for children under 7 years. Free entrance to the Helsinki Metropolitan Green Belt exhibition.
item.matko:disabled: The whole building has been planned with the physically challenged in mind. A 1,8 km trail accessible for all starts from the vicinity of Haltia. On wheelchair an assistant is required on the outdoor trail.
item.matko:groups: Group entrance to the main exhibition on advance reservation: 5e/ person, min. 10 persons/ group. Guidance 70 e/ hour, max. 25 persons/ group.
item.matko:services: Haltia's restaurant and shop embrace nature themes in their products. 200 parking lots.

item.title: Haltiala Farm
item.description: Farm with animals (cows, sheep, pigs, hens).
item.matko:open: The animals are outside in summertime (usually 1.6.-15.10.), otherwise they are indoors and you can see them Mon-Fri 18-20 and Sat-Sun 11-18.
item.matko:groups: Group visits Mon-Fri 9.00-15.30. Pls contact Jari Kuusinen tel. +358-(0)500 607 444 in advance.
item.matko:services: Happenings during Christmas and Easter

item.title: Hanasaari - the Swedish-Finnish Cultural Centre
item.description:
Ranked as one of the most high-standard conference centres in Finland, Hanasaari offers a venue ideal both for business and private events. It hosts international conferences and seminars for up to 230 attendees as well as small meetings, workshops and other activities. International guests appreciate especially the responsive and flexible service, the relaxed atmosphere and the unique location by the sea. Hanasaari also features a Scandinavian style hotel with 61 rooms. Hanasaari is located in Espoo, only a few minutes drive from the centre of Helsinki by bus or car. Free parking is available.
Restaurant: Restaurant Johannes serves Nordic delicacies combined with a welcoming ambiance for luncheons, business dinners, family events and hotel guests. The restaurant, including a separate adjoining room for 30 persons, can seat up to 240 dinner guests and host cocktail-parties for up to 380.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 7 km, airport 25 km. Hanasaari Cultural Centre is located in Espoo, west of downtown Helsinki on a scenic archipelago headland where the sea is always close at hand.
item.matko:accomodationinfo:
Hotel rooms at Hanasaari Cultural Centre may be reserved by conference guests or by anyone in need of overnight accommodation.
The hotel has a capacity of 92 guests in 30 single and 31 double rooms. An extra bed can also be provided in ten of the rooms enabling families of four to stay in the same room. All rooms have a window overlooking the scenic surroundings. Parking space is available free of charge for private motor vehicles and buses.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Johannes serves delicious Nordic cuisine combined with a welcoming ambiance for luncheons, business dinners, family events and hotel guests. The restaurant, including a separate adjoining room for 30 persons, can seat up to 240 dinner guests and host cocktail-parties for up to 380.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna suite with two saunas and a 17 meter swimming pool, various leisure possibilities in the surroundings, free of charge wireless Internet access in all premises, and free parking for 170 cars.

item.title: Hanna Sarén Summer Store
item.description: Hanna Sarén makes custom-crafted apparel, based on a unique blend of whimsical imagination, glamorous sophistication, and contemporary elegance.

item.title: Happy Jazz Club Storyville
item.description: Happy Jazz Club Storyville, situated behind the Parliament, entertain their customers by having both Finnish and international jazzorchestras play four evenings a week. In the streetlevel bar piano music is played in the early evening. Storyville's kitchen serves cajuncreole delicacies until 03 in the night.
item.matko:open: Jazz Club: Wed-Thu 20-03, Fri-Sat 20-04, outdoor terrace is open in summer daily at 14-02. The streetlevel Tin Roof Bar: Tue -Sat 18-04. Age limit 18years.

item.title: Harakka Nature Centre
item.description: The Harakka ("Magpie") island is located off the coast of Helsinki where the peninsula of Helsinki reaches far to the bosom of the baltic sea. The island used to belong to the Finnish defence forces, and it was opened to the public in 1989. There are buildings from both the periods of Russian and Finnish armies. The Nature Centre facilities include, among others, barracs built by the Russians in 1908. Gardens, old enbankments, rocky fields, seashore meadows and little marshes provide a variety of habitats that allow biodiversity incomparable in the Helsinki archipelago.
item.matko:location: Connecting boat leaves from the Kaivopuisto park, next to Café Ursula. The white sign is to be rised five minutes before the departure. Return trip 3 € for adults & 1.50 € for children (aged 4-16).
item.matko:services: The Nature Centre of Helsinki Environmental Centre is working in the island. We are offering exhibitions, tours and events in the various historical buildings renowated for this use and the nature path circling the island.
item.matko:ingress: Gardens, old enbankments, rocky fields, seashore meadows and little marshes provide a variety of habitats that allow biodiversity incomparable in the Helsinki archipelago.

item.title: Hard Rock Cafe Helsinki
item.description: Multiple event spaces available for parties up to 300 people. Hard Rock Café Helsinki is a 240-seater restaurant with an international and relaxed atmosphere. The rock shop sells Hard Rock Café merchandise on the street level.
item.matko:open: Restaurant: Sun-Thu 11-00, Fri-Sat 11-02. Rock shop: every day 10-23

item.title: Harri Syrjänen
item.description: Goldsmith and a leather artist. Jewellery from all possible materials, leather bags etc.

item.title: Hartwall Areena / Helsinki Halli Oy
item.description: The Hartwall Arena is one of the liveliest centres of entertainment in Europe: concerts, operas, dance performances, top ice-hockey and other sporting events, and to an increasing extent private corporate events. These include conferences, seminars, AGMs, cocktail parties, product launches, etc. Various premises, both large and small, can easily be combined to suit the occasion, the theme or the product to be launched.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 13 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Golden Star Restaurant, Silver Star Restaurant, Lapin Kulta Restaurant, 13 fast food outlets, 3 hamburger restaurants, 3 Pizza Hut restaurants, Jokers Bar, Hocken Roll Café
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Hartwall Areena 2350 m2 (net)
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Hartwall Arena also hires out equipment for events held on other premises: chairs, tables, platforms, sound systems, etc.

item.title: Helinä Rautavaara Museum
item.description: The Helinä Rautavaara Museum is a colourful, welcoming meeting place for fascinating exhibits from different parts of the world. It is based on the collections of Helinä Rautavaara, comprising over 2,500 works of art, ritual and utility items from Asia, Africa and Latin America. As an etnographic museum, it focuses on phenomena arising from cross-cultural interaction. Temporary exhibitions and events.

item.title: Helka Hotel
item.description:
The Helka Hotel has served its guests in the heart of Helsinki since 1928 and it has been renovated in 2006 as a theme hotel of Finnish Design and Nature. The bright and spacious rooms are furnished with products from Artek and Finnish top designers. Themes from design and nature are present everywhere: in furnishing, service, food and music.
Helka has served its guests in the heart of Helsinki since 1928. Renovated in 2006 and located in the heart of Helsinki, the Helka Hotel is conveniently close to the main railway station the airport bus terminal and the long distance coach terminal, but equally important it is very near the shopping district and other attractions for the visitor.
item.matko:location: City centre 0,5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, easy access for blind or partially sighted, two disabled rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 150 rooms: 58 single rooms, 87 twin rooms, 4 suites. All guestrooms have private bathrooms, a minibar, telephone and TV with satellite movie channels.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Aurinko has up to 160 seats for customers. Very popular lunch, but also very nice place for private or business dinners. Lounge bar 50 seats.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna
item.matko:services: The hotel offers 149 guest rooms - 59 single rooms, 86 double rooms out of which two for disabled guests, and four suites. There are five floors, one of them for smokers. Every room is equipped with automatic wake-up system, tv, free broadband Internet access, minibar and hairdryer. Laundry and ironing services, morning sauna and a small parking lot in the inner courtyard are also available.

item.title: Hellsten Helsinki Parliament
item.description: Hellsten Hotel Apartments offers spacious, furnished apartments for short or long term rent. All apartments are equipped with kitchenettes and some apartments even have sauna and balcony. Hellsten Helsinki Parliament is located in the city centre, near the Parliament House and the National Museum. There are 43 hotel apartments for 1-4 persons and room sizes vary from 21 to 75 square metres.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 18 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 43 Hotel Apartments: 21 One Bedroom apartments, 20 Studios 2 Two bedroom superior apartments with sauna. All rooms come equipped with Direct line telephone, Cable TV, Broadband Internet Access, fully equipped kitchenette, tiled bathrooms.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Within the building: Breakfast room, front desk open weekdays 8am-8pm, laundry facillity, iron/ironing board, sauna. A weekly cleaning service is also included.

item.title: Hellsten Helsinki Senate - Penthouse
item.description: Hellsten Hotel Apartments offers spacious, furnished apartments for short or long term rent. All apartments are equipped with kitchenettes and some apartments even have sauna and balcony. Hellsten Helsinki Senate is located in Katajanokka, one of the city´s most prestigious areas. There are 52 hotel apartments for 1-4 persons and room sizes vary from 20 to 160 square metres.
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo:
14 studios and 37 one-bedroom apartments, some with a private sauna. A luxury penthouse is also available.
All rooms come equipped with telephone, broadband internet connection, cable TV with VCR, clock radio, kitchenette, microwave, work area and steam iron. Within the building, residents will also find a laundry room, sauna and garage. A weekly cleaning service is also included.

item.title: Helmi
item.description: Stylish establishment with international kitchen favoured by media, advertising and banking professionals. Age limit 24years.

item.title: Helsingin Golfklubi
item.description: Golf course
item.matko:location: Estate of Tali

item.title: Helsinki Apartment
item.description: Fourteen high-class apartments in downtown Helsinki.
item.matko:location: In the vicinity of Töölöntori: city centre 1,5 km, airport 15 km. Downtown Helsinki / Töölö.
item.matko:disabled: There is a lift in all the apartment buildings.
item.matko:services: Wifi internet connection.

item.title: Helsinki Art Museum, Tennispalatsi (Tennis Palace)
item.description: The Tennis Palace Art Museum is a part of the Helsinki City Art Museum. It arranges changing Finnish and international exhibitions from various periods and related happenings.
item.matko:location: Near central bus station, in Kamppi.
item.matko:admission: Adults 10€, students and pensioners 8€, children under 18 free.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC and lift.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups, duration of the approx. 50 min. Languages Finnish, Swedish, English. Preliminary booking obligatory tel. +358-(0)9-3108 7003. Possibility also for workshops, tel. +358-(0)9-3108 7054.
item.matko:services: Museum shop as well as other shops, cafés and restaurants and movie theatre in the Tennispalatsi building. Closeby Forum parking hall, entrance from the Eteläinen Rautatienkatu.

item.title: Helsinki Bed and Breakfast
item.description:
Stay comfortably in a local home and relax in a room of your own but feel the life around you. In addition to the breakfast you will get the best hints on where to go and a personal view to the everyday life and celebrations in the Finnish capital. Alternatively you can rent the entire home for yourself - ideal e.g. for a family. There is a difference between a home and an apartment! Helsinki Bed and Breakfast will establish the contact between the guest and the local host. It will also safely manage your reservation and your payment.
The level of accommodation varies from a small and cosy loft bed to a luxurious double room. The kitchen and the living room are usually in shared use.
item.matko:location: Homestay is available in different parts of the capital area.
item.matko:disabled: Yes
item.matko:groups: Distributed to more than one host
item.matko:services: Cook together Finnish home food -evenings. Babysitting. Visit to an allotment garden cottage in Helsinki. Daysail at sea in Helsinki archipelago. City walk. Bar marathon.

item.title: Helsinki Canoe Center
item.description: Canoes for hire and guided canoe tours to order.
item.matko:location: Near to the Sibelius park, bus 24 from Erottaja.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Guides for groups (Finnish, Swedish, English), fee by appointment.
item.matko:services: Restaurant

item.title: Helsinki Cathedral
item.description: The beautiful and historically significant Helsinki Cathedral is an Evangelic Lutheran church, and for many it is the symbol of Helsinki. The church was designed by architect Carl Ludwig Engel in the 19th century as part of the Empire-style-downtown Helsinki area. The cathedral was completed in 1852.
item.matko:open: Open 9-18, in summer 9-24. Sightseeing visits to the Cathedral are not possible during services and other events.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs by the lift in the crypt (Kirkkokatu 18), Inva-WC also in the crypt. Please call +358 9 2340 6120 in advance.
item.matko:services: In summer (June-August) Cathedral Shop and Cafe Krypta (Kirkkokatu 18).
item.matko:ingress: The Cathedral is designed by C.L. Engel.

item.title: Helsinki City Museum
item.description: The Helsinki City Museum main building, a department store from 1913, opens a new exhibition Mad about Helsinki in June 2013. The exhibition presents the history of the city through the favourite places and storied of the Helsinki residents. Old documentary movies about Helsinki (mainly in Finnish) are shown at Kino Engel 2.
item.matko:open: Mon, Tue, Wed & Fri 9-17, Thu 9-19, Sat-Sun 11-17. NOTE PLEASE! Museum is closed until 5.6.2013. The new exhibition Mad about Helsinki opens June 6th
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchairs, wheelchairs available. Inva-WC and lift.
item.matko:additionalinfo:
Palmia rents out the premises for private occasions
Palmia Meetings and Catering Käpyläntie 8, 00600 Helsinki (P.O. Box 9500, 00099 City of Helsinki) Tel. +358 (0)9 310 27237 tai 050 534 9205 Fax +358 (0)9 310 86393 Email: kokous.juhla@palmia.fi Internet: www.palmia.fi
item.matko:services: Museum shop

item.title: Helsinki City Museum / Tram Museum
item.description: Helsinki's oldest tram depot (1900) houses the Tram Museum and was opened in June 2008 as part of the new Korjaamo culture centre. The refurbished museum presents tram history at the grassroots level, from a passenger's point of view. Branch of the City Museum.
item.matko:location: Trams 3T, 4, 7A, 10.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs. Inva-WC and lift.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Cocktails for about 400 persons. There is no kitchen in the premises.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Museum presents the history of public transport in Helsinki. Trams have been in service for over 100 years in Helsinki - a regular service was started in 1891. There are old trams on display, including horse-driven trams. The Museum is located in the oldest tram depot in Helsinki, built in 1900. The great hall can accommodate 400 persons for cocktails. There is also a well-equipped auditorium for 50 persons.

item.title: Helsinki City Museum/Burgher's House
item.description: The oldest surviving wooden building in the city dates from 1818. The charming house is decorated in the style of a middle-class home of the 1860s.
item.matko:location: Trams 1, 1A, 7B, bus 18.
item.matko:disabled: No access with wheelchairs.

item.title: Helsinki City Museum/Hakasalmi Villa
item.description: Next to Finlandia Hall is situated the elegant Hakasalmi Villa which is a branch of Helsinki City Museum. The villa was once the private home of Aurora Karamzin (1808-1902), the benefactress and founder of the Helsinki Deaconess Institute who once served in the Russian royal court. Karamzin lived here until her death.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 25 min. Next to Finlandia Hall.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC and lift.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Hakasalmi Villa can accommodate max. 200 persons for cocktails with a buffet. There is no kitchen in the premises. Palmia Catering Services will deliver the refreshments and set the tables.
item.matko:additionalinfo:
The Villa was built in 1846, and it represents Italian villa style as well as round-arched style. Nowadays it is a museum with exhibition rooms in both floors and a lift for the handicapped. The use of the premises varies according exhibitions.
Palmia Meetings and Catering Käpyläntie 8, 00600 Helsinki (P.O.Box 9500, 00099 City of Helsinki) Tel. +358 (0)9 310 27237 or +358 (0)50 534 9205 Fax +358 (0)9 310 86393 Email: kokous.juhla@palmia.fi Internet: www.palmia.fi
item.matko:services: Café

item.title: Helsinki City Museum/Sederholm House- Children's town
item.description: In 2012 the Helsinki City Museum opened the Children's Town. This new kind of children's museum invites children of all ages and their families to experience the history of Helsinki first-hand. In the Children's Town, children can play in boutiques and workshops from 18th-century Helsinki, sit at a school desk in a 1930s primary school class and visit a grandma's home from the 1970s. The Sederholm House, built in 1757, is the oldest building downtown.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs. Inva-WC and lift.
item.matko:groups: Guide bookings tel. +358 (0)9 3103 6639 or 3103 6491, in Swedish tel. +358 (0)9 3103 6632.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Catering: kokous.juhla@palmia.fi www.palmia.fi

item.title: Helsinki City Museum/Tuomarinkylä Manor Museum
item.description: Tuomarinkylä Manor from the 1790s stands on a hill surrounded by fields in northern Helsinki. The exhibition Elegance in the main building presents interior design in Helsinki from baroque to functionalism through the City Museum's fine collection of furniture and decorative objects.
item.matko:location: Buses 64, 70V and 72 from the Railway Square.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible by wheelchair, assistance required, toilet for wheelchair users in the restaurant.
item.matko:services: Mansion café/restaurant Tuomarinkylän kartanoravintola (tel. +358 (0)207 851080, www.tuomarinkylankartanoravintola.com) in the building nextdoor, serves also lunch.

item.title: Helsinki City Museum/Worker Housing Museum
item.description: The atmospheric Worker Housing Museum and its little "stove rooms" tell a fascinating story about Finnish everyday life in the past. The museum is located in the oldest apartments built by the city for its own workers in Helsinki.
item.matko:location: Trams 1, 1A, 3B, bus 23.
item.matko:disabled: No access with wheelchairs.

item.title: Helsinki City Planning Department
item.description: Helsinki City Planning Department is responsible for the city´s physical planning and traffic planning.
item.matko:services: Exhibition Hall

item.title: Helsinki City Theatre
item.description: Drama, dance performances (Helsinki Dance Company, www.hkt.fi/tanssiryhma) and musicals. Performances in Finnish.
item.matko:location: Performances also in Studio Pasila, Ratamestarinkatu 5 (p.09-39401) and Lilla teatern.
item.matko:admission: Ticket sales, at Ensi linja 2 (Mon-Fri 9-18), at Eläintarhantie 5, ticket sales at the theatre Sat 12-19. Also tickets 1hour before at the door.
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 8 cm) along the path, Inva-WC, lift, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, induction loop system - amplification system for people with hearing aids, inva seats for the big stage in the aisles, small stage and Studio Elsa on the back landing, Please inform staff in beforehand. tel.+358-(0)9-394 0277.

item.title: Helsinki City Theatre / Lilla Teatern
item.description: Swedish and Finnish theatre performances.
item.matko:disabled: Access by wheelchair, assistant required. Please notify in advance. No lift, Inva-WC.
item.matko:services: Box office is open one hour before performances start. Intermission service, fully-licensed.

item.title: Helsinki City Theatre / Theatre Studio Pasila
item.description: Helsinki City Theatre's stage in Pasila

item.title: Helsinki City Winter Garden
item.description: The Winter Garden, founded in 1893, has been a recreational meeting place for the residents of Helsinki for over a century. No matter what season it is, the elaborate oasis of exotic plants invites you to take a tour of the greenery. In addition to the plants, the splashing barbels in the pools delight visitors. In the summertime and even in the autumn, a passer-by can admire the marvellous Rose Garden in front of the Winter Garden.
item.matko:location: City centre 15 min, 25 min. to the airport
item.matko:open: Tue 9-15, Wed-Fri 12-15 , Sat-Sun 12-16 (Mon closed). Rose garden open in summer daily at 7-21
item.matko:groups: Guide by request, tel. +358 (0)9 3103 9985.
item.matko:additionalinfo: A summery atmosphere prevails throughout the year. The more than 200 plants bloom in three different spaces: in the palms room, in the western wing and in the cactus room. Besides the plants, carps swimming about in their pond add to the charm of the Garden. When necessary, a tent can be erected in the yard. No stairs, premises accessible by wheelchairs.

item.title: Helsinki Civil Defence Museum
item.description: Helsinki Civil Defence Museum introduces visitors both the history of civil defence and present-day arrangements for it in the city. The detailed illustrations of the situation in 1939-1944 include a mock-up of a wartime cellar bomb shelter complete with air raid sound effects. Technical equipment and other materials of post-war civil defence are also on exhibit.
item.matko:open: September-May on Saturdays from 10-14. At other times by appointment.
item.matko:groups: Finnish, Swedish, English by appointment

item.title: Helsinki Climbing Center
item.description: In Helsinki Climbing Center (in Finnish Helsingin Kiipeilykeskus) you´ll climb on the finest indoor-climbing walls in Scandinavia. Walls up to 16 metres high, tens of ready-made-routes and more than 1 700 square metres of climbing walls are waiting for your magic touch! Guided experiences for groups in English, too. Helsinki Climbing Centre and Puistola Tennis Hall belong to Tapanila Sport Center.

item.title: Helsinki Club (Sokos Hotel Helsinki)
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Ruuat valmistetaan omassa keittiössä ja kannetaan pöytään vastavalmistettuina.

item.title: Helsinki Congress Paasitorni
item.description:
Helsinki Congress Paasitorni operates in a more than 100-year-old building which has been skillfully restored. This unique conference centre is located close to the city centre and is easily accessible by public transport.
Paasitorni offers an inspirational and memorable setting for conferences and congresses, dinners and festivities. The building hosts almost 30 functional and distinctive rooms from 8 to 800 people. Paasitorni's services were expanded considerably in 2012 with the opening of Scandic Paasi, a new 170-room individually designed hotel adjoining the conference centre. The facilities were also complemented with new conference rooms and restaurant.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 25 min
item.matko:restaurantinfo: First class service in four unique restaurants. Restaurant Paasi with two adjacent private dining rooms (320 seats) and Restaurant Paasin Kellari (200 seats) for conference guests, groups and private events. Restaurant Graniittilinna for traditional Finnish cuisine à la carte. Restaurant Juttutupa for relaxed get-togethers. Coming up: new 200-seat floating restaurant pavilion Meripaviljonki.

item.title: Helsinki Conservatory
item.matko:services: Concerts

item.title: Helsinki Contemporary
item.description:
Helsinki Contemporary offers cultural experiences at a contemporary art gallery in the heart of Helsinki Gallery District on the lively street Bulevardi. The gallery is located at a new renaissance-style building and offers a beautiful view to the Old Church Park. The interior of the gallery is very unique in style, designed by the acclaimed finnish designer Ilkka Suppanen. The gallery shows works by established and emerging finnish and international artists.
Outside the gallery opening hours the space can be let for private events. For a cocktail party the gallery is ideal for 100-150 people. A private evening with a buffet can be arranged for 60 guests. For a unique sit-down dinner long tables with white linen are set in the centre of the gallery space. In the morning between 8 and 10 am the space has been successfully used for press conferences, launch parties, company presentations and breakfast meetings.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:groups: Presentations of the exhibitions in English, Swedish and Finnish by request.

item.title: Helsinki Day Spa
item.description: Helsinki Day Spa is a city spa which offers relaxation and harmony at a high level.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The Helsinki Day Spa is an excellent place to organise a refreshing event for your customers, cooperative partners or your own personnel. Organise a meeting in an atmosphere full of mental peace. A wellbeing package will motivate and thank them for their cooperation and support.
item.matko:services: Eg. massage, facial and body treatments, beauty treatments, body&mind-lessons (Yoga, Pilates, Stretching)

item.title: Helsinki Hall of Culture
item.description: The Helsinki Hall of Culture was designed by architect Alvar Aalto and is a venue for conferences, galas, trade fairs and concerts. Situated in the inner city, well served by public transport. The Aalto Hall has 1450 seats. There are seats both on the flat and in the raked auditorium. Seats on the flat can be removed for gala use. From the spring season of 2013 there will be 4-6 new meeting rooms for 20 to 100 persons each.
item.matko:location: City centre 15 min/2.5 km, airport 25 min/18 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: All areas are used for catering and are fully licensed. Catering up to 2.000 persons, services tailored to suit all kinds of events. Restaurant Kultti Cafe: 120 seats for dinners and 150 for cocktail parties.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The main entrance hall and lobby 900 m2/net, 1100 m2/gross. Catering and pause services in the same area.
item.matko:additionalinfo:
* 499 seats on the flat and 889 in the raked auditorium.
Sound, lighting and video services as agreed.
item.matko:ingress: A venue for conferences, galas, roadshows, trade fairs, concerts.

item.title: Helsinki Limo Oy
item.description: High quality Sedan cars and minibuses with excellent drivers who are willing to serve.
item.matko:location: City center.

item.title: Helsinki Metropolia University of Applied Sciences, Arabiankatu
item.description: Pop/jazz

item.title: Helsinki Music Centre
item.description: The opening of the Helsinki Music Centre gave Helsinki an acoustically first-class concert hall as well as other facilities providing a wide range of musical experiences for people of all ages and a place to study music. The main users of the building are the Sibelius Academy, the Helsinki Philharmonic and the Finnish Radio Symphony Orchestra.

item.title: Helsinki Observatorium
item.description: Designed by the architect C.L. Engel, the Helsinki Observatory, which dates back to 1834, is currently undergoing a period of refurbishment and is due to re-open to the public in October 2012. The building will feature a visitor centre, run by the Helsinki University Museum, which will introduce visitors to space and the history and future of astronomy. It is primarily aimed at children and young people but will be open to all visitors.
item.matko:services: The Observatory will be complete with a planetarium and café as well as a lecture theatre, which will be available for venue hire and is suitable for a range of events.

item.title: Helsinki Playground - indoor play ground
item.description: Helsinki Playground is a great place for the children to come and enjoy playing every day of the week. The Playground offers many different kinds of fun, educative ja sporty activities for the kids. Spend the day with adventure bouncing castles, big play area, ball cannons, toddler area, climbing wall and ball pool etc. The Playground Café offers snacks and refreshments.
item.matko:location: Situated in Hakaniemi, entrance at Hakaniemi market square
item.matko:open: Open daily 10-20, periods 10-12, 12-14, 14-16, 16-18, 18-20. Entrance from Hakaniemi Market Square or when by car via the parking hall entrance in the beginning of Sörnäisten Rantatie.
item.matko:admission: Tickets 12€/3-14years/2h, 8€/children under 3 yrs/2h (max 150 persons at a time). Parents and grandparents accomanying their children free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: Two parking spaces for disabled people in the parking hall, lift, inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Bookings in advance for groups minimum of 10 people, tel.+358 (0)20 710 9900.
item.matko:ingress: Helsinki Playground is a great place for all children to come and enjoy playing.

item.title: Helsinki Running Tours
item.description: Helsinki Running Tours organizes running tours, lectures and training for tourists and groups like congresses. We operate in the beautiful routes of Helsinki.
item.matko:open: We run througout the year. Schedule is on our web page.
item.matko:groups: Ask for an offer for a group running event

item.title: Helsinki University Botanic Garden, Kaisaniemi
item.description: The University of Helsinki Botanical Garden at Kaisaniemi is one of Helsinki's most popular visitor attractions. The garden is situated very close to the city centre, and its glasshouses and surrounding grounds offer nature lovers a unique experience all year round. The gallery between the large and small glasshouses is used to host temporary exhibitions, mostly on themes related to nature.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:open: Greenhouses: in winter: Tue-Fri 10-16, Thu 10-18, Sat-Sun 10-16, in summer: Tue-Sun 10-17. The gates to the outer garden are open Mon-Sun 9-20. Exceptions: www.luomus.fi/kaisaniemi.
item.matko:admission: Greenhouses: adults 8€, pensioners, students and children (7-17 years) 3€, children under 7 years free of charge. Outdoor garden free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC, assistant needed.
item.matko:groups: Guide reservations tel +358-9 191 28855 (Tue-Fri 9-11) or opastukset@luomus.fi.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Well-lighted art gallery with an 18 m long exhibition wall and a separate 3x2 m sized vitrine
item.matko:additionalinfo: The biggest glass house, Palm House, can be hired for cocktail occasions in the evenings. A tent is available for garden parties. Meeting rooms Linkola and Elfving and a little kitchen. A souvenir shop. Reservations of Palm House, meeting rooms and guided tours tel. +358 9 1912 4453, 05+358 50 337 5271, e-mail hortus-botanicus@helsinki.fi
item.matko:services: Small museum shop in connection to the ticket sales. Restaurant Viola, Kaisaniemenranta 2, tel. +358-9-1311 4298, open only by appointment during summertime. The Empire-style wooden building, dating from 1823 and situated near the Kaisaniemenranta road provides a charming setting.
item.matko:ingress: The Garden offers an unique experience all year round.

item.title: Helsinki University Botanical Garden Kumpula
item.description: Kumpula Botanic Garden situates on a historical lands of Kumpula mansion. The Kumpula Garden collection comprises two parts: garden of cultivated plants and geobotanical garden.
item.matko:admission: Adults 5€, children 3€, children under 7 years free entrance.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchair, Inva-WC, assistant needed.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups by agreement, tel.+358 (0)9 191 28855 (Tue-Fri 10-12), e-mail:opastukset@luomus.fi
item.matko:services: Café & shop

item.title: Helsinki University Museum Arppeanum
item.description: Helsinki University Museum was established in 2003 by merging the former University Museum specialising in the history of the University of Helsinki, the Museum of Medical History, the Museum of the History of Veterinary Medicine, the Museum of the History of Dentistry and the Collections of Craft Science. To complement the new conglomeration of museums, the Mineral Cabinet, which today belongs to the Finnish Museum of Natural History, returned to its original location in the Arppeanum building. Each year the museum also holds one or two temporary exhibitions in a specially designed area.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Entrance with wheelchair from the court yard, from where the lift is accessable. Ticket sales is on the 2nd floor.
item.matko:groups: Guidebooking, tel.+358 (0)50 4156 760 or +358 (0)50 4155 285. Duration approx. 1-1/2h.
item.matko:services: Museum shop and Cafe Arppeanum, tel.+358 (0)10 548620, www.cafe-arppeanum.fi

item.title: Helsinki Zoo
item.description: Helsinki Zoo, known as "Korkeasaari" among Finns, is one of the oldest zoos in the world (founded in 1889). In Helsinki Zoo you'll meet animals from the arctic tundra to the tropical rainforest. Approximately 200 different animal species reside in the Zoo, and there are almost a 1000 different plant species. Protecting endangered species is a heartfelt matter for the zoo. The zoos in Europe form a network which works to preserve a number of species. Zoos are often the last refuge for many endangered species. The rhino sign will take you to the animals that belong to the zoos' shared protection programme.
item.matko:location: Waterbus connection from Market Squareand Hakaniemi in summer. Bridge connection from Musetikkamaa year round. Zoobus nr.11 from the Railwaystation to Korkeasaari zoo all year round.
item.matko:open: May-August Mon-Sun 10-20, October-March Mon-Sun 10-16, September and April Mon-Sun 10-18. Closed only on Christmas Eve.
item.matko:admission: Adults via Mustikkamaa bridge 10€, waterbus 16€. Children (6-17 yrs) via Mustikkamaa bridge 5€, waterbus 8€. Waterbuses from the Market Square and from Hakaniemi Market in summer only.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchairs, assistant needed, Inva-WC. Tours by car possible on Thursdays 9-10.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours upon request, also guided tours with different themes. Languages Finnish, Swedish, English. Guidebookings tel.+358-(0)9-3103 7900 and zoo.asy@hel.fi
item.matko:services: Safari Café (~60seats) in Mustikkamaa pavilion and the Pukki Restaurant on the island (~100seats, ~80 seats on the outdoor terrace in summer, tel.+358-(0)9-6962 3729), are both open all year round. Café Karhu, tel.+358-(0)9-6962 3750, Saarenvartijan tuvan kahvila (~20seats, ~28 seats on the outdoor terrace) and kiosks are open in summer. Also outdoor tables for guests to use. Souvenir shops.
item.matko:ingress: Helsinki Zoo is one of the oldest zoos in the world.

item.title: Helsinki-Malmi airport
