item.description: The functionalist style Helsinki-Malmi airport, opened in 1936, still serves as a center for general aviation. There are numerous air taxi firms, aircraft hire companies and flying schools based at this airport as well as flying and parachuting clubs. There has also been an enormous increase in helicopter flying in the recent years. It is possible to go see old aircrafts at Helsinki-Malmi airport.
item.matko:location: Bus 75, Railwaystation-Helsinki-Malmi or local train to Malmi station, bus 77A, distance approx.2km
item.matko:services: Restaurant-Café Hello Café, tel.+358 (0)40 900 3405 , also meeting facilities and catering service. SIL -shop, flight maps, flight materials and accessories, Finnish Aeronautical Association, tel.+358-(0)9-3509 3450.

item.title: Henry's Pub
item.description: Henry's Pub offers you live-music, hot chicken wings and feaking great atmosphere with easy-going staff and customers. It wouldn't be smart to stay away!

item.title: Hercules Gay Night Club
item.description: Popular Gay NightClub located in the center of Helsinki. Customers are mainly gay men over 30 years, also leather guys.
item.matko:open: Open daily at 21-04. Age limit Fri-Sat 24years, Sun-Thu 20years.

item.title: Hermannin sauna
item.description: Sauna Hermanni is a public sauna, one of the three remaining public saunas in Helsinki. Sauna Hermanni was founded in the 1950's.There are two saunas, mens sauna seats 30 and womens sauna 20 persons. You can bring your own refreshments with or buy some once at the sauna.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 15-20, Sat 14-18 (it's possible to enjoy the sauna still one hour after closing)
item.matko:admission: Adults 10€, children 3€ (children under 12yrs free), students and senior citizens 8€.
item.matko:groups: It is possible to hire the sauna for private occations on Fri-Sun
item.matko:services: Cupping and massage available upon request (reservations, tel.+358 (0)40 838 8963)

item.title: Herttoniemi Church
item.matko:open: Wed 12-18, other days 10-14. Service on religious holidays at 10.

item.title: Herttoniemi Manor House Museum
item.description: Herttoniemi Manor House Museum is the former home of Vice-Admiral Carl Olof Cronstedt in a manor house built in 1813. Park in the French and English style with the long linden alleys, grass parterres and ornamental bushes complete with gazebo. There is also a farmstead museum in buildings transferred to the site from the nearby region.
item.matko:open: Open May-September every Sun 12-14, guided tour at 14. In October-April open on the first Sunday of each month.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups upon request.

item.title: Heureka Shop / Kamppi shopping centre,2nd floor
item.description: Heureka Shop is a souvenir shop that specialises in science products and products that are linked to Heureka's temporary exhibitions. Heureka Shop offers a selection of science items, puzzles and gifts as well as tickets to the science centre Heureka in Vantaa.

item.title: Heureka, the Finnish Science Centre
item.description: Heureka, The Finnish Science Centre, is a hands-on exhibition and action centre. Astronomical movies and science programmes are shown in the Vattenfall Planetarium. Theme exhibitions: Ships and the Sea, Speed - Science in motion, Move and Play. Science Park Galilei is open every year May-September.
item.matko:location: Near Tikkurila railway station. From Helsinki city centre, Railwaystation, local trains R, H, K, T, N and I to Tikkurila station (20 min, 20 km). Airport 10 min, 7 km.
item.matko:open: 1.1.-31.12.: Mon-Wed, Fri 10-17, Thu 10-20 and Sat-Sun 10-18; 21.2.-6.3., 27.6.-12.8., 10.-23.10. Mon-Fri 10-19, Sat-Sun 10-18 (information on opening hours exceptions on Heureka webpages).
item.matko:admission: Adults: allround ticket 21-30,50€, exhibition 16,50/18,50€, one show at Planetarium 11€. Children (6-15 yrs): allround ticket 14,50-20€, exhibition 11,50/12,50€, one show at Planetarium 9€.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, all on the same level. Inva-WC. Drive up to inva-parking from Shell at Ring III/Tikkurila, end of Härkävaljakontie street. Induction loop in the Verne theatre and the auditorium Virtanen.
item.matko:groups: School groups: General ticket 8,50/11,50€, exhibitions 7€, Planetarium 5€. Guide available on request 36,60-61€ (Finnish, Swedish, English), Russian if booked one week in advance.
item.matko:services: Lunch restaurant Einstein, tel. +358-(0)9-857 9399. Open as Heureka, seating for 180. For groups also to by appointment, special menu for school groups. Banqueting services. Shop and free car park.

item.title: HIAP Helsinki International Artist-in-residence Programme
item.description: The Helsinki International Artist-in-Residence Programme (HIAP) is one of the most important international residency centers in Finland. Each year between 70 and 90 visual artists, dancers, choreographers, curators and researchers from around the world are offered a residence in Suomenlinna and at the Cable Factory. The HIAP Project Room arranges regular art exhibitions, lectures and other public events.

item.title: Hietalahti market hall
item.description: The Old Market Hall vendors have moved to the 110 years old Hietalahti Market Hall due to the renovation of the Old Market Hall in Eteläranta. Here you'll find all kinds of foodstuff, eg. vegetables, fruit, fish, cheese etc.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 8-18, Sat 8-16, Sun closed (on summer Sundays during 5.5-25.8. at 10-16)

item.title: Hietalahti Market Square
item.description: At the Hietalahti market square is held a popular outdoor flea market, especially in summertime. The market is open all year when weather permits. The Hietalahti Antique and Art Hall next to the market square houses antique shops.
item.matko:phone: +358 (0)9 310 71396/market square warden, +358 (0)9 3104 0377/Real Estate dept., Premises Centre

item.title: Hietaniemi Beach
item.description: Hietaniemi offers a shallow and safe swimming area and is very popular on hot summer days. You can also enjoy beach volleyball and basketball. Children have their own play area. There is also a café. Nearby you will find minigolf and the Taivallahti Tennis Centre.

item.title: Highlight valaistus Galleria
item.description: Highlight valaistus Galleria is a space that shares contemporary Finnish lighting design from both new and familiar artists.
item.matko:location: In proximity of the Olympic Stadium and the Sibelius Park.

item.title: Hiisi
item.description: Finnish food in big portions. Hiisi is a restaurant that uses local and organic food made in traditional Finnish way, with a little twist of modern Scandinavian kitchen.
item.matko:location: Fenniapasaasi / Kaisaniemenkatu 4
item.matko:open: Lunch Mon-Fri 11-14. A la Carte Wed-Fri 17-21, Sat 13-21

item.title: Hilda Viola
item.description: Vintage apparel and latest fashion trends from Paris with affordable prices.

item.title: Hilton Helsinki Airport
item.description: Hilton Helsinki Airport is the airport's first upscale hotel, offering travelers state-of-the-art facilities and contemporary design with a Finnish twist. The hotel is well equipped for meetings, events and conferences for 2 to 340 guests. All hotel rooms and facilities are soundproofed. The modern facilities include a spacious Ballroom, Hilton Boardroom, 12 meeting rooms, a dedicated Executive Floor and Lounge, a 24-hour Business Centre and parking space in front of the hotel.
item.matko:location: Hilton Helsinki-Vantaa Airport is located at Helsinki Airport´s International terminal, easily accessible through a 200 m covered walkway. Helsinki city centre 20 km.
item.matko:disabled: 4 accessible hotel rooms, all conference rooms and the restaurant are accessible, elevators to all floors, toilet for disabled people in the lobby area.
item.matko:accomodationinfo:
330 rooms; 180 Hilton Guest Rooms, 42 Hilton Executive Rooms, 19 Hilton Executive Plus Rooms with private sauna, 5 suites with 2 rooms and private sauna.
Guest room facilities: air conditioning, in-room safe, in-room bar, wi-fi Internet access, hair dryer, coffee & tea making facilities, iron and ironing board, bath with separate shower.
Enjoy your stay in the comfortable 28m²/301sq.ft room with large soundproofed windows. Catch up with work at the desk and stay in touch with wireless internet access. Curl up on the easy chair and unwind watching on-demand movies on the LCD flat panel TV. Re-energize in the luxury bathroom with separate bathtub and shower.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Gui for up to 250 seated guests.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms:
Business center, executive lounge.
Hilton Helsinki Airport has a range of adaptable, high quality conference rooms located at street level. All designed in the same natural, elegant Finnish style as the rest of the hotel. The Ballroom is the perfect venue for meetings, dinners as well as car shows.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Hilton Fitness by Precor Gym and saunas are available free of charge to the hotel guests. Arrival and departure flight information screens and self-service airline check-in in the hotel lobby. Parking facilities for 100 vehicles, 24-hour room service, luggage service, Wi-Fi.
item.matko:services: A spacious Ballroom, a boardroom, 12 meeting rooms, a dedicated Executive Floor and Lounge, a 24 hour Business Center and parking space for 100 cars in front of the hotel.

item.title: Hilton Helsinki Kalastajatorppa
item.description: Hilton Helsinki Kalastajatorppa has a long and diverse history. Many international conferences and events have been held here during the years. The unique surroundings, tasteful decoration, high-class restaurants and diverse meeting and banquet rooms together create exciting atmosphere for hotel stays and events of all kinds.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 18 km. Seaside location.
item.matko:disabled: 2 accessible hotel rooms, accessible conference rooms, restaurants are accessible, toilet for disabled people in public areas.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 238 rooms in total: 106 Hilton Guest Rooms, 48 Hilton Guest Rooms Plus, 76 Hilton DeLuxe Rooms, 7 suites with a sea view, 1 Presidential Suite.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Meritorppa seating 120 guests . Conference & Events Center for private functions: Pyöreä Sali (Round Room) for max 350 persons, Siirtomaasali up to 550 persons for seated dinners. Elegant Vanha Torppa - a glance from the history - is ideal for cocktails for 150 persons as well for dinners for 90 persons.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Siirtomaasali (Colonial Room) 503 m2, Merisali 356 m2, foyer areas adjacent 200 m2.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Gym, business centre, 24-hour room service, four saunas, swimming pool, private beach, massage, garage and plenty of parking space, car wash.
item.matko:services: Restaurant, bar, business center, 17 conference rooms, sauna, swimming pool, gym.

item.title: Hilton Helsinki Strand
item.description: Hilton Helsinki Strand, a stylish and comfortable downtown hotel, is located by the sea, within walking distance of the city centre and the historic sights of Helsinki. The location is ideal for both business and holiday travellers. In addition to the bright, spacious rooms, the hotel offers versatile meeting and conference spaces for small negotiations and big dinners alike.
item.matko:location: City centre 0,5 km (10 min on foot), airport 17 km. Walking distance from the city center.
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 4 cm) along the path, essential access, automatic slide door, automatic hinged door, opens towards arrival direction, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted, two inva-rooms in the hotel.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 190 rooms: 94 Hilton Guest Rooms, 47 Hilton Guest Rooms Plus, 42 Hilton Executive Rooms, 7 suites
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Comfortable Restaurant Bridges for up to 150 seated guests. Bridges ' Corner is ideal for private functions, luncheons and get together for 80 persons. The Ballroom seats 200 persons for dinner, 300 for a cocktail reception.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Ballroom 220m2, foyer 120 m2
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna & More Wellness treatments and services on the top floor with saunas, swimming pool and a magnificent view, gym, business centre, 24 -hour room service, luggage service, and garage.
item.matko:services: Executive Floor & Lounge, 6 conference rooms, restaurant, bar, sauna and swimmingpool, gym

item.title: Hippie Shake Records
item.description: Hippie Shake Records is specialized in rare 60/70s rock and hard rock records. The shop stocks thousands of 7" & 12" -singles, LP's, CD's and CD-singles from all over the world.

item.title: Hobby Point
item.description: Hobby Point is a hobby material shop in the city centre. The shop also stocks a wide range of eg. model railroad equipment, RC-cars and boats and miniature models for cars, boats and airplanes.

item.title: Holiday Inn Helsinki - Vantaa Airport
item.description: The modern Holiday Inn Helsinki - Vantaa Airport is a good choice for a restful stopover. The complimentary shuttle bus makes getting to and from the airport a breeze. The hotel is located in the Aviapolis business district close to local companies and 20 minute drive from the Helsinki City Centre. Unwind at the hotel's cozy bistro or take a 5-minute walk to Jumbo shopping mall full of shops or visit the Flamingo Spa.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 19 km, airport 1 km
item.matko:disabled: Wheelchair accessible rooms available.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 280 non-smoking rooms. 258 standard rooms with queen size bed or twin beds, 21 executive rooms with queen or king size bed. All rooms have a hospitality tray, ironing equipment, ADSL broadband and wireless connection.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 2 saunas, Minigym
item.matko:services: Restaurant Bistro Fiore, Minigym and two saunas, free airport transfer, Business Corner, 7 meeting rooms.

item.title: Holiday Inn Helsinki City Centre
item.description: Holiday Inn Helsinki City Centre is located next to the Central Railway Station and offers you Scandinavian-style guest rooms, overlooking Helsinki Music Centre and Finlandia Hall or bustling Eliel Square. A Finnair shuttle bus stop is located in front of the hotel. Hotel also offers free internet, a Business Corner, restaurant, Gym and Finnish sauna.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km.
item.matko:disabled: Two wheelchair accessible rooms. There is an induction loop system at the reception and guests with hearing impairment can borrow a portable vibrating alarm system.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 174 rooms of which are all non-smoking. 148 standard rooms with queen size bed or twin beds, 26 executive rooms with queen or king size bed. All rooms have a hospitality tray, ironing equipment, ADSL broadband and wireless connection free of charge.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Verde located on the second floor. The cuisine is based on classic international food flavoured with Scandinavian specialities.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Business Corner, Conference room, Parking Hall P-Eliel, MiniGym, 2 saunas.
item.matko:services: Restaurant Verde, Lobbybar, Business Corner, Sauna, Minigym

item.title: Holiday Inn Helsinki Exhibition & Convention Centre - Messukeskus
item.description: Located right next door to the Helsinki Exhibition & Convention Centre, the Holiday Inn Helsinki provides the guest with a truly unique, functional range of services. Convenient connections to Helsinki-Vantaa Airport, Helsinki Railway Station and downtown Helsinki puts the Holiday Inn hotel at the centre of the Finnish conference scene. The Helsinki Exhibition & Convention Centre in connection with the hotel offers guests a wide range of exhibition and conference facilities. With its great location for business and leisure travel, this high-standard hotel offers 244 spacious rooms. Amenities include ADSL and wireless broadband connection, coffee & tea making facilities, in-room safe and an ironing center. The hotel offers free access to Minigym and Finnish sauna.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, automatic slide door, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, light connected to the phones, which light up when the phone rings, 5 rooms for disabled. There is an induction loop system at the reception and guests with hearing impairment can borrow a portable vibrating alarm system.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 244 rooms of which 205 standard, 7 disabled, 34 executive rooms and 5 suites. All rooms have hospitality tray, ironing equipment, ADSL and wireless broadband connection free of charge.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Brasserie Terra Nova serves a wide range of Finnish and international cuisine. The lively bar at Terra Nova welcomes guests for cocktail or a glass of wine before dinner. Winter garden also available for banquets.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: http://www.visithelsinki.fi/en/conference-venues/helsinki-exhibition-convention-centre
item.matko:additionalinfo: Business Centre with broadband internet access, Minigym, 3 saunas, garage.
item.matko:services: Business Centre with broadband internet access, Minigym, 3 saunas and garage.

item.title: Holiday Inn Helsinki West - Ruoholahti
item.description: The Holiday Inn Helsinki West - Ruoholahti is set in the vibrant Ruoholahti business district. Breathe in fresh sea air with a walk along the nearby shore, or hop on a metro and reach Helsinki's lively city centre in just five minutes. Unwind in the MiniGym and sauna and mingle over aperitifs in the relaxed Lobby bar. Finnish and international dishes are served in stylish Fokka Restaurant.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Wheelchair accessible rooms. There is an induction loop system at the reception and guests with hearing impairment can borrow a portable vibrating alarm system.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 256 non-smoking rooms of which 125 Twin rooms, 99 Queen rooms and 32 Executive rooms
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Fokka Restaurant & Bar serves breakfast, lunch and dinner
item.matko:services: Restaurant Fokka, Lobby bar, Sauna, Minigym, garage, Sauna cabinet, Business Center, conference room.

item.title: Holy Trinity Church
item.description: Helsinki's oldest Orthodox church from 1827. Summer café. Church and summer café is open 3.6-15.7.2013 on Mondays at 13-17.
item.matko:open: Vigil Sat. at 6.pm(Slavic), liturgy Sun at 10am(Slavic) Evening service Mon-Thu at 5pm.(Finnish)

item.title: Hoochie Mama Jane
item.description: Colourful vintage paradise in Kallio, selling mainly clothing and accessories, evening dresses, cocktail dresses and also everyday-wear. Also a wide selection of shoes, bags and jewellery from past decades.

item.title: Hostel Academica
item.description: Hostel Academica is a summer hostel located right in the Helsinki city centre. There are 229 modern single and twin rooms which all have private toilet, shower and kitchenette with a fridge inside the room. Bedlinen and towels as well as morning sauna and swimming are included in the prices. In most of the rooms guests are able to have a WLAN internet connection. When staying at Hostel Academica, you´ll easily reach restaurants and cafes, shopping centers, beautiful green parks, beach and main sightseeing attractions in the city. They are all within a walking distance from the hostel.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:open: 1.6.-1.9. Office is open all year round.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Single & double rooms, also rooms for 3-4 persons. All rooms have private shower and bathroom. Rooms are spacious; 26-29 m2.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: UniCafe restaurant downstairs.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna and swimming pool for 20 persons.

item.title: Hostel Erottajanpuisto
item.description: The small and cosy Erottajanpuisto Hostel is located right in the centre of Helsinki. It is a friendly and atmospheric hostel with 15 cosy rooms. The hostel is open 24/7 each and every day of the year, so you are welcome at any time.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km
item.matko:disabled: Hostel is in the 3rd floor, no lift available.
item.matko:groups: Group prices for minimum of 12 persons in big rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 15 rooms: 3 x single rooms, 3 x double rooms, 3 x 3-persons rooms, 3 x 4-persons rooms, 3 x 6-persons rooms.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: the hostel doesn't have an own restaurant but there are two restaurants in the same building and many more on the same street.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Every room has a TV and hand basin, bedclothes and towels. Toilet and shower is in the corridor.

item.title: Hostel Suomenlinna
item.description: Hostel is located on Suomenlinna Island Fortress, which is included in UNESCO's World Heritage List, on Iso Mustasaari, near Rantakasarmi Jetty barracks and the ferry harbour (main quay). Public transport tickets are valid on the ferry. The hostel has 7 rooms for 2-10 people and operates in an old school.
item.matko:location: Ferry to city centre 15 min, airport 20 km + ferry to Helsinki 15 min
item.matko:open: open year round, groups also welcome.
item.matko:groups: The hostel is mainly targeted for groups.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Together 40 bedplaces in rooms for 2-10 persons. Toilets and showers in the corridor.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Café
item.matko:additionalinfo: Common room, self catering kitchen.
item.matko:services: Hostel Suomenlinna has 34-39 beds: 24 beds in dorms for 6, 8 and 10 people and 10 beds in twins and triples. We have a small lounge area where the sofas form to 4-5 beds, if necessary. Showers and toilets are shared ones and in the corridor. There is a small self service kitchen corner in the hostel and a free wireless internet connection.

item.title: Hotel and Restaurant Museum
item.description:
The Hotel and Restaurant Museum is situated close to the city centre in Cable Factory, in Ruoholahti area. Museum's meeting room is in the middle of exhibitions and it's suited for private occasions such as meetings, small seminars and lectures.
Museum's new permanent exhibition is an adventure appealing to all senses. The museum also puts on temporary exhibitions on specific themes and offers a wide range of programme. Entrance fees to the exhibitions are included in the room rent.
item.matko:location: City centre 8 min, airport 30 min
item.matko:open: Tue-Sun 11-18. Archives open Tue-Fri 9-15 or by appointment (free entrance).
item.matko:admission: Adults 7€, children, students and pensioners 4€, one child under 15yrs with accompanying adult
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed (entrance G), lift and Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Guidebooking, e-mail: varaukset(at)hotellijaravintolamuseo, tel.+358 (0)44-747 4109 (Tue-Fri 9-11). Languages: Finnish, Swedish or English, duration 45 min.
item.matko:services: Coffee and salad lunches can be arranged for the meetings.

item.title: Hotel Anna
item.description: Cosy hotel with 64 rooms on walking distance from major department stores and sights. Hotel Anna serves breakfast and there is a good selection of restaurants and trendy pubs in the area around the hotel. All rooms are fully equipped with TV, telephone, minibar, WC, shower, hairdryer, umbrella, WLAN (free of charge).
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 64 rooms: 30 singles, 6 superior singles, 20 twins, 5 superior twins and 3 junior suites.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The use of the meeting room free of charge for hotel guests.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna, parking space in a garage nearby, wireless broadband internet system accessible in the hotel.

item.title: Hotel Arthur
item.description: Hotel Arthur is privately owned and attractive conference hotel with a cosy, friendly and international atmosphere. The hotel is situated in the centre of Helsinki and offers modern and efficient meeting facilities for up to 500 persons. Restaurant Arthur serves a delicious breakfast, tasty lunch buffet, varying a la carte and HelsinkiMenu. Hotel Arthur contributes in the jubilee year of World Design Capital Helsinki 2012 with a colorful wall painting.
item.matko:location: In the city centre 300 metres from the main railway station, airport 17 km.
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, steep ramp in path essential for access - gradient over 18%, lift; essential for access, easy access for blind or partially sighted, one inva-room, no separate toilet for wheelchair users in the restaurant, a steep hill to the gateway where an easier entrance, easier entry from the nearest gateway
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 182 rooms, 400 beds, several family rooms for 3-5 guests, Sir Arthur Suite.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant: 240 seats, lobby bar/café, terrace in summer; the conference facilities can also be used for banquets.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: 450 m2 at different levels.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Three private restaurant cabinets can also be used as conference rooms.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 3 family saunas.
item.matko:services: Restaurant for 240 persons, conference rooms 10, biggest ball room for 200 persons, 3 saunas.

item.title: Hotel AVA
item.description: Hotel AVA is a cosy hotel in a peaceful environment. Connections to the city centre, Helsinki-Vantaa Airport and Pasila railway station are excellent. There are totally 75 non-smoking guest rooms from single rooms to six persons' apartment with reasonable prices. There is a TV and bathroom in every room. In studio rooms and in the apartments there are kitchen facilities with microwave and refrigerator. Hotel AVA also has a sauna, free parking even for large vehicles, laundry, WLAN and movie channels.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 13 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 75 rooms from single rooms to apartments for up to 6 guests
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Buffet-breakfast restaurant. Seats for 40-50 persons. There is possibility to make a group reservation for the lunch or dinner. Also for private functions.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna, computer room, free parking

item.title: Hotel Avion
item.description: Hotel Avion is a privately owned, modern and comfortable hotel and restaurant in Helsinki Malmi. All the rooms have a minibar, TV and air-conditioning. We also have allergy rooms. Good connections to the city centre. Local train goes every five minutes and the trip takes 10 minutes. Air-port, exhibition centre and ice-stadium Hartwall Arena are also near. There is a possibility to use a computer in Avion (wireless ADSL) and we have an internetbar
item.matko:location: City centre 14 km, airport 8 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 39 rooms: 12 single, 24 double (separate beds), 3 suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Breakfast, daily lunch buffet, a la carte restaurant.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Other meeting facilities available in the same building.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna
item.matko:services: Air-conditioning, minibar, phone, TV and shower in every room. Also non-smoking rooms and rooms for allergic. Computer with internet access available for hotel guests.

item.title: Hotel Cumulus Kaisaniemi Helsinki
item.description: The newly renovated Hotel Cumulus Kaisaniemi welcomes you to Helsinki! The hotel's location in the very centre of Helsinki only two blocks from the main railway station across the street from a metro sta-tion makes it easy to reach the Cumulus Kaisaniemi. Add pleasant service and comfortable rooms - sure to enjoy your stay!
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 17 km
item.matko:disabled: elevator, one room especially suited for persons with disabilities
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 104 rooms: standard single and twin rooms, most of them for non-smokers.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Huviretki, about 100 places dinner restaurant.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna, garage nearby.
item.matko:services: sauna, cumulus shop, ironing room

item.title: Hotel Fabian
item.description: An elegant, continental style 58-room boutique hotel was opened in August 2010. A special feature of the new hotel are loft-like rooms and nine extended stay rooms for those who wish to spend a longer time in Helsinki. Architecture of the building plays a key role in hotel's interior design creating a unique identity for the Hotel Fabian.
item.matko:location: Kaartinkaupunki, city centre 0.5km, airport 20 km

item.title: Hotel Finn
item.description:
Situated on the top floors of a historical building, the Hotel Finn will offer you a modern and intimate setting during your stay in Helsinki. The Hotel Finn is located a short walk from the central railway station, bus station and right next door to the well-known Stockmann department store.
Customers will be able to enjoy the convenience of staying in a lively quarter within walking distance to Helsinki's shopping areas, tourist attractions and parks, theaters and restaurants, while experiencing a calm and serene atmosphere.
The hotel consists of 27 bedrooms varying from different sizes and prices. Each one of them is equipped with the essential amenities to ensure a comfortable stay.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 27 rooms for one, two, three or four persons. Most rooms have a shower or bath. All rooms have a toilet and sink as well as phone and television.

item.title: Hotel GLO Bar
item.description: The stylish and easily accessible GLO Bar at street level has become a popular meeting place for all who want to enjoy the pleasant atmosphere with some good friends and simply relax.

item.title: Hotel Hanasaari
item.description: Forget the busy city life and spend the night at Hotel Hanasaari. Enjoy the peace and quiet only a few minute's drive from Helsinki. Our spacious and peaceful rooms are decorated in a light Scandinavian style, and their natural colour scheme echoes the colours of the seaside. Hanasaari is the right choice, whether travelling on business or pleasure.

item.title: Hotel Haven
item.description: Hotel Haven, Finland's first member of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World chain, is designed to provide homely warmth, exclusive comfort and high-quality service for the discerning guest. First class service is supported by high-quality restaurants; G.W.Sundmans, Sundmans Krog and Havis serve both business and leisure guests. Additionally, conference services, altogether four meeting rooms and an auditorium, makes it possible to organize meetings for up to 120 persons within the hotel. In an elegant, yet cosy lobby, guests can relax by a fireplace and browse through daily papers. Bar Haven serves both hot beverages and relaxing drinks.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Hotel Korpilampi
item.description: Hotel Korpilampi is located in Espoo, less than half an hour's drive from Helsinki City centre and from Helsinki-Vantaa airport. The hotel is surrounded by unique wildlife and nature. Hotel Korpilampi has 151 rooms, of which 54 rooms has been renovated 2011.The hotel has 17 conference rooms, an auditorium for 350 people.
item.matko:disabled: Two wheelchair accessible rooms.
item.matko:groups: 17 conference rooms, big restaurant with capacity for more than 300 guest, group prices.
item.matko:services: Hotel Korpilampi has 151 rooms, of which 54 rooms has been renovated 2011. All rooms have shower, wc, laminated floor and tv and WiFi. A rich buffet breakfast is included in the room price as well as sauna and swimming at the hotel. The main restaurant has capacity for more than 300 guests and there is a beautiful summer terrace. The hotel has 17 conference rooms, an auditorium for 350 people.

item.title: Hotel Kämp
item.description: Hotel Kämp is one of the most valued historical buildings in central Helsinki and the first deluxe 5 star hotel in the Nordic countries. Offering luxurious facilities and unsurpassed service in Finland, Hotel Kämp is located in the very heart of the city at Pohjoisesplanadi with its neo-classical architecture, designer shops and elegant Esplanade Park. It is within a few minutes' walk of the harbor and close to all major cultural sites. The hotel provides outstanding service and excellent banqueting facilities, as well as 179 rooms and several suites, including the famous Mannerheim Suite. Valet service is available, and the hotel is within walking distance of the shops and sights of Helsinki.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Fully accessibility, automatic slide door, toilet for wheelchair users, parking for disabled, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting poor at places, the hotel has specially fitted rooms fro persons who use wheelchair, in emergency situations, priority of assistance to motion handicapped, easier entry from Kluuvikatu 2.
item.matko:accomodationinfo:
179 rooms of which 133 Deluxe rooms single/double, 31 Executive Rooms single/double, 8 Junior Park Suite, 4 Kämp Suites, 2 Executive Suites, 1 Presidential Suite.
Luxurious marble bathrooms are equipped with bath and separate walk-in shower. The biggest suites have also in-room sauna. All the rooms have televisions with satellite, film and radio channels, 3 direct-dial telephones with voicemail, wireless internet connection, air conditioning, safe deposit, Mini Bar and 24h Room Service.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Brasserie Kämp; Restaurant Yume: modern Japanese cuisine;
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The most elegant banquet facilities in the city, the legendary Mirror Room and three multifunctional meeting rooms offer new kind of tastes, atmosphere and experiences for parties, meetings and cocktail receptions.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Kämp Spa

item.title: Hotel Rantasipi Airport
item.description: Half an hour from the centre of Helsinki The high-standard and comfortable Rantasipi Airport is an effective airport hotel that is ideal for busy conference guests as well as people going on holiday abroad. The hotel offers pleasant sauna and pool facilities, excellent restaurant and catering services, a Business Corner and a lobby bar.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city 18 km, airport 2 km. The hotel offers pleasant sauna and pool facilities, excellent restaurant and catering services, a Business Corner and a lobby bar.

item.title: Hotel Room
item.description: Can you call it a hotel, if all the rooms are located in different cities of the world? Sure you can. And we call it a hotel even though only the first room, room number one, is open for business. It's located in Kallio district, in Helsinki, Finland. A 30m2 fully furnished flat with complete kitchen and a funky interior, suitable for 1-2persons (3 if one is comfortable sleeping on the couch).

item.title: Hotel Seurahuone Helsinki
item.description: The Hotel Seurahuone Helsinki is a high class hotel in the heart of Helsinki. Historically over 180 years old Seurahuone is one of the most traditional hotels in Finland. The hotel's 118 stylishly decorated rooms feature individual alternatives; Standard Single, Standard Double and Seurahuone Club classes as well as four Junior Suites. The hotel's Banquet Floor offers an exceptional venue with traditional setting coupled with high-quality and modern service. The hotel's legendary restaurant and bar have undergone a major renovation. The new Brasserie Le Havre restaurant harks back to the Hotel Seurahuone Helsinki's first seafront location by the Market Square. The name also honours the core of European food culture, the French brasserie-style cuisine.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km.
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, low step (8 cm) outside entrance door, lift does not meet the spatial requirements of a wheelchair, door opening 75 cm, no special inva-rooms but rooms can be accessed with wheelchair, entrance from outside the restaurant, ten steps to the hotel bar, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 118 rooms: 96 standard rooms, 18 Seurahuone Club rooms, 4 Junior suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Brasserie Le Havre, Bar Socis.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Banquet Floor with six private banquet rooms, Business Point, ironing room.
item.matko:services: Brasserie Le Havre, Bar Socis

item.title: Hotel Sofia
item.description: Sofia is situated in Helsinki in a peaceful nature by the sea, just 15 km from the centre and the airport. The hotel has 3 different types of hotel rooms and can accommodate 150 persons. 12 meeting and conference facilities for 450 persons - the largest one is an auditorium for 220 persons.
item.matko:location: Vuosaari, Helsinki. City centre 15 km, Vuosaari metro station 2 km, airport 20 km.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant 220 seats, Lobby bar 60 seats, Retro club 100 seats and Brass room 30 seats.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Main lobby + lecture rooms nearby (450 m2).
item.matko:additionalinfo: 4 saunas, one by the sea, 17 m long swimming pool, gym room, sports hall, own beach, free internet services, own free parking area for 130 cars.
item.matko:services: Conference-, hotel and restaurant services.

item.title: Hotelli Haikon kartano
item.description: Genuine manor house ambience and pampering spa treatments. EHMA and SKÅL INTERNATIONAL sustainability awards.
item.matko:location: Located by the sea, only half an hour's drive from Helsinki.
item.matko:groups: 20 conference rooms.
item.matko:services: Spa, spa treatments, restaurant, hotel, conference center.

item.title: House of Nobility (Ritarihuone)
item.description:
The Swedish-born architect G. T. Chiewitz draw the neo-gothic plan for the palace and it was was completed in 1862, suitably for the Diet of all four estates in 1863.
The interior of the palace is largely designed by the decorators of that time. The west wing of the building is rented for private functions, whereas the east wing is for the purposes of the nobility. The assembly hall and board room is 464 sq. meters and is rented to companies, organizations and societies for banquets, cocktail receptions, concerts and meetings in a unique milieu.
item.matko:location: City centre 0.5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:ingress: Banquets, cocktail receptions, concerts and meetings.

item.title: HTC Helsinki (Sodexo)
item.description: HTC Helsinki is located in Ruoholahti, by the sea. It was built in 2002 and consists of five different buildings: Nina, Pinta, Santa Maria, Vega and Kon-Tiki. Auditorium Kolumbus seats 235 persons, seminar rooms Magalhaes and Vasco da Gama 20-70 persons. There are also five small conference rooms for 12 persons/room. There are also two special saunas: Albatrossi and Pohjankiisla which are located in the top floor with roof gardens. There is a meeting room and a lounge in both saunas.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurants Explorer (180 seats) and Acqua (80 seats) serve lunch on weekdays from 11am to 2pm. Other times Restaurant Explorer can host events for 170-225 persons, cocktails for up to 450 persons.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Pinta house's entrance hall, about 300 m2; auditoriums and seminar rooms for catering and cocktails. The entrance hall can also be used as exhibition space.

item.title: Hugo Boss Store
item.description: Collections for both men and women, eg. Orange and Black Label

item.title: Hugo's Room
item.description: Helsinki's newest gay bar and terrace is located at Iso Roobertinkatu.

item.title: Huone Events Hotel
item.description: Located in the up and rising Jätkäsaari, Huone Events Hotel is the first Events Hotel in the world. Opened in November 2012, the hotel offers living rooms instead of bedrooms. There are 8 living rooms, 3 saunas, 1 common lounge and 1 terrace. The living rooms are all different themed, available for meetings in the daytime, but parties in the evening. All the rooms are sound-proofed and equipped with AV-system, 65' Flatscreen TV, free WIFI, Flip chart etc. Huone has the all-in-one solution for small events organising, from food, space, programme, entertainment, transportation, sauna to your own event coordinator.
item.matko:location: City centre 8mins, airport 30mins.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Not available. There is a hotel offering accomodation in the same building, but nearby areas there are 2 hotels.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Huone offers Italian, Finnish and Asian cuisine for their customers. From breakfast, lunch and dinner to cocktail snacks and late-night supper. Food can be served to the rooms or enjoyed in the lounge.

item.title: Huopalahti Church
item.matko:open: Mass on Sundays at 10 and on Wednesdays at 19.30.

item.title: Hurjaruuth Dance Theatre
item.description: Hurjaruuth is a dynamic dance theatre company founded in 1981.
item.matko:open: Office open weekdays 9-16. Office and tickets tel. 09-565 7250, fax 09-693 1299.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchair. Inva-WC and lift.
item.matko:groups: Reductions for school groups
item.matko:services: Café, 350 seats, coffee 1€.
item.matko:ingress: Hurjaruuth is a dynamic dance theatre company.

item.title: Huvila Festival Tent
item.description: The Huvila Festival Tent is a unique concert venue at Hakaniemi. The box office and restaurant are open from 6pm. The restaurant is an excellent place to enjoy the balmy August nights after your show. Please note that the minimum age for admittance to the tent is 18 years.

item.title: Huvilan kahvila
item.description: Café Huvilan kahvila is a completely and naturally gluten-free café and patisserie that also caters for other special diets. The café is located at Villa Hakasalmi, between the Finlandia Hall and the Music Centre.

item.title: Höyhentämö
item.description: Theatre

item.title: Ice Cellar
item.description: In the Ice Cellar everything has a form. There local art and culture actors will be able to present their creative work. It will give a permanent setting for different, even spontaneous events. It has a light organisational structure, and those responsible for its activities are open to new, diverse thoughts. The aim of the project will be to find new ideas for and develop cultural tourism products and services. This side of the operations in the Ice Cellar will be supported by an art shop and culture café.

item.title: Icepark
item.description: Helsinki Icepark at the Railway Station Square is a perfect way to enjoy Finnish winter in an urban way. It makes it easy to enjoy skating or simply a cup of coffee in the café while watching the others skate. The Icepark offers its visitors entertaining and instructive programs every day including regular skating lessons by licensed instructors. Skates are available for rent, ice hockey sticks are not allowed. The Park also hosts events, from live music to special performances.
item.matko:open: Daily with weather reservation. Winter 2012-2013: Mon-Fri 12-21, Sat 10-21, Sun 10-19.
item.matko:admission: Adults 5€, children under 18 years 3€. Skate rental 5€.
item.matko:services: Skate rental, café

item.title: Ichiban Sushi
item.description: Ichiban Sushi is a Japanese run family restaurant with a cozy and friendly atmosphere. The restaurant serves hand-made sushi. Lunch menu Mon-Fri 11-14.

item.title: Iittala Shop
item.description: Finnish design-tableware. The heart of Iittala's design philosophy is formulated along Kaj Franck's early thinking. According to Franck, "objects should always be appropriate, durable and functional."

item.title: Impuls Make up & Hair
item.description: Hairdresser

item.title: Indian Summer Vintage Store
item.description: Indian Summer is a vintage clothing store offering selected vintage pieces and army surplus, as well as fashion from fresh independent designers, music and art books.

item.title: Innogalleria
item.description: Gallery of the National Board of Patents and Registration of Finland.

item.title: Institut francais de Finlande
item.description: The French Cultural Centre is the meeting place for Finnish and French culture. The centre aims to increase the awareness of modern-day France in the fields of education, science and culture.
item.matko:open: Reception Mon-Fri 9-17, library and information centre Mon-Thu 11-18, Fri 10-17.
item.matko:services: The library and information centre is open to all and offers information about France. The collection includes books, music CDs, films (video, DVD), journals and CD-ROMs.

item.title: International Cultural Centre Caisa
item.description: Multicultural exhibitions, concerts, events

item.title: Isku Interior Oy
item.description: Furniture exhibitions

item.title: Ison Karhun Kauppa- teddy bear store / Kamppi shopping centre
item.description: The shop sells all sorts of soft toys and teddy bears for both young and old. Also eg. STEIFF-products. It's also possible to fill your own teddybear. The shop also houses the Teddy Bear Hospital that takes care of soft toys that need attention.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 9-21 Sat 9-18, in summer also Sun 12-18

item.title: Itis Shopping Centre
item.description: The largest shopping centre in the Nordic countries, Itis was built in three stages. The first part was completed in autumn 1984 and an extension in September 1992. The opening of the Piazza in September 2001 brought Itis to its current size. Until early 2012, the shopping centre was named Itäkeskus. It was renamed Itis in March 2012 together with the launch of a complete overhaul of the shopping centre, scheduled for completion in 2014. There are more than 120 shops, 15 restaurants, two department stores and about 30 offices in the shopping centre.
item.matko:services: Some services, eg. restaurants, have their own exceptional opening hours.

item.title: Itäkeskus Swimming Hall
item.description: A family recreation centre big enough for 1000 persons at a time, quarried inside a rock (Also a fall-out shelter for 3,800.) Children's pool and water chute, 50 metre pool, 6 saunas, jacuzzi, turkish bath, cold-water pool, massage (advance booking). 3 and 5 m diving boards and solarium.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, electronic doors, own changing room, lift and Inva-WC.
item.matko:services: Gym included in price. Also guided exercise, instructor by arrangement, tel. 09-3108 7202 (Finnish, Swedish, English). Café c. 50 seats, open Mon-Wed 9-21, Thu 11-22, Fri 9-22, Sat 9-20.30, Sun 9-19.30. Parking for c. 100 cars.

item.title: IVANAhelsinki
item.description: Contemporary Finnish design combining modern Scandinavian style with a traditional Slavic touch. Designer Paola Suhonen is internationally recognized and her clothes are handmade in Finland.

item.title: Jetty Barracks Gallery
item.description: Maintained by the Helsinki Artists' Association, the gallery hosts exhibitions of top quality contemporary art.

item.title: Jogging Guide
item.description: Jogging in Helsinki.

item.title: Johan & Nyström
item.description: A serious place for coffee lovers! The Johan & Nyström Cafe and Roastery in the Katajanokka district offers a specialty coffee experience, as well as good selection of teas and delicious pastries. In addition to coffee, cafe also sells machines and other equipment.

item.title: Johanna Gullichsen
item.description: Johanna Gullichsen Textile Craft & Design offers an extensive lifestyle collection for modern living. The collection consists of fabrics for upholstery and furnishings, kitchen and table-linen, bath-linen, bed-linen, kimonos and other home accessories. Johanna Gullichsen’s textiles reflect elements of modern living.

item.title: Jone's Karaokebar
item.description: Karaokebar in Kaisaniemi around the corner of Railway station.

item.title: Joutsen
item.description: Joutsen Finland is the northernmost down products manufacturer in the world. Joutsen manufactures products for three product groups: down wear, down bedding and down sleeping bags. The quality of Joutsen products is acknowledged even outside Finland.

item.title: Juju Jewellery
item.description: Juju Jewellery sell silver jewellery by four finnish designers.

item.title: Jukka Male Museum
item.description: Exhibitions
item.matko:location: Cable Factory
item.matko:disabled: Lift from the yard

item.title: Jurkka Theatre
item.description: Performances in Finnish
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, please notify beforehand. Assistant needed (1-3 stairs).
item.matko:groups: Pensioner groups 15€/person (over 20 persons), school groups by appointment.
item.matko:services: Café/restaurant, seating for 50, fully licensed. Open 1 h before performance. Coffee and pastry 5€. Parking in street.

item.title: Jätkäsaari
item.matko:location: Next to the Western Terminal, the nearest metro station: Ruoholahti

item.title: Kaarle Xll
item.description: The popular "Kalle" has been working since 1976 with the same business idea and name. The relaxed atmosphere restaurant consists of 6 bars in two floors, one of the bars beeing the ever so popular Suomibaari (nowadays Bar 4), a bar with solely Finnish pop music. Artist-evenings mainly on Fridays in Bar 4, starting at 23.00.

item.title: Kaarna bar & kitchen
item.description: Kaarna bar & kitchen is a relaxed Finnish restaurant that offers fresh, clean and simple flavours of the Finnish kitchen with a Scandinavian touch.

item.title: Kabuki
item.description: Traditional Japanese restaurant that has been serving its loyal customers for over 15years. This small restaurant is very popular so table reservations are recommended. Also take-away service.

item.title: Kadetti Restaurant
item.description: The Kadetti Restaurant is in a Jugend building designed by Eliel Saarinen in the beautiful Munkkiniemi district of Helsinki. Conferences, training events and congresses welcome on weekdays. In the evenings and at weekends the Kadetti is a private restaurant for individually tailored events. Many of the rooms are suitable for a variety of events, the Kadetti and Tornisalonki for banquets. Free parking and well served by public transport.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 20 km

item.title: Kafe Moskova
item.description: Time stands still at the Brezhnevian era's last monument Kafe Moskova, situated in central Helsinki. Cold beer and freezing service. 26 seats. Agelimit 20years.

item.title: Kaffa Roastery
item.description: Kaffa Roastery is a Helsinki-based coffee roastery located in the hip neighborhood of Punavuori. In addition to the specialty coffees, the small roastery offers freshly roasted coffee beans, as well as espresso machines and an array of high-quality coffee equipment.

item.title: Kahvila Sävy
item.description: Kahvila Sävy in Kallio district offers high quality coffees produced by small roasteries.

item.title: Kaisaniemi Park
item.description: Situated alongside the Central Railway Station, Kaisaniemi Park is a great place for recreation and includes the University Botanical Gardens.
item.matko:location: Next to the Railway Station (eastern side)
item.matko:ingress: Park is a great place for recreation.

item.title: Kaisla
item.description: Kaisla, entrance at Vilhonkatu and Vuorikatu, by Kaisaniemi metro station, instantly opens up the world of beer in all its glory to those who visit. The city's most impressive row of taps catches the eye and fills pints with 26 of the finest beers from all over the world. An expedition into the world of bottled beers lasts as long as adventures in bygone days: about 140 varieties are served.

item.title: Kaivohuone
item.description:
Restaurant Kaivohuone, in a unique setting, is situated in the middle of the most beautiful Helsinki in the park of Kaivopuisto. The restaurant has served both Finnish and international guests from 1838. Behind seven bars the competent personnel serves the thirsty party people with excellent customer service. Kaivohuone can also be hired for private occasions. During winter only open upon request.
Age limit: 18 years
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Seats up to 1000 persons, terrace for up to 500 persons, in use May-August. Full lighting and sound reproduction system, audio-visual equipment and a large stage.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The sales services of Night People Group are open Mon-Fri at 020 7759 814, myynti@npg.fi. Kaivohuone is part of Night people Group.

item.title: Kaivopuisto minigolf
item.description: 18 holes and beautiful views to the sea.
item.matko:location: Eiranranta

item.title: Kaivopuisto Park
item.description: Helsinki's oldest and best known park is surrounded by embassies and villas. The nearby sea, rock cliffs and green lawns offer many opportunities to relax and enjoy the outdoors. At the highest point of the park is the Ursa Observatory. There are several cafées and restaurants along the shore and on the islands.
item.matko:ingress: Helsinki's oldest and best known park.

item.title: Kaivopuiston antiikki
item.description: Furniture from the 18th and 19th century, also porcelain, silver and jewellery.

item.title: Kakkugalleria
item.description: Cafe and bakery serving handmade cakes, pastries, truffles and other tasty treats. The two other Kakkugalleria cafes in the city center are located at Erottaja 7 and Fredrikinkatu 41.

item.title: Kalevala Koru & Lapponia Jewelry outlet
item.description: Kalevala Koru outlet is located in the same building as the factory. In the outlet shop it is possible to find the whole Kalevala koru collection as wellas parts of the Lapponia Jewelry collection. Here you can also find special items, eg. jewelry collections that are no longer manufactured.
item.matko:location: In Pitäjänmäki

item.title: Kalevala Koru Shop
item.description: Kalevala Koru is the largest jewellery manufacturer in Finland who designs, produces and sells high quality gold, silver and bronze jewellery. The ground of design is strongly based on Finnish and Scandinavian culture combining the historical heritage with modern life alike.
item.matko:services: Also a shop at Kamppi shopping centre. Factory shop: Strömbergintie 4, tel. +358 (0)20 7611 214

item.title: Kallio Bear Park Cafe, kiosk in Karhupuisto park
item.description: The kiosk in the Karhupuisto park serves coffee, Helsingin jäätelötehdas ice cream, fresh cinnamon rolls (Korvapuusti, a Finnish sweet pastry), the Karhupuisto parks own ice tea and Laitilan Wirvoitusjuoma-soft drinks. The park is named after the statue "Bear on an anthill".
item.matko:open: Summer café Bear Park Cafe is open from April to September daily (except on rainy days).

item.title: Kallio Church
item.description: This grey granit church was planned by Lars Sonck in 1912. Jean Sibelius composed a melody for the bells.
item.matko:disabled: The vestibule of the church is dark.
item.matko:services: Helsinki Organ Summer concerts on Mon at 19.30.

item.title: Kallio Ice Rink
item.description: Ice skating in winter, football and baseball games in summer.
item.matko:location: In Kallio, trams 1, 1A, 3B, 3T and 8
item.matko:services: Skate rental, café.

item.title: Kamera Gallery
item.description: Photo gallery

item.title: Kamppi Bowling Center & Bar
item.description: Bowling in Kamppi is not just a sport, it's much more!
item.matko:location: Kamppi shopping center, 4th floor.

item.title: Kamppi Shopping Centre
item.description: Kamppi is the newest shopping centre in Helsinki city centre.
item.matko:open: The shopping centre is open Mon-Fri 9-21, Sat 9-18.
item.matko:services: Kamppi consists of a bus station for long distance buses, a terminal for Espoo buses, a connection to the Kamppi metro station, cargo services and a parking facility.

item.title: KAMU Espoo City Museum
item.description: The exhibitions at the Espoo City Museum create an allround picture of Espoo's history. The basic exhibition, A Trip through Time in Espoo, covers Espoo's colourful history from the age of mammoths to the present day. The museum also arranges workshops and events.
item.matko:admission: WeeGee ticket adults 12€, students and pensioners 10€, under 18yrs free entry. WeeGee ticket covers admission to all the museums in WeeGee House.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours, enquiries and bookings, tel. +358 (0) 9 8165 7052.

item.title: Kankurin Tupa
item.description: Handicrafts and souvenirs. Here you'll also find Christmas decorations all year.

item.title: Kanneltalo
item.description: Exhibitions, concerts
item.matko:location: City centre 11 km, airport 14 km
item.matko:admission: Free admission to exhibitions, admission fee for concerts
item.matko:services: Café, library

item.title: Kannonnokka Oy
item.description: Kannonnokka, situated just 58 km from Helsinki city center, offers wilderness experience for groups. There you will find kota ( Lappish hut ) where wild boar or game meals are served by bright campfire, outdoor terraces with a nice view over the river, sauna in the rock with outdoor whirlpool and warm bath and many outdoor activities. Kannonnokka operates to order.
item.matko:location: 58 km from Helsinki, 7 km from Porvoo.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Uusi 20 hengen osittain kallioon louhittu kivisauna on toivottaa saunojat tervetulleiksi pehmeiden löylyjen syleilyyn. Terassilla kallionjyrkänteen reunalla saunojia odottavat poreallas ja kuumavesipalju, joka tarvittaessa toimii myös kylmävesialtaana. Kivisauna, altaat ja hieman yli 20 neliön takkatila ovat ympärivuotisessa käytössä.
item.matko:services: Kannonnokka offers unique wilderness atmosphere for social evenings, meetings or recreation days. Situated just in the middle of wild boar forest you enjoy gourmet-meals in Lappish hut or outdoor terrace. Try our unique sauna in the rock with outdoor whirlpool and warm bath. Worth of trying is also cable slide over the wild boar forest or cooking school in the wilds.

item.title: Kansallissali (Kämp Group)
item.description: Unique national romanticism and robust design in the heart of Helsinki. Kansallissali has conference facilities for up to 200 people. Easy to reach and Hotel Kämp's kitchen takes care of quality cuisine.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Entire hall 200 m2

item.title: Karjakaivo
item.description: The 460 hectare outdoor recreation area of Karjakaivo is situated 30 kilometres from Helsinki, on the north side of Nuuksiontie road. It is a peaceful outing area with its steep cliffs, erratic boulders, mires and wetlands. In addition to the steep cliffs there is also plenty of easily accessible terrain. From the adjacent Solvalla sports academy you can access short round tours.
item.matko:location: In Espoo 30 km from Helsinki, between Bodominjärvi and Nuuksio Pitkäjärvi. Bus number 85(A) from the center of Espoo.
item.matko:open: Enquiries, info monday - thursday: 07.00 - 15.00 friday: 07.00 - 20.00 saturday - sunday: 09.00 - 17.00
item.matko:services: parking, café, camping place, cooking shelters and fireplace, hiking trails, possibility of rock climbing

item.title: Karjalatalo, Restaurant Karelia
item.description: Built in 1974, the Karelia has a quiet location well served by public transport. Main hall, foyer and restaurant on the ground floor (can be combined), private dining rooms on three floors. Karelian traditions and customs reflected in the interior and décor.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 km, airport 12 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Karelia, private restaurant: 100 seats, Takatasku Pub
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Main hall 290 m2 + stage 75 m2, foyer 350 m2
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna + sauna lounge, sauna for 10 at a time, lounge for c. 26, small ecumenical chapel adjoining the Galleria room, Käpylä Keep Fit Club in the same building

item.title: Karkkikauppa Sweetheart
item.description: Small and cute confectionary, where you can find sweets from all over Europe.
item.matko:services: Take away coffee and tea.

item.title: Kart 'in Club
item.description: Karting on a racy and safe indoor track.
item.matko:location: Bus 55 from the Railway Square
item.matko:services: Single, groups, meetings, saunas etc.

item.title: Kart'in Club
item.description: Karting Race Track (indoors).
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 14.00-21.00, Sat-Sun 10.00-19.00. Office on working days 08.30-16.30 (also by appointment)

item.title: Karuna Church, Seurasaari Island
item.description: The Karuna Church situated in the Seurasaari outdoor museum on Seurasaari island was built in 1685 and moved to Seursaari in 1912. The church is one of the most popular churches in Helsinki for summer weddings.
item.matko:services: On Wednesdays in summer evening concerts at 19.00 and summer Sundays service at 12.30.
item.matko:ingress: Popular church for weddings in Helsinki.

item.title: Kasvisbaari
item.description: Luch restaurant serving vegetarian food. Gluten-free and vegan alternatives available daily.
item.matko:location: Taiteidentalo/Kuvataideakatemia

item.title: Katajanokan Kasino
item.description: This traditional restaurant was opened in 1913 and entirely renovated in 1996. The architecture and decor of Katajanokan Kasino - from the spacious Kenraali dining room to the distinctive and historical private rooms - represent a fascinating aspect of Helsinki's restaurant tradition. Traditions are also upheld by the restaurant's high quality kitchen. The seaside location and a spacious terrace make Katajanokan Kasino a real jewel of summer Helsinki, and with its private rooms, it is also a suitable setting for a variety of conferences and other occasions all year round.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 35 min
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 11-14, in summer Mon-Fri 11-23.00. At other times upon request.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The venue has few fixed furniture, and can thus cater for all kinds of needs. Restaurant services are of the highest quality in both food and wine, and incorporate everything from breakfasts to suppers.

item.title: Katajanokka Studio Apartment
item.description:
A unique studio apartment of 40 m2 / 3,75 m high in Katajanokka is for rent for 1-2 persons, preferably on a weekly basis. The apartment is located on the 5th Floor. The unique original elevator, with faceted glass, is the original one. A joy to ride in with its link to the past, when artisanship, beauty and functionality went hand in hand. The apartment was renovated in 2005/2009. These include the ceiling, hand-painted walls and hand-carved original doors and wooden floor as well as . The original 1903 hallway paintings have been fully restored.
Katajanokka, home of many embassies, has some of the finest examples of art nouveau architecture in the world. Satamakatu 5 was designed by Selim A. Lindqvist in 1903. The main market place in front of the Presidential Castle is 2 minutes walking distance away. There are guided cruises to the beautiful archipelago departing from the harbour of the Market Place.
item.matko:admission: 550e / week Contact beforehand preferably by mail. Rental agreement will be made with every customer.
item.matko:services:
Facilities: Broadband WLAN Internet connection. Widescreen 32" TV. DVD-player. Radio. C-casette player.
Facilities outdoors: In the neighbouring house there is a food store open every day. There are several restaurants and cafes in the neighbourhood.
Connection: From the city center to Munkkiniemi by tram number 4 which runs until 01.40 AM. Although Katajanokka stands on it's own peninsula the city centre is only 10 minutes away by foot.
View: Overlooking Katajanokka Park (see picture). Breathtaking views the Uspenski Cathedral and the Presidential Castle.
item.matko:ingress: Studio Apartment in Katajanokka for rent.

item.title: Kattilahalli
item.description:
A historic steam-electric power plant has been converted into a modern event centre. The over century-old building designed by S.A. Lindqvist has unique architectural value and is officially protected by the National Board of Antiquities. It is located in the dynamic new district of Kalasatama with excellent transportation connections to the city centre.
The former boiler hall of the power plant covers an area of approximately 1,600 square meters, allowing it to accommodate large exhibitions, meetings, banquets and other events of up to 1000 guests.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 17 km

item.title: Kaunis Veera
item.description: High-quality brand clothing, primarily new clothes but also vintage finds.

item.title: Kaurila sauna
item.description: The woodheated Kaurila log sauna is situated in the old part of Meilahti in Helsinki.
item.matko:location: 5km to city centre, bus 24 or tram 4
item.matko:services: You can bring your own food and bewerages.Towels and seat covers are available for guests. Possible to buy hand made sauna products.

item.title: Kellarikrouvi (Cellar restaurant)
item.description: Restaurant Kellarikrouvi consists of the unique Cellar Restaurant Kellarikrouvi in downstairs and the popular street-level restaurant Fabian. Kellarikrouvi restaurant is known for its excellent, moderately priced Finnish food, and for its a la carte and special menus.

item.title: Kellarikrouvi, street level
item.description: The street level of Kellarikrouvi is a welcoming neighbourhood restaurant with seating for 70. An ideal place to enjoy a glass of wine or a delicious unpretentious meal. The lunch menus feature home-cooked meals and modern favourites. The lunch is self-service. One level down is located restaurant Kellarikrouvi's downstairs.

item.title: Kellariteatteri
item.description: Helsingin Kellariteatteri (The Helsinki Cellar Theatre) is a traditional Finnish youth amateur theatre. Founded in 1956, we still operate at the original location, a basement facility formerly used to store firewood - hence our name. Our motto is to learn though participating. The theatre is run on a non-commercial basis. We produce approximately ten plays per year. Our members are chosen through auditions - new members join every year to maintain Kellariteatteri as a jolly bunch of young theater enthusiasts.

item.title: Keltainen Jäänsärkijä
item.description: Sells, buys and exchanges, CD's, vinyls and music DVD's. Over 10 000 titles.

item.title: Kierrätyskeskus
item.description: Helsinki Metropolitan Area Reuse Centre Ltd is a community aiming at the public good. It was founded to make our environment a better place to live in by decreasing the amount of waste and increasing the people's environmental awareness. Lönnrotinkatu shop sells clothes, shoes, books, kitchen ware, toys etc. Also a small amount of furniture. Also Plan B Boutique that sells unique products made out of recycled materials.

item.title: Kindergarten Museum
item.description: Kindergarten Museum illustrates the history of Finnish kindergartens and kindergarten teacher training, pedagogical trends, toys, equipment and interiors.
item.matko:open: Open on Wednesdays from 12-18. Groups by appointment
item.matko:admission: Adults 4€, students and pensioners 2€, children under 16years free of charge
item.matko:groups: Groups by appointment

item.title: Kino K-13
item.description: Movie theatre

item.title: Kirpilä Art Collection
item.description: Kirpilä Art Collection comprises Finnish art from the end of the 19th century to the 1970's. It is named after Dr. Juhani Kirpilä (1931-1988), who donated his home and art collection to the Finnish Cultural Foundation.

item.title: Kitch Bar & Cafe
item.description: Bar & Cafe serving mainly organic food and fair trade products.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue: 08.00 - 24.00,Wed-Fri: 08.00 - 02.00,Sat: 12.00 - 02.00,Sun: 12.00 - 24.00 NB! Kitch Bar & Cafe will close their doors for 2 months on Saturday 27.2.2010

item.title: Kivikko Ski Hall
item.description: Indoor ski hall
item.matko:location: In Kivikko district, 12 km and 20 min from Central Railway Station. Bus 94 B from Kontula Metro Station. 15 minutes away both from the Helsinki Airport and the city center.
item.matko:admission: 2013: Adult €14; pensioners, students, youth (12 - 18-yo), unemployed €12; kids (7 - 11-yo) €10
item.matko:disabled: Accessible WC, elevator.
item.matko:services: Winter World offers snowy antics in any weather. No ski rental so far. The ski hall also includes a children´s sports park and gym.

item.title: Klaus K Hotel
item.description: Klaus K is a personal contemporary hotel inspired by the emotional contrast of Finland's national epic, its nature and concept. All 139 rooms including 2 suites, are provided with state-of-the-art equipment ranging from custom made beds and mattresses to laptop size safe to oversized robe and towels to LCD television to high speed internet - wireless and wired. Rake Sali Ball Room, in connection with the Klaus K Hotel, is perfect for example for seminars, conferences and celebrations with all banquet services provided by Klaus K Hotel.
item.matko:location: Right in the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Disabled facilities
item.matko:groups: The hotel welcomes groups and is happy to tailor its services to fit group needs
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 139 rooms in four different room categories: 74 x Passion / Mystical: Up to 20 sqm. 30 x Desire: 20 to 25 sqm. 26 x Envy: 25 to 30 sqm. 5 x EnvyPlus: 30 to 40 sqm. 2 x EnvySuite: 55 sqm. Unique art rooms and suites designed by Finnish designers Harri Koskinen, Katja Tukiainen, Riiko Sakkinen and Jani Leinonen.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: LIVINGROOM private events for up to 540 persons; Toscanini 72 seats, private events for up to 120 persons; Bar/Club Ahjo for 350 persons.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Klubi is a meeting space with a sauna, in connection with the Helsinki Day Spa. Wintti is a unique meeting space for up to 12 persons (seated) on the top floor of the Rake Building. The long board room table is surrounded by two spacious seating areas.

item.title: Klockriketeatern
item.description: Mostly Swedish speaking theatre. Also visiting acts.

item.title: Kluuvi gallery
item.description: The Kluuvi gallery is managed by the Helsinki Art Museum. It focuses on experimental and non-commercial works of Finnish artists, offering opportunities to projects, which would be difficult to realise elsewhere in Helsinki. The City of Helsinki sponsors the Gallery financially by charging a very low lease and taking no sales commission.

item.title: Kluuvi Shopping Centre
item.description:
Located in the centre of Helsinki, Shopping Centre Kluuvi focuses on international brand selection, current and quality domestic concepts and locally produced organic food.
The fashion selection includes a variety of well-known brands such as Fred Perry, French Connection, G-Star RAW, Tiger of Sweden and Superdry. There are also multibrand stores such as The Brand New Maranello and Showroom8 which sells the popular clothing line, Desigual. The hungry shoppers will find comfort in the diversity of restaurants at Kluuvi. The basement level stores provide both daily groceries and delicious organic food.
The lounge themed top floor is a central meeting point which livens up regularly as different events are arranged. In addition, the shopping centre has a wireless network available to customers without a charge.
item.matko:open: The shopping centre is open Mon-Fri 10am-9pm, Sat 10am-6pm, Sun 12-5pm. Opening hours may vary depending on store. Specific opening hours for each store are available at www.kluuvi.fi.

item.title: Kokomo Tikibar & Room
item.description: Kokomo Tikibar & Room is inspired by tiki culture. It is a restaurant with Polynesian food and cocktails. Clubs and live music.

item.title: KokoTeatteri
item.description: Theatre with plays from drama to contemporary dance performances. BarKoko is open during the performance nights until midnight.
item.matko:groups: Information on group discounts (min.10persons) from the theatre office.

item.title: KOM Theatre
item.description: Performances in Finnish
item.matko:open: Box office at Kapteeninkatu 26, open one hour before performances start, tel. 09-684 1841; Box office open Mon-Fri 10-16.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed, please notify in advance.
item.matko:groups: Adult groups (over 20 persons) 16-20€.
item.matko:services: Café open in interval. KOM-restaurant in connection with the Theatre.

item.title: KOM-restaurant
item.description: The KOM-restaurant is in connection with KOM Theatre and is popular amongst both theatre and culture people as well as locals. During daytime the restaurant serves as a cafe and lunch restaurant with free internet access. In the evenings the retaurant is an a la carte restaurant with a relaxed atmosphere. Programme usually on Monday evenings (sometimes also on Thursdays).
item.matko:open: Mon-Thu 11.30-01, Fri 11.30-02, Sat 16-02, Sun closed (kitchen open until 22.45).

item.title: Kongressikoti
item.description: Kongressikoti Ltd., an apartment hotel located in the prestigious Kruununhaka district of Helsinki, the capital city of Finland. The premises have an excellent array of services and choice of transport available within walking distance.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:services: Rooms includes TV, washbasin and refrigerator. Extra beds upon request.

item.title: Kontoret
item.description: Kontoret (Office) offers small meeting rooms (1-8 persons) and tools to efficiently hold meetings and work, alone or in teams. By creating an account, for FREE, you receive your own access code. We charge for the exact time you use.
item.matko:location: From Train station (600m) and Kamppi (900m) walking distance to Kontoret. The trams 10, 3B, 6 and 6X and buses 20 and 24 stops at Erottaja.
item.matko:services: Fast Wi-Fi, coffee and printing included in the prize. Discount of 20% for parking in Qpark Erottaja. Taxistop Erottaja just outside the front door.

item.title: Kontula Ice Rink
item.description: Ice rink

item.title: Kontula skateboard hall
item.description: Finland's largest indoor skating hall. ca. 2000 m2 of space where people can skateboard.

item.title: Korea House
item.description: Korea House is the first and only Korean restaurant in Finland. The restaurant serves you tasteful and traditional Korean food in a beautiful and relaxing atmosphere.

item.title: Korjaamo Café
item.description:
Take a break and have a lunch or a coffee in a unique, tranquil environment guarded by old trams. If the weather is nice, you can also enjoy Korjaamo's summer garden, which is a green oasis in the middle of the city (open from June to August).
Lunch is served on weekdays 11 am to 3 pm and options include a delicious salad buffet (10/13 euros) and soup + toast (10 euros). As a desert you could choose a special coffee or tea with something sweet from our selection of bakery. We also serve a tasty brunch on Saturdays and Sundays (10/13 euros). Welcome!
item.matko:open: from June 24th: Mon-Tue 11 am-10 pm, Wed-Sun 11 am-8 pm

item.title: Korjaamo Culture Factory
item.description: Korjaamo Culture Factory is one of the largest arts centres in the Nordic countries, which produces arts events accross various fields including music, theatre, fine arts and talks. Newness, open-mindedness and interaction with audiences are top values in Korjaamo's programme. Every August, Korjaamo hosts Stage - Helsinki Theatre Festival, which showcases a top-notch selection of domestic and foreign theatre pieces. Korjaamo has its own gallery, Korjaamo Galleria, which produces approximately 20 exhibitions a year. During summer, Korjaamo's garden is packed with free programme, including open-air theatre, gigs and DJ's. Korjamo has a bar and a café that is open every day.
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:services: Wine Bar/café, terrace, gallery.

item.title: Korjaamon baari & keittiö (bar & kitchen Korjaamo)
item.description: Lunch is served on weekdays combining traditional home cooking with mediterranean and Asian influences. Brunch is served on weekends. The brunch includes a selection of salads and warm foods as well as cakes and desserts. Bar & kitchen serves bistro style food also in the evenings. The à la carte menu is available from Monday to Saturday from 4 pm
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 11am - 9pm, Wed-Thu 11am - 11pm, Fri-Sat 11am - 1am, Sun 11am - 5pm. Lunch on weekdays 11am - 2pm. Brunch during weekends 11am - 3pm. Evening menu served Mon - Sat from 4pm.

item.title: Koskenranta Event Centre & Restaurant
item.description:
The Koskenranta Event Centre is located by the Old Town Rapids, close to the main transportation infrastructure. The red wooden building used to serve as the cold flow laboratory of energy company Fortum but has now been fully renovated inside and out. The building's largest hall can accommodate up to 1200 guests for cocktail events, exhibitions and production launches, for example, and 1000 guests for banquets and meetings.
The concept behind the large and light space is that it can be furnished individually for each event according to the customer's wishes. There are also two meeting rooms for 10 to 30 people. A large sauna, suite and free parking add to the appeal of the new venue.
item.matko:location: City centre 8 km, airport 16 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The complex includes a 100/150-seat restaurant with a separate 200-seat terrace.

item.title: Kosmos
item.description: A classic in Helsinki's restaurant scene, Kosmos is frequented by a diverse clientele. The elegant dining room décor dates back to the 1920s and 1930s. Vorschmack and fried Baltic herring are among the best-known delicacies of the restaurant's Finnish-international cuisine.

item.title: Kotiharju Sauna
item.description: Kotiharjun Sauna is the last genuine wood-heated public sauna in Helsinki and has welcomed sauna-goers since 1928. Hardy washing ladies are still on hand to scrub the living daylights out of you, should you wish, and massages and other treatments are also available.
item.matko:location: In Kallio
item.matko:open: Tue-Sat 14-20 (doors close as indicated but sauna is in use until 21.30).
item.matko:admission: Adults 12€, children (12-16 years) 6€, students and pensioners 8,50€, towels and washer service also available (washing service available Tue, Fri and sat 16-19, 9€).
item.matko:disabled: No access with wheelchairs, lots of steps.

item.title: Kotihotelli Oy
item.description: Kotihotelli can offer homelike accommodation for longer or shorter periods of stay. The flats are situated in the city of Helsinki, some in the heart of the city, others further from the city centre.
item.matko:location: In the city centre and in the metropolitan area, airport 18 km
item.matko:admission: 55-120 e/night. The main rental period is seven days. The flats can be rented even for shorter periods of time, however advance bookings cannot be taken nor confirm the shorter stays.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: From studios to larger flats
item.matko:additionalinfo: TV set, VCR, stereo, washing machine and other smaller appliances, as well as linen, all kitchen utensils and crockery. There is a telephone line for local calls (in the Helsinki area, which also includes Espoo, Vantaa and other nearby cities).

item.title: Kotimaailma Apartments
item.description:
Kotimaailma offers its customers an excellent alternative to a hotel. Our furnished apartments are always located within walking distance of city center services.
