Very well decorated and equipped, our studio, two room and three room apartments are available in the central area of Turku, Tampere, Helsinki and Oulu. The period of residence may vary from 4 days to as much as 36 months. In the case of extended stays the price may always be negotiated on a case-specific basis (periods of longer than 2 weeks).
Our prices always include value added tax, contents insurance, sheets and other bedding, final cleaning, water and electricity charges plus all the equipment to be found in every Kotimaailma apartment. Our apartments are fully equipped, which means customers only need to bring clothes and toiletries with them.
Check-in weekdays 10am-5pm or as agreed.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Krulla's Wiener Kaffeehaus
item.description: Helsinki's first café in Viennese style. Breakfast is served daily, lunch on weekdays and brunch on Saturdays. 24seats.

item.title: Kulmagalleria
item.description: Art Gallery

item.title: Kulmakahvio - Bear Park Kulma
item.description: Kulmakahvio is a small gay cafe in Karhupuisto, Kallio.
item.matko:location: Kulmakahvio cafe is on the corner of Agricolankatu and Kaarlenkatu in Kallio
item.matko:services: Coffee, tea, soda, soft drinks and bakery are offered.

item.title: Kulosaari Casino
item.description:
Built in 1915, the Kulosaari Casino is a traditional, high standard restaurant with the most beautiful sea view in Helsinki. Acclaimed for its cuisine and unique atmosphere, it is one of the city's most popular places for festive occasions - for groups both large and small. The spacious dining room offers a splendid view of the Gulf of Finland. Function rooms are available for parties of different sizes.
Around the year, the Kulosaari Casino is a popular setting for festivities. At the end of the summer, the beautiful sea view makes the Kulosaari Casino one of the most popular locations for crayfish parties. The core of the restaurant is the stylish Merisali dining room. Its two wings, the Wellamo and the Kippari can be turned into function rooms. The separate Hopeasalmi function room is suitable for groups of 30 to 80 people. The summer restaurant (Sun Marine) can be used either individually or together with the rest of the Casino.
item.matko:location: City centre 6 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 17-24, during 1.1.-30.4. open only upon request.

item.title: Kulosaari Church
item.matko:address: Kulosaarentie 40, entry Kyösti Kallion tie 1 a

item.title: Kumpula Outdoor Swimming Pool
item.description: Kumpula outdoor swimming pool was built for the Olympics 1952 and it is the third oldest outdoor swimming pool with tracks. It has recently renovated maintaining the original outfit. The pools: pool 25 m, children's pool, wading pool, diving pool.
item.matko:admission: Adults 3,80€, children (7-17 yrs) 1,90€, children under 7yrs free entry.
item.matko:services: Weight lifting space, chess area, basketball court, volleyball court, children's play area, jumping castle, café, parking lot. Café tel. +358-(0)9-877 6558. Swimsuit for rent 2 €, seat cover 0,50€.

item.title: Kuninkaan Lohet
item.description:
In the premises of an old file factory, a luxuriously furnished restaurant breathes history and elegance, providing a perfect setting for even the most demanding employee event, client conference, or dinner party.
The Kuninkaan Kartano is an idyllic milieu for meetings and training sessions. The Gustavian-style manor house with its light, charming interiors is also a romantic setting for wedding receptions.
With the river cutting thru the landscape, the Vantaankoski industrial milieu provides an excellent setting for meetings, training programs, congresses, or even press conferences. The peaceful surroundings of the lush scenery guarantee an enjoyable day for a meeting.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 16 km, airport 10 km
item.matko:open: The restaurant Kuninkaan Lohet is open only by booking, which means that the reservations must be made in advance.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Two saunas
item.matko:services: The magnificent views from the two riverside saunas are balm both to muscles strained by canoeing or snow-shoeing and to brains exhausted from a day's hard thinking.

item.title: Kunsthalle Helsinki
item.description: Each year, the Kunsthalle Helsinki hosts 8-10 major exhibitions as well as a similar number of studio shows, in addition to events, concerts and a cross-disciplinary programme. The focus of the exhibitions is on contemporary art but the exhibition programme also includes design and architecture. Kunsthalle Helsinki does not have a collection of its own, but serves as a venue for changing exhibitions.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 30 min.
item.matko:admission: adults 9€, discount price 6€, under 18yrs free admission
item.matko:groups: Guidebooking, tel.+358 (0)45 7731 4316, groups max.25pers.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Exhibition space appr. 600 m2, restaurant 120 m2
item.matko:services: Museum shop. Restaurant Farang, is a modern Asian restaurant, situated in the Kunsthalle Helsinki building.

item.title: Kuudes Linja
item.description: An underground live club with cult status.
item.matko:services: Wed-Thu 21-03, Fri-Sat 22-04 (gigs occasionally also on other weekdays). Age limit 20years.

item.title: KuuKuu
item.description: KuuKuu opened in 1990 and has been the livingroom of many locals and artists ever since. Serving classic dishes for every taste KuuKuu is both a restaurant and a bar with 36 seats for diners and 18 seats in the bar. The outdoor terrace is open in the summertime and has places for 40 people. KuuKuu also hosts two cabinets (for 16 and 10 persons).
item.matko:open: Open Mon-Tue 11-23, Wed-Fri 11-01, Sat 12-01, Sun 12-23. Lunch is offered weekdays at 11-16.

item.title: Kuurna
item.description: Kuurna is a small and cozy restaurant in the Kruununhaka neighbourhood. The menu changes every two weeks and there are also a few daily specialities. All the ingredients are carefully chosen and the menu consists of mostly Finnish classics with a modern twist. Kuurna offers two seatings each weekday evening: the first from 6pm until 8pm and the latter one starting at 8.30pm. On Saturdays there is an earlier seating from 4pm till 6pm.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri seatings from 6pm to 8pm and at 8.30pm. On Saturdays from 4pm to 6pm, from 6pm to 8pm and at 8.30pm.

item.title: Kuutio Auditorium
item.description: The Kuutio auditorium can accommodate 110 persons. The auditorium is known for its good acoustics and comfortable seats. A few smaller rooms can be arranged for workshops and the lobby can be used for exhibition purposes.
item.matko:location: City centre 6 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Lunch restaurant 110 seats. Meals and refreshments varying from breakfasts to cocktail parties can be arranged by the restaurant next to the auditorium.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Foyer
item.matko:additionalinfo: The auditorium is equipped with the state-of-the-art technology. Best Western Hotel Haaga is located within walking distance. Free parking. Good traffic connections to the city centre.

item.title: Kämp Café Brasserie
item.description: Kämp Café honours its long history, and the traditions are a matter of great pride, but the overall style is more modern and easily accessible. It is classy and elegant, but in a relaxed and welcoming kind of way. The Kämp Café also has its own bakery which produces mouth-watering cakes, pies and fresh bread. Drop by the Kämp Café Brasserie & Bar at any time, have a glass of champagne and treat yourself to an exquisite meal.

item.title: Kämp Spa
item.description: Kämp Spa is an oasis of ultimate relaxation and rejuvenation. Kämp Spa offers a range of holistic spa treatments based on the most exquisite berries and plants of the Nordic nature.
item.matko:location: Kämp Spa is located on the 8th floor of the historical Hotel Kämp and the modern Hotel Glo Kluuvi.
item.matko:open: Monday-Friday 11:00 am-8:00 pm. Saturday 9:00 am-8:00 pm.
item.matko:groups: The groups should book Spa treatments or Spa packages in advance.
item.matko:services: Day and Medical Spa treatments. Gym and sauna facilities.

item.title: Käpylä Ice Rink
item.description: Ice rinks for skating with sticks or without sticks.
item.matko:services: Café open Sat-Sun 10-16.

item.title: König Helsinki
item.description: The three large bar areas and the two completely different kinds of music worlds of the nightclub König Club are open from Wednesday through Saturday. The popular domestic and international classic hits are played harmoniously side by side in the different bars of König. The DJs warm up the party in the night and on the dance floors as the live band evenings do on Wednesdays. DJ's Wed - Sat from 10pm.

item.title: La Famiglia
item.description: La Famiglia is a relaxed, easy-going, cosy and unpretentious Italian-American restaurant. In addition to à la carte dishes, La Famiglia's rustic Italian milieu offers three different menus: America, Italy and Finlandia. There is also a bar for relaxing aperitifs before dining and an area for the little ones to play in and watch videos.
item.matko:groups: La Famiglia's dining room and the La Famiglia Banquet facility downstairs, seating 100, provide an excellent setting for a diversity of functions.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: La Famiglia's dining room and the La Famiglia Banquet facility downstairs, seating 100, provide an excellent setting for a diversity of functions.

item.title: La Table
item.description: A small french restaurant inpired by a comic serie "La Table".

item.title: La Torrefazione
item.description: Coffee shops and roastery. Lunch possibility.
item.matko:location: In the center.

item.title: Laajasalon golfkenttä
item.description: Golf court. One round (6 holes) takes only one hour and rented clubs are available.
item.matko:location: HSL's bus number 85 stops to a point, which is only 10min walk away from the golf court.

item.title: Laboratory
item.description: Exhibition hall

item.title: Lady Moon
item.description: Lady Moon is an intimate nightclub in central Helsinki, located right across the street opposite to the central Railway station. Nightclub Lady Moon is one of the few clubs in Helsinki that draws a big crowd of party people seven nights a week.

item.title: Laituri
item.description: Laituri is the Helsinki City Planning Department's information and exhibition space. It is a new and open place where plans, changes and development projects can be examined. At Laituri it is also possible to participate in discussions about the city. Additional information: Reetta DeWan, tel. +358 (0)9 310 37440.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, in the old bus station building in Kamppi

item.title: Lappish Restaurant Saaga
item.description: The Saaga Restaurant brings you the magic of Lapland in good food and a warm atmosphere - a piece of the rugged and beautiful Lappish countryside, a kitchen full of Lappish flavours and a restaurant full of the exotic northland. Saaga serves both traditional and more modern Lappish delicacies. The à la carte includes game, reindeer and fish from Lapland together with mushroom and berries. The restaurant can seat a total of 120 guests on two floors. The private room Shaman has seats for 10 clients and the ground floor dining room can accommodate private parties of 50. The work of artists and craftsmen from Lapland features strongly in the design of the restaurant, both in the broad strokes of the space and in the detail.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 35 min (20 km)
item.matko:disabled: No Inva-WC. Toilets not possible to acces with wheelchair (ladies downstairs, gentlemen upstairs). Stairs to the 2nd floor, no lift.
item.matko:groups: The restaurant can seat a total of 120 guests on two floors. The private room Shaman has seats for 10 clients and the ground floor dining room can accommodate private parties of between 30 and 50. Lunch and dinner can be arranged for groups, private parties, meetings, cocktail parties.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Lappish & Finnish restaurant, 120 seats in 2 floors; downstairs dining room for 50 persons, upstairs for 60 persons and the private room Shaman for 10 persons, à la carte, dinners, lunches for groups, private parties, meetings, cocktail parties, food prepared using only Finnish ingredients.

item.title: Lapponia Jewelry
item.description: Founded in Finland in 1960, Lapponia Jewelry has always followed its bold intuition. Björn Weckström, who designed the first collection, established a new sculpture-like jewelry, drawing his inspiration from the shape and matte surface of gold nuggets from Finnish Lapland. Lapponia's trademark, unique motifs and genuine design, was born. Today, Lapponia employs an international team of jewelry designers. Traditional Finnish jewelry manufacturer Kalevala Koru acquired Lapponia Jewelry in August 2005.

item.title: Lasikammari
item.description: Buys and sells Iittala glass since 50 years. Finnish glass and tableware for table settings
item.matko:location: In Kruununhaka
item.matko:open: Tue-Thu 12-17, Mon, Fri, Sat 12-14, at other times by appointment

item.title: Lasipalatsi Film and Media Centre
item.description: Functionalist building known as the Glass Palace was designed by architect Viljo Revell in the 30s. It was recently modernised and has housed a media centre.
item.matko:location: City centre
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs (1st floor), lift.
item.matko:services: Restaurants, cafées, shops. The library is open Mon-Thu 10-22, Sat-Sun 12-18, tel. 09-3108 5000.

item.title: Lassila Ice Rink
item.description: Ice rink
item.matko:services: Café / Pohjois-Haagan Urheilijat, tel. +2358 (0)9 562 2288

item.title: Laterna Magica
item.description: Gallery
item.matko:services: Second-hand bookshop , book gallery.

item.title: LeBonk
item.description: LeBonk is a club that spans three floors, plus Helsinki's most fashionable roof terrace. The interior of this designer nightclub was created by the artist Alvar Gullichsen - best known for his Bonk Art, which is displayed on two floors of the club.

item.title: Leisure World Flamingo
item.description: Flamingo Leisure World is located in Vantaa, right next to the Helsinki Airport. All indoor attractions are open every day around the year. At Flamingo, you will find Flamingo Spa, the 309-room Sokos Hotel Flamingo, restaurants, shops and a variety of leisure activities and wellness services (eg. Finnkino multiplex cinema, West Coast glow-in-the-dark minigolf, BowlCircus bowling alley, an adventure park for kids).
item.matko:location: Flamingo Leisure World is located in Vantaa, right next to the capital Helsinki and Helsinki Airport.
item.matko:open: Open every day, all year round.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible toilets and lifts.
item.matko:services: Hotel, waterpark, spa, cinema, bowling alley, glow in the dark minigolf, adventure park, night club, restaurants, shops, parking for 800 cars.

item.title: Lepakkomies
item.description: Rock Club

item.title: Levykauppa Äx
item.description: Record store with the largest selection in town. Occasionally also live gigs.

item.title: Liberty Or Death
item.description: Liberty Or Death is an innovative cocktail bar. In the bar you can enjoy high quality beverage products and more personalized service. Monthly changing cocktail menu includes twisted classics and new trends from around the world.
item.matko:location: Helsinki's Design District.

item.title: Library 10
item.description: Located at the Main Post Office, the library combines services of the Pasila Music Station and the Cable Book Library. The library has the most diverse music collection in Helsinki. The Library 10 offers also many new services for varied work. At the Studio premises you can even make your own music video or play library's instruments. Wireless network and accessories on loan such as scanners and headphones enable a customer to build a workplace according to his lights. The stage functions as a stage for culture performances for bands and as well as for other performers. Lending and returning material is carried out by automatons.
item.matko:address: Elielinaukio 2 G, Main Post Office Building
item.matko:location: Entrance: the wing situated on the Railway Station side, 2nd floor

item.title: Liike
item.description: Liike presents collections from Finnish designers and offers them sales facilities. Featuring currently i.a. vainio.seitsonen, Tikit, Jaana Haaksiluoto, Tyra Therman and Nomen Nescio. Accessories, shoes and other interesting design from new designers.

item.title: Limbo
item.description: Limbo boutique is every girl's paradise offering the hottest dresses around and a large selection of funky jewellery and accessories from several Finnish artists. A new Limbo collection for petite dogs also now available!

item.title: Linnanmäki Amusement Park
item.description: Linnanmäki has entertained families since 1950. The amusement park has an enormous selection of fun rides, from ultra scary to more easy-going. The special wooden rollercoaster is over 50-years-old and remains the most popular ride. Linnanmäki also has many arcade halls with the latest games as well as an outdoor stage presenting entertaining performances. Supporting child welfare workover 60 years.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:open: Summer season is from end of April to September. Opening hours vary, please check in advance www.linnanmaki.fi
item.matko:admission: Free entrance. Some rides for small children free of charge (NB!height-based restrictions); other attractions with all-day-wristbands or single tickets, prices vary. Please see:www.linnanmaki.fi
item.matko:disabled: Relatively hindrance-free movement nearly everywhere in the park, an assistant is necessary due to the hilly terrain, motion handikapped persons have been given attention in the design of the restaurants, each of them has a toilet for wheelchair users inside or in the vicinity to use the amusement machines, an assistant is needed to lift, personnel assists if possible, assistants are permitted in the machines free of charge
item.matko:groups: Companies and groups, tel. +358 (0)10 5722 220 , e-mail:myyntipalvelu@linnanmaki.fi (Mon-Fri 9-16). Class trips, tel.+358 (0)10 5722 224, e-mail:luokkaretket@linnanmaki.fi
item.matko:services: Cafées, restaurants, kiosks, shops and parking for c. 300 cars.

item.title: Linnanmäki, Meeting premises
item.description: Linnanmäki offers premises for meetings, conferences and exhibitions all year round. The amusement park environment is a colourful setting for a memorable work day, for serious discussion and relaxed conversation alike. During breaks or to crown a fruitful meeting, participants can enjoy amusement park rides, games and delicacies. Linnanmäki can be reserved for private occasions, such as personnel or customer events for up to 7,000 people. The package includes the unique environment, amusement park rides, games, restaurants and other forms of entertainment. The Carnival of Light and Ice Pearl WinterFest bring fun and excitement into the peaks of autumn and winter.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Linnanmäki restaurants are always available upon order. They offer high-quality catering for meetings, breakfast, light snacks, rich buffet meals, dinners, cocktail events and coffee servings.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Every amusement park visitor helps children. The Children's Day Foundation collects funds for child welfare work, and maintains and develops the Linnanmäki amusement park.

item.title: Lokal
item.description: 72 % Art 28 % Coffee - a new concept by Katja Hagelstam, which combines a gallery space and a coffee corner in a small home-like environment. The exhibitions change every month and focus on Finnish contemporary art and design. We will also have a small carefully selected selection of products we like, both old and new.

item.title: London Pub
item.description: Pub
item.matko:services: Live music, jam session every Monday

item.title: Long Wall
item.description: Chinese restaurant.

item.title: Luckan
item.description: Information Centre
item.matko:services: Exhibitions, films

item.title: Lume Media Centre, University of Art and Design Helsinki
item.description: Lume is the audio-visual R&D centre of the University of Art and Design Helsinki. Its premises are available for seminars, conferences, meetings, galas, festivals, performances and trade fairs. Lume also serves as a venue for film, TV, new media and theatre productions, all under the same roof. Material filmed in the studios can be edited and mixed and the premiere celebrated in the Sampo Hall, which is also a full-sized cinema.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Catering possible in the upper foyer; seated dinners for 60, buffets for 400. Free catering, no license for spirits.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Gallery space: 185 m2, 37 metres x 5 metres, height 5.3 metres
item.matko:additionalinfo: TV-studio (tv equipment, 4 cameras), film studio (500 m2, includes lifting equipment). Stage, film and tv studio, plus exhibition space (height 11 metres) can be combined. Total space 1346 m2 for around 1500 people.

item.title: Lumi Supermarket - Flagship boutique
item.description: The renowned Finnish designer handbag brand Lumi Accessories offers handbags and accessories with Nordic simplicity and functionality.

item.title: Luomupuoti Satumarja
item.description: Organic foodstuffs - vegetables, fruits, juices, dried fruits etc.

item.title: Luukki Recreation Area
item.description: The heart of Luukki, which is one of the most popular outdoor recreation areas in the Helsinki region, is an old manor. The area includes 20 hectares of forest inhabited by flying squirrels. Helsinki purchased Luukki in 1961. The area covers over 900 hectares.
item.matko:location: Bus number 345 from Elielinaukio.
item.matko:services: Parking lots, information boards, café, caravan area, camping sites, cooking shelters, bathing sites, playground, ball field, golf, outdoor recreation routes, fishing

item.title: Lähetyskirkko, The Finnish Evangelical Lutheran Mission
Lääkärikeskus asema40
item.description: Private clinic

item.title: m/aux Kathrina
item.description: Kathrina is an old wooden vessel built in 1949 that can be chartered for cruises in Helsinki 3.9.-16.9.2013.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Main Guard Post
item.description: The Main Guard Post was designed by C.L. Engel and it was completed in 1843. Its functions included guarding the Imperial Palace, now the Presidential Palace. Nowadays it is used by the Helsinki garnison.

item.title: Malmitalo
item.description: Malmitalo is the cultural centre for the northern parts of Helsinki. Completed in 1994 it offers events, theatre presentations, concerts, exhibitions and films for children and adults. The building also has conference facilities for hire.
item.matko:location: City centre 13 km, airport 11 km. In Malmi, local trains K or I to Malmi
item.matko:additionalinfo: More information: http://kulttuuri.hel.fi/malmitalo
item.matko:services: Library, Ticket Sales Point by Lippupalvelu

item.title: Manala/Botta
item.description: Restaurant, disco and bar popular among eg. students. Finnish home cooking style food until closing time. On Fridays and Saturdays it is party time: four floors, five bars and two dance floors. St.Urho's Pub is an oasis for beerlovers.
item.matko:open: Manala:Mon-Fri 11-04, Sat-Sun 14-04. Lunch Mon-Fri 11-14. Botta: Fri-Sat 23-04. Age limit 22years. St.Urho's Pub: Sun-Tue 15-01, Wed-Sat 15-03

item.title: Mange sud
item.description: Restaurant Mange sud, 'eat the South', is a new Mediterranean restaurant in Helsinki.

item.title: Mann´s street
item.description: Gaybar. Karaoke Mon-Sun from 20.00 onwards. Dancing every first Saturday of the month.

item.title: Mannerheim Museum
item.description: Mannerheim Museum is the home of Baron G. Mannerheim, Marshal of Finland. The museum shows his medals and decorations, uniforms and documents that relate events from his life and from the contemporary Finnish history. Guided tour incl. in entrance fee during opening hours (last tour at 15.00).
item.matko:location: In Kaivopuisto, trams 3T/3B
item.matko:admission: Adults 10€, students and pensioners 8€, children under 12 years free of charge. Guided tour is included to the price. Tours are normally arranged as visitors arrive (last tour at 15 at latest).
item.matko:disabled: Difficult for wheelchairs (thresholds, exhibits on two floors), no lift, assistant needed, please notify in advance.
item.matko:groups: Guides are recommended to be booked in advance for groups as well as for groups or private individuals, who wish to begin a tour at a specific time. The maximum size of a group is 60 persons. Guide bookings tel. +358 (0)9 635 443. Guided tours available in Finnish, Swedish, English and by appointment in German, French, Spanish and Russian.
item.matko:services: Small museum shop, books, cards and posters for sale. Parking outside the Museum.

item.title: Maranello
item.description: Maranello Men & Women - D&G, Rock & Republic, Caramelo, Guess, Replay, Seven Jeans, True Religion, Super Dry.

item.title: Marian Helmi
item.description: Popular beer restaurant -bar especially among university students with large selection of Finnish and foreign beers and ciders.

item.title: Marimekko
item.description: Marimekko Corporation is a leading Finnish textile and clothing design company that was established in 1951. The company designs, manufactures and markets high-quality clothing, interior decoration textiles, tableware, bags and other accessories under the Marimekko brand, both in Finland and abroad
item.matko:services: Shops also at several shopping centres, e.g. Kamppi Centre. Factory outlets: Hakaniemi Market Hall, tel.+358-(0)9-753 6549 & Kirvesmiehenkatu 7 (in Herttoniemi), tel. +358 (0)9 758 7244 (open Mon-Fri 10-18, Sat 10-16).

item.title: Marimekko outlet
item.description: Design clothes and textiles. Also a small outlet shop at the Hakaniemi Market Hall in Helsinki city centre.

item.title: Market Square
item.description: The Market Square is Helsinki's most international and famous market. The booths here sell traditional market foods and treats, as well as handicrafts and souvenirs. There is also a heated café tent where you can comfortably sip steaming hot coffee even on the coldest days in winter.
item.matko:phone: +358 (0)9 3107 1390/market square warden, (0)9 3104 0377/Real Estate dept., Premises Centre
item.matko:location: Located on the South Harbour at the end of the Esplanade Park.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 6.30-18, Sat 6.30-16, during summer also Sun 10-17.

item.title: Marski Bar & Restaurant
item.description: Marski Bar & Restaurant, a Mediterranian style restaurant and bar, are situated in the centre of Helsinki. The renewed street level bar, Streetbar, is a perfect meeting point to easily drop in and relax after shopping or a busy day at the work, or meet some friends in the late evening.
item.matko:open: Restaurant: Mon-Fri 11-14, 18-23:30, Sat 18-23:30, Sun closed. Bar: Mon-Thu 15-00.30, Fri-Sat 15-01.30, Sun 18-23.30.
item.matko:groups: Also for groups

item.title: Marttiini
item.description: Marttiini is the most famous knife manufacturer in Finland. Marttiini's product selection consists of all kinds of knives for home and outdoor use. Marttiini is known for high quality, and their Lappish knives are also very popular gift items.

item.title: Maxim
item.description: Movie theatre

item.title: Maya Bar & Grill
item.description: Maya Bar & Grill is the place to go for modern Latin American cuisine. The restaurant is located in downtown next to National Theatre and the Central railway station. Maya Bar & grill´s delicious menu items include salads, tortizas, fajitas, steaks and vegetarian food. Try the Minidillas as starters!

item.title: mbar
item.description: Internet café with dj's and live-acts in the evenings (Wed & Fri) and on weekends.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 9-24, Wed-Thu 9-02, Fri-Sat 9-03, Sun 12-24 (mbar summer terrace open daily until -02 (weather permitting).

item.title: Megazone Laser Game
item.description: Experience an indoor adventure that calls for wits and agility in a labyrinth filled with fog and heart-pounding, rythmic music. Blinking lights, ear pearcing sounds and red laser beams cutting through the dence atmosphere create an exciting sci-fi like enviroment. For an adrenaline pumping experience reserve spots in a open round or book a private game. The lasergame is suitable for the whole family. The staff gives instructions when needed (languages: English, Finnish and Swedish). It is also possible to play console games and Human Table Football.
item.matko:location: In the old Pitäjänmäki shopping centre
item.matko:admission: Open rounds 8€/person (25 min) Possible reservations by phone or e-mail.
item.matko:disabled: No access with wheelchairs.

item.title: Meilahti Church
item.description: Meilahti Church was designed in 1954 by architect Markus Tavio. The lamps, altar candelabras and the font was designed by Paavo Tynell and the communion utensils by Birger Gardberg. The swedish speaking parish, St. Thomas, is located in the same property.

item.title: Mekkomania
item.description: Vintage clothes and accessories.

item.title: Memphis Hesari
item.description: Memphis is a relaxed bar and restaurant. A meetingpoint for friends, a place to relax, dine and listen to music or to spend the whole evening.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 11-24, Wed-Thu 11-01, Fri 11-04, Sat 12-04, Sun 13-04 (Kitchen open daily until 23.30).

item.title: Mereija
item.description: Green clothing and sewing services. Repairs, modifications and tuning of old clothes.
item.matko:location: Opposite National Opera

item.title: Merimelojien maja
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Keittiö, mutta ei astioita
item.matko:additionalinfo: Majaa vuokrataan perjantaisin ja lauantaisin klo 08 - 02 välisenä aikana. Vuokrauksen hinnat internetsivuilla.

item.title: Messukeskus, Expo & Convention Centre Helsinki
item.description: Messukeskus is one of the leading congress centres in Northern Europe and the largest of its kind in Finland. It is a high-quality, centrally located conference venue, where all of Finland's major conferences and similar events take place. The centre offers 53 fully adaptable meeting rooms and seminar halls, of various sizes, as well as plenty of high-quality exhibition facilities. A hotel with 244 rooms is conveniently located under the same roof.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, parking for disabled near the eastern and northern entrances, easier entry Eastern entrance, no permanent induction loop but can be installed if desired by the customer.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Holiday Inn Helsinki adjacent
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Terra Nova á la carte restaurant: 80 seats. Combination of Winter Garden cabinet, Buffet Restaurant and Restaurant Piazza is ideal for dinner and cocktail receptions for up to 1000 participants. Numerous restaurants and cafes are open during fairs and events. Large, versatile banqueting facilities.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo:
7 exhibition halls, gross exhibition area 58 000 m2. Congress wing halls and foyers also suitable for exhibitions.
Hall 3 can be divided into 7 meeting rooms a-g (250-350 pax/room). Hall 5 can be divided into 6 separate halls, three of them can be used at the same time, halls a-f 750-1000pax/hall. Hall 6 can be divided into 4 sections a-d (a: 4498m2, b: 4752m2, c: 3654m2, d: 4240m2).
item.matko:additionalinfo:
*Hall can be divided into 3 sections **Hall can be divided into 2 sections
Either halls 5A-5C or 5E-5F can be used at the same time
Hotel accommodation, restaurant services, AV-services, cleaning services, forwarding services, stand planning and construction services, parking for 4 600 cars.

item.title: Metropolia Ammattikorkeakoulu, Hämeentie
item.description: Theatre performances
item.matko:location: tram 6

item.title: Metropolia University of Applied Sciences, Helsinki Conservatory
item.description: konserttisali

item.title: Michelle
item.description: Michelle Bar & Bistro is a comfortable, french restaurant on Mikonkatu. Michelle's heart and core is a big bar, which attracts to relax after work. Michelle Bar & Bistro serves delicious french-styled bistro food. Daily changing lunchmeals or a lunch buffet is served from 11.30 am to 2.00 pm. During the summers, in front of the restaurant, on the promenade of Mikonkatu, is the Michelle Terrace which serves customers from lunch time to dusk.
item.matko:open: Upstairs: Mon 11-23, Tue-Fri 11-24, Sat 16-24. Downstairs Mon 11-23, Tue 11-24, Wed-Thu 11-01, Fri 11-02, Sat 13-02.

item.title: Mikebon Shop Helsinki
item.description: Large selection of high quality souvenirs.
item.matko:location: The shop is located on ground level in the gateway from Kamppi Shopping centre to Forum Shopping centre. Access also from Narinkkatori.

item.title: Military Museum
item.description: From Hakkapeliittas to peacekeepers-exhibition tells basic facts and interesting details about Finland's military history. Weapons, uniforms, equipment, medals and badges of honour, flags and war-themed art from various times on display.
item.matko:admission: Adults 5€, students and pensioners 3€, children under 7years and war veterans free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: Suitable for wheelchairs, at the entrance assistance is needed
item.matko:groups: Guided tours should be booked in advance
item.matko:services: Picture collection.
item.matko:ingress: The museum displays military equipment: weapons, colours, decorations, arms and uniforms.

item.title: Military Museum's Manege
item.description: The exhibition From autonomy to Atalanta-an exhibition on Finnish military history on the Military Museum´s Manege presents the history of Finland's defence forces and Finnish soldiers as well as wars involving Finland from the 17th century to the present day.
item.matko:location: Suomenlinna Fortress, by ferry from the Market Square about 15 min
item.matko:admission: Adults 5€, children (7-17 yrs), students and pensioners 3€, under 7 yrs free entry.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed. Inva-WC.

item.title: Milliklubi
item.description: A new night club in the city centre, opposite of the Railwaystation. For each night there is something going on, from club nights to live music. On request the nightclub also offers party packages to small groups (6-10 persons).
item.matko:additionalinfo: Yksityistilasuuksia varten tiloja on kolme:Bank, Millionaires Disco ja Vegas. Bank käsittää noin 80 asiakaspaikkaa ja on suosittu tila pienemmissä yksityistilaisuuksissa. Bankista löytyy pieni stage. Istumapaikkoja on reilusti. Isompi tila Millioniares Disco palvelee tanssi-, biletys- ja seurustelutilana, siihen voi tarpeen mukaan rakentaa buffet- ja viinipöydät. Myös Millionaires Discosta löytyy pieni stage. Vegas palvelee peli- ja yleisenä seurustelutilana. Peleistä meiltä löytyvät ruletti ja Black Jack sekä lukuisia peliautomaatteja. Tilavuokrat on asetettu asiakasmäärien ja tilaisuuksien pituuden mukaan. Isoin ryhmäkoko on 315 henkilöä. Ruokatuotantoyhteistyökumppaneita on lukuisia, niiden mm. ravintola Seurahuone ja Delicatessen

item.title: Minna Parikka Concept Boutique
item.description: Minna Parikka's new concept boutique on Aleksanterinkatu offers feminine design shoes and bags.

item.title: Miun Shop
item.description: Miun is a small family owned company that produces all its products in Finland. The designs in the Miun women's clothing collection are clean and clear with a romantic touch.

item.title: Molly Malone's Irish Bar
item.description: Selected as one of the top 50 Irish Pubs in Europe, Molly Malone's Irish Bar offers its customers, with the strength of two floors, three bars and a competent bar staff together a genuine and happy Irish atmosphere right in the heart of Helsinki. Molly's has also Irish live music every night.

item.title: Moomin Shop
item.description: All items related to Tove Jansson's beloved Moomins
item.matko:location: Kämp galleria

item.title: MPH Fashion Outlet City
item.description: MPH Fashion Outlet City presents a great variety of brands such as Guess, Guess by Marciano, Nike, Colmar and Calvin Klein. Explore the world of fashion for men, women and children!
item.matko:location: Within only two minutes of walking distance from the Valimo railway station. Trains L and A from Helsinki to Valimo.
item.matko:services: Outlet has a separate playroom for kidds.

item.title: Munkkiniemi beach
item.matko:services: At the area: cabins, toilets, children's playground, showers, beach-volley ground, weightlifting area and kiosk

item.title: Muru Dining
item.description: Restaurant and wine bar, there ingredients for the food are seasonal, pure and simple. The four owners, professionals in their field, recommend, prepare and serve the food themselves.

item.title: Museum of Contemporary Art Kiasma
item.description: The Museum of Contemporary Art Kiasma breaks the boundaries of traditional art museums and follows the latest trends. The collections include Finnish and foreign art, particularly from the Nordic and Baltic countries and Russia from 1960s onwards. Special exhibitions and related happenings. The Kiasma Theatre's programme includes drama, dance, performance, music, multimedia, film and video art & seminars, lectures and public discussions. Kiasma is a part of the Finnish National Gallery.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:admission: Adults 10€, students and pensioners 8€, children under 18 years free of charge. On the first Friday of each month free entry at 17-20.30.
item.matko:disabled: Easy access with wheelchair, wheelchairs available. Inva-WC and lift, 2 Inva parking lots.
item.matko:groups: Guidebooking, tel. +358 (0)9 1733 6509 (Tue-Fri 9-12). Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English, Russian & Italian. Also theme guided tours.
item.matko:services: Kiasma Museum Store, tel+358 (0)9 1733 6505 and Café Kiasma, tel+358 (0)45-878 7186, café and restaurant with approx.80 seats, summer terrace, catering service, lunch (also for groups, when pre-booked). Opening hours same as museum. Kiasma Theatre tel+358 (0)9 1733 6501, workshops tel+358 (0)9 1733 6668.
item.matko:ingress: Kiasma is a part of the Finnish National Gallery.

item.title: Museum of Cultures
item.description: The Museum of Cultures studies and represents the peoples and cultures of the world and records their cultural heritage. The emphasis of the collecting and research activities is documenting present-day cultural phenomena.
item.matko:open: Tue- Sun 11-18 NB! Museum of Cultures will be open until 19.5.2013, after which it will move to the National Museum's premises during 2013.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair. Inva-WC and lift. Help by personnel when needed.
item.matko:groups: Guidebookings tel: +358 (0)9 4050 9809
item.matko:services: In the same building:Tennispalatsi art museum, shops, cafés and restaurants and Finnkino cinema

item.title: Museum of Finnish Architecture
item.description: The Museum of Finnish Architecture offers rich new perspectives, discussion openers and meaningful experiences of architecture. Our mission is to activate a personal connection with the built environment and provide tools for understanding architecture. The museum offers Finnish and international tourig exhibitions and a permanent exhibition on 19th Century Finnish Architecture. A bookshop, specialized public library and collections are also at your service. The museum organizes a great variety of events including visiting lectures, guided tours, architecture walks and workshops. Guided tours from tel. (09) 8567 5100. The museum has two locations in Helsinki, a neo-renaissance building in the inner-city Design District of Kaartinkaupunki and a wooden villa in Kaivopuisto.
item.matko:location: City centre 0.5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:admission: Adults 6€, students and pensioners 3€, children under 18 years free of charge. Free entrance the 1st Friday of the month..
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair according to exhibition. Notify in advance, entrance from the back of the building from where it is possible to take a lift to the exhibitions. No Inva-WC, but an ordinary, spacious toilet.
item.matko:groups: Free entrance for schoolgroups with teatcher. Guide booking for groups tel. +358-(0)9 8567 5100.
item.matko:services: Library, archives and a bookshop.

item.title: Museum of Natural History
item.description: The Finnish Museum of Natural History's exhibitions show the diversity of nature. The exhibition that tells about the Finnish nature takes the visitor from the summery archipelago to the wintry Lapland with its mountains. The "History of Life" exhibition presents the course of the evolution from the Big Bang to dinosaurs and larger mammals of the Ice Age. Through the exhibition "World Nature" the visitor is taken on an exploration excursion that begins from the polar areas and ends in the tropical warmth. The secrets of the bones are introduced in the exhibition "Story of the Bones". Different theme events and visiting exhibitions are a part of the museum's activity.
item.matko:open: September-May Tue-Wed & Fri 9-16, Thu 9-18, Sat-Sun 10-16. June-August Tue-Sun 10-17.
item.matko:admission: Adults 10€, students, pensioners and children 7-17 years 5€. Free entrance on every months first Thursday at 16-18 (in summer 15-17).
item.matko:disabled: Access possible with wheelchair, Inva-WC and lift. Upon arrival with wheelchair, please inform the museum in advance (tel.+358 (0)9 191 28800). Accessible entrance is in the court yard
item.matko:groups: Guide bookings tel. +358 (0)9 1912 8855 Tue-Fri 9-11, or by e-mail opastukset@luomus.fi.
item.matko:services: Museum shop and café

item.title: Museum of Technology
item.description: Museum of Technology presents the history of technology and industry in Finland from the late 19th century to the present day. It shows the history of various branches of industry (metal, chemical, wood-processing, mining, building) communications, computer technology, domestic appliances and electric power technology, printing and surveying. The numerous permanent and special exhibitions are held in a delightful old industrial milieu on a beautiful stretch of river.
item.matko:location: City centre 6 km, airport 18 km
item.matko:admission: 2013: Adults 6€, pensioners 5€, students 2€, children (7-17 years) 1€, children under 7 yrs free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair, lift and Inva-WC, assistant needed.
item.matko:groups: Entrance fee for groups (min.10pers.) 4€/person. Guidebooking Riina Linna, tel +358 (0)9 7288 4422, riina.linna@tekniikanmuseo.fi.
item.matko:services: Museum shop, auditorium. In museum area also a café restaurant. Combined ticket with Power Station Museum 8€/adults

item.title: Music Hunter
item.description: Record store specialized in music collectibles, also cd´s, vinyls, music books, notes etc.

item.title: Music Theatre Bolero
item.description: Music Theatre Bolero presents dance and theatre performances for culture enthusiasts.

item.title: Music Theatre Kapsäkki, restaurant Allotria
item.description: Theatre performances, concerts

item.title: Mustasaari
item.description: Mustasaari, owned by the Helsinki Parish Union, is open for all during the opening hours in summer season. Beach, café, playground for children etc..
item.matko:location: Boat connection from Taivallahti Pier: Adults 4€, children under 10 yrs free of charge. Timetable: www.jt-line.fi
item.matko:open: Mustasaari is open Tue-Sun in June-August (2.6.-23.8.09).
item.matko:groups: Groups are asked to announce their arrival in advance.
item.matko:ingress: Beach, café, playground for children etc..

item.title: Mustikkamaa beach
item.matko:services: Toilet, showers, volleyball ground and weightlifting area

item.title: Muu gallery
item.description: The exhibition profile of the international contemporary art gallery MUU includes installations, video art, as well as shows of traditional art forms. Besides exhibitions, MUU also arranges performances, concerts, discussion forums, video presentations, workshops as well as lectures by visiting artists and curators.

item.title: My o My
item.description: Fashion. Sweets. Design. Art. My o My is an award-winning concept store group for women and men. The selection includes premium hand-picked fashion and design brands around the world including e.g. See by Chloé, Phillip Lim, Raf Simons and Viktor & Rolf.

item.title: Myllypuro Ice Hall
item.matko:location: Metro to Itäkeskus, from where bus 92
item.matko:open: Ice skating winter 2012-2013: on Thursdays 13:00-14:30, without hockey sticks.

item.title: Myllypuro Tennis Centre
item.matko:location: In Myllypuro, metro connection from the city centre

item.title: Mäkelänrinne Swimming Hall
item.description: Swimming hall with eg.50 metre swimming pool, diving pool, 10 m diving boards, children's pool (water +32C), teaching pool, cold-water pools, solarium, massage (advance booking needed).
item.matko:admission: Adults 6,20€, children (7-16v.) and pensioners 3,20€/person, children under 7years free.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC.
item.matko:services: Private saunas, conference facilities and solarium. Café Uppopulla, open as swimming hall.

item.title: Nalle Pub
item.description: Gay bar

item.title: Namaskaar
item.description: The oldest Indian restaurant in Helsinki, also dishes from Bangladesh. A la carte and evening buffet. 108 seats. There is another Namaskaar restaurant at Bulevardi 6. Namaskaar has also got several Namaskaar Express restaurants in the city centre (eg. at Aleksanterinkatu 36, Forum shopping centre and Kaisaniemi metro station.

item.title: Nanking
item.description: Chinese restaurant

item.title: Nanso
item.description: Known for their comfortable and true reliability, high quality and strong design, Nanso's collections feature all the elements of tomorrow's favourite clothes. They exemplify your casual elegance and sense of everyday beauty. The Lempivaate collection is all about comfort.

item.title: Napa-galleria
item.description: Napa Books has been publishing art books, graphic novels and flipbooks since 1997. In 2007 Napa Gallery & Shop opened in the heart of Helsinki. The gallery presents contemporary art exhibitions from illustration and photography to graffiti. We also offer rare art books and magazines by independent publishers from around the world.

item.title: Narinkka-market
item.matko:address: In front of Kamppi shopping Mall

item.title: Nasta
item.description: Funny objects, clothes and shoes from the past decades.

item.title: National Museum of Finland
item.description: The National Museum of Finland illustrates Finnish history from prehistoric times to the present day. Major archaeological finds, the historical, numismatic and ethnological collections have been put together for over 170years. Workshop Vintti on the third floor is an interactive exhibition especially designed for children, where visitors can study the history of Finland and its culture using their hands and heads. VINTTI is suited to everyone over the age of seven. Younger children can visit in the company of adults. There is no upper age limit. Temporary exhibitions.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:admission: Adults 8€, students and pensioners 6€, children under 18 years free of charge. Free entrance on Fridays 16-18
item.matko:disabled: Accessible entrance on Mannerheimintie street. Lift to all exhibitions, electrical doors. An induction loop in the auditorium. Magnifying glasses, wheelchairs and rolling walking aids to lent. Guide and assistance dogs are welcome. Toilet for disabled. A part of the exhibitions are dimly lighted due to technical reasons.
item.matko:groups: Guide booking tel.+358 (0)40 1597 679 (Tue-Fri 9-12). Languages Finnish, Swedish, English, German, French, Russian. Group size max. 30pers., schoolgroups max. 25 pers. and kindergarten groups max. 15pers.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The cafe-restaurant seats 50 and in the summer months there is an outdoor café for 50 persons. Food and refreshments for the auditorium are served in the adjacent lobby.
item.matko:additionalinfo:
In addition to its museum and exhibition activities, the National Museum of Finland has high-standard facilities for arranging various kinds of functions, such as conferences, seminars and media launches in its spacious and wellequipped auditorium. Situated on the ground floor of the museum, the auditorium seats 212. There is separate access from street level to the conference facilities.
Functions and conferences can be combined with a visit to the museum's permanent or temporary exhibitions. Guided tours by request.
item.matko:services: Café (tel.+358 (0)9 4050 9530, open Tue-Sun 11-17, approx. 50 seats, a terrace in summer, lunch Tue-Fri 11-14. Museum shop, information centre. Auditorium (212 seats).
item.matko:ingress: Finnish history from prehistoric times to the present day.

item.title: National Pensions Institute
item.description: Building planned by Alvar Aalto in 1953-57.

item.title: New Bamboo Center
item.description: New Bamboo Center is Asian restaurant specialised on curries. Cheap prices.
item.matko:location: Next to Kamppi Centre

item.title: Next Hotel Rivoli Jardin
item.description: Rivoli Jardin is located at the very heart of Helsinki, just a stone's throw from the Esplanade Park, and the most beautiful shopping and walking streets. Design District Helsinki, as well as the best restaurants, are within walking distance. The hotel has wireless Internet access and all rooms are individually air-conditioned.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 6 cm) along the path, essential access, lift; essential for access, easy access for blind or partially sighted, one disabled suite, steep hill to the inner yard where the hotel is situated
item.matko:groups: Small groups, max 30 persons.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 8 single, 46 double rooms and one suite. Apartments 31-69 sqm.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Breakfast room and bar.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Small meeting room for 8 persons
item.matko:additionalinfo: Business office with PC, printer and internet access, sauna
item.matko:services: Lobby bar, breakfast room, sauna, meeting room ( max. 8 persons), gym.

item.title: Nightclub Tähti
item.description: At Nightclub Tähti ("star") it is possible to listen to stars of the Finnish music industry. Karaoke bar "Iskelmä Baari" offers a large selection of songs and a great atmosphere.
item.matko:open: Nightclub Tähti: Fri 21-04, Sat 21-04. Iskelmä baari: Fri 21-04, Sat 21-04. Age limit 20years.

item.title: Nina's
item.description: Nina's boutique offers a beautiful collection of designer shoes and bags as well as ready to wear. Brands include Christian Louboutin, Céline, Marc by Marc Jacobs , Dries van Noten, Repetto, Carven, Chloé, Notify and Jamin Puech.

item.title: Nokia
item.description: Nokia's flagship store.

item.title: Nordea Bank
item.description: Building planned by Alvar Aalto in 1960-65.

item.title: Nordea Bank Museum
item.description: Nordea Bank Museum traces the history of Finnish banking from 1862 onwards in a bank interior designed by architects Gesellius, Lindgren and Saarinen at the beginning of the 20th century. Note and coin collection.
item.matko:open: Open on the first Thursday of every month at 15-17. Closed in July.

item.title: Norisushi Bar
item.description: The small popular sushi-bar is situated in the Old Market Hall.

item.title: Nosturi
item.description: Nosturi is a versatile live music venue located close to downtown Helsinki, operated by the Live Music Association (ELMU ry). Nosturi takes pride in providing a platform for a broad spectrum of culturally relevant events such as concerts, raves, youth discos, theater and art gallery functions from all walks of life - everything from unknown underground bands to the largest mainstream acts.

item.title: NUDGE
item.description: Nudge offers stylish and ecofriendly clothes and accessories for women, men and children. Our selection includes ecological products for interior decoration and biosertified natural cosmetics.
item.matko:location: City Centre

item.title: Nuuksio National Park
item.description: Go to Nuuksio to enjoy the quiet of the wilderness. Walk along the duckboards and paths, roam and ramble, ski along the tracks or work your way through the unbeaten snow, pick berries or gather mushrooms, fry sausages and make a pot of coffee on a camp fire, take a swim or do some fishing. Ease off for a while, come on your own or with a group, enjoy the sounds and smells of the wild. Wonder and revive yourself!
item.matko:location: Bussi number 85(A) from the center of Espoo.

item.title: O-Gallery
item.description: Art gallery

item.title: O'Malley's
item.description: O'Malley's Irish Bar started in 1981 as the first Irish bar in Finland. There is a jam session at the bar every week. Live gigs every now and then from traditional Irish music to mainstream pop.

item.title: Olaus Petri Church
item.description: Olaus Petri church was founded in 1932. The architect is Ture Rydberg.

item.title: Old Church
item.description: The Old Church (by C.L. Engel) was built in 1826 and was the first Lutheran church to be built after Helsinki became the Finnish capital. In the park are graves and memorials to Finnish and German soldiers who died in the Civil War of 1918.
item.matko:disabled: Entrance from Lönnrotinkatu side, via door marked with a wheelchair sign.
item.matko:services: Organ music on Tue at 12noon.

item.title: Old Market Hall
item.description: The Old Market Hall alongside the Market Square has been a meeting place for Helsinki's food aficionados and a popular tourist attraction since it first opened in 1889. In addition to traditional treats, you can also find Japanese sushi and delicacies from Lapland.
item.matko:open: The Old Market Square is closed for renovation from 31.1.2013 and is expected to be re-opened in summer 2014

item.title: Old Student House
item.description: The Old Student House has been one of the main scenes of events in the city since 1870 but has nevertheless moved with the times. Superb location on about the most central site in Helsinki, magnificent and varied premises available for all kinds of events: galas, conferences, briefing sessions, seminars and receptions.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, steep ramp in path essential for access - gradient over 16%, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, door opening 63 cm, toilet for wheelchair users in the restaurant kitchen, can be used when the kitchen is open, no access with wheelchair to the second floor of the building, easier entry from the patio
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Main hall 480 m2, upper floor total 170 m2
item.matko:additionalinfo: Caters for all kinds of special occasions on the turnkey principle, wide range of AV equipment, own sound and lighting, including design

item.title: Olofsborg
item.description: One of the most loved Jugend -style buildings in Helsinki. The second runner-up of public vote for the most beautiful jugend -style building in Helsinki organized by Helsingin Sanomat in 2007. Architects were the famous trio Herman Gesellius, Armas Lindgren & Eliel Saarinen. The towers of the building are inspired by the Olavinlinna Castle. Completed in 1903.
item.matko:ingress: One of the most loved Jugend -style buildings in Helsinki.

item.title: Olympic Stadium
item.description: The Olympic Stadion, built in 1938 was designed in functionalistic style by the architects Yrjö Lindegren and Toivo Jäntti. The Olympic Games were held in 1952 in Helsinki. Today the Olympic Stadium hosts both national and international sporting events and concerts.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 16 km
item.matko:open: Stadium Tower open Mon-Fri 9-21, Sat-Sun 9-18. Note please! The tower is closed during competitions and events.
item.matko:admission: Entrance to the tower: Adults 5€, children 6-17years 2€, children under 6years free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: Access to a separate balcony with wheelchairs, inva WC. Cafeteria and inva WC in connection with the information point, easy access for partially sighted. No access to the tower with a wheelchair.
item.matko:groups: Entrance to the tower: group discount when over 10persons. Lunch for groups upon request, Sodexho, www.sodexho.fi/olympiastadion
item.matko:restaurantinfo: A restaurant for 100-250 persons
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Stadium Tower (72 meters high), panorama over the whole city. Stadion Hostel, rooms
item.matko:services: Eg. the Sportsmuseum of Finland (www.urheilumuseo.fi), Stadion Hostel (www.stadionhostel.fi), café-restaurant Olympia Bistro (open Mon-Fri 9-16, lunch served Mon-Fri 11-14, Sodexho, www.sodexho.fi/olympiastadion)
item.matko:ingress: National and international sporting events and concerts.

item.title: Ombrellino
item.description: Toys and interior decorations for nurserys, mainly international brands. Ombrellino was founded in 1978.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 10-19, Sat 10-17, during summer also Sun 12-17

item.title: Omena Hotel Yrjönkatu
item.description:
Omena Hotel Yrjönkatu is located in the center of Helsinki on the corner of Eerikinkatu and Yrjönkatu close to Forum Shopping Centre. All the services you need are on the doorstep from shops and department stores to restaurants, bars and clubs.
Across the road from the hotel at Mannerheimintie 20, Cafe Picnic Forum serves breakfast to Omena Hotel guests for EUR 5.90 per person. Breakfast includes a roll juice, coffee/tea and yoghurt. Breakfast is served Mon-Fri 7.45 -10.00 Sat 10:00 - 12:00 (not on Sundays and public holidays).
item.matko:location: In the city centre, main railway station 300m, airport 20 km
item.matko:services: The hotel doesn't have its own parking. Car parks at the Forum shopping centre and at Stockmann are both within easy reach of the hotel.

item.title: Omenahotelli Eerikinkatu
item.description:
Helsinki's first Omena Hotel boasts a perfect location in the city center of Helsinki, only a couple of blocks from the major shopping centers Kamppi (www.kamppi.fi) and Forum (www.forum.fi). You can find numerous shops, restaurants, cafés, pubs, night clubs, etc in the immediate vicinity of the hotel.
Breakfasts is served in the hotel's partner's restaurant, Café Picnic, which is located on Fredrikinkatu 61 (close to the hotel building). The price is 5,50 eur/person. You can book and pay for the breakfasts (1-4 per room) in advance, but breakfast is also available for walk-in customers.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:groups: Group reservations +358 (0)20 7716555 (Mon-Fri 10-15) or info@omena.com.

item.title: Omenahotelli Lönnrotinkatu
item.description: Omena Hotel Lönnrotinkatu enjoys a prime location in the heart of the Finnish capital. All the services you need are on the doorstep from shops and department stores to restaurants, bars and clubs. Helsinki's famous Stockmann department store and the Kamppi and Forum shopping centres are all just a stone's throw away. Stylish and spacious, Omena rooms can comfortably accommodate four adults.
item.matko:location: in the centrum, to the airport 18 km.
item.matko:groups: groupreservations@omenahotels.com

item.title: On the Rocks
item.description: On the Rocks is a rock club in the city centre opposite of the Railwaystation for those who favour heavier music. A streetbar with free billiards. Live gigs most evenings, 5-7 times a week, in the cellar rock-club. Showtime starting from 22.30. Every other Wednesday Finnish stand-up comedy at 21.00.
item.matko:open: Wed-Sat 21-04, Sun-Tue 22-04, street bar & outdoor terrace 16-04 (summer time 12-04). Age limit 23years (except for Thursday evenings when the age limit is 20years).
item.matko:admission: Free entrance to the bar. Entrance fee for the rock club downstairs cost 4-15€, pre-bookings from Tiketti.

item.title: Opa outlet
item.description: Opa Muurikka manufactures eg. cooking ware for homes and for hiking. In the same building you'll find also other outlets, eg. the Arabia factory outlet
item.matko:location: tram nr.6 towards Arabia

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Albert
item.description: Original Sokos Hotel Albert is a cosy, relaxed hotel in a trendy residential area in downtown Helsinki. The hotel's warm-hearted atmosphere and caring staff bid guests a warm welcome to their living room in the Punavuori neighbourhood. Favoured by locals, the Papa Albert Restaurant and the Papa Albert Bar, specialising in Italian wines and specialty coffees, ensure customers enjoy their visit. In the vicinity of the hotel, Punavuori's Design District boasts a wide range of other restaurants, cafés and bars. Welcome to Albert - a hotel with personality!
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 35 min. Located in Helsinki Design District.
item.matko:disabled: 2 rooms for disabled, large elevator, washroom for disabled. Easy entrance to hotel and restaurant.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 95 non-smoking rooms of which 85 standard and 10 superior. 2 rooms for disabled.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Ristorante & Bar Papa Albert.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Restaurant cabinets for private occasions (max 18 persons).
item.matko:additionalinfo: Wireless broadband connection in all rooms. Guest sauna daily.
item.matko:services: Guest sauna and restaurant.

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Helsinki
item.description: Honest, easy-going and a favourite with staying power, Original Sokos Hotel Helsinki is located on the pulse of the city, between Ateneum Art Museum and Senate Square in the centre of the capital with its busy shopping area. All hotel rooms have a youthful Scandinavian theme. Its cosy Fransmanni and Memphis restaurants serve a versatile menu in a relaxed atmosphere. Customers can use the newly opened EasyFit gym, for a low-price charge. On the highest storey, above the rooftops of Helsinki, you'll find cosy sauna facilities for the enjoyment of business travellers and holidaymakers alike. You can't get any closer to the heart of Helsinki than this. Welcome!
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, steep ramp in path essential for access - gradient over 16%, lift; essential for access, the entrance is dangerous, the vestibule is dark and there are steps, the door blocks the ramp, persons who use wheelchair need assistance, disabled rooms
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 202 non-smoking rooms: 54 single rooms, 123 double rooms, 20 superior rooms, 5 suites (2 of these boast a sauna). 3 rooms for the disabled. All rooms refurbished in 2006-2007.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Cosy French-style restaurant with cabinet for 35 persons and summer terrace, trendy Memphis restaurant, night club Helsinki Club.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: 1 conference room with adjoining VIP sauna suite for max 12 persons.
item.matko:additionalinfo: All rooms feature a wireless internet connection. Laundry service, Europark Kluuvi garage.

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Pasila
item.description: The hospitable Original Sokos Hotel Pasila is situated right next to the action, close to he vicinity of Helsinki Exhibition and Convention Centre, Hartwall Arena, Linnanmäki Amusement Park and Helsinki's Central Park. Easily accessible, the hotel has good train, tram and bus connections, which makes it a favourite of exhibition, conference and sports event visitors. The hotel's versatile range of facilities includes accommodation, meeting and restaurant services and comfortable saunas. Welcome to easy-going Pasila!
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 16 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 178 non-smoking rooms: 53 single rooms, 100 double rooms, 19 superior rooms and 6 suites. One suite boasts a sauna. 63 family rooms and 2 rooms for the disabled.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Conference meals are buffets set in the conference and banquet restaurant Pasila. The restaurant is also available for private occasions, banquets and cocktail parties for up to 140 persons. Spanish-style restaurant Sevilla and a lobby bar
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: All conference rooms can be used as exhibition facilities: the room height is 2.9 m, except in suites 1 and 2, where it is 2.4 m. 100 sq.m coffee court/general resting area.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 2 saunas and 1 sauna lounge, parking.

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Presidentti
item.description: The Original Sokos Hotel Presidentti event house is located next to Kamppi Shopping Centre in the midst of Helsinki, surrounded by its culture events and versatile shopping opportunities. Presidentti serves you in every situation. The hotel offers many different kinds of conference and event facilities, also for larger occasions. Presidentti's Spanish-styled Sevilla Restaurant and its Adjutantti Pub ensure your enjoyment along with the Pressa Restaurant and its entertainment. Meetings, lodging, fine food and good fun - under one roof. It's nearly impossible not to enjoy yourself at Hotel Presidentti. Welcome!
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, but access with wheelchair to Restaurant from outside through the inner yard or through the kitchen, automatic slide door, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, inva rooms and toilet for wheelchair users also in the entrance hall.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 494 rooms: 47 single rooms, 408 double rooms, 34 superior rooms, 5 suites with a sauna. 423 rooms for non-smokers, also rooms for allergic persons and 4 rooms for the disabled available.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Conference and banquet restaurant Presidentti for up to 650 guests. Available for private occasions, banquets, cocktail parties, etc.; fixed video projector, sound reproduction system for speech, parquet floor for dancing. Spanish-style restaurant Sevilla and a lobby bar, Pub Adjutantti.
item.matko:services:
494 rooms (423 for non-smokers)
455 standard rooms (Scandinavian design, twin beds or a double bed, divan or swing chair, parquet floor)
34 superior rooms (standard room with flat screen TV, safe deposit box, electric kettle, bathrobe, and slippers)
5 suites (Standard suite: 78 m2, Scandinavian design, drawing room, bed alcove, dressing room, and sauna. President suite; 97 m2, stylish international design, drawing room, bedroom, dressing room, sauna, and hot tub, carpet floor)

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Tapiola Garden
item.description: Espoo's Tapiola Garden is the heart of Tapiola's continuously developing garden city. It has a tangible cosy character and friendliness. The hotel has good traffic connections and is located near a large shopping centre, a cultural centre and the WeeGee Exhibition Centre. The Spanish-style restaurant of this newly refurbished hotel as well as its spacious lobby bar/café adds to its openhearted atmosphere. Almost all the comfortable hotel rooms have a balcony. Fitness room, great outdoor possibilities, saunas, sauna cabinet and swimming pool offer easy relaxation after a busy day. It's easy to enjoy life here. Welcome!
item.matko:accomodationinfo:
Sevilla Bar & Restaurante is a Spanish-style restaurant with a relaxed ambiance serving a full menu featuring sangria, delicious tapas dishes and juicy steaks.
You can read newspapers and enjoy a wide selections of drinks in the cosy lobby bar. Coffee and snacks are served in the lobby's Coffee bar.

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Vaakuna Helsinki
item.description: The functionalist Vaakuna building, completed in 1952 for the Olympics, is situated in the best location in the city - at its very core. Its soundproof windows keep city noises out and ensure peaceful dreams. Rich with atmosphere, the Loiste Restaurant serves you from breakfast till late in the evening, with terraces boasting rooftop panoramas on Vaakuna's 10th floor. Original Sokos Hotel Vaakuna is a great place to spend a family holiday in Helsinki. Onni the Squirrel's playroom and a Sony Playstation gaming room in the summertime guarantee the enjoyment of both young and older children. A Hotel with a capital "H". Welcome!
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift does not meet the spatial requirements of a wheelchair, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, two disabled rooms, risk to bump into the ramp in the entrance hall, spacious personnel lift available if necessary.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 270 rooms: 160 single rooms, 76 double rooms, 22 superior rooms and 12 suites. All rooms feature an Internet connection over a wlan network. All rooms are for non-smokers, the rooms on the 9th floor come with a balcony. 2 rooms for the disabled.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurants Loiste (seating 205) and Kaarre (seating 120), located at the 10th floor of the building, offer a great view over the city. A rooftop terrace through the summer season. Seven conference rooms. The entire tenth floor of the hotel (restaurants and conference facilities) is available for corporate events, banquets, and cocktail parties for max. 700 participants.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: A 30 sq.m coffee corner in the lobby of the conference facilities.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 2 saunas, Eliel underground car park, entrance opposite the main entrance to the hotel.

item.title: Orion Cinema
item.description: Finnish Film Archive's films
item.matko:location: City centre, airport 19 km

item.title: Ostrobotnia Banquet Floor
item.description: The Ostrobotnia Banquet Floor is the perfect place for events both small and large. You can choose between eight rooms differing in style, size and ambiance. Ostrobotnia is located beside the Parliament House and the National Museum. The facilities are situated on the second and third floor of the building. There are tree separate rooms: Jääkärihuone, Snellman and Runeberg. The Ball Room can be combined with the Chydenius room.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Manala restaurant 176 seats. St. Urho`s pub 100 seats.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sound and lighting system in the Ball room. Internet connection.

item.title: Oulunkylä Ice Rink
item.description: Ice rink

item.title: Oulunkylä Recreation Centre
item.matko:location: Bus number 72 from the Railway Square.

item.title: Oulunkylän Curling Hall
item.description: Curling Hall in Oulunkylä, Helsinki.

item.title: OVVN
item.description: OVVN is a store for 10 different brands. The idea of the shop is to offer design clothing, -jewellery, -shoes and accessories for both women and men that are out of the ordinary mainstream fashion. The shop offers mainly handmade unique objects as well as small collections. The prices vary between street fashion and design.

item.title: Pacifico
item.description: Bar Pacifico, located in the heart of Kallio, is known for its warm, international atmosphere, great music and delicious brunch during the weekend.

item.title: Paloheinä Golf Ltd
item.description: An open for all golf course in the north Helsinki area. A large driving range and a 9-hole course (only one in the party needs to have a green card). At Paloheinä Golf it is also possible to rent the equipment.
item.matko:location: City centre 13 km, buses 67 and 66A, airport 10 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Big Horn Steak House includes 80 seats indoors and 80 seast terrace. Big Horn Steak House also for parties or meetings.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: A cabinet for 20 people
item.matko:additionalinfo: All the rights to serve alcoholic drinks

item.title: Paloheinä Ice Hall
item.matko:location: Bus 66/66A
item.matko:open: Ice skating winter 2012-2013: on Thursdays 13:30-15:00 without hockey sticks (rink 1) and 13:15-14:45 with sticks (rink 2).

item.title: Paloheinä Recreational Centre
item.description: Paloheinä is the most popular cross-country skiing centre in Helsinki and is easy to get to by bus or car. The skiing trails are opened as early as November and can be skied on as late as April, snow conditions permitting. Most of the trails are lighted until late in the evening. Ski service is available for waxing and preparation of skis. Ski package (including boots, skis and poles), snowshoe and small sled rentals. Also skiing courses!
item.matko:location: Approx. 9 km from the centre of Helsinki; buses 66, 66A from the city centre.
item.matko:open: The Paloheinä Skiing Service skirental is open during wintertime according to the snow situation in Helsinki
item.matko:services: SNOWSHOE HIKING Snowshoe hiking has become increasingly popular in Finland in recent years. The snowshoes attach to your own boots and allow you to walk across snowfields without sinking. Snowshoe hiking can be enjoyed by anyone, regardless of age or physical condition. You can try out snowshoe hiking on your own at several outdoor recreational centres, for example at the Paloheinä Recreational Centre.

item.title: Paloni Concept Store
item.description: Paloni's products are handmade by its 80 independent designers from across the globe. The product range includes women's and children's clothing, jewelry and accessories, home decor and gift items. In addition to being ethically produced, Paloni's products represent ecological design methods and materials, like slow design, zero waste and the use of recycled and organic materials.

item.title: Park Hotel Käpylä
item.description: Park Hotel Käpylä is a cosy conference hotel in an idyllic garden district of the city and easily accessible by car or public transport. There is ample free parking in the surrounding streets. The meeting facilities can be converted to suit a number of purposes, from wedding receptions to seminars. Sauna department with three saunas and a swimming pool.
item.matko:location: City centre 6 km, airport 12 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 40 rooms: 1 single ja 39 double rooms, extra beds available
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant with indoor terrace and bar, total of 120 seats. Sunny outdoor terrace with 50 seats in the courtyard.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Conference lobby 100 m2
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: For the conference clients, the hotel provides spacious and comfortable meeting facilities for up to 120 persons. AV-equipment is included in the price of the meeting package. Internet access available.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna

item.title: Parliament
item.description: Finland's 200-seat parliament gathers in this impressive building representing 1920s Classicism. The facade of the building is made of red granite from Kalvola. The main facade includes 14 Corinthian columns. A Visitors' Centre operates in the Little Parliament (Arkadiankatu 3, open Mon-Fri 10-16), an annex on the left side of the actual Parliament building. At the Visitors' Centre you will find information about the Parliament. Here it is possible to watch videos about the Parliament or read brochures, also Café Pikku Parlamentti and free access to internet.
item.matko:open: Guided tours are available for groups min.6 persons (not during plenary sessions).Prebooking needed. The public is welcome to observe all Parliaments' plenary sessions from the public gallery. The door on the right side of the main entrance is open 15 min. before each plenary session.
item.matko:disabled: All tours are accessible by wheelchair users. Alternative routes and viewing points exist for visitors with (motorised) wheelchairs. Visitors should contact the guide service in advance for alternative routes +358-9-432 2027 or oppaat@eduskunta.fi.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours are arranged for groups (6-25pers.) upon request Mon-Fri 9-16.15, tel. +358-9-432 2027. Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English & German. All tours are free of charge. Entrance to the guided tours on the left side of the main entrance.

item.title: Pasila Sports Hall
item.description: Sports hall

item.title: Pasila's Old Roundhouse
item.description:
100 years old roundhouse is situated in the middle of Pasila, near center. Scenery is peaceful railway yard where trains are running every now and then.
Horseshoe shaped building offers an unique architecture and space. Area is 680m2, height is 7,5m and whole venue can be divided in two with double doors.
Capacity during dinner is 300 and 400-500 cocktail. Old Roundhouse is sunlit, roomy and lovely with arcs reaching to the roof. The walls are white, the floor is blue, and beautiful arcs underlines spacious feeling.
Venue has been equipped with movable estrade, light and audio system used in speeches and background music.
You can bring your own goods or we can tailor an offer including only the services which you are externalizeing.
item.matko:location: City centre 3.5 km, airport 16 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Interior can be easily changed from one arrangement to another in order to serve better the customer and to back up the goal of the event . Capacity is 300 during dinner and 400-500 cocktail. You can bring your own beverages but the catering is exclusively of Crepperie Oy.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Room 1: 147 m2 Room 2: 147 m2 Room 3: 219 m2

item.title: Pataässä Karaoke Bar
item.description: The first Karaoke Restaurant in Helsinki.
item.matko:open: Mon-Thu 15-03, Fri 12-03 Sat-Sun 9-03, karaoke daily Mon-Thu 17-02.30, Fri 16-02.30, Sat-Sun 9-02.30

item.title: Penny Lane
item.description: Vintage clothing shoes, bags and other accessories. Also for men.

item.title: Pentik
item.description: Pentik is an international interior design retailer. The company designs a versatile range of products under its own brand in cooperation with carefully selected international partners.

item.title: Pentik outlet
item.description: A home decorated with Pentik designs has the modern and relaxed feel of a place where you feel happy and comfortable. The Pentik style combines Scandinavian simplicity with rustic charm and touches of the exotic to create a beautiful and harmonious whole. Eg. Arabia outlet is located in the same building.
item.matko:location: tram nr.6 towards Arabia

item.title: Perho
item.description:
The Restaurant Perho functions as the training restaurant of Finland's first restaurant school, founded 11.1.1935. The students work on their on-the-job learning periods both in the kitchen and in the dining room of the Restaurant Perho. The restaurant also runs a small brewery. The season beers can be tasted at the restaurant.
Once a month (the second Tuesday at 18.00-20.00) there is a theme evening at the restaurant. The price (starting from 22€; pre-booking necessary) includes an expert lecture and restaurant services.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 11-23, Sat 12-23, Sun 12-17 During 1.6.-15.8.2005 Sat only for groups by request, Sun closed During 27.-14.8.2005 Mon-Fri 11-15.
