item.matko:disabled: Possible to access with wheelchair. Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Both private and corporate occasions can be arranged upon request.
item.matko:services: Approx. 120 seats. Three private rooms, a total of approx 100 seats. Entrance to the private rooms from the Perhokatu side. The private function restaurant is open on agreement.

item.title: Peuramaa Ski Center
item.description: Peuramaa Ski Center is located near Helsinki region.

item.title: Photographic Gallery Hippolyte
item.description: Internationally renowned gallery focuses mainly on contemporary photographic art. It shows a diverse range of exhibitions based on photography. The sales collection contains artworks, books and a collection of artists' portfolios. The collection room also occasionally transforms into a project room for small-scale exhibitions.
item.matko:open: Tue-Fri 12-17, Sat-Sun 12-16, in July: Mon-Fri 12:00-17:00, Sat-Sun closed)

item.title: Pihlajasaari Island
item.description: Pihlajasaari is a former villa island that is now a versatile outdoor recreation area. It still has a few old villas set amongst rocks, wooded areas, groves and beaches. Varying terrain, good location and services have made Pihlajasaari the most popular summer island in Helsinki. Sun worshipers are attracted by Pihlajasaari's sandy beaches, there is also a naturist beach. Also cooking shelters, boat harbour, sauna to rent, café-restaurant Pihlajasaari (www.pihlajasaari.net) and possible to camp during Fri 12noon-Mon 12noon.
item.matko:open: There are ferry connections from Merisatama and Ruoholahti in summer.
item.matko:groups: Possible to book the restaurant for private occasions. Menus and buffet menus available for groups (menus min. 5persons, buffet menus min.20persons), restaurant Pihlajasaari (+358 (0)40 546 5350, www.pihlajasaari.net)
item.matko:ingress: Pihlajasaari is a former villa island that is now a versatile outdoor recreation area.

item.title: Pirkkola Ice Hall
item.matko:location: Buses 51, 62 and 63 near the ice hall. Also buses 42, 52, 54, 79, 512 and 522 further outside
item.matko:open: Ice skating (ice hall 2) winter 2012-2013: on Wednesdays 13:30 - 15 with hockey sticks and 15:30-17:00 without sticks, also on Saturdays 9:00 - 11:00 without sticks.

item.title: Pirttimäki
item.description:
The Pirttimäki and Karjakaivo outdoor recreation areas form an extensive whole. The landscape was shaped by the last Ice Age and is quite hilly. Impressive features include steep cliffs, erratic boulders, scenic lakes and ponds, lush bogs and mires. There is also a 1.8-hectare walnut grove in the area.
The City of Helsinki purchased the Dahlbacka forest estate in 1946. It soon became known by the Finnish name Pirttimäki. As a result of subsequent purchases, the area has grown to its present size of over 430 hectares.
item.matko:location: In Espoo 26 km from Helsinki, between Lake Bodominjärvi and Lake Nuuksion Pitkäjärvi. Bus number 86 from the center of Espoo.
item.matko:open: Enquiries, info monday - thursday: 07.00 - 15.00 friday: 07.00 - 20.00 saturday - sunday: 09.00 - 17.00
item.matko:services: Parking lot, information board, café, club room, hut with fireplace, saunas, camping sites, WC, cooking shelter, bathing sites and docks, playground and ball fields, outdoor recreation routes, fishing

item.title: Pivnice Hádanka
item.description: The city's first Czech-themed pivnice offers tasty beers and a cosy atmosphere.

item.title: Pivnice Milenka
item.description: Czech style beer restaurant, popular amongst eg. the students of Theater Academy of Finland round the corner. Events ever now and then.

item.title: Play It Again Sam
item.description: Vintage clothing from the late 19th century until the beginning of the 70's

item.title: Police Summer Home
item.description: The Police Summer Home is a fine venue for parties and other events and is situated on the shore in the Lauttasaari district of Helsinki.
item.matko:location: Lauttasaari, Länsiulapanniemi. City centre 5 km, airport approx. 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Upon renting the space, the customer is free to arrange catering, music and other entertainment according to his wishes. The customer is also responsible for decorating and cleaning up.
item.matko:additionalinfo:
Projector and screen available upon request for both rooms.
Rental period is from 9am to 12midnight, after which one hour is allowed for cleaning up. Owned by the Helsinki Police Summer Home Association (Helsingin poliisilaitoksen kesäkotiyhdistys r.y.)
item.matko:services: Two banquet halls, one seating 180 persons and the other 50-60 persons. The house can provide up to 180 chairs. Two saunas, one for 15-20 guests and the other for 8-10 guests.

item.title: Ponkes
item.description: A store specialized in skateboarding equipment and clothes.

item.title: Pop & Jazz Conservatory
item.matko:location: In Arabia, tram 6 and 8

item.title: PopAntik
item.description: Antique & collectible toys

item.title: Popot
item.description: Popot offers limited edition and customized sneakers from all of the most popular brands such as Nike, Converse, Adidas, Vans, New Balance, Puma , Reebok etc. Obviously we are also equipped to provide you the latest accessories and gear. The selection also includes special Finnish sneakers like Karhu Originals and St. Vacant.

item.title: Porvoo Art Factory
item.description: Culture and congress center. At the Art Factory entertainment, art and the corporate life get a new, unique meeting point. The old factory atmosphere serves an ideal and inspiring surrounding for great leisure. This is also a perfect place for arranging different events such as meetings, conventions and concerts. The Art Factory is situated only 30 minutes from the greater Helsinki area, as well with commuter traffic as with your own car. In summertime it is possible to reach the Art Factory by sea. The closeness of Porvoo old city and the riverside gives the Art Factory its own accent.

item.title: Postres
item.description: A privately owned fine dining restaurant where the owners have a passion for desserts, hence the name of the restaurant (postres = dessert). The restaurant offers also a whole dessert menu. During lunch (Tue-Fri 11.30-14) a daily changing three course menu. The restaurant has one star in the Michelin Guide.

item.title: Presidential Palace
item.description: The original drawings for the Presidential Palace were made by Pehr Granstedt at the beginning of the 1800s. The building was finished in 1820, after which C.L. Engel adapted it for use by the Tsar. Since Finland's independence the building has served as the official residence of the President, although today it is used primarily for presidential functions. The official residence of President Tarja Halonen is Mäntyniemi in the Meilahti district, near Seurasaari Island, Entrance to the Presidential Palace is possible only with a guided tour.
item.matko:open: Only for groups by appointment. NB! The Presidential Palace is closed due to renovation.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours by arrangement for groups , Helsinki Expert/Groups and corporate Events, tel.+358 (0)9 2288 1222, e-mail:groups@helsinkiexpert.fi, www.helsinkiexpert.fi

item.title: Pressa / Sokos Hotel Presidentti
item.description: Pressa is a 30+ nightclub with three bars, where Finnish music artists perform mainly on Fridays and Saturdays. Also karaoke.

item.title: Provokante Store -High Fashion
item.description: Provokante Store offers the latest high fashion collections from the finest Italian brands.

item.title: Public House Black Door
item.description: A beer restaurant with a wide selection of beers and whiskeys from the British islands.

item.title: Puistolan Palloiluhalli
item.description: You´ll find the enjoyable tennis and badminton courts in Puistola Tennis Hall. Please also note the possibility for golfing on our simulator´s 35 different 18-hole-virtual-courses. Puistola Tennis Hall and Helsinki Climbing Centre belong to Tapanila Sport Center.

item.title: Pukkisaari Iron-Age Trading Place
item.description: A trading place from the latter Iron Age is built right beside the Seurasaari island. It is possible to visit on occasion and during events, During summer visitors can also occasionally see a genuine ancient vessel, Sotka, with its crew in the pier of Pukkisaari Island. More information: Sommelo ry, www.sommelo.fi
item.matko:open: Buildings are open on the last weekends of every month at 12-16 and during events.
item.matko:groups: Organized tours and workshops for groups by request, inquiries: Sommelo ry/Julius Väliaho e-mail: julius.valiaho -at- luukku.com
item.matko:ingress: A trading place from the latter Iron Age is built right beside the Seurasaari island.

item.title: Punnitse ja säästä
item.description:
The Punnitse & Säästä-shops ("weigh & save") sell a couple of hundred bulk foodstuffs as well as a hundred prepacked special products. Specialized in nuts, beans, lentils, dried fruit etc. A majority of the products is organic.
Punnitse & Säästä stores at Helsinki:
Punnitse & Säästä Freda Fredrikinkatu 55 Tel: +358 (0)45-1244234 Open: Mon-Fri 10 am - 8 pm. Sat 10 am - 6 pm. E-mail krista@punnitse.fi
Punnitse & Säästä Kurvi Hämeentie 50 Tel: + 358 (0)45-1130693 Open: Mon-Fri 10 am - 8 pm. Sat 10 am -6 pm. E-mail krista@punnitse.fi
Punnitse & Säästä Columbus Vuotie 45 Tel: +358 (0)50-9956061 Open: Mon-fri 10 am - 8 pm. Sat 10-18.
Punnitse & Säästä Malmi shopping center Malmi Nova Malminkaari 13-19, 2 nd floor. Tel: +358 (0)45-8835252 Open: Mon-Fri 10 am - 8 pm. Sat 10 am - 4 pm. E-mail: malmi@punnitse.fi

item.title: Puotila Chapel
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue closed, Wed-Fri 13-15, Thu 18 evening service, Sat & Sun during services.

item.title: Puro, Sähkötalo Office Building
item.description: Building planned and designed by architect Alvar Aalto in 1965-1975.

item.title: Päivikki and Sakari Sohlberg Home Museum
item.description: Päivikki och Sakari Sohlberg Home Museum consists of the home, carefully preserved just as it was in the days of its former owners, of Päivikki and Sakari Sohlberg. In the course of their long lives this lawyer couple acquired a large collection of utility items and works of art spanning the entire 20th century at their apartment in a Jugend block in the Katajanokka district of Helsinki.
item.matko:open: By appointment, especially for groups. Guided tours on Mondays at 15.30 & 17 (not in June-August), prebooking necessary.
item.matko:admission: 5€/person, incl. guided tour to the museum, children under 15years free of charge when accompanied by an adult.

item.title: Päivälehti Museum
item.description: Päivälehti Newspaper Museum profiles Finnish journalism, printing techniques and the history of the daily newspaper Helsingin Sanomat from the 19th century to the present day. The Päivälehti Museum also regularly offers special exhibitions and theme events, providing information on different aspects of journalism. On the Museum premises, one can also watch old movies, read webmagazines, and newspapers, or search for news in the electronic archive.
item.matko:disabled: The museum has wheel-chair access, a toilet for the disabled, a lift and a range of visual auxiliaries. Upon request, the museum can also arrange for sign language services.
item.matko:groups: Guidebooking, tel. +358 (0)9 122 5210, free of charge, duration 1h. Languages: Finnish, Swedish and English.
item.matko:services: The museum also has a printing room, a strip cartoon gallery and temporary exhibitions. Museum shop and children's corner.

item.title: Pörssitalo: Restaurant Pörssi
item.description:
Pörssitalo offers six unique halls for meetings of 20-500 people.
Restaurant Pörssi is a restaurant for many occasions. This historical restaurant, with its unique and impressive architecture, is a fitting location for both large banquets and feasts as well as corporate and cocktail parties, business negotiations and small gatherings. High quality space - from comfortable private rooms to the large main dining room - is available for all purposes.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Qulma
item.description: Breakfast and lunch restaurant. Salads, Danish style open sandwiches and soup buffet.
item.matko:location: Kruununhaka district
item.matko:disabled: Toilet for handicapped

item.title: R/H
item.description: R/H is a Finnish womenswear label, established in 2010 by Hanna Riiheläinen ja Emilia Hernesniemi, offering a collection rich on playful details combined with nordic minimalism, insightful feminine cuts, colorful prints and a certain spirit of black magic - still light and easy to wear.

item.title: R3D
item.description:
R3D is club venue that focuses to play electronic music. Its program consists of top names of Finnish club DJ's and the freshest and most interesting names that Finland and foreign countries have to offer.
Age limit: 19 years

item.title: Radisson Blu Espoo
item.description:
After a full day at work, it is time to relax. At Radisson Blu Hotel Espoo, technology and business are interlaced with nature and excellent sports facilities. With a pleasant seaside location, the hotel lies within walking distance of one of the major high-tech concentrations in Finland as well as Aalto University. Dipoli Congress Centre is located practically next door; Helsinki centre is just 15 minutes away and the airport approx. 30 minutes.
The beautiful wooden flooring and wallpaper depicting the Espoo archipelago bring nature into the hotel rooms. The Magic Dreams intelligent beds which conform to every individual guarantee you relaxing sleep. The sauna section on the top floor houses three saunas, a pool, a bar and a terrace complete with a spectacular sea view. Rent a bicycle and explore the surroundings or try out Nordic walking and take a tour to the nature or the architectural classics in the area. The hotel is also an excellent choice if you are travelling on holiday or with your family - pets included! Our goal is 100% guest satisfaction and we guarantee it.
The hotel has been rewarded with TripAdvisor® 2013 Certificate of Excellence award.
• Superb seaside location in peaceful surroundings. • 209 rooms, most overlooking the sea. All rooms renovated in 2010. • Enjoy a delicious lunch or dinner in Restaurant Ranta. Lobby Bar is just right for a get-together with colleagues. • Super Breakfast buffet or Grab & Run takeaway breakfast. • Top-floor sauna section with a sea view: three saunas, a pool, a bar, lounge and rooftop terrace. • Full free Wi-Fi coverage. • Experience Meetings: functional teamwork facilities, good food, excellent service, satisfaction guaranteed, and sustainable development. • Two meeting rooms for 30 persons: wooden floors, lots of light, overlooking the hotel courtyard and the sea. • A short walk to Dipoli Congress Centre, Aalto University and the largest technology village in Northern Europe. • Easy access by car; free parking in front of the hotel. • Good connections: just 9 km to Helsinki centre, 28 km to Helsinki Airport. • The Swan, the Nordic Ecolabel, is testimony to our environmentally responsible operations.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: A fitting name for this informal, seaside restaurant, the word Ranta translates to "shore." Guests can enjoy a relaxing holiday in Espoo in this friendly, home-like atmosphere that presents a sea-inspired menu with Italian flare. The terrace offers a beautiful view over the Gulf of Finland, providing the ideal place to relax during warm months.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Radisson Blu Espoo boasts two conference rooms that span more than 93 square metres. These meeting rooms can accommodate up to 30 guests each and feature wooden floors and natural daylight. Free high-speed wireless Internet access is provided to all guests and delegates, and a business service centre is also available.

item.title: Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel
item.description: At Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel all rooms are equipped with the amenities of a first-class hotel, such as Magic Dreams intelligent beds, free Wi-Fi and MediaHUB connectivity panels. Start off with a sumptuous Super Breakfast, enjoy the various flavours in Kitzens, work out in our gym or pop down to our urban H.U.B. meeting point.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km. Hotel is located in the heart of Helsinki, next to the central railway station. The main bus station, underground and tram stops are all a short walk away.
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, revolving door, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, 6 inva-equipped rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 291 rooms including Business Class rooms and suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Kitzen is a new, exciting culinary experience, where iconic design and innovative dining come together in a historical setting. Kitzens offers delicacies from five different types of cuisine, with each meal prepared to the customer's wishes. Kitzens is also the first restaurant in Finland to provide menus on tablet computers. Across from the restaurant, Bar 7 Bling serves some of the most sparkling drinks in Helsinki. HUB bar & lounge in at the hotel lobby is open 24/7. http://www.kitzens.fi/ http://www.bar7blings.fi/
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: All areas have free wireless wlan. Jalmari meeting room has a Smartboard. Elegant Boardroom is a place for high profile meetings and events.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna available for all hotel guests. A small fitness room.
item.matko:services: Hotel has a guest sauna and small gym area. High-speed and/or wireless Internet access is free of charge for all guests throughout the hotel.

item.title: Radisson Blu Royal Hotel
item.description: At Radisson Blu Royal Hotel Meetings & Events section is your best choice for both meetings for six and conferences for up to 300 people. The premises are also suitable for private and business celebrations. Weddings, birthdays, trade shows, exhibitions - with us you will succeed. Located next to Kamppi centre and excellent connections.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km. Located in the heart of Helsinki next to the city's newest and largest business, shopping and entertainment district.
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, automatic slide door, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting poor at places, two inva rooms, access through the hotel to the hotel restaurants and bar, easier entry from Malminkatu.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 262 rooms including Business Class rooms and suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Grill It! offering the best steaks in town, Royal Buffet for private occasions, Coffee Bar in the lobby open 24/7.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Most of the meeting rooms suitable for exhibitions, conference lobbies being break out areas. The largest exhibition area is the Ballroom with 252 m2, break-out area (lobby) 160 m2.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna available for all hotel guests, a heated garage for extra charge.
item.matko:services: Hotel has two guest saunas and warm parking hall (extra charge). High-speed and/or wireless Internet access is now free of charge for all guests throughout the hotel. Coffee bar in the hotel lobby open 24/7.

item.title: Radisson Blu Seaside Hotel
item.description: Top-notch service, rooms decorated with a personal touch, modern restaurants and the sea just outside create a great setting for a pleasant stay, just as you want it to be. Spacious family rooms, Magic Dreams intelligent beds and Wi-Fi. For you and your company, Katto Sauna & Lounge tops off the sensations with a spectacular sea view. Restaurant Viola serves mouthwatering Italian food. Of the hotel's 12 meeting rooms, the largest is suitable for conferences for 150 participants or cocktails for 200 people.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, by the sea, tram stop is in front of the hotel, metro is 500m away, design boutiques are at a walking distance. Helsinki-Vantaa airport: 40-min-drive.
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 337 rooms including Business Class rooms and suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Italian restaurant Viola (120 seats), Seaside Hall (280 seats), the Katto Lounge for up to 40 guests on the top floor for private occasions, Coffee Bar in the lobby open 24/7.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Virtanen 1 + 2: 170 m2
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna available for all hotel guests. A small fitness room. Katto Sauna & Lounge for private parties. A heated garage for extra charge.
item.matko:services: Hotel has guest saunas and modern gym. High-speed and/or wireless Internet access is now free of charge for all guests throughout the hotel.

item.title: Raffaello
item.description: Italian-style Raffaello Café is a restaurant for dining and spending time together. The restaurant menu is Mediterranean-style. In summer a popular courtyard terrace, often with live music.

item.title: Rahaliike Holmasto
item.description: Coins and medals
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 10-17, Sat 10-14 (on auction Saturdays shop is closed)

item.title: Rake Sali Ball Room
item.description: Rake Sali Ball Room, in connection with the Klaus K hotel, is perfect for example for seminars, conferences, weddings, birthday parties, dinners and other celebrations with all banquet services provided by Klaus K Hotel. The venue is set in a national romantic era building, at the top of Helsinki's Esplanadi and the crossroads of the city center main streets Mannerheimintie and Erottaja. All the best shopping in the city is just across the street.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Rantasipi Airport Congress Center
item.description:
The Rantasipi Airport Congress Center includes 31 conference rooms, facilities for virtual conferences, a 600m2 multipurpose hall and comprehensive restaurant and catering services. The facilities are easily adapted to meet the needs of the event. The new Executive sections offers exclusive conference & lounge rooms for top meetings, and the 600m2 multipurpose hall is sizable enough to drive in.
All of the conference and meeting rooms are equipped with cutting-edge conference technology, and wireless Internet is accessible throughout the venue. The Rantasipi hotel adjacent offers 278 rooms, sauna facilities & a swimming pool. There are also 550 parking spaces, some of which are covered.
item.matko:location: Airport 3 km, Helsinki city centre 18 km, Tikkurila 6 km. The complimentary shuttle bus makes 3-4 runs per hour, according to a set timetable, between the Congress Center and the airport.

item.title: Rastila Camping Helsinki
item.description: Modern 4- star camping area. Different levels of accommodation for various demands. 165 modern caravan pitches with electricity hook-ups. A slop sink, a waste water disposal system and fresh water points. Service buildings. 80 tent pitches on grass. Driving directions: take Ring 1 (Kehä 1) or Itäväylä (170) to Itäkeskus. Proceed about 2 km towards Vuosaari. Turn right from ramp and the turn left.
item.matko:location: 12 km to the city centre, 22 km to the airport. With metro towards Vuosaari from the city centre, to Rastila station in 18 minutes.
item.matko:open: Open every day all through the year. On vinter season 1.10.-30.4. reception is open 8-21.
item.matko:admission: Prices during winter season 2011-2012: Caravan pitch 11€/ night+ camping fees+ electricity 7€/ night, tent pitch 6€/ night+ camping fees. Cottages from 77-192 €/ night.
item.matko:disabled: Some of cottages are suitable for disabled. One of the servicebuildings is equipped with ramp and shower/toilet for disabled.
item.matko:services: Cottage accommodation: Holiday cottages for 6-8 persons, Log cottages for 4-6 persons, family and modern camping cabins for 4 persons. In total 22 cabins. In addition, there are tent, camper and camping car places. Restaurant, beach, parking lot, rental of bicycles during the summer. Sea side sauna 75 e / hour (min. 2 hours), and familysaunas.

item.title: Rauhankatu 1 (The Pearl of Kruununhaka)
item.description: The Winner of public vote for the most beautiful jugend -style building in Helsinki organized by Helsingin Sanomat in 2007. The building presents the early phases of Jugend -style but has still some remains of the eclectism from the end of 19th century. Every floor is styled different. Completed in 1900, architects were Onni Törnqvist (Tarjanne) and Lars Sonck.
item.matko:location: Kruununhaka
item.matko:ingress: The most beautiful jugend -style building in Helsinki.

item.title: Rautatalo Office Building
item.description: Building planned by Alvar Aalto in 1951, 1955 and 1957.

item.title: Ravintola Laulumiehet
item.description: Restaurant Laulumiehet has been running for over 50 years already as a made-to-order restaurant. During this time all kinds of events have been organized in the facilities; from weddings and funerals to schooling events. The banquet hall can be easily modified and suits therefore every occasion.
item.matko:location: in Kamppi, 500 m from the city center
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Perinteinen keittiö ja eksoottisiin ruokalajeihin erikoistunut juhlapalvelu. Juhlatiloissa anniskeluoikeudet

item.title: Ravintola Lämpö
item.description: Easy going restaurant in Suvilahti in the shadows of two old gasometers. We serve breakfast, lunch, brunch. In the evenings you can enjoy menu inspired by the area. Or come just for a cup of coffee.
item.matko:location: Five minute walk from Kalasatama metro station
item.matko:disabled: Inva toilet
item.matko:groups: Ask for an offer for group lunch
item.matko:services: Free wi-fi

item.title: Ravintola Pelmenit
item.description: Pelmenit is an uncomplicatedand cosy Ukrainian restaurant in the Sörnäinen district that offers extremely affordable Slavic home cooking. Pelmeni is a type of dumpling similar to ravioli that is filled with minced meat

item.title: Ravintola Pompei
item.description: Said to be the first pizzeria in Helsinki, Pompei seems to have been transported straight from Napoli to the classical Finnish Kruununhaka district.

item.title: Ravintola Seurahuone
item.description: The stylishly decorated hotel restaurant, Ravintola Seurahuone Restaurang, offers good service. Located at the best business site in Helsinki, the restaurant is a stunning blend of mood created by skilfully crafted and restored surfaces combined with contemporary furnishings. The food itself is of a high standard, reflecting the spirit of European urban culture. Despite this, the menu hasn't forgotten Seurahuone classics.
item.matko:open: Open: Mon-Tue 11:30-22, Wed-Fri 11:30-23, Sat 13-23, Sun closed
item.matko:ingress: Stunning combination of restored surfaces combined with contemporary furnishings

item.title: Ravintola Solna
item.description: Restaurant Solna has been operating in the heart of Munkkiniemi since 1966. This cosy, homely restaurant offers modern French and Continental cuisine, prepared from the freshest raw ingredients by our chefs.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:additionalinfo: Kokousvieraille ruokasalin takana on rauhallinen 8 hengen kabinetti.

item.title: Ravintola Sunn Senaatintori
item.description: Continental bistro.
item.matko:location: In the Kiseleff house, in the center.

item.title: Ravintola Wanha Mylly
item.description: Restaurant Wanha Mylly is situated in the 18th century farm steward's house of the Herttoniemi Manor.
item.matko:location: Herttoniemi Manor
item.matko:open: Mon 11-20, Tue-Thu 11-21, Fri 11-22, Sat 12-22 and Sun 12-20. Holidays 12-20.

item.title: Red Apple Apartments
item.description: Red Apple Apartments has a variety of fully furnished studio, 1 bedroom, and 2 bedroom apartments in the heart of Helsinki for both business and leisure travellers. All the apartments come with fully equipped kitchens.
item.matko:location: City Centre

item.title: Regus Luna House
item.description: Regus Luna House is based in a beautiful, impressive building ideally located in the very heart of the city. The centre has five conference and meeting rooms and the professional team can help to ensure the success of meetings.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:services: The meeting rooms are equipped with fast Internet connections, whiteboard, flipchart, conference phone, notepads, pencils and water. An LCD-projector is available for all conference and meeting rooms. Videoconferencing can be organized with high tech equipment using either IP or ISDN connections.

item.title: Remake EkoDesign Oy
item.description: Remake is part of the EkoPuoti consept where you can find a eco-hairdresser and eco-beauty services. Remake is a ecodesign shop/ showroom and studio.
item.matko:location: Remake Ekodesign is located at Hakaniemi square, behind the old market hall.

item.title: Restaurant Aino
item.description: Aino is a Finnish restaurant in the centre of Helsinki located by the historical Esplanad Park. The à la carte menu seeks inspiration from traditional Finnish cuisine. The kitchen uses mainly Finnish seasons ingredients. The rustic atmosphere of the arched cellar offers a delightful place for evening dining. Special occasions can be catered for in cabinets for 25, 12 or 8 persons.
item.matko:open: Open Mon-Fri 11.30-22.30, Sat 16-22.30, Sun closed. Lunch Mon-Fri 11.30-15.

item.title: Restaurant Aito
item.description: Restaurant Aito, seating 36 persons, is an intimate and casually stylish dining and meeting place for locals and visitors alike. Restaurant Aito offers genuine, straightforward, modern and traditional food, relying on Finnish ingredients with an international twist. Aito aims to serve seasonal gastronomic experiences from a frequently changing menu. Monday to Friday from 11 am to 2.30 pm also a daily changing lunch dish, soup of the day and lunch menu.

item.title: Restaurant Arthur
item.description: The Restaurant Arthur seats up to 250 guests in a wonderful chandeliered room that is perfect for company parties, banquets and weddings. Lunchbuffet, suitable also for groups. The restaurant also offers the Helsinki Menu.
item.matko:groups: Lunchbuffet, suitable also for groups.

item.title: Restaurant Bellevue
item.description: The oldest Russian restaurant in Helsinki, located near the Uspenski Cathedral.

item.title: Restaurant Boat Wäiski
item.description: The only restaurant boat open all year round in Helsinki. It's possibel to just have a cup of coffee or a beer, but lunch is beeing served during weekdays and in the evenings there is an a la carte menu. All sorts of events are being arranged on the boat as well.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 10.30-22 (lunch Mon-Fri 10.30-15), Sat 12-22. At other times upon request. The outdoor terrace is open rain or shine.

item.title: Restaurant Boathouse
item.description: BoatHouse is a fresh summer restaurant, offering a relaxed atmosphere and good summer food. The Boathouse kitchen offers seasonal treats with flavours from the New World. The connection ferry to Liuskasaari leaves from Merisatama. It is located between restaurant Carusel and Kompassi pier. Return ticket is 5€/person and can be charged with restaurant bill. There is also connecting bridge between Liuskasaari and Uunisaari.
item.matko:location: Located on the isle of Liuskasaari off Kaivopuisto shore. City centre 15 min, airport 45 min.
item.matko:open: Mon-Sat 17-24, Sun 15-22 (Saturdays are usually booked for private occasions/weddings), open May-September.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant's capacity for sit-down functions is max 200 people.

item.title: Restaurant Café Chapman
item.description: In the daytime, Café Chapman, which is close to the Visitor Centre, is a lunch spot for the whole family and in the evenings, an à la carte restaurant. The pleasant courtyard terrace is an ideal place to enjoy refreshments.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, inva-WC. There are many cobbled sections of road on Suomenlinna, where the use of a wheelchair or baby carriage may be somewhat difficult.

item.title: Restaurant Cantina West
item.description: The Cantina West has been the flagship of tex-mex food culture in Finland since it was opened in 1990. Good food, friendly service, music and relaxed atmosphere are both characteristic and important to the restaurant. The kitchen prepares mexican delicacies always from fresh ingredients.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Restaurant Carelia
item.description: An international restaurant situated in a former farmacy. The menu seeks its inspiration from different parts of Europe and combines this with fresh Finnish ingredients. The clientele is influenced by the National Opera which is situated opposite of the restaurant. Table reservatios are highly recommended.

item.title: Restaurant China
item.description: Restaurant China is the first Chinese restaurant in Helsinki and was founded in 1973. It is specialized in the cantonese kitchen of South-China and has 65seats. Situated in the city centre, on Annankatu, this restaurant offers also north Sze-Chen delicacies and a special menu for asian travellers. Lunch Mon-Fri 11-15.
item.matko:groups: Special menu for asian travellers. Special offers for school groups.

item.title: Restaurant Demo
item.description: Demo serves their guests high class home made food combined with personal and friendly service. Demo is owned by two talented chefs Tommi & Teemu. Their goal is to offer a change to top quality dining, in a relaxed and cozy environment. Restaurant Demo was choosen to be restaurant of the year 2006 by the The Association for Gastronomes in Finland. In 2007 one star in the Michelin Guide Rouge.

item.title: Restaurant Elite
item.description: Elite has been a unique cultural restaurant and living room for artists since its establishment in 1932. Actors, musicians, authors, dancers and artists have enjoyed themselves for years here in the theatre of real life. Paintings by some of its artist patrons can be admired on the walls of the Elite. The Finnish-international restaurant serves eg. sirloin steak with creamed onion à la Tauno Palo (inspired by the famous Finnish actor), vorschmack and creamy "pyttipannu".

item.title: Restaurant Farang
item.description: Farang is a restaurant which serves modern Asian cuisine, located within the premises of the historical Kunsthalle Helsinki. Farang offers unique and fresh flavors from Southeast Asia. Farang's simplified, modern and atmospheric decor combined with the warm service and strong expertise in Asian cuisine creates an excellent setting for a comprehensive dining experience.
item.matko:open: Tue-Fri Lunch menu 11.30 am-1.30 pm, Tue-Sat Dinner menu 5 pm-midnight, Sun closed, Mon closed

item.title: Restaurant FreshCo
item.description: Restaurant is situated in the Finnair Stadium, 800 seats.
item.matko:open: Restaurant FreshCo is open during the football season (until Oct. 31) Mon-Fri 11-15 and during other Finnair Stadium events. Other times only by appointment.

item.title: Restaurant GLO Art Kitchen
item.description: New Restaurant GLO Art Kitchen is situated in the 100-year-old cellar of a magnificent Art Nouveau building. The restaurant serves food focusing on Nordic ingredients: high quality meat, Finnish fish and classic burgers. GLO Art Kitchen suits perfectly for private occasions and parties. Its two separate meeting rooms can host a cozy dinner for 10 as well as a bigger party for over 20 guests.

item.title: Restaurant Graniittilinna
item.description: Situated in Hakaniemi, restaurant Graniittilinna is the newest addition to the already renowned and loved Marco Polo and Juttutupa. Located directly adjacent to Marco Polo, Graniittilinna offers exquisite a la carte dishes based on traditional Finnish fare using local ingredients. In addition to its extensive a la carte menu, Graniittilinna provides its customers with weekly-changing lunch menus, along with a superior selection of fine wines. HelsinkiMenu is served here. The restaurant was voted HelsinkiMenu restaurant for the year 2005.

item.title: Restaurant Grotesk
item.description: Restaurant Grotesk was opened in November 2007 by Teemu Aura and Tommi Tuominen who also own the Michelin-star rated restaurant Demo. Situated in a great place, Grotesk offers something for everyone: excellent drinks or bubbly for the thirsty as well as tasty food for the hungry. Michelin Bib Gourmand honourable mention. Helsinki Menu is also served here.
item.matko:open: Mon 11.30-14, Tue-Fri 11.30-14 and 17-24, Sat 17-24. Bar: Tue-Sat from 16.

item.title: Restaurant Haaga Inn
item.description: Pop in for a cup of coffee or stay a bit longer enjoying tasty food. The Best Western Hotel Haaga restaurant Haaga Inn offers one a trendy and cosy atmosphere which is designed to make one feel comfortable and welcomed. Lunch on weekdays 11-14. Helsinki Menu is served here.
item.matko:location: In Haaga, city centre 10 min, airport 20 min
item.matko:services: Banquet restaurant, conference facilities and sauna department with 4 saunas and a swimming pool.

item.title: Restaurant Havis
item.description: Havis is a restaurant specialized in fish and crustacean. The menu includes also vegetarian and meat dishes daily. The restaurant has three different sides: traditional Havis with 54 seats, modern/relaxed Kitchen with 32 seats and an outdoor terrace in summer with 40 seats. Havis was voted 'Best Helsinki Menu Restaurant' in both 2006 and 2007.
item.matko:location: Next to the South Harbour

item.title: Restaurant Helkan keittiö- Helka's kitchen
item.description: Helkan Keittiö - Helka's Kitchen - is inspired by Finnish design and nature. In addition to stylish surroundings the restaurant is centered upon tasty dishes which are prepared to honour Finnish ingredients and dishes.
item.matko:groups: Ask for an offer for group dining

item.title: Restaurant Hima & Sali
item.description:
Hima & Sali restaurant at the Cable Factory offers a wide variety of lunches Mon-Fri and the café is open until the evening also at weekends. The premises are available, by agreement, from weekday afternoons until late at night and weekends, even round the clock. We don't charge rent at all for use of the main festive hall when booked in conjunction with other orders.
The unique Sali Hall is an almost ten-metre-high Dining Hall in an old cable factory. Clean-lined furniture and an easily adaptable space make this an excellent venue for dinner for a few dozen people or 250-person banquette. The DIning Hall can cater for up to 150 seated dinner guests.
item.matko:groups: Groups by appointment.
item.matko:services: Catering service

item.title: Restaurant Janoinen Lohi
item.description: Beer Restaurang

item.title: Restaurant Juttutupa / Marco Polo
item.description: Juttutupa and Marco Polo together with restaurant Graniittilinna is a combination of three unique restaurants. They offer both tasty a la carte menus and relaxing, continental beer culture. As one of the oldest pub/restaurants in Helsinki, Juttutupa's roots are deeply ingrained in Finnish history. In addition to its captivating past, Juttutupa is one of the popular live music venues in the city. restaurant Marco Polo; with its dark wooden interiors and mouth-watering offerings, Marco Polo is an excellent choice for either lunch or dinner.
item.matko:open: Juttutupa: Mon-Thu 10-01, Fri-Sat 10-03, Sun 11-24 Marco Polo: Mon-Thu 10.30-24, Fri 10.30-01.00, Sat 11-01, Sun 12-21

item.title: Restaurant Juuri
item.description: Juuri is a Finnish restaurant whose roots ("juuri" in Finnish) are in the traditional Finnish food culture, in the innovative thinking and in the handicraft that preparing meals is. The speciality of the restaurant is the "sapas" which are small Finnish appetizers.
item.matko:services: Catering.

item.title: Restaurant Kaisaniemi
item.description: Restaurant Kaisaniemi, founded in 1827, is one of the oldest restaurants in Finland. It is located in the Kaisaniemi park, just a few minutes away from the main railway station. Kaisaniemi's customers have included such distinguished Finns as poet Eino Leino, field marshal C. G. Mannerheim, poet J. L. Runeberg, writer Z. Topelius and composer Jean Sibelius. Today, a secret passage used by Mannerheim can still be found in the Marski Room. Also suitable for meetings and conferences.
item.matko:location: City centre 0,5 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:open: Mon-Sat 11-22, Sun 12-20, open also on request at other times.
item.matko:groups: Good venue for group lunches, dinners and functions with organised programme.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: 350-870 seats

item.title: Restaurant Kappeli
item.description: The Kappeli restaurant serves classical Finnish dishes from reindeer to salmon. Finnish tastes backed by 140 years' experience. The dining room has a unique atmosphere, at once cosy and stylish, comprising the beauty of Esplanadi park, the spaciousness of the glass veranda and the dignified essence of the house. Cosy for couples and a setting for larger groups. The café is traditional meeting-place offering sweet and salty snacks, as well as a good selection of beers and wines. The bar is the oldest part of Kappeli. History, ambience, daily newspapers. A place to meet and relax after work.

item.title: Restaurant Kiltakellari
item.description: The restaurant occupies the old brewery founded by Nikolai Sinebrychoff on the Bulevardi in 1819. The building has since been modernised, but with full respect for the old milieu and retaining the sturdy pillars and old brick walls. The main hall is reached via a narrow vaulted passageway. Fully licensed, full-service catering for conferences, private occasions and dinners for up to 250. Also lunches.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:groups: Only by appointment
item.matko:services: 3 cabinets for 12, 10 and 6 persons

item.title: Restaurant Kipinä
item.description: Restaurant Kipinä, next to the Kaisaniemi metro station, offers an ideal scene for an evening out in an unreserved atmosphere with good, homemade food with a mediterranean accent. The gastrobar also serves homemade food at lunch time and in the evenings different kinds of pinchos.

item.title: Restaurant Kokki
item.description: Restaurant Kokki is the training restaurant of the hotel, restaurant and catering-students at Helsingin palvelualojen oppilaitos- Helsinki City College of Culinary Art, Fashion and Beauty . The facilities can be used for many purposes. 120 seats and a cabinet for 8 persons. HelsinkiMenu is served Tue-Fri.
item.matko:location: City centre 9 km, airport 23 km. In Roihuvuori
item.matko:open: During the school year Mon-Fri 11.15 - 14.00, at other times by request only (closed in Summer).
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Kokki is the training restaurant of the hotel, restaurant and catering students at Helsingin palvelualojen oppilaitos - Helsinki City College of Culinary Art, Fashion and Beauty.
item.matko:additionalinfo: All conference facilities are equipped with modern conference equipment. Conference facilities are open by agreement. Also sauna facilities available for 10 persons.

item.title: Restaurant Kolme Kruunua
item.description: Interior from the 1950s and traditional Finnish cuisine such as meatballs, "Pyttipannu" ('hash') and fried Baltic herrings.
item.matko:open: Restaurant: Mon-Thu 16-01, Fri-Sat 16-03 and Sun 14-01. Kitchen: Mon-Sat 16-24, Sun 14-23.

item.title: Restaurant Koto
item.description: Traditional Japanese restaurant.

item.title: Restaurant Kuu
item.description: Established in 1966 restaurant Kuu has offered classics carefully prepared from Finnish ingredients. A wide selection of wines. 60 seats, in summetime also 25 outdoors. Awarded as the best HelsinkiMenu restaurant in 2009.

item.title: Restaurant Lappi
item.description: The first Lapland style restaurant in the heart of Helsinki. "Kelonkolo" Bar is a quaint bar situated to the front of the restaurant. Menu available in 11 languages.

item.title: Restaurant Lasipalatsi
item.description:
Restaurant Lasipalatsi is restored honouring the Functionalism style of the 1930's and the atmosphere is therefore unique. Voted best HelsinkiMenu restaurant in 2001.
The restaurant serves HelsinkiMenu. In addition to popular classics, Restaurant Lasipalatsi serves seasonal delicacies at their best. The chefs take great pride in ensuring that guests can always enjoy fresh, domestic fish, cheeses and berries. The Lasipalatsi building, also home to the film theatre Bio REX, offers an excellent functionalist style backdrop for various social receptions. In addition to a well-lit functionalist style dining hall, three quiet cabinets can be rented for events ranging from breakfast meetings to gala dinners. The stylish and welcoming Aquarium cabinet, Helsinki cabinet and the Winter Garden with its real palm trees offer sit-down meals for groups from 10 to 60. The private function rooms have windows and their interiors match the restaurant.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 4 cm) along the path, essential access, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted.

item.title: Restaurant Lehtovaara
item.description: Restaurant Lehtovaara is one of the most traditional restaurants in Helsinki. It was founded in Helsinki in 1940. The Restaurant Lehtovaara has earned a reputation over the decades as a fine establishment for Finnish and international cuisine. Restaurant Lehtovaara has received several acknowledgements, e.g. the Rôtisseur-shield in 2002. 120 seats. Also a popular glass terrace that is open all year round. The restaurant also serves the HelsinkiMenu.

item.title: Restaurant Loiste
item.description:
The Restaurant Loiste is a warm-spirited restaurant in the very heart of Helsinki. The restaurant, situated on the 10th floor, is suitable for lunch as well as for a la carte dinner.
You can also sit outside and enjoy the spectacular views from the Loiste's terrace, one of the city's most magnificent locations all through the year.
item.matko:location: City centre
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms:
The Loiste's beautiful private dining rooms are excellent locations for conferences, meetings and all kinds of private parties or banquets. The magnificent views add the final touch to a successful meeting and pleasant evening.
Private dining rooms 1-3 can be combined to form a single large space. An overhead projector, screen, flap chart, video projector, DVD player, video recorder and cordless microphone can be obtained for all meeting rooms.

item.title: Restaurant Luomo
item.description: Restaurant Luomo, opened in May 2009 in Kruunuhaka, seats 30. The theme of the restaurant is Local & Global; local produce, international high quality cuisine and ecological food. The menu consists of 7 courses of which one can choose a menu of 3-, 5- or 7-courses. Luomo offers innovative and modern cuisine, based on classical gastronomy.
item.matko:admission: Menus: 39€ (3 courses) / 49€ (5 courses) / 59€ (7 courses), wine packages to match available.

item.title: Restaurant Lyon
item.description: Restaurant Lyon is a traditional French-style restaurant situated opposite the National Opera. Voted 'Restaurant of the Year' in 1996 by the Finnish Gastronomy Association. Lyon was also voted 'Best HelsinkiMenu Restaurant' in 2003.

item.title: Restaurant Meritorppa
item.description: Restaurant Meritorppa is situated in Hilton Helsinki Kalastajatorppa's Seaside Wing, on the ground floor. The restaurant seats approx. 80 persons. There is also a separate cabinet for 20persons. A magnificent sea view from both the restaurant as well as the outdoor terrace (in summer). Meritorppa serves both Finnish and international cuisine and a wide range of wines.

item.title: Restaurant Messenius
item.description: Restaurant Messenius is a traditional restaurant, founded in 1937.
item.matko:location: In Töölö

item.title: Restaurant Mestaritalli
item.description: Mestaritalli is a traditional summer restaurant. The summer season begins at the end of April and continues until autumn. The restaurant has a summer terrace with a seaview with 200 seats. Located in a beautiful park, the restaurant is popular especially for weddings. Not to forget the Meritalli, partly buildt on the sea, which is popular among sunloving, thirsty people. Mestaritalli is open all year and serves regular guests on weekdays and private occasions on weekends.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, one step, Inva-WC, lighting intensity 50-150 lux.
item.matko:groups: Group menus, Restel Tapahtumaravintolat sales, tel. +358 (0)9 733 5814, e-mail: ravintolat.mestaritalli@restel.fi
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Mestaritalli is perfect for different occasions. It is possible to have seats for 150 persons in main hall and in the cabinet for is suitable for up to 40 persons, however 5-22persons is recommended. The cabinet is also perfect for a small private party.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Parking for 30 cars.

item.title: Restaurant NJK
item.description: The villa-type restaurant, located on the small island of Valkosaari, was built in 1900. It is one of the most popular locations for festivities during the summer season, as well as one of the most popular crayfish restaurants in town - and a wonderful setting for a tasty meal. The tall, spacious Middle room is surrounded by a bright covered veranda with large windows and a view towards the Market Square and Katajanokka. The connection ferry departs from Valkosaari pier close to the Olympic terminal.
item.matko:open: In summer: Mon-Sat 17.00-24.00 (on Saturdays often private occasions), Sun closed.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The yacht club restaurant is located in the heart of seaside Helsinki. Restaurant is wonderful for both large and small occasions. The restaurant can hold up to 200-300 guests and function rooms can also be used separately by smaller parties. The Club function room is suitable for smaller private occasions.

item.title: Restaurant Nokka
item.description: Every visit to a restaurant holds a story. A unique series of events which are created of details, also those invisible ones. However, the most important ones are those hand-picked, high quality ingredients. In Restaurant Nokka the story is influenced by chef Ari Ruoho and his pure ingredients. The duck is from Alhopakka, the ceps come from the known pickers and the lamb from Bovik, Snappertuna. The eagerness of each producer, subjective responsibility and the ethical level of the whole occupation indeed shows - and tastes. Nokka was voted 'Best Helsinki Menu Restaurant' in 2002, 2008 and 2011 and also 'The Best Restaurant in Helsinki' in 2012.

item.title: Restaurant Nuevo
item.description: Nuevo is situated in a peaceful street in the heart of Helsinki between the Market Square and Senate Square. Nuevo's decor and profile is modern, and it has a pleasant bar. The homely atmosphere is perfect for an exploration of the world of Spanish food and wines. The kitchen is inspired by the gastronomic regions of Spain, with regularly changing themed menus providing variety throughout the year.

item.title: Restaurant Old Anchor
item.description: Lunch Buffet

item.title: Restaurant Olo
item.description: Olo is a modern Nordic gourmet cuisine restaurant at the heart of Helsinki. Olo's kitchen represents the modern Nordic cuisine, where traditional raw materials of the North are well-respected. The cuisine aims to offer clarity of design and generous flavours as known from our grandmothers' times. The menu follows the yearly cycle of the Nordic nature, bringing to the table only what is at best at a given time. The natural and clean flavours of land and sea reign in Olo's kitchen. The restaurant has had a Michelin star since the year 2011.
item.matko:open: Mon 11:30-14, Tue-Fri 11:30-24, Sat 17-24, kitchen closed weekdays 13:30-18:00
item.matko:services: Olo is also a wine cabinet and olo cabinet, perfect for private and business-related arrangements, and an outdoor restaurant that will open for the warm seasons of 2008.

item.title: Restaurant Palace
item.description:
Restaurant Palace is a first class gourmet restaurant in Helsinki. Get a taste of classic 50's feel and enjoy the most beautiful sea view in Helsinki. Restaurant Palace is located on the 10th floor of a historical building designed for the Helsinki Olympics in 1952. In addition to the à la carte restaurant, Restaurant Palace offers private rooms for meetings and events for up to 500 guests.
In the Restaurant Palace of today, traditions come together with new trends and innovations. The menu includes deliciously creative dishes which are prepared using the finest Finnish ingredients of the current season. Chef de Cuisine Lasse Koistinen leads the restaurant with an innovative touch. The selection of wines is in a league of its own: over the years the wine cellar has been filled with carefully selected first-rate wines.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 30 min
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Palace Gourmet restaurant has 70 seats and offers the best of Finnish and Scandinavian cuisine.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Organize unforgettable summer parties at Restaurant Palace's 10th floor! Invite your friends and family to enjoy a unique restaurant experience with the best sea view of Helsinki. Weddings, graduation parties, birthdays... Anything you want to celebrate! Restaurant Palace offers two different summer celebration packages, both of which include facilities in Merisali and a private terrace with a beautiful sea view, sparkling wine, and swinging background music. When the weather is sunny, you can enjoy the sunshine until the late evening at the terrace. Restaurant Palace is especially famous for the best crayfish parties and August's kickoff parties in Helsinki.

item.title: Restaurant Piha
item.description: An Italian style restaurant. 170 seats, outdoor terrace in summer.

item.title: Restaurant Pihlajasaari
item.description: Restaurant Pihlajasaari is located on the island of Pihlajasaari in front of Helsinki city centre, only 10 minutes by boat from Kaivopuisto. The island is one of the most popular summer oases for native Helsinki residents. The fully-licenced café-restaurant of the island has served customers in an 120-year-old wooden villa, called villa Hällebo, for over 80 years. Restaurant Pihlajasaari has 190 seats, 90 of which inside the villa and the rest on two outside terraces. There is an excellent view to the open sea from the front terrace situated on natural rock whereas from the smaller back terrace Helsinki can be seen. The restaurant provides Finnish specialities, e.g. smoked salmon from the own smokery and home made doughnuts. Private occasions can be arranged on request.The connection ferry to Pihlajasaari leaves from Merisatamanranta behind Café Carusel and 15.6. - 11.8. also from Ruoholahti. On the island there is a boat harbour for those who come by their own boat.
item.matko:location: Restaurant Pihlajasaari is located on the island of Pihlajasaari in front of Helsinki near Kaivopuisto
item.matko:services: Inside the restaurant 90 seats and on the two terraces 100 seats. Private occasions on request.

item.title: Restaurant Pääposti
item.description: The Pääposti Restaurant and its conference facilities are situated right in the heart of the city centre: the main railway station, Kiasma Museum of contemporary Art, Sanoma House and Sokos department store around the main Post office in the busy downtown district. Under the glass ceiling of the restaurant, it is possible to enjoy a variety of truly memorable parties.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The Restaurant is perfect for various theme parties and formal dinner banquets. Cocktail parties for up to 400 persons and dinners/lunches for up to 225 persons.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Restaurant 578m2 with a small hall 34m2.

item.title: Restaurant Rivoli
item.description: The Rivoli restaurant has two different rooms, two different atmospheres.The menu concentrates on fish and seafood, but offers also a wide range of Finnish and French specialties. Trattoria Rivoletto offers pizza and other Italian dishes.

item.title: Restaurant Saari
item.description: Restaurant Saari is located on the Sirpalesaari island just a stones throw from the centre of Helsinki. The restaurant provides Finnish and archipelago specialities as well as magnificent views of the Gulf of Finland. The restaurant seats 200 guests in the dining room, 22 guests in the Belvedere balcony, 12 guests in the private room Sampo and about 75 guests on the sunny outdoor terrace. The restaurant can also be booked for bigger private parties. A connection boat serves the island every hour and half from the Saari pier located on the shore of Merisatama. The crossing (about 200 m) takes just a few minutes. Also a few docking spaces are available for quests arriving at the restaurant aboard their own boats. OPEN: 1.5.- 2.10.
item.matko:location: City centre 3km, airport 23 km
item.matko:open: In May and September: Mon-Sat 16.30-23 and Sun 16.30-22, June-August: Mon-Sat 12-23, Sun 16.30-22
item.matko:disabled: Stairs to the boat, assistant and lifting needed. An asphalted, evenly rising walk from the pier to the restaurant. Access with wheelchair to the outdoor terrace, bar Pursi and the private room Sampo. Stairs to the restaurant. No Inva-WC.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Finnish restaurant, summer restaurant, open 30.4.-30.9., dining room 180 seats, Belvedere balcony 22 seats, private room Sampo for 12 persons, Jacht bar for 25 persons, outdoor terrace for 75 persons. A la carte, dinners, lunches for groups, private parties, crayfish parties, food prepared using only Finnish ingredients, boat connection 200 m/3 min.

item.title: Restaurant Saaristo
item.description: Restaurant Saaristo is a beautiful summer restaurant, located on a small island "Luoto - Klippan" near Kaivopuisto. During summer, restaurant Saaristo operated by A&S Restaurants offers high-quality lunch on weekdays, á la carte dinner on evenings and Sunday brunch. Ferry from the pier close to the Olympic terminal.
item.matko:location: Located on the islet Luoto off Kaivopuisto shore. City centre 5 min, airport 35 min
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant's capacity for sit-down functions is max 430 people. As a venue for summer weddings and other summer parties, Luoto is one of Helsinki's best.

item.title: Restaurant Saslik
item.description: At Saslik you can enjoy the generous delicacies of Russian kitchen and the atmosphere of Czarist Russia. For 40 years Saslik has uncoved the secrets of the Russian soul - rich with tradition, atmosphere and hospitality. It is the most legendary Russian restaurant in Helsinki. 2 dining rooms and 8 romantic private rooms offer unforgettable surroundings for meetings, business lunches or festive dinners. The à la carte menu includes diverse selection of traditional Russian delicacies, including also rare bear dishes. Russian troubadours perform Wednesday-Saturday nights both in dining rooms as well as in private rooms. The troubadours can also be reserved privately. Theme nights like the Catherine the Great's Party by appointment.
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km (trams 3B, 3T, 10), airport 21 km
item.matko:open: Mon-Sat 12-23, Sun closed, June-August Mon-Sat 18-23, Sun closed.
item.matko:disabled: Access by wheelchair. No separate Inva-WC. Toilets not possible to access by wheelchair.
item.matko:groups: Group menus can be found on the webpages of the restaurant.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Russian restaurant, 230 seats, 2 dining rooms & 8 private rooms for 2-50 persons, meetings, lunches, dinners, private parties, à la carte, live Russian music (Wed-Sat nights), open on Sundays, special dinners for private groups: Catherine the Great party.

item.title: Restaurant Savotta
item.description: Savotta's authentic logging site atmosphere and distinctive servings are both inspired by the rich Finnish forests, thousands of lakes, the world famous Finnish "sisu" and strong traditions. The à la carte menu includes Finnish fishes, game specialities and traditional Finnish dishes. All dishes are prepared by our chefs using only the finest Finnish ingredients. The restaurant has 60 seats downstairs, 12 seats in the upstairs private room and 40 seats in the outdoor summer terrace. Savotta is located in the center or Helsinki - by the Senate Square, opposite side of the Cathedral. Restaurant is open every day of the year.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 30 min
item.matko:open:
Mon-Sat 12-23, Sun and Public Holidays 17-22
Savotta is open daily, also during Christmas and Midsummer.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Finnish restaurant, 70 seats, summer terrace for 40 persons, dowstairs dining room for 60 persons, a private room for 12 persons, à la carte, dinners, lunches, private parties, food prepared using only Finnish ingredients.
item.matko:services: 70 seats, approx. 50 downstairs and approx. 20 upstairs. There is also a summer terrace with 40 seats.

item.title: Restaurant Savoy
item.description: Restaurant Savoy has been at the very top of Helsinki's restaurant scene since the 1930's. Field marshal Mannerheim (or "Marski") was among the most well-known regulars, and his favorite dishes can still be found on the menu - from the vorschmack and pike perch a la Mannerheim to his filled-to-the-rim favorite shot. The milieu created by world-renown architect Alvar Aalto sets the scene for an elegantly timeless dining experience. Savoy was chosen Restaurant of the year 2007 by La Société des Gastronomes Finlandais .
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:additionalinfo: Restaurant Savoy is also a popular location for special occasions. The second floor is reserved exclusively for private parties - from intimate soirees to press/educational conferences, and even receptions of up to 120 people. There are six private rooms of a variety of size, that can also be opened up into a single space.

item.title: Restaurant Savu
item.description: Restaurant Savu, situated on Tervasaari Island, next to Kruununhaka, is located in building built in 1805 as a tar storage. At Savu all appetizers and main courses are smoked with various methods or seasoned with smoke aromas. The dining room seats 90 guests and in the storehouse loft there are two private rooms for 32 and 28 persons. In summer, the outdoor terrace seats 170 persons and on the storehouse balcony there are some smaller tables for 2 persons. The historical storehouse provides a unique milieu for meetings and bigger private events.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 35 min

item.title: Restaurant Seurasaari
item.description: Taste some of the delicious sandwiches, salads and pastries available at the cafe or enjoy the sea view on the outdoor terrace. At the old ball room "1890" & cabinets also delicious à la carte specialities are offered in a unique restaurant milieu. Restaurant Seurasaari was elected the HelsinkiMenu restaurant of year 2012.
item.matko:open: Café open from 1.9. Sat-Sun 11-17. The restaurant is open only for orders during the winter season.

item.title: Restaurant Sipuli
item.description: The Sipuli Restaurant is set in a restored brick warehouse. The kitchen at Sipuli Restaurant is renowned for its combination of Nordic traditions and new international cuisine. The restaurant has a versatile facilities which makes it one of the most popular choices for conferences and banquets in Helsinki. Rooms can be combined to meet specific needs and spacious banquet hall is fully equipped for meetings, conferences and corporate training events. The large and bright Winter Garden can accommodate even the largest banquets and cocktail parties.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 8 cm) along the path, essential access, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted.
item.matko:groups: Groups are requested to order a single set menu five business days before their reservation.
item.matko:restaurantinfo:
Á LA CARTE: The spacious à la carte restaurant with an open kitchen is located at the heart of Restaurant Sipuli. A large skylight window offers a splendid view of Uspenski Cathedral. Max. seats for 110 persons. Suitable for private lunch and dinner parties 50-100 persons. WINTERGARDEN: Complete with a glass ceiling, stretches for over 400 m2. It provides an excellent setting for special occasions. THE BANQUET HALL: Built in the spirit of the old storehouses it now replaces - a spacious and versatile hall for meetings and banquets. BAR KANAVA: Bar Kanava with its maritime atmosphere provides a comfortable street level space for more informal gatherings for 30-110 persons.
PRIVATE ROOMS II-FLOOR (4): Private rooms decorated in light colours separated only by partition walls can easily combined into one 98 m2 hall.

item.title: Restaurant Skiffer
item.description: Trendy restaurant Skiffer combines dining, great drinks and ultimate comfort into one perfect package. The unique atmosphere consists of an eclectic combination of modern design and traditional maritime elements.
item.matko:open: 30.4.-31.5. only during weekends 10-20 (subject to weather condition), 1.6.-31.8. Mon-Thu and Sun 11-22, Fri-Sat 11-24, 1.9.-31.9. only during weekends 10-20 (subject to weather condition) 10-20

item.title: Restaurant Sundmans Krog
item.description: Situated on the ground floor of the Sundmans building opposite the Old Market Hall, Sundmans Krog is an ideal venue for get-togethers, parties and fine dining. The atmosphere is pleasantly relaxed, and the menu features exquisite seafood as well as international dishes. With its central location, Sundmans Krog is a nice place to eat and meet friends. The restaurant also features the Helsinki Menu.

item.title: Restaurant Suomenlinna Brewery
item.description: Restaurant Suomenlinna and the Brewery pub in the Jetty Barracks welcome you to taste local beers next to the ferry boat harbour. Built in 1870, the arched dining room offers possibilities for events such as banquets, cocktail parties and conferences. Conference room with sea view. Additional space in the sunny garden during the summer months.
item.matko:location: City centre 3km, with a ferry boat 15 minutes from the Market Square, airport 22 km
item.matko:disabled: Fully accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted, easier entry from the inner yard of the building.
item.matko:groups: Open for groups outside opening hours.
item.matko:services: Local beers. Lunch buffet, dinner.

item.title: Restaurant Suomenlinnan Upseerikerho
item.description: The sauna at the officers' club has a lounge equipped with a fireplace. The facilities cater for a maximum of 15 people. The sauna is usually only rented to members, but on Wed-nesdays and Thursdays it is available for non-members to rent. It is possible to order food and drinks to be delivered to the sauna from the restaurant.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 22 km

item.title: Restaurant Särkänlinna
item.description: Restaurant Särkänlinna is located in a fortress on the island of Särkkä. It has beautiful views towards Helsinki and to the open sea. The Särkänlinna high quality à la carte restaurant, immemorial history and atmosphere make time stand still in the most pleasant of ways; here you can savour every moment. The kitchen of the Särkänlinna restaurant combines French and Finnish traditions spiced up with some Russian influences. The connection boat departs from the Ullanlinna pier in Kaivopuisto park.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: 130 - 150 can be seated in the high class a la carte restaurant. In Piper Hall's restaurant open on order there is space for max. 130 people.

item.title: Restaurant Teatteri
item.description: Restaurant-club-café. An interesting restaurant complex, including a 22-metre-long bar. Age limit: 24.
item.matko:open: Wine & Deli: Mon-Thu 9-22, Fri 9-23, Sat 11-23. Teatterin Grilli Restaurant: Mon-Thu 11-24, Fri 11-01, Sat 11-01. Teatterin baari Bar: Mon-Thu 11-01, Fri-Sat 11-03. Clock Bar: Wed-Sat 16.30-04. Nightclub: Thu-Sat 23-04.

item.title: Restaurant Tori
item.description: An intimate local bar/restaurant that is always popular, especially on weekends. Serves both Finnish and international dishes.
item.matko:open: Mon-Thu 10-24, Fri 10-01, Sat 12-01, Sun 12-22. Age limit 18years.

item.title: Restaurant Torni
item.description: Restaurant Torni was established in 1931, the same year that the adjoining hotel was opened. The restaurant was fully renovated in 1995 in the true original classic style of the building, Finnish functionalism. Torni is known for its food, the menu features trendy dishes created using traditional Finnish ingredients. The restaurant was voted Best HelsinkiMenu restaurant in both year 2000 and 2004. Helsinki Menu is also served here. In the same building also the Ateljee Bar, very famous for its magnificent view over the city (entrance via the hotel main entrance on Yrjönkatu side)

item.title: Restaurant Troikka
item.description: Welcome and experience the unique atmosphere of this beautifully decorated restaurant. People like to call Troikka "the friendly Russian". When entering the restaurant you can immediately sense why. The warm atmosphere in the restaurant makes you feel welcome and invites you to enjoy the most delicious dishes of the Russian kitchen.
item.matko:open: The kitchen is open tue - fri 17 - 22:30, sat 14 - 22:30. Closed sun - mon. The restaurant is on summer holidays from midsummer until the second week of august.
item.matko:disabled: Access by wheelchair. No separate inva-wc. Toilets not possible to access by wheelchair.
item.matko:groups: The restaurant can serve larger groups outside opening hours when requested

item.title: Restaurant Töölönranta
item.description: The Töölö Bay's unique park atmosphere combined with modern Finnish architecture and design provide very special surroundings. The Restaurant Töölönranta offers well-lighted and comfortable seating that can be flexibly arranged for special occasions. The Töölönranta is ideal for summer cocktail parties.
item.matko:location: City centre 1.5 km, airport 19 km

item.title: Restaurant Uunisaari
item.description: An attractive, fully-licensed restaurant, a café with a sun terrace and three saunas on an island off Kaivopuisto Park. The main building was renovated in 1999 under the supervision of the National Board of Antiquities. Red brick walls creating a warm and festive atmosphere. Open all year round. Ferry from Merisatamantori.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Dining room for 120 persons, café for 60 persons, terrace for 250 in summer
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: 2 function rooms from 18 to 100 persons
item.matko:additionalinfo: Beach and rocks popular with sunbathers, 3 saunas for 8, 10 and 15 persons

item.title: Restaurant Vespa
item.description: Vespa is an Italian restaurant in the city centre, next to the Esplanade park. The second floor restaurant has large windows towards the park. Bar & Deli on the ground floor is open from early morning until late night. From the Deli it is also possible to take away. Trattoria in the cellar is a cosy cellar restaurant which is suitable also for bigger groups. In summer season there is an additional outdoor terrace in front of the Bar & Deli.
item.matko:open: Vespa Ristorante 2nd floor: Mon 11-23, Tue-Fri 11-24, Sat 13-24, Sun 14-23. Bar & Deli: Mon 8-24, Tue-Thu 8-01, Fri 8-02, Sat 10-02, Sun 14-23. Trattoria: Tue-Sat 17-24

item.title: Restaurant Viola
item.description:
The wooden Empire-style villa on Kaisaniemenranta nestles in the botanical gardens and embodies a fascinating era in Helsinki's history. Finnish vineyard products, a light summery lunch, sweet and savory baked goods, and the enchanting gardens opening up in front of you create as unique café experience.
The welcoming old-world atmosphere of Viola is a lovely setting for a special occasion. Viola is in an old, neo-classical timber building that has been completely restored. It is a cozy yet festive setting that is inspiring and set in park-like surroundings. Viola has a main restaurant hall and adjoining smaller rooms that can accommodate up to 60 dinner guests at a time.
item.matko:location: A short walk from the railway station through the Kaisaniemi park

item.title: Restaurant Vltava
item.description: Czech Restaurant in three floors for both dining as for an evening with friends at the pub. Music club Muzika Vltava plays live music on Wednesdays. Muzika Vltava offers music from soul to pop and rock.

item.title: Restaurant Walhalla
item.description: Restaurant Walhalla is a gourmet restaurant located on the historic grounds on the fortified southern edge of the Kustaanmiekka isle, Suomenlinna. The restaurant offers, besides the beautiful surroundings of its main dining hall caponiere Delwig, also a bar, a stunning sea view terrace and the Pizzeria Nikolai. The restaurant is open from the First of May till the crayfish season in autumn. The restaurant is open for orders all year. In summertime the JT-Line waterbus takes you directly to the King's Gate, close to Walhalla. From the HKL public transport ferry pier (all year) it is an approx. 1,5km walk. Both ferries depart from the Market square.
item.matko:location: 20 minutes by boat from the Market Place
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, 3 steps, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, level differences but also ramps inside the restaurant.
item.matko:restaurantinfo:
Caponieres Delwig & Boije The caponiere Delwig is the beautiful main dining hall of the restaurant, its windows made out of the former loopholes. Walhallas cabinet, Boije, is located in the caponiere which it's named after.
The Castle square offers more spacious surroundings for bigger celebrations.
Delwig seats 180, Boije 40 and the Castle square (in tents) up to 250 diners. Please phone for further details on reservations.
item.matko:services: Open by appointment for lunch and on Sundays

item.title: Restaurant Wellamo
item.description: A charming traditional Finnish restaurant offering food for body and soul since 1975. The luch menu changes daily. The restaurant is also an art gallery.
item.matko:open: Tue-fri 11-14 and 17-23. Sat 17-23, Sun 13-20. Closed on Mondays.

item.title: Restaurant Yläkerho/Restaurant of the Suomenlinna Petty Officers' Association
item.description:
Traditional Finnish petty-officers' club dating back to 1920. The summer terrace has a wonderful view of the sea and the city centre of Helsinki.
There are sauna facilities in connection with the restaurant, suitable for six people at a time. The lounge with the fireplace can seat up to 16 people. For more space, the Messi cabinet room can be booked. The restaurant offers a special sauna menu.
item.matko:location: City centre 3km, airport 22 km

item.title: Restaurant Zetor
item.description: Zetor is a legendary Finnish restaurant where you sit among tractors and other countryside memorabilia. Big portions of Finnish home cooking.
item.matko:open: Open daily. See opening hours from Zetors webpages.

item.title: Restroom Karaokebar
item.description: Karaokebar build to an old public toilet.

item.title: Riihitie block of flats
item.description: Block of flats planned by Alvar Aalto in 1952-1954.
item.matko:ingress: Block of flats planned by Alvar Aalto.

item.title: Rikhardinkatu Library
item.description: Library, exhibition hall

item.title: Ril's Shop
item.description: Ril's is a total clothing concept for a modern woman. The collection includes coordinated collections for both everyday use and celebration. The collection emphasizes timeless elegance, clear lines and modern thinking. The collection has merited several design prizes during its existence.

item.title: Ristorante Gastone
item.description: Italian restaurant in the city centre

item.title: Ristorante Prego
item.description: Ristorante Prego is a cosy Italian restaurant in the very heart of Helsinki. The service is fast and friendly - even in the busiest lunch time.
item.matko:location: In the city centre

item.title: Robert's Coffee
item.description: Robert's Coffee is the largest coffee shop chain in the Nordic countries. The selection of Robert's Coffee includes pure original coffees, own blends, espressos, flavoured coffees, decaffeinated coffees and a wide selection of teas. Some of the Robert's Coffee "netcup" coffee shops offer also free internet access for their customers, eg. at Kamppi shopping centre (also WLAN), the Olympic terminal (also WLAN) and Stockmann department store. See the other coffee shops on the webpages www.robertscoffee.com

item.title: Russian Scientific and Cultural Centre
item.description: Cultural centre presenting films, exhibitions etc.

item.title: Rutumin Kartano Ky
item.description: Rutumi Manor, originally built in 1794 evokes the spirit of the past. Manor is located 90 km from Helsinki. The hostess of the manor introduces the interesting history of the manor and after that you'll enjoy manor's traditional Finnish delicious buffet table which is served in the former bakery-room, including a shot of traditional Rutumi schnapps.

item.title: Ruutu-Rouva
item.description: High-quality vintage clothing

item.title: Ryhmäteatteri
item.description: Performances in Finnish, summer theatre in Suomenlinna.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed, Inva-WC. Please notify in advance since only 2 Inva places available per performance.
item.matko:groups: School groups 10-12€.
item.matko:services: Box office open weekdays 11-14, tel. 09-718 655. Café-bar open 1 h before performances, also in interval. Coffee and pastry 3-5€. 300 seats in Pengerkatu, 450 in Suomenlinna.

item.title: Ryijypalvelu
item.description: Specialized in handmade "ryijy" wallrugs.

item.title: Rymy-Eetu
item.description: A Bayern - Finnish restaurant at Erottaja, where the music plays and beer flows. Rymy-Eetu has live music, drink chants, retro food, good laughs, day beers and long lunches. So a great May Day - atmosphere every day. Prost!
item.matko:open: Sun-Tue 11-03, Wed-Sat 11-04. Lunch Mon-Fri 11-14, breakfast daily at 11-18, age limit 20years.

item.title: Rööperin taidesalonki
item.description: art gallery
item.matko:open: Tue-Wed 12 - 17, Thu 16 - 20, Fri klo 12 - 17 ant Sat-Sun 12 - 16.

item.title: S-galleria
item.description: Art exhibitions.

item.title: Salmi
item.description: Salmi is a popular outdoor recreation area. Salmi covers 860 hectares.
item.matko:location: All buses from Helsinki Bus Station that go up Vihdintie, enquiries Matkahuolto, tel. +358 (0)200 4000 and www.matkahuolto.fi
item.matko:services: Parking lot, information boards, café, hut with fireplace, grill shelter, saunas, caravan area, camping site, shower and WC, cooking shelters, bathing site, playgrounds, ball field, outdoor recreation routes, fishing

item.title: Salutorget
