item.description: In May 2009 a new restaurant was opened next to the Market Square in the oldest genuine bank hall in Finland designed by Emil Fabritius. Salutorget is a restaurant complex with a restaurant and bar.

item.title: Salvation Army Museum
item.description: The Salvation Army Museum depicts the history and present of the Finnish Salvation Army.

item.title: Salve
item.description: The restaurant, that has been operating already in the 19th century as a seamens bar, is nowadays a relaxed dinner restaurant where both artists, professors, businessmen as well as ordinary working people enjoy the atmosphere and classic dishes, eg. the Salve's fried herring.

item.title: Sampo Puppet Theatre
item.description: High-class puppet theatre and temporary exhibitions of art and theatre puppets.
item.matko:location: Two minutes' walk from Puotila metro station.
item.matko:open: Open in winter weekdays 9-16 and one hour before the start of performances, in summer by arrangement.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, please notify beforehand tel. 09-323 6968.
item.matko:groups: School groups and guided children's groups 6€/hlö. Guide can be booked (Finnish, English, Serbo-Croatian, Czech).
item.matko:services: Café only open in conjunction with occasional performances. Plenty of free parking space. Puppet theatre material on sale.
item.matko:ingress: High-class puppet theatre and temporary exhibitions of art and theatre puppets.

item.title: Samuji Shop
item.description: SAMUJI is a new fashion label created by the former Marimekko creative director Samu-Jussi Koski. Samuji Collection comprises of two individual lines: classics and seasonals. Classics consist of timeless, high-quality garments whereas Seasonals is more experimental and trendy.

item.title: Satkar
item.description: Nepalese cuisine Satkar was founded in 1998 and is well known for its food and friendly service.

item.title: sato HotelliKoti Kristianinkatu
item.description: sato hotelhome is your choice when you need quality accommodation, 4 nights onwards, in downtown Helsinki. you will be living in totally renovated apartments that are fully furnished and equipped with complete kitchen. modern electronic appliances are also found from the apartments. our service includes weekly and end -of- stay cleaning, bed linen and towels, wireless internet connection.
item.matko:location: Helsingin keskusta, Kruunuhaka
item.matko:admission: Varies accoding to flat type and lengt of stay. Prices starts from 93€/ night in short accommodation in single room apartment.

item.title: SATO Hotellikoti Oy
item.description:
SATO Hotelhome is your choice when you need quality accommodation, 7 nights onwards, in downtown Helsinki. You will be living in totally renovated apartments that are fully furnished and equipped with complete kitchen. Modern electronic appliances are also found from the apartments. Our service includes weekly and end-of-stay cleaning, bed linen and towels, wireless internet connection.
Located in the central Kruununhaka district of Helsinki, the Kristianinkatu 11-13 building was renovated in spring 2013. All of the apartments are stylishly decorated with respect for the original spirit of the building, which was constructed in the 1930s. Click on the links above to see pictures of the apartments and their floor plans. Our service includes weekly and end-of-stay cleaning, changes of bed linen and towels as well as a free wireless internet connection.
Kristianinkatu 11-13 is located in the heart of Helsinki in the peaceful Kruununhaka district, which is one of the most prestigious and sought-after areas in the city. You will find lots of small grocery shops and boutiques as well as restaurants in the neighbourhood. Helsinki's main railway station is within a pleasant walking distance and so are the city's most important attractions, such as the Helsinki Cathedral and the Market Square. Kristianinkatu also provides you with easy access to Helsinki's seaside pleasures. Read more on how to get there and local services.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 35 min
item.matko:accomodationinfo: The apartment building includes 77 apartments ranging from 27m2 up to 73,5m2 in size. Apartments feature complete kitchen and modern electronic appliances. Doors are equipped with electronic locks, thus keys are not needed.

item.title: Sauna Arla
item.description: Sauna Arla, founded in 1929, has a long tradition in public saunas in Helsinki. One of the three remaining public saunas in Helsinki the sauna is heated by natural gas and wood.
item.matko:admission: 10€/person, students and senior citizens 8€, children with accompanying adult free of charge.
item.matko:services: Cupping and massage upon request. Also towels, bath whisks and refreshments available. It is possible to bring ones own refreshments.

item.title: Sauna-Aitta Shop
item.description: Sauna-Aitta Shop offers hundreds of Finnish sauna/bath items and sauna gift ideas! Buckets, ladles, Finnish linen textiles for bath and sauna, thermometers, hygrometers, natural sauna scents, body-care items, sauna/bath soaps, accessories and items for interior design.
item.matko:location: Kamppi

item.title: Saunamarket Finland
item.description: Everything for the sauna.
item.matko:location: Kiseleff House

item.title: Saunas at Rastila
item.description: Rastila Camping Helsinki has three cosy saunas that can be rented: two small family saunas and a larger seaside sauna with fireplace inside and a barbecue place outside. All saunas are in use all year round. Beach sauna and family sauna II are located near the sea, possibility to swim all year round.
item.matko:location: At Rastila Camping in Vuosaari district, Rastila metro station.

item.title: Saunasaari - Sauna Island
item.description: Saunasaari is an island reserved mainly for groups and corporate hospitality. Three "smoke" saunas.
item.matko:groups: Groups: 4-40 persons.
item.matko:services: Transport can be arranged beforehand by taxi-boat or waterbus. Refreshments to order, bathers should bring any alcoholic beverages they wish to drink.

item.title: Savoy Theatre
item.description: The Savoy Theatre, run by the City of Helsinki Cultural Office, provides a stage for numerous Finnish and foreign artists. In addition, many events of the leading City festivals are arranged at the Savoy theatre. Joint productions and the Cultural Office's own productions are also held here. Over 200 visiting performances every year. Music, dance and theatre performances. 705 seats. Exhibitions in the foyer.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:open: Box office is open during theatre season Mon-Fri 12-14.30 and 15-18, during evenings and weekends 1hour before the performance.
item.matko:disabled: Seats with wheelchair on the 5th and 6th row. Inva-WC, ramps on the stairs for the entrance to the stalls.
item.matko:services: The box office also sells all tickets sold by the Lippupalvelu (www.lippupalvelu.fi) ticket office. Restaurant Katsomo tel +358-(0)9-6128 5350 or www.royalravintolat.com.

item.title: Scandic Continental Helsinki
item.description: The Scandic Continental hotel is located only a short walk away from the city centre of Helsinki. It is the perfect base for exploring Helsinki attractions, such as the Olympic Stadium, Linnanmäki Amusement Park or Sea Life Underwater World. You can also enjoy ballet and opera performances in the nearby Opera House or go see a concert in the Stadium. Helsinki's best shopping streets and restaurants are also situated within walking distance.
item.matko:location: City Centre 1,5 km, airport 18 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, 4 handicapped parking spaces in front of the hotel, disabled entrance, doors can be opened automatically, no threshold at the entrance, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors open automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted (there is no buttons marked in Braille or any voice announcement in the lift), lighting intensity 50-150 lux, lift buttons and buffet breakfast bar are accessible from a wheelchair, no inva rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 514 rooms, of which 12 suites
item.matko:restaurantinfo:
Bar Continents, 120 seats: A cosy bar where one can enjoy classic cocktails, get together to discuss the day's topics after a long round of meetings and relax with a glass of beer or sparkling wine.
Restaurant Lastu, 200 seats. Menu and wine list can be found at www.scandickeittio.fi.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Ballroom 511 m2, Nordica 379 m2, Fennica 230 m2.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Own Finnair/oneworld Check In, hotel packages including limousine service, Business Centre, sauna and swimming pool, well-equipped gym with Turkish sauna, Ambassador lounge exclusively for guests in Ambassador rooms.

item.title: Scandic Espoo
item.description: The hotel features 96 rooms, most of which are non-smoking. Rooms with disabled access available. Sofa beds in some rooms. Some rooms with connecting door. All rooms have wood floors, air-conditioning, TV and Radio, minibar, telephone, modem and fax points, wireless internet access, safe, ironing board and iron. Bathrooms are equipped with underfloor heating, a hairdryer and an illuminated mirror. Easy access internet point at the lobby area. 24 h SHOP at the lobby area with food & drink, books, toys, gifts, games and products to help you relax.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 13 km, airport 25 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, handicapped parking spaces 20 meters from the hotel, steep ramp in path essential for access - gradient over 40 %, doors can be opened automatically, there are no level differences or threshold at the entrance, lift; essential for access, lift doors open automatically, lift buttons are accessible from a wheelchair, easy access for blind or partially sighted (there is buttons marked in Braille, but not any voice announcement in the lift), 1 inva room.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 96 rooms: 68 twin rooms, 23 double rooms and 5 single rooms.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Colonial Bar & Kitchen has 220 seats. The summer terrace provides an additional 80 seats. Part of the restaurant is separable for 80 guests, and a private room for 12 is available. Buffet Breakfast, lunch and á la carte dinner. Room Service during restaurant opening hours.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Meeting breaks at the restaurant Colonial or in the Meeting room.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Indoor swimming pool 12 m, 4 saunas, outdoor terrace. Exercise bike, stepper and rowing machine. Bikes and Nordic walking poles can be borrowed at the reception.

item.title: Scandic Grand Marina
item.description: Scandic Grand Marina presents unique architecture by the sea and charms with its milieu and scenery. Scandic Grand Marina and Marina Congress Center are located nearby the Market square and all the facilities of the Helsinki city centre are only a short walk away. Scandic Grand Marina and Marina Congress Center offer splendid settings for successful meetings, congresses and events which can be arranged for even up to 2500 persons. In our saunas you can refresh before a long day or relax after having one.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 30 min
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, handicapped parking spaces 20 meters from the hotel, steep ramp - gradient over 22,5 %, doors can be opened automatically, no threshold at the entrance, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors open automatically, lift buttons are accessible from a wheelchair, easy access for blind or partially sighted (there is no buttons marked in Braille or any voice announcement in the lift), lighting intensity 50-150 lux, 8 inva rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 462 rooms: 20 Economy single rooms, 332 Standard twin rooms, 64 Standard twin rooms with sofabed, 26 Superior rooms, 20 Suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Makasiini Restaurant & Bar: The visitor entering the Makasiini Restaurant is greeted by an enchanting early 20th century milieu and nice view of the harbour. Lobby Bar & Key West Pub.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The hotel has 6 meeting rooms, complimented by 11 more in Marina Congress Center across the street.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: See Scandic Marina Congress Center.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Meeting rooms, Hair-dresser/barber, Scandic Shop, gym, garage, self service laundry, business corner, play area, free wireless internet access.

item.title: Scandic Marina Congress Center
item.description:
Scandic Marina Congress Center is a unique congress center located right in the heart of the city. Its waterfront location, only a short walk from Helsinki centre, makes Marina Congress Center an incomparable venue for conference and gala events. The magnificent sea view towards the Helsinki archipelago creates extra value throughout the year.
Marina Congress Center offers 11 meeting rooms with exceptionally flexible space solutions. The facilities are ideal for hosting conferences and congresses for 10-700 persons, also exhibitions and banquets for even up to 2500 people. The meeting rooms vary from spacious halls to a private dining room with seaside view. Accommodation of meeting guests is easily arranged in Scandic Grand Marina hotel across the street.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 35 min
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, parking for disabled, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, induction loop system for people with hearing aids.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Scandic Grand Marina opposite (462 rooms and 7 conference rooms).
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The international cuisine, prompt service and delicious meals are the assets of Scandic Marina Congress Center's restaurant services. The restaurant facilities are easily adapted to suit the client's needs. For instance the Restaurant can seat up to 250 persons and the Fennia halls can seat up to 500 person. A separate Marine Room overlooking the harbor can be divided off from the Restaurant hall as a superb venue for special occasions for up to 60 persons.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: 1st floor foyer 900 m2/gross, 300 m2/net; 2nd floor foyer 730 m2/gross, 275 m2/net.

item.title: Scandic Marski
item.description: Scandic Marski, a hotel with comfortable rooms, theme restaurant, street bar and friendly service. The hotel is located right in the heart of Helsinki, in the core of the city´s business, shopping and sights. Parking space for 100 cars in its own underground garage. The hotel has seven meeting rooms, all located on the first floor, suitable for meetings with 2-160 participants or other events for up to 300 people. The hotel's gym, three saunas, their comfortable lounge and the wide roof terrace provide well-earned relaxation after a long day. The entire cultural and leisure offering of the city is within walking distance.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, handicapped parking spaces in front of the hotel, doors can be opened automatically, there are no level differences or threshold at the entrance, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; lift doors open automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted (there is no buttons marked in Braille or any voice announcement in the lift), lighting intensity 50-150 lux, lift buttons and buffet breakfast bar are accessible from a wheelchair, 3 inva rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 289 rooms: 9 rooms with private sauna ja 6 suites with city view. - 47 king superior category - 6 queen room category - 59 queen superior category - 65 twin room category - 28 twin superior category - 39 single room category - 39 family superior category - 6 junior suites
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Marski Restaurant offers Grill & Chill tastes in a casual atmosphere from breakfast until late at night. The restaurant has 130 seats and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Many seasonal themes are served during the year. Marski Bar, with 85 seats and Brazilian-style Cofi, with 50 seats have a casual atmosphere, versatile variety of drinks along with snacks and pastries.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Private saunas, gym, business centre, garage, Scandic SHOP, free wireless internet access.

item.title: Scandic Paasi
item.description: Scandic Paasi, conveniently situated in the Helsinki city centre, is in an attractive location by the sea and benefits from good transport links. The area has several theatres and museums that offer unforgettable experiences for all culture lovers. Helsinki's main shopping streets and restaurants are just a stone's throw away from the hotel. In addition, the hotel has two exciting restaurants of its own, each with an inimitable style.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 25 min
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 170 rooms: 47 superior level rooms and one master suite, 11 rooms with private sauna, 43 with balcony, 16 rooms with kitchenette, all decorated in three different styles; "spectacular", "leisure" or "conscious".
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Four unique restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the congress centre: Graniittilinna, Paasiravintola, Paasin Kellari and Juttutupa.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Lobby bar, meeting rooms, well equipped gym, Scandic shop, free wireless internet access, panoramic sauna for groups, play area for children.

item.title: Scandic Simonkenttä
item.description: Scandic Simonkenttä combines modern design and Scandinavian architecture. The 360 modern rooms are furnished with environmentally friendly materials, yet making no compromises on comfort. The meeting rooms, all with plenty of light and equipped with modern technology, are suitable for meetings of two up to seminars of 80 people. The meeting rooms are all located on the ground floor, except Pavilion, which is a meeting room on the top floor. All rooms have large windows on at least one wall, allowing abundant natural light. The standard equipment in all meeting rooms includes overhead projector, screen and flipchart.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, doors can be opened automatically, there are no level differences or threshold at the entrance, there is a doorbell at night, which is accessible from a wheel-chair, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted (there is no buttons marked in Braille or any voice announcement in the lift), lift buttons and buffet breakfast bar are accessible from a wheelchair, 5 inva rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 360 rooms; 12 rooms with balcony and private sauna, 2 suites
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Simonkatu with 170 seats has a modern, young and airy interior with a relaxed international atmosphere. The restaurant offers the best of Nordic cuisine, prepared in open kitchen. The modern and airy Café Simonkatu with 100 seats serves small snacks, special coffees and cocktails. A sunny terrace with 60 seats is available in summer.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 3 saunas, gym, Scandic SHOP, business corner, free wireless internet access

item.title: Schooner Zangra
item.description: Kuunariristeilyt organise cruising trips in Helsinki area and archipelago. Schooner Zangra is a stable and confortable 57 footer oceangoing yacht, and she is designed and built in Finland. Day cruises for 12, overnight trips for 8 passangers.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Cabins for 8 people.
item.matko:services: Refresments; sandwiches, espresso, cappuccino and caffe latte for sale on board.

item.title: Schröder
item.description: Sells fishing and hunting supplies.

item.title: Schulmanin Taideliike
item.description: Art from the 18th and 19th century, also furniture and other objects

item.title: Sea Horse
item.description: A classic Finnish "artist haunt" restaurant serving traditional Finnish home style food. The restaurant dates back to 1934.
item.matko:services: NB! No table reservations by e-mail!

item.title: Sea Life Helsinki
item.description: Sea Life takes you on a voyage from the tropical oceans to the Arctic Sea, stopping at the Baltic Sea along the way. Discover strange and fascinating underwater worlds, home to crabs and starfish as well as sharks and rays. Visitors can step inside the ocean tank through a transparent tunnel. The exhibitions present many species whose environments are threatened by pollution and other environmental damage caused by humans. Helsinki's Sea Life is part of the pan-European Sea Life network. The aim is to enlighten visitors about the need for protecting the sea environment and the biggest threats, such as pollution and over fishing. New 2013: Turtle Shelter.
item.matko:location: Sealife Centre Helsinki is located next to the Linnanmäki Amusement Park. Trams 3B and 9 from city centre.
item.matko:open: Sealife is open daily (closed only on Christmas eve, and Christamas day), please see opening hours at www.sealife.fi
item.matko:admission: Adults 16€, children (3-14 years) 11€ (children under 3years free of charge).
item.matko:disabled: Accessible with wheelchair, some hight differences along the route, an assistant might be needed. Inva-WC (in café premises) and lift.
item.matko:groups: Group reservations and guidebooking, tel.+358 (0)9 5658 200, e-mail:info@sealife.fi . Group discount available for groups over 10persons. A well equipped class room and studymaterial for school groups.
item.matko:services: Gift shop, café, parking.
item.matko:ingress: Sea Life takes you on a voyage from the tropical oceans to the Arctic Sea, stopping at the Baltic Sea along the way.

item.title: Semifinal
item.description: Rock club and live music. Age limit: 18.
item.matko:address: Urho Kekkosen katu 6 (entrance from inner yard)

item.title: Senate Square
item.description: The Senate Square and its surroundings form a unique and cohesive example of Neoclassical architecture. The square is dominated by four buildings designed by Carl Ludvig Engel between 1822 and 1852: Helsinki Cathedral, the Government Palace, the main building of the University of Helsinki and the National Library of Finland. Helsinki Cathedral is arguably Finland's most famous and photographed building; it celebrated its 150th anniversary in 2002. The oldest stone building in Helsinki is the Sederholm House located on the southeast corner of the square.The main building of the City Museum can be found on the Sofiankatu museum street.
item.matko:location: In the heart of the city, in the corner of Unioninkatu and Aleksanterinkatu streets.
item.matko:open: The Cathedral on the Senate Square is open: Mon-Sun 9-18, during summer 9-24.
item.matko:ingress: Unique and cohesive example of Neoclassical architecture.

item.title: Serena Ski
item.description: Four slopes for skiers of different levels, a street slope and halfpipe and in addition two free lifts and a sledging track for children.
item.matko:location: Serena is next to the Korpilampi Hotel, at Lahnus, Espoo, 23 km from Helsinki. Bus 339 from Helsinki bus station platform 14.
item.matko:services: Ski rental (downhill skis, cross-country skis, snowblades, snowboards and snowshoes), ski service and ski school (www.serenahiihtokoulu.com). Serena villas, completed in 2004, provide high-level accommodation facilities for tourists. Serena also rents Aurinkolampi holiday villas in the immediate vicinity of the resort.

item.title: Serena Water Park
item.description: Great place for the entire family to enjoy the tropical warmth year-round, with terraced pools, massaging whirlpools, waterslides and a unique sauna section carved from the bedrock. Black Hole pipeslide, featuring sound and light effects. Outdoors there are carpet slides, rapids, a "Salt Sea", pipeslides and liana tower.
item.matko:location: Serena is next to the Korpilampi Hotel, at Lahnus, Espoo, 23 km from Helsinki. Bus 339 from Helsinki bus station platform 19.
item.matko:open: Open daily in June-July. At other times mainly during weekends and school breaks. Serena Ski:see www.serenaski.fi
item.matko:admission: All day ticket 24,50€, evening ticket (at 16-20) 20,50€, children under 4 years free of charge. Children under 10yrs only when accompanied by an adult. Also family tickets.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Services for groups and corporate guests upon request, tel. +358 (0)9 8870 550
item.matko:services: Granina cave restaurant, tel. 09-8870 5545. Signs at the main road, 1000 free parking slots. Serena Ski in winter. Serena cottages, inquiries tel.09-8870 550. hotel Korpilampi nearby.

item.title: SES Auditorio Ltd
item.description: Auditorium with 150 seats and foyer, where it is possible to arrange exhibitions and serve meals and cocktails.
item.matko:location: City centre 0.5 km, airport 35 min
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Foyer
item.matko:additionalinfo: Technical equipment: 35 and 16 mm filmprojectors, Dolbystereo sound, data/videoprojector, VHS, Beta SP and DVD players, slide projector, overhead projector, microphones, internet connection

item.title: Seurasaari Beach
item.description: In 1906 a bathing beach was built for the citizens on the west side of Seurasaari. It still has its old look from the years back. Women and men have separate sections. Nowadays the beach is a nudist beach, which everyone can enjoy two days a week, on these two days a swimming suite is obligatory. The nearby based sand beach is also a popular place to enjoy the sun.
item.matko:services: Swimming, winter swimming, cabin, toilet, showers, kiosk. The Seurasaari Open Air museum is located on the same island.

item.title: Seurasaari Open-Air Museum
item.description: The Seurasaari Open-Air Museum provides an insight into Finnish housing in days gone by and Finnish folk tradition. The buildings and interiors transferred to the Museum from the Finnish provinces reflect the life of crofters, peasants and gentry from the 18th to the 20th century. Guides in national costumes lead visitors back to the cottages and salons of former times during the summer season 15.6. - 15.8. The guided tour begins from the ticket kiosk daily, 12.00 in German, 13.00 in Finnish and in Swedish, 15.00 in English. The guided tour is included in the museum ticket. Craft demonstrations, concerts, Midsummer festivities.
item.matko:location: Bus 24 from Erottaja to the end of the bridge to Seurasaari or tram 4 to Pikku-Huopalahti from where a walk approx. 10 min.
item.matko:open: Seurasaari island is open all year. The open-air museum is open 15.-31.5. Mon-Fri 9-15, Sat-Sun 11-17; 1.6.-31.8. Mon-Sun 11-17, 1.9.-15.9. Mon-Fri 9-15, Sat-Sun 11-17.
item.matko:disabled: Accessability with wheelchair might be difficult, ramps can be installed to some houses (upon request), assistant needed. Permit to drive in the museum grounds from City of Helsinki Sports department (www.hel.fi/liv), Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Guidebooking, tel+358 (0)40-128 6374/+358 (0)9-4050 9660 or seurasaarenulkomuseo@nba.fi .Languages Finnish, Swedish, English, German. Group size max. 30pers (school-/ kindergarten groups max.25/20persons)
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Seurasaari (tel.+358 (0)9 626 625, www.sinunjuhlasi.fi). A beautiful, idyllic cafeteria built in 1880. Seating for 645.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Café Antin Kaffeliiteri, meals to order, seating for 50. Also Museum Shop tel. 09-4050 9662.
item.matko:services: Café Antin kaffeliiteri and museum shop, open as open-air museum. Restaurant Seurasaari (tel.+358 (0)9 626 625, www.sinunjuhlasi.fi). Also kiosks and a beach. Karuna church (inquiries from the open-air museum, tel.+358 (0)40 128 6374).
item.matko:ingress: The Seurasaari Open-Air Museum provides an insight into Finnish housing in days gone by and Finnish folk tradition.

item.title: Shaker
item.description: Shaker is an showcocktail-bar with an extensive drinklist and the best flair-bartenders in Finland.

item.title: Shopping Centre Forum
item.description: The city's oldest shopping centre, Forum, was completed almost 60years ago for the Olympics. In the last 25years the shopping centre has developed into a block of fashion and entertainment. In 2012-2014 Forum will be renovated, and will in the future concentrate on three themes: fashion, leisure and a versatile restaurant world.
item.matko:services: Parking hall P-Forum beneath the Forum shopping centre (www.forump.com). Entrance through Simonkatu and Eteläinen- & Pohjoinen Rautatiekatu. By foot also via Forum, Stockmann and Kamppi as well as Kalevankatu 3, Urho Kekkosen katu 1 and Fredrikinkatu 42 / Malminkatu 12.

item.title: Shopping Centre Jumbo
item.description: The shopping centre Jumbo is among the biggest ones in Finland. 4600 free parking spaces, a comprehensive nearly 120 specialty stores. Large grocery stores K-Citymarket and Prisma, department stores Stockmann and Anttila.
item.matko:location: Jumbo Shopping Centre is situated in Vantaa, Ring III, near Helsinki-Vantaa Airport

item.title: Shopping centre Ruoholahti
item.description: Shopping Centre Ruoholahti has over 20 shops and businesses under its' roof. Biggest enterprises are K-citymarket, K-rauta and Alko.
item.matko:location: Metro to Ruoholahti, bus 15A
item.matko:open: Public premises Mon-Fri 7-21, Sat 8-18, Sun 12-18, parking hall daily 6-22. Shops have own opening hours.
item.matko:services: Parking hall (over 1500 places), free parking for 3 hours for customers.

item.title: Sibelius Academy
item.description: The Sibelius Academy is the only music university in Finland and one of the biggest in Europe.

item.title: Sibelius Monument
item.description: In the Sibelius park is the world famous composer Jean Sibelius' (1865-1957) monument by Eila Hiltunen. It was unveiled 7.9.1967. The Sibelius Monument, recembling organ pipes, is made of welded steel with the bust of the composer on one side. The monument is one of Helsinki's most popular statues and one of the most well known tourist attractions. The monument is 8,5m high, 10,5m wide and 6,5m deep. It is built of over 600 pipes and weighs 24 tons.
item.matko:location: In Taka-Töölö, between Merikannontie and Mechelininkatu. Bus 24.

item.title: Sibelius Park
item.description: This park was named after Finland's greatest composer Jean Sibelius on his 80th birthday in 1945. A favourite destination for tourists is the Sibelius Monument designed by Eila Hiltunen.
item.matko:location: Mechelininkatu
item.matko:ingress: This park was named after Finland's greatest composer Jean Sibelius.

item.title: Sibelius Park Minigolf
item.description: 18 holes.
item.matko:location: Sibelius Park

item.title: Siltanen
item.description: The trendiest hipster-filled restaurant in the Kallio district. On weekends you can enjoy brunch - meat-eaters select the Berlin breakfast tray, while vegetarians choose the Buddha. In summertime you may eat outside on the sunny terrace away from the traffic. The restaurant plays club music every evening, plus live gigs on occasion.

item.title: Silvoplee
item.description: Specialized in raw unprocessed foods. Also warm vegan dishes.
item.matko:location: Next to Hakaniemi metro station

item.title: Sinebrychoff Art Museum
item.description: The Sinebrychoff Art Museum houses Finland's most significant collection of paintings by old foreign masters from the 14th to 19th centuries and an interior museum of Paul and Fanny Sinebrychoff illustrating Finland's connections to the centuries of tradition in European art and antiquities. Fine collection of miniatures, porcelain and silver. Also special exhibitions. The museum is a part of the Finnish National Gallery.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 20 km.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair, entrance to the museum from the gable of the building (inform museum in advance, tel.+358-(0)9-1733 6460), lift and Inva-WC. Assistance needed.
item.matko:groups: Guide booking, tel.+358 (0)9 1733 6460 (Tue-Fri 10-17). Languages Finnish, Swedish, English, German, French, Italian and Russian, also sign language and for the visually impaired.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Art Museum Sinebrychoff rents facilities both for corporate and private occasions. The Yellow salon (Salonki) on the 2nd floor seats approx. 30 persons. The arched cellar facilities (Holvisali) seat approx. 100 persons.
item.matko:services: Cafe Fanny (tel.+358 (0)50 414 3332), museum shop

item.title: Sinne
item.description: Art Gallery

item.title: Sir Eino
item.description: Sir Eino is a pleasant and cosy pub next to the Esplanade park.

item.title: Sis. Deli + Café
item.description:
Sis. Deli serves food made from local ingredients, delicious and healthy meals, also take-away. No artificial ingredients used.

item.title: Sisustusliike Zaza
item.description: Furniture and decorations for your home

item.title: Skatepark Micropolis
item.description: Micropolis is made out of granite, concrete, grass, bushes and trees. The main idea was to create a public skatepark that would offer an architectural experience for a regular citizen and would feel as a natural streetspot for a skater. Natural means that it would have its own character as permanent public space and wouldn't seem that it's built just for the skater.
item.matko:location: Trams 3T, 3B and 7A/B. Skatepark locates in the central park of Helsinki.

item.title: Skatta Hotel
item.description: Hotel Skatta is located in a beautiful, old area of Helsinki near the city centre.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, airport 18 km

item.title: Skybreakers
item.description: Sky Breakers has arranged bungy, stunt and adventure events since 1989, when the company was founded.
item.matko:location: Next to Cafè Ursula on the beach.
item.matko:services: Finland's highest bungee 150 m.

item.title: Sling In
item.description: The city's longest drink list and most skilled bartenders - over 900 drinks!
item.matko:address: Mikonkatu 8, 2nd floor (entr. from the inner yard)

item.title: SOFiNAH
item.description: SOFiNAH is packed with FiNE FASHiON STORiES, focusing on handpicked, functional and feminine designer clothes. Passion of the owners is to find new ethical labels with interesting cuts & materials of highest quality. Selection includes labels such as CamillaMikama, Norrback, Month of Sundays ja Jolier.

item.title: Sokos Department Store
item.description: Sokos offers the latest trends of the season, the most inspiring ideas and the most exhilarating fashion tips for dressing up, beauty, home and hobbies.

item.title: Solo Sokos Hotel Aleksanteri
item.description: The old building offers individual, high-quality rooms and many memorable details. For instance, the hotel boasts a Rock 'n Rose room, designed by Finnish rock music icon Remu Aaltonen, as well as burlesque art and Scandinavian design. Aleksanteri shows a classy collection of great styles. Individual, pleasantly surprising and always in tune with the times, the hotel's individual service has earned praise. The new Olipa kerran ... ('Once Upon a Time ...') restaurant features a menu of fresh, seasonal menu of delicacies honouring client wishes.
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km, airport 20 km. Located in the Helsinki Design District.
item.matko:disabled: 4 rooms for disabled, washroom for disabled. Easy entrance to hotel and restaurant.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 151 non-smoking rooms of which 126 standard and 21 superior. 8 family rooms, 4 rooms for disabled.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Fransmanni.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 1 private sauna for 12 people. Business Center, gym. Internet access through the TV set in all rooms. Alexander Theatre parking lot adjacent to hotel.
item.matko:services: The hotel houses the Olipa kerran restaurant and bar, as well as two meeting rooms. Guest sauna, gym

item.title: Solo Sokos Hotel Torni
item.description: Torni is a lively classic in the heart of Helsinki. As a Solo hotel, it is much more than a building and an address: it has unique character and personality. Torni's spirit is built on individual service, a comprehensive art experience and thousands of stories. Every room is a world of its own, with small details such as tile stoves, works of art and on bathtubs on claw foot pedestals. On the highest floors, impressive city views add a final touch. At the Torni Restaurant, delicious tastes meet striking visuality. The Ateljee Bar, American Bar and Irish-inspired O'Malleys are local meeting places, each with a special atmosphere of its own. Welcome to a classic with personality!
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 152 rooms: 36 single rooms, 69 double rooms, 27 superior rooms and 20 suites. All rooms feature an Internet connection over a wlan network. Part of the rooms feature a balcony.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Ravintola Torni, food culture since 1931. Trendy food from Finnish ingredients in nostalgic surroundings. Extensive wine list. Ateljee Bar, a tower with a view since 1951. Bar, terrace and a breathtaking view. Monthly art exhibitions on the premises. American Bar, a happy mixture of the 1930s and today. An international cocktail bar, ideal for an evening in style. O'Malley's Irish Pub, a wide selection of Irish beers in a genuine atmosphere. Live music two nights a week. Summer terrace on the inner yard.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 4 saunas.

Soul Vintage is a small, cosy boutique located in Kallio near the Sörnäinen metro station, offering a selection of clothes, accessories, interior design items and a small selection of vintage furniture. Available also a selection of new products and art from contemporary artists.
During summer season the shop offers also a possibility to rent vintage Jopo bikes from the 60's and 70's.

All StadiHome apartments are situated in the heart of Helsinki, in quiet surroundings. The apartments are cosy and fully equipped, with comfortable beds for two in all apartments. Bed linen is included in the price. Additional beds available at request.
In all apartments there is a TV, microwave oven, coffee machine and washing machine. Some of the apartments also have a dishwasher. Possibility for Broadband Internet connection in all apartments.

item.description: Stadion Hostel is magnificently set in Helsinki Olympic Stadium, in the center of Helsinki. The hostel offers you the best value in the town with the rates starting from €19,50 / night (17,50 Euros for HI-members). There are a few private rooms in the hostel, but mostly the hostel gathers travellers together to dormitories. Totally there is 162 beds in our hostel. Special group prices available. Stadion Hostel is first HI Quality certified hostel in Finland.

item.title: Stoa Cultural Centre
item.description: Stoa is a lively and varied culture centre for East Helsinki situated by the metro station in Itäkeskus, next door to the Itis Shopping Centre. The high quality events at Stoa attract visitors of all ages from all over Helsinki. Stoa's programme includes Finnish and international contemporary dance and circus, theatre, music, children's performances and exhibitions. Stoa's auditorium is one of the best venues for contemporary dance in Helsinki. City of Helsinki Cultural Office is responsible for events at Stoa.
item.matko:open: Mon-Thu 9am-8pm, Fridays 9am-6pm, Sat-Sun 10am-4pm. Closed on Sundays from May to August.
item.matko:disabled: Inva-WC, areas for wheelchair users in the auditorium.

item.title: Stockmann Department store
item.description: Located in the centre of Helsinki, the Stockmann department store offers a wide selection of products from foods to top fashion and electronics across 538,000 square feet of shopping space. An exhibition hall on the 5th floor features sales exhibitions on varying themes. This summer's exhibition, Feels like Finland, is dedicated to tourists and travellers, offering selected products from brands like Arabia, Iittala, Marimekko and Aarikka. On the 7th floor, a Visitor Centre provides visitors with advice and help on tax free issues. Opposite to the department store, on Keskuskatu, lies one of the largest bookstores in Europe, Akateeminen Kirjakauppa. Stockmann department stores can also be found in Itäkeskus, Tapiola and Jumbo in the greater Helsinki area.

item.title: Strindberg
item.description:
On the second floor is Strindberg à la carte, a restaurant which combines the ever-popular Nordic home cooking -"husmanskost"- with contemporary international flavours. The spacious bar, with its soft couches and lounge area, and its wide variety of cigars and magazines, has become a popular rendez-vous spot for many. Downstairs is the popular Café Strindberg.
Alakerrassa suosittu Café Strindberg.

item.title: Studio Aalto
item.description: Alvar Aalto designed the building at Tiilimäki 20 in Munkkiniemi as his own office in 1955. The building is only a short walk from Aalto's own house, where the office had previously been located. Because of a number of large commissions, the office needed more space to work in. Studio Aalto is one of the best of Alvar Aalto's 1950s buildings.
item.matko:open: During 1.10.-30.4. Tue-Sat at 11.30-12.30, entrance and guided tour at 11.30 NB! only one tour. During 2.5.-30.9. Tue-Sat at 11.30-13.30. item.title: Submarine Vesikko
item.description: The Military Museum's submarine Vesikko is a 250-ton coastal submarine of the Second World War. The only existing submarine from the Finnish fleet, which served under the name of Vesikko from 1936 to 1947. Vesikko saw action in convoys and on protection and patrol duty in the Gulf of Finland. The submarine base was located in the shipyard section of Suomenlinna.
item.matko:location: Suomenlinna Fortress, by ferry from the Market Square about 15 min.
item.matko:admission: Adults 5€, children (7-17 yrs), students and pensioners 3€, under 7 yrs free entry.

item.description: Hostel Karavaani, a family friendly summer hostel offers private rooms for 1-5 persons, bed places in a dormitory and family rooms. Self-service kitchens, indoor play facilities for children and a lounge.

item.title: Suomen Saunaseura - Finnish Sauna Society
item.description: Five wood-fired saunas by the sea, two "normal" and three "smoke", and an electric City Sauna. Room for 12 persons/sauna. Washroom, two changing rooms and a lounge with log fire (max. 40 persons). In winter swimming in pool in ice. PLEASE NOTE! FOR MEMBERS ONLY, NOT OPEN FOR PUBLIC!
item.matko:location: On Lauttasaari island, bus 20 from Erottaja.
item.matko:disabled: Please notify in advance.
item.matko:groups: Private sauna can be booked.

item.title: Suomenlinna Church
item.description: Suomenlinna Church was built as a Russian Orthodox garrison church in 1854 and was converted into an Evangelical-Lutheran church in the 1920s, when also the appearance of the church was changed. You are welcome to visit the church and to take part in our activities. The church also functions as a lighthouse.
item.matko:open: Wed-Sun 12-16, June-August Tue-Sun 12-16. No sightseeing during worships, weddings, funerals and such especially on Saturdays and Sundays.
item.matko:disabled: The church is accessible for wheelchair users, please call +358 9 2340 6126 in advance.

item.title: Suomenlinna Conference and Banquet facilities, Governing Body of Suomenlinna
item.description: In Suomenlinna sea fortress there are nine venues of different sizes and types available. The venues in the 18th century fortress and a Unesco World Heritage site are suitable for hosting variety of events such as seminars, conferences and banquets. The venues were originally part of the military fortification during the periods of Swedish and Russian rule, and were used as a gunpowder magazine, a granary, a church and a barracks. There is no public transportation on the island but all the venues are within walking distance from the main quay.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, ferry to city centre 15 min, airport 22 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: There are nine restaurants and cafés in Suomenlinna of which two are open all year round: Suomenlinna Brewery Restaurant 120, meeting room 20, garden 200 and Restaurant Café Chapman 90, cottage 100, terrace. Restaurant Walhalla (available for private functions in winter) 200, outside in tents 500. Cafés open in summer: Café Bar Valimo, Café Piper, Toy Museum Café, and Café Vanille.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Suomenlinna Museum.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Catering services, activity service, museums, guided walks, multivision show on the history of the maritime fortress.

item.title: Suomenlinna Maritime Fortress
item.description: Suomenlinna (Viapori/Sveaborg) fortress is one of the biggest sea fortresses in the world. Founded in 1748 and built by Augustin Ehrensvärd on islands off the coast of Helsinki. Suomenlinna one of the most popular attractions in Finland and a place where people live. It was included in Unesco's World Heritage List in 1991 as a unique monument to European military architecture. An important part of any visit to Suomenlinna is a good meal or a welcome break at one of the cafés. The fortress has a selection of restaurants and charming cafés. The Visitor Centre, situated in the middle of the fortress at Tykistölahti bay, is a base and information point for visitors and is the starting point for the walking tours. It also contains the Suomenlinna Museum exhibition. Suomenlinna is explored on foot. During the summer months there are daily guided tours in English, Swedish and Finnish around Suomenlinna. In the winter there are tours in English during the weekends.
item.matko:location: Just off the coast of Helsinki city centre. Public transport ferry (all year) or waterbus by JT-Line (in summer) from the Market Square. Traveltime approx.15min. Timetables www.hsl.fi & www.jt-line.fi
item.matko:open: Suomenlinna island is open all year round. Suomenlinna visitors centre and museum and some other services are open also during winter. No entrance fee for the island.
item.matko:admission: Public transport ferry:Suomenlinna ticket (return) 5€ adults/2,50€ child 7-16yrs or single ticket (from vending machine at the pier). Waterbus JT-Line in summer: return 7€/adult, 3,50€/child 7-16yrs.
item.matko:disabled: There are many cobbled sections of road on the islands, where the use of a wheelchair or baby carriage may be somewhat difficult.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours and programme for groups on request, Ehrensvärd Society, tel. +358-(0)9-684 1850, www.suomenlinnatours.com
item.matko:services: Eg. museums, cafés, restaurants, guided tours etc. Please see the Suomenlinna webpages for more information.
item.matko:ingress: Suomenlinna fortress is one of the biggest sea fortresses in the world.

item.title: Suomenlinna Museum
item.description: Suomenlinna Museum is situated in the old navy inventory chambers, which were built in the early 1780s. The permanent exhibition presents the construction of the fortress and the eventful history of the islands from the 18th century to the present day. The visitors can get to know the life of Swedish officers, Russian merchants as well as Finnish civil war prisoners, who all lived in the fortress. The museum also features temporary exhibitions and information about UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The wide-screen show Suomenlinna Experience offers spectators an excursion to the absorbing history of Suomenlinna. The show starts every 30 minutes. The Suomenlinna Visitor Centre hosts also the Suomenlinna Tourist Information
item.matko:location: In the Visitor Centre
item.matko:admission: 2011: Entrance fee (incl.widescreen show) adults 5€, students and seniors 4€, children under 18 years free.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair to the ground floor exhibition and to the widescreen show. Adapted WC, assistance needed. There is a lift in the building. (Please note! There are many cobbled road sections on the islands, where the use of wheelchair or baby carriage may be difficult.)
item.matko:groups: Entrance fee for groups 4€/pers. (min.10pers.) Guidebooking: +358 (0)9-4050 9691. Guided tours 44€/1h, museum opening fee outside opening hours 50€/h. Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English. School groups free entrance. Guided tours for school groups 20€/30min. or 40€/1h. Reservations for widescreen show tel. +358 (0)9 4050 9691. Several cafés and restaurants on the island. More information on Suomenlinna at www.suomenlinna.fi.
item.matko:services: A 25-minute Suomenlinna Experience widescreen show, commentary in seven languages: Finnish, Swedish, English, German, French, Russian, Japanese.

item.title: Suomenlinna Toy Museum
item.description: The Suomenlinna Toy Museum presents old toys, the oldest of which go back to the beginning of the 19th century. The newest toys are from the 1960's. The private collection features hundreds of old dolls, approximately one hundred antique teddy bears, and other toys full of history. The toys of the collection origin in Finland and they reflect the Finnish culture and game tradition. Of great interest are for example the toys and games of wartime. Café and museum shop.
item.matko:location: Suomenlinna Fortress, Iso Mustasaari. By ferry about 15 min.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed, steep uphill, Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: School and other groups, 10-40 persons, by arrangement, also outside opening hours. Group discount -10% when group min. 20 persons. Schoolgroups group discount -20% (min.10pers.). Group discount only when all tickets are purchased at one go.
item.matko:services: Café, open when museum is open. Toy Museum boutique shop sells genuine Steiff and Hermann teddy bears and Käthe Kruse dolls. There is also a wide selection of postcards.

item.title: Suomenlinna Visitor Centre
item.description: Suomenlinna Visitor Centre is conveniently located in the heart of the fortress, providing tourist information and also housing the Suomenlinna Museum. The information desk sells books, postcards and souvenirs. Guided walking tours also start from the Suomenlinna Visitor Centre.

item.title: Telakka Event Centre
item.description: The Telakka Event Centre is one of the biggest event facilities in Helsinki. It offers unique opportunities for dinners, cocktail parties and special events. The history if the property dates back to 1945 and it has served as a head quarter of a Finnish company as well as a shipbuilding dock.

item.title: Temppeliaukio Church
item.description: Quarried out of the natural bedrock, Temppeliaukio Church is one of Helsinki's most popular tourist attractions. The interior walls are created naturally by the rock. The church was designed by architects Timo and Tuomo Suomalainen and opened in 1969. Due to its excellent acoustics the church is a popular venue for concerts.
item.matko:open: Open during 1.9.-31.5. Mon-Sat 10-17, Sun 11.45-17. Open during 1.6.-31.8. Mon-Sat 10-17.45, Sun 11.45-17.45 Opening hours are subject to change as per church ceremonies.
