item.matko:ingress: Quarried out of the natural bedrock, Temppeliaukio Church is one of Helsinki's most popular tourist attractions.

item.title: Tero Saarinen Company
item.description: Tero Saarinen Company is one of Finland's leading cultural exports. The contemporary dance group has appeared in nearly 40 countries and its activities also include running an international teaching programme as well as creating and licensing Tero Saarinen's schoreographies for other prominent dance groups.

item.title: Texas Outback Bar & Grill
item.description: The new Texas Outback Bar & Grill has been opened in the city centre. The restaurant offers food, drink and live music. Live bands play at the first floor club and acoustic music is played every Wednesday at the ground floor bar.

item.title: The Aalto House
item.description: Aino and Alvar Aalto's home was completed in Riihitie Road, Munkkiniemi, Helsinki, in autumn 1936. In this as in their other works, the young architects combined modern and traditional thinking. The furniture, designed by the Aaltos, had already won international acclaim in the early 1930s, and the couple furnished their home with their own creations. The cosmopolitan atmosphere of the home is underlined by works of well known artists such as Le Corbusier, Alexander Calder and Poul Henningsen. The Aaltos' home has recently been lovingly restored and is now a home museum open to the public.
item.matko:location: Munkkiniemi, city centre 5 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:open: During 1.10.-30.11. and 1.2.-30.4., open Tue-Sun 13-17. Entrance and guided tour on the hour (last one at 16). During 1.5.-30.9., open Tue-Sun 13-18. In August daily at 13 -18. Entrance and guided tour on the hour (last one at 17). In December and January only by appointment. Max 20.pers/guided tour.
item.matko:groups: Groups only by appointment, e-mail:riihitie (at) alvaraalto.fi
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Service upon agreement. Dinners max for 10 persons in the dining room. Private celebrations like weddings and anniversary max for 50 persons.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: There are two separate spaces for holding meetings: the studio and the dining room with room for a maximum of 10 people.
item.matko:services: Museum shop

item.title: The auditorium of ETERA Mutual Pension Insurance Company
item.description: The auditorium of Etera Mutual Pension Insurance Company offers a comfortable facility for various occasions. The auditorium´s lobby can be used for serving snacks and beverages and arranging small exhibitions.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 15 km, Pasila railway station 0.5 km.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Fazer Amica Restaurant offers coffee, breakfast, lunch and buffet dinner for 100 persons and terrace for 70 persons.
item.matko:additionalinfo: State-of-the art audiovisual equipment, auditorium technician services and interpreting room are available.

item.title: The Cathedral Crypt
item.description: Venue for events and exhibitions
item.matko:services: Café Krypta open every day during summer, Mon-Sat 11-17, Sun 13-17

item.title: The Church of St. John
item.description: St. John's Church is designed in Neogothic style by the Swedish architect A. E. Molander and built in 1893. It is the biggest church in Helsinki and has excellent acoustics, making it a popular place for concerts of large choral works in particular.
item.matko:services: Helsinki Organ Summer concerts on Wed at 20

item.title: The Circus
item.description: A new night club in the city centre with six large bars. The night club also offers karaoke rooms (reservations in advance).

item.title: The Cygnaeus gallery
item.description: The Cygnaeus gallery is the oldest art museum in Finland (1882), built round the art collection which Professor Fredrik Cygnaeus donated to the nation. The basic exhibition consists of the 19th c. Finnish art, including paintings by Albert Edelfelt and Helene Schjerfbeck and sculpture by Walter Runeberg and Johannes Takanen among others. The items in the collection, supplemented through other donations, now number nearly 450 pieces, of which around 100 paintings, sculptures and drawings are permanently on view. Special exhibitions, concerts.
item.matko:admission: Adults 6,50€, students and pensioners 5€/person, children 7-17 years 2,50€, children under 7 years free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: No access with wheelchairs, assistant needed. Please notify in advance.
item.matko:groups: Entrance:5€/person (min. 10 persons). Guide booking, tel.+358-(0)40 128 6360. Languages: Finnish, Swedish and English.

item.title: the Funkiest
item.description: A record store specialized in hiphop, founded in 1995. Hiphop on CD, vinyl and cassette. A large selection of Finnish hiphop and rap music. Soul, funk & jazz on vinyl only.

item.title: The Helsinki Ice Hall
item.description: The Helsinki Ice Hall is suitable for diverse corporate events.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 4 cm) along the path, essential access, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, toilet for wheelchair users, parking for disabled above the ticket office from where also access to INVA-stand, access to lower floor only from outside, training field can be accessed with lift from behind the building, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux
item.matko:restaurantinfo:
Main Street, Sport Café, Beer restaurant, Big reds, lounge, Royal Club, Brewster's corner, Corner bar, 14 fast food outlets
Restel event restaurants sale service tel. +358 (0)9 733 5456, fax +358 (0)9 733 5435, e-mail: tapahtumaravintolat@restel.fi, www.tapahtumaravintolat.com
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Arena 2000 m2, Foyers 4000 m2, Training Hall 1800 m2
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Helsinki Ice Hall also hires out chairs, stages, floors etc.

item.title: The House of Municipalities
item.description: The Association of Finnish Local and Regional Authorities is located in Helsinki, in the district of Kallio, within 300 metres walking distance from Hakaniemi underground station. There are many hotels in the vicinity of the Association. The building has meeting and conference facilities.
item.matko:location: City centre 2,5 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Palmia takes care of the catering on-site.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Two saunas and a swimming pool. These facilities also include a conference room for 40 persons. Cocktail parties and similar events can be arranged in the sauna department.

item.title: The Lauri and Lasse Reitz Foundation Museum
item.description: The Lauri and Lasse Reitz Foundation Museum displays the art and antique collection of Lauri Reitz, one of the most renowned master builders of his time. The collector's wife, Maria Reitz, established the foundation in her will. Alongside her husband she wished to honour the memory of her son Lasse, who had died young. The home museum was opened to the public in 1971. It exhibits 19th century Finnish painting as well as handicraft from the 16th to the 19th century including silver and china items, arms and furniture.

item.title: The Left Shoe Company
item.description: Personalised shoemaking at its finest. Experience the quality, fit and comfort of a handcrafted custom made shoe, created just for you in 7 weeks.

item.title: The Light House
item.description: The Light House is a multipurpose centre owned by the Finnish Association of the Deaf, Finnish Federation of the Hard of Hearing and Service Foundation for the Deaf. The Light House is situated in Haaga and is easily accessible. The well-equipped auditorium has seats for 175 persons.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 km, airport 10 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant (advance bookings only), 130 seats
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The lobby can be used for exhibitions or presentations connected with the seminars.

item.title: The Macbeth Hall
item.description:
The Macbeth Hall´s rock walls, big glass paintings and dozens of candles creates an medieval ambience where customers can forget present-day and enjoy their evening. Grandiose meals and tasty wines with the ambience of the Macbeth Hall gives an remembrance never to be forgotten.
The Macbeth Hall is one undivided hall. Height is 4m and customer area 400m2. Capacity during dinner is 150 and 180 cocktail.
Estrade (6x5m) and light & audio system for speeches. Technique was hidden in order to preserve medieval atmosphere. Wares and equipments are easy to freight with elevator (3m long, 2000kg) that goes from street level to venue. You can bring your own goods or we can tailor an offer including only the services which you are externalizeing.
item.matko:location: city centre 4 min, airport 20 min
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Venue is well suitable for private events like medieval theme events, show & dinner, b to b events, incentive groups, promos etc. Interior is medieval and castle-like. Capacity during dinner is 150 and 180 during cocktail. You can bring your own beverages but the catering is exclusively of Crepperie.
item.matko:additionalinfo: All services, from catering and evening programme direction to technical applications, are available.

item.title: The National Library of Finland
item.description: Exhibitions in the gallery and the Cupola Hall. The Library's main building is designed by architect C.L. Engel 1836 and was built in 1840-45. The annex is called the Rotunda and was built in 1902-06, architect Gustaf Nyström.
item.matko:admission: Free admission to exhibitions, lectures and concerts. Further information Inkeri Pitkäranta tel. +358-9-1912 2738, inkeri.pitkaranta@helsinki.fi
item.matko:groups: Guided tours 1 hour/40€; library Esko Rahikainen tel. +358-9-1912 2722, esko.rahikainen@helsinki.fi, gallery exhibitions Sisko Vuorikari tel. +358-9-1912 2671, sisko.vuorikari@helsinki.fi
item.matko:ingress: Exhibitions in the gallery and the Cupola Hall.

item.title: The People's Archives
item.description: The People's Archives maintained by the Social Archives Foundation is the central archives of the Finnish left-wing labour movement and popular organisations. The People's Archives was established in 1945, right after the Second World War to be the central archives of the Communist Party of Finland. The People's Archives collects, preserves, arranges and catalogues archives and other material related to the social and cultural history of the left-wing labour movement, popular organisations and the working class in Finland. There are actual archival material 3006 metres of shelving over more than 9600 record creators.
item.matko:services: Exhibitions

item.title: The Tiger
item.description: The renewed dance floor of Tiger is providing the best hit songs and club beats. On Fridays the program is brought to you by the best party promoters Finland has to offer, known from the world famous party island; Amnesia and Space. The other dance floor is offering the best of urban party music from hip-hop classics to the freshest R&B-songs.
item.matko:open: Fri-Sun 22-04. Age limit Fri-Sat 20 years, Sun 18 years
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The Tiger is a high class nightclub, which is located at the 5th floor of the shopping center of Kamppi above the rooftops of Helsinki.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The Tiger is also perfect for corporate- and business events. The nightclub can be reserved for private use outside the business hours.

item.title: Theatre Academy
item.description: Theatre Performances

item.title: Theatre Avoimet Ovet
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 18 km

item.title: Theatre Museum
item.description: In the Theatre Museum the exhibitions "Might and magic", "Arkadia theatre" and "The attic of the theatre" offer an excursion into the history of the Finnish theatre, the magic world of drama. Temporary exhibitions on themes and subjects tying in with the permanent displays.
item.matko:location: City centre 3km, airport 21 km. Metro to Ruoholahti, tram 8, buses 65A, 66A, 20, 21V, 15.
item.matko:admission: 2011: Adults 6€, children (under 15 years), students and pensioners 3€. One child free of charge together with paying adult.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, lift and Inva-WC. No wheelchair access to Arkadia theatre stage or dressing room.
item.matko:groups: Workshops and guided group visits, tel+358 (0)207 961 670. Group visits possible also outside normal opening hours. Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant services are available in the museum, also outside the opening hours.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Museum also suitable for private and corporate occasions. All spaces in the Theatre Museum are excellent for very unique banquets and receptions for 20-100 persons. We will plan together your party or event and make them look like you want; good food, theatre, acting, bands, guided tours, as you wish. Enquiries tel. +358 (0)9 6850 9127 or e-mail teatterimuseo@teatterimuseo.fi.
item.matko:services: Coffee automat. Parking close to the Cable Factory. Theatre museum can arrange for e.g. coffee/lunch to be served for groups. Museum also suitable for private and corporate occasions. Enquiries tel. +358 (0)207 961 670 or e-mail teatterimuseo@teatterimuseo.fi.

item.title: Tieteiden talo
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Näyttelysali 504: pöytävitriinit ja standeja.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Salissa 104 on flyygeli, asiakas maksaa itse virityksen. Lisäksi saatavilla äänentoisto, mikrofonit (myös langattomat) ja kuulosilmukka.

item.title: Tiger of Sweden Consept Store
item.description: A different cut.

item.title: Tiiliholvi
item.description: This spacious room with more than five metre high ceiling makes a nice setting for different kinds of parties and occasions. The space may also be used as conference room or for meetings. This seaside facility is located on city centre Helsinki at the foot of the Uspenski Cathedral. The venue is suitable for groups from 5 to 80 persons.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Fregatti Catering provides all the catering services. Notice: Own alcoholic liqueurs are allowed in the space. Fregatti delivers non-alcoholic beverages.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The space may also be used as an exhibition area.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Conference and meeting devices, stereos, cold-stores for beverages.

item.title: Tinttu.com
item.description: Tinttu.com - Fairytale Design by Petronella is a fabulous boutique offering a range of Hilarious hats, Childish childrenswear and Fabulous Fairytale interior design products.

item.title: Tivoli
item.description:
Located at Fredrikinkatu in Helsinki, Tivoli is a combination of high quality event venue and a spectacular nightclub. Tivoli is one of the most popular nightclubs in Finland and its special characters are first class lighting system and interior planned to the last detail.
On Saturdays, the music is brought to you by the most popular DJ's Finland has to offer, as for example the Heavyweight DJ's. On Fridays Tivoli provides events organized by external event managers. The entry fee costs 8 € on Saturdays, on Fridays the entry fee depends on the event and promoter. Invariably, free entry with the Membercard is not valid on Fridays.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: High quality sound- and lighting systems, 14 screens, 6 plasma screens, 15 video projectors, 200m2 dance floor and performance stage on which events can be projected on screens with cameras.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The sales services of Night People Group are open mon-fri at 020 7759 814, myynti@npg.fi. Tivoli is part of Night People Group.

item.title: tm-galleria
item.description: Focusing on Finnish Contemporary Art, the Finnish Painters' Union's gallery has a versatile profile. There one can also become acquainted with the various portfolios of the union's members, as well as see specialized portfolios, such as for portrait painters.

item.title: Toscanini
item.description: Toscanini - A taste of Italy on Bulevard! Welcome to enjoy our delicious new portions such as Crostinis of the house, Tagliolini with tiger prawns, mussels and crayfish or Bistecca al Rosmarino served for two.

item.title: Toyota Climbing Arena
item.description: The biggest wall climbing center in the Nordic countries!

item.title: Traveller's Home
item.description: The Traveller's Home reception is located in the city centre. Traveller's Home offers reasonable priced accommodation in homelike apartments which are located in downtown Helsinki, about 50-1000 m from the reception. The rooms are equipped with TV, microwave oven, water and coffee cooking facilities. Toilet, shower and towels are available.
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:open: 1.1.-31.12. opening hours 14-18, other times by agreement
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 3 apartments for 1-2 persons, 2 apartments for 2-4 persons

item.title: Tropicario - tropical animal house
item.description: Experience the adventure in the world of snakes and lizards. See the worlds most poisonous snakes, look into the eyes of giant multimetre snakes. See the giant monitors basking or water turtles swimming and spiders waiting for next meal. This is the biggest tropical zoo in the Northern countries.
item.matko:location: Metro to Sörnäinen, trams 1, 1A, 7A, 7B
item.matko:open: Mon-Sun 10-19; last admissions 45 minutes before closing time.
item.matko:admission: adults 12€, students and pensioners 10€, children (4-14 yrs) 8€.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible with wheelchair
item.matko:groups: Groups (min.15pers.) 10€/pers. Guided tour 50€/1h. Inquiries and bookings tel.+358-(0)9-750 076 or tropicario@tropicario.com
item.matko:ingress: Tropicario is the biggest tropical zoo in the Northern countries.

item.title: Tuomarinkylä mansion restaurant
item.description: In the splendid mansion environment in Tuomarinkylä in Helsinki, shadowed by huge linden trees, the restored "Salon" ballroom of the manor functions as an elegant A la Carte and order restaurant. The ceiling high up, carried up by massive timber beams, provides the restaurant with a unique interior from the late 18th century. Here you can enjoy delicious French- Finnish meals provided by appreciated chefs and excellent service.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Ikkunalliset kabinettitilat ja hyvin parkkitilaa

item.title: Töölö Church
item.description: Töölö church was built in 1930 and it was designed by prof. Hilding Ekelund (1893-1984). The church seats 500 persons.

item.title: Töölö Sports Hall
item.description: Swimming Hall, sauna, gymnastics, ball games

item.title: Töölö Sports hall
item.description: Töölö Sports Hall, previously an exhibition hall, was completed in 1935 and served as a venue for concerts, banquets and sporting events. Nowadays the multifunction hall is used for a wide variety of sports training purposes and for competitions in basketball, volleyball, fencing, boxing and gymnastics. The Sports Department also has its offices on the premises.
item.matko:services: Café, meeting facilities and sauna (reservations tel.+358 (0)9 310 87800)

item.title: Töölönlahti Bay
item.description: The park around the Töölö Bay begins in the heart of Helsinki. The Winter Gardens, Boasting hundreds of plants, are located at the north end of the bay. Wooden villas along the shores are a reminder of Helsinki's history. The Töölö Bay is a treasure especially for bird watchers.
item.matko:ingress: The park around the Töölö Bay begins in the heart of Helsinki.

item.title: UFF
item.description: U-landshjälp från Folk till Folk i Finland rf (UFF) is an independent non-profit non-governmental humanitarian organization founded in 1987. The objective of UFF is to give equal opportunities for all people. The shop on Fredrikinkatu sells mainly clothes and shoes for men and women, textiles for homes and on teh vintage-department clothes from the 70's and 80's for both men and women.
item.matko:location: Other UFF -stores in centre: Iso Roobertinkatu 4-6, Runeberginkatu 4 C, Hämeentie 4 & Mannerheimintie 104

item.title: Unicafe Ylioppilasaukio
item.description: Diner for students. Five different lunch alternatives that change daily. Salad and bread included.
item.matko:location: Ylioppilasaukio -square

item.title: Union Design
item.description: Union Design is a modern atelier workshop, which represents the finest traditions of handicraft culture. It is situated in one of Helsinki's most culturally noteworthy historic complexes - Whale court, in a building designed by Theodor Höijer in 1904. The client's imagination and wishes are, for the goldsmiths, silversmiths and jewellers of Union Design, the most highly valued raw materials. Such resources are the undeniable outset and goal for any crafted piece to succeed

item.title: Union Five /Kamppi shopping centre 5th floor
item.description: Union Five is clothing store that specializes in street fashion as well as in skateboarding and snowboarding apparel and equipments.

item.title: University of Helsinki
item.description: The Main Building of the university, designed by Carl Ludvig Engel, was completed in 1832. It is located next to the Senate Square in the heart of Helsinki's neoclassical centre, facing the Cathedral and the Government's Palace. The Fabianinkatu side was completed in 1937, before the war. The architect was J.S Sirén, who also designed Parliament House.
item.matko:ingress: The Main Building of the university.

item.title: Urho Kekkonen Museum Tamminiemi
item.description: Tamminiemi Villa is located in Meilahti adjacent to Seurasaari museum island on a beautiful park estate which used to be President Urho Kekkonen's official residence during his period in office between 1956 and 1981. In those days it was known as the centre of Finland's political and governmental life. Tamminiemi is furnished the way it was in Kekkonen's time.
item.matko:open: Wed-Sun 11-17, guided tours 11-16 in Finnish, guided tour in English on Saturdays at 12.30.
item.matko:disabled: Lift available. Handicap toilet in main building as well as in café building.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours upon request. Also possible outside regualar opening hours. Inquiries and booking tel.+358-(0)9-4050 9650. Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English, German and Russian.
item.matko:services: Café Adjutant, tel. +358-(0)9-4050 9650, 20 seats.

item.title: Uspenski Orthodox Cathedral
item.description: Completed in 1868 in the Katajanokka district of Helsinki, the Uspenski Cathedral is the largest orthodox church in Western Europe. With its golden cupolas and redbrick facade, the church is one of the clearest symbols of the Russian impact on Finnish history.
item.matko:open: Tue-Fri 9.30-16, Sat 10-15, Sun 12-15. In summer (until 29.8.2013) Tue-Fri 10-19, Sat 10-15, Sun 12-15. Closed during church events.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair difficult. In summer an temporary ramp to make the church easier to access with a wheelchair.
item.matko:groups: Guide booking in advance, tel.+358-(0)207 220 683, languages: Finnish and English.
item.matko:services: Small souvenirshop.
item.matko:ingress: The Uspenski Cathedral is the largest orthodox church in Western Europe.

item.title: Uunisaari Island
item.description: Uunisaari Islands are located close to the city centre, offering a tranquil and relaxing seaside atmosphere. Close to the harbour, the islands are a short 3-minute boat ride from the Kaivopuisto Park beach. Winter time there is a bridge. There is a city supervised beach on Uunisaari for swimming. The Uunisaari restaurant offers a setting for special occasions, such as corporate events, weddings, celebrations, meetings and conferences. There are also sauna facilities.
item.matko:location: On an island, just off the Kaivopuisto park
item.matko:services: An attractive, fully-licensed restaurant, a café with a sun terrace and four saunas on an island off Kaivopuisto Park. The main building was renovated in 1999 under the supervision of the National Board of Antiquities. Red brick walls creating a warm and festive atmosphere. Open all year round. Ferry from Merisatamantori, 1.5-3 €.

item.title: Uutela Recreational Area
item.description: The park includes pine forest, rocks, bogs, shoreline, stately trees and an old arboretum as well as the "Uutela lagoons". The park was established in 1952 - 1953 and covers 71.5 hectares (total area 105 hectares).
item.matko:location: Eastern Helsinki, Southeast of Vuosaari, about 16 km from the city centre.
item.matko:services: 3 cooking shelters, toilet, well, parking place, hiking trails, nature trail with information boards

item.title: Valkosaari Shipyard
item.description: Genuine island atmosphere in the middle of Helsinki, at the Eteläsatama harbour by the Olympic terminal. Built in 1926 and located on the island Valkosaari, the shipyard is rented for festive occasions for private parties and businesses alike. Continuous, easily modifiable space is available for 100-350 persons. The end of the building opens up to the courtyard, where you can enjoy the view of the Suomenlinna island fortress.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Valtimonteatteri
item.description: Theatre

item.title: Vanhaa ja Kaunista
item.description: Finnish 20th century design - art glass, ceramics, tableware etc. by eg. Aalto, Franck, Wirkkala, Sarpaneva, Nyman, Toikka, Nurmesniemi, Gardberg, Still
item.matko:open: Tue, Wed and Thu 12-16 and Sat 12-14

item.title: Vantaa Art Museum
item.description: Vantaa Art Museum's exhibitions present contemporary art from both Finland and abroad. The focus of the collection lies on national art starting from the 1960s. Supplementary program is available for visitors of all ages.
item.matko:location: M-train to Myyrmäki. The art museum is situated at the Myyrmäki House by the railway station.
item.matko:open: Tue, Wed, Fri 11am-6pm, Thu 1pm-8pm, Sat 10am-4pm, Sun, Mon closed.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible entrance, a toilet and a lift for wheelchair users.

item.title: Vapiano
item.description: Italian fast food restaurant (German concept).
item.matko:location: I the vicinity to the Central Railway Station, in the center.

item.title: Verkkokauppa.com
item.description: Europe's largest 20 000 m2 home-electronics store and 24h/7 kiosk. Over 55 000 articles from over 1000 vendors. Store features for example Angry Birds shop, Canon ImageLab, Lego World and Teddy Workshop.
item.matko:location: Opposite to Helsinki West Harbour, use address Hietasaarenkuja 7 if you are using a GPS-navigator.
item.matko:disabled: Handicap restrooms and lifts.
item.matko:services: 24 h kiosk, gaming café, store, several restaurants, free indoor and outdoor parking, Finland's largest sightseeing terrace with real MiG-21BIS fighter and computer museum.

item.title: Vermo Race Track
item.description: trotting races

item.title: Vermon ravirata, Race track & Restaurant Raviini
Vihti Ski Center
item.description: Vihti Ski Center offers a wide variety of slopes for both alpine skiing and snowboarding only 45 minutes from Helsinki. Vihtiski is located at the northern side of Lohjanharju which usually means that we have snow even when the city doesn't.
item.matko:location: Vihti is 45km away from Helsinki via Turku highway.
item.matko:services: Equipment rental, cafè, ski school

item.title: Viirus
item.description: teatteri

item.title: Villa Achille
item.description: A seaside log villa with unique atmosphere located only 30 minutes' drive from the centre of Helsinki. Villa Achille's facilities accommodate 30-80 persons depending on the type of occasion. For meetings, theme days and evening gatherings. Villa is directly adjacent to a bathing beach.
item.matko:location: City centre 15 km, airport 20 km

item.title: Villa Aino Ackté
item.description: A two-storey timber villa built in 1877 by Commercial Councillor Henrik Borgström was for 40 years the summer home of the world famous soprano Aino Ackté. During 1986-88, the City of Helsinki renovated and restored the house to its original condition. From the beginning of May to the end of October, the house can be hired as a venue for small concerts, cultural events, meetings, seminars and private functions, and for rehearsals and music tuition. Max. 70 persons.
item.matko:location: City centre 11 km, airport 24 km
item.matko:services: The facilities include tables, chairs, a Yamaha baby grand piano, a piano, an electricer cooker (no oven), a microwave oven, fridge, freezer, and two filter-coffee percolators. A porter will be provided for the duration of all events organised at the villa. In the summer, the villa's jetty can also be used.

item.title: Villa Andania
item.description: Romantic Villa by the sea built 1919 for a merchant family. Villa is surrounded by sea on three sides, own beach and harbour as well as sauna. Good connections by car and by boat. 250 sqm in two floors, hall for 80 - 90 persons as well as smaller meeting rooms. Open all year round. Meetings, events, lunch and dinner programs as well as theme parties. Speciality archipelago and maritime activities summer and winter - archipelago safaris, island excursions, light house safaris, schooner cruises.
item.matko:location: City centre 17 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: No accommodation
item.matko:additionalinfo: Seaside sauna

item.title: Villa Angelica
item.description: Villa Angelica, situated close to Seurasaari, invites you to enjoy a cup of coffee and delicious pastries in a romantic villa environment.
item.matko:location: Bus 24
item.matko:open: The café is open October-March. In summer time only for private functions. Inquiries, tel. 0500-603 378.

item.title: Villa Gyllenberg
item.description: Villa Gyllenberg houses one of the finest private museums in Finland. Villa Gyllenberg is the former home of the Gyllenberg family. It was built in 1938 and extended in 1955. The art museum is specialised in Finnish art from the period 1700-1970 and in early foreign art.
item.matko:location: Buses 194, 195 from Elielinaukio
item.matko:open: Wed 16-20 and Sun 12-16. Closed in July. Other opening times for groups by arrangement.
item.matko:admission: Adults 5€, children (12-17 years), students and pensioners 3€.
item.matko:disabled: New gallery accessible by wheelchair, but not old part of premises. Inva-WC and lift in the gallery.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups upon request, also outside the openinghours. tel. +359 (0)9 647 390 (Mon-Fri 9-16). It is also possible to arrange a coffee break upon request.
item.matko:services: Café, seating c. 50, open when museum open. Shop, cards and art books. Car park.

item.title: Villa Vuosanta
item.description: Villa Vuosanta is situated in Vuosaari region in eastern Helsinki in a nature conservation area. The main building was completed in 1900 and it was designed by the famous Finnish architects Eliel Saarinen, Armas Lindgren and Herman Gesellius. The villa has its own sand beach.
item.matko:location: Vuosaari, keskustaan 17 km, lentokentälle 25 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Lodging possibilities for approx. 20 persons.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Catering from Base Catering, 09 - 877 6655, myynti@basecatering.fi
item.matko:additionalinfo: Possibility to bring own beverages (incl. alcohol). Wood-heated sauna by the beach for approx. 30 persons.

item.title: Villa Wuorio
item.description: Villa Wuorio is a magnificent log villa designed by Gesellius-Saarinen-Lindgren, the renowned Finnish architects. Located on a point of land in Hevossalmi, this magnificent villa offers stunning views over the sea. The versatility of the venue and the lush green grounds provide a unique environment in which to host a meeting, casual gathering or a garden party for groups of 10-500 people. The area is easily accessible both by land and sea. The premises can be used during warm seasons only.
item.matko:location: City centre 16 km, airport 18 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Venue is well suitable for private events, b2b events, dinners, cocktails, meetings etc. Catering services are provided by Fregatti catering. Own alcoholic beverages can be brought but the soft drinks can be arranged by Fregatti.
item.matko:additionalinfo: AV-services, cold storage for beverages, wood-heated sauna by the sea for 6-10 people.

item.title: Villipuutarha
item.description: The "Wild Garden" is a green oasis amidst the granite features of the Kallio district. Enjoy a deluxe breakfast in beautiful interior on Saturday mornings (reservations required), or begin your workday with a cup of coffee from as early as 7am. All the decorations are for sale.
item.matko:location: Kallio district, next to the sports field

item.title: Virgin Oil Co.
item.description: An Italian-American restaurant with the atmosphere created by the action in the bar and the club milieu of the live gigs forms an entity that will entertain you. The pizza is made in a wood-heated oven and the wine is straight from the cask. All this on three floors in the heart of Helsinki.

item.title: Virike-Aitta
item.description: Traditional wooden and other Finnish toys.

item.title: Virka Gallery
item.description: Virka Info and Gallery are housed at Helsinki City Hall. Virka Gallery arranges exhibitions and concerts. Virka Info provides information on the City of Helsinki and its services.
item.matko:services: WLAN and free access to Internet

item.title: Vogue
item.description: The only gay sauna in Finland. Three traditional Finnish saunas with swimming pool, bar, relaxing room and top floor terrace.
item.matko:services: Sport massage Fri-Sat 17-22, Sun klo 16-21.

item.title: Vuokko Shop
item.description: Vuokko Nurmesniemi is an internationally recognized and awarded designer. She's been designing her own collection since 1964. Before that she was creating the artistic line of Marimekko, when working as the company's head designer. The Vuokko collection, completed twice a year, concists of classic and timeless creations. Vuokko stores can be found not only in Helsinki but also in Turku and Oulu.

item.title: Vuosaari Canoe Center, Natura Viva
item.description: Canoeing courses, trips etc.
item.matko:location: Metro to Rastila
item.matko:open: Open 2013: May 11 - September 22. May: Mon-Fri 14-20, Sat-Sun 10-20. June, July, August: Every day 10-22. September: Mon-Fri 14-20, Sat-Sun 10-20.

item.title: Vuosaari Golf
item.description: Vuosaari Golf is a straightforward high quality golf course where it is easy to pop in for a game. The 18-hole course is located near the sea, so you can get there via the waters as well. Vuosaari Golf is a Scottish-style Links course that offers new challenges for an experienced player and good basis for training for a beginner.Vuosaari Golf is open to guest players and the season continues well into the autumn on the sandfilled course. Vuosaari Golf hosts courses in golf and the large range has room for everyone to practice on.
item.matko:location: Vuosaari

item.title: Vuosaari House
item.matko:location: In Vuosaari, metro connection from the city centre

item.title: Wanha Satama (Old Harbour)
item.description: Wanha Satama is a prominent venue for events of all kinds: Fairs and exhibitions, meetings and seminars, business events, galas, parties and banquets. All event and catering services available. Wanha Satama venue is a combination of old atmosphere and modern efficiency and technology. Restored 19th century warehouse building consists of 8 halls which can be used in different combinations, accommodating up to 3.000 participants. Each hall has arched windows, brick walls and old wooden pillars. The environment lends your event a dignified atmosphere and creates your customers added value. The professionals of Wanha Satama will help you with all the aspects of your event. The quality system of Helsinki Fair Ltd Wanha Satama is certified to meet ISO 9001 requirements.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min (0.7 km), airport 30 min (20 km)
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Wanha Satama Restaurants tailors all the catering services of events individually to customer's requests. BRASSERIE: Lunch restaurant, open during the weekdays and on request for private functions. GARDEN: Lunch restaurant, open during events and on request. LOBBY: Open on request during events and private functions. http://www.wanhansatamanravintolat.fi/en
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: 8 halls, total exhibition space 4.000m2.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Note: the halls have no fixed furnishings. The figures are thus the maximum areas and the halls are furnished as required.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Event planning & services, event coordination, AV and technical solutions, furniture solutions, exhibition planning & construction services, catering services, subcontractor services.

item.title: Wanha Satama Restaurants
item.description: Wanha Satama exhibition and fair centre is a unique meeting point that hosts a variety of events: meetings, conferences, fairs, exhibitions and parties. The unique setting in the beautifully restored 19th century brick storehouse makes Wanha Satama the perfect choice for any party.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min (0.7 km), airport 35 min (20 km)
item.matko:restaurantinfo:
BRASSERIE: Lunch restaurant, open daily 11 am and 2.30 pm.
GARDEN: Lunch restaurant, open during events and on request.
LOBBY: Open on request during events and private functions.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Events for up to 2,000 people or more will be tailor-made.

item.title: Wanhan Tanssikellari
item.description: Located in the center of Helsinki, Wanhan Tanssikellari offers food and ballroom dancing at the same time. On Mondays there is a DJ playing records. Tue-Sat the orchestras play music to dance to, from walzes to tango, except on Saturdays the music is more youthful with party- and pop/rockbands playing.
item.matko:open: Lunch Mon-Fri 10.30-14. Dance restaurant is open Tue-Wed 16-01, Thu 16-02, Fri 16-04, Sat 20-04. Grill is open Tue-Thu 16-22, Fri-Sat 16-24. Age limit 18yrs.

item.title: Wayne's Coffee Kaisaniemi
item.description: Wayne's Coffee coffee shops serve their own coffees, homebaked pastries and fresh food. The café offers internet access. See the other coffee shops on the internet www.waynescoffee.fi
item.matko:services: Internet and WLAN

item.title: WeeGee Exhibition Centre
item.description: The WeeGee Exhibition Centre is a cornucopia of museums, exhibitions and events - the biggest in Finland. Five museums: EMMA-Espoo Museum of Modern Art, Espoo City Museum, Helinä Rautavaara Museum, Finnish Toy Museum Hevosenkenkä and Finnish Museum of Horology, the art gallery Galleria Aarni, a museum shop and a café-restaurant. Things to see and do for people of all ages.
item.matko:location: Buses 106, 110T, 194 from Kamppi Terminal
item.matko:open: Tue, Thu-Fri 11-18, Wed 11-20, Sat-Sun 11-17. Free entry on Wednesdays at 18-20
item.matko:admission: WeeGee ticket adults 12€, students and pensioners 10€, under 18yrs and over 70yrs free entry. WeeGee ticket covers admission to all the museums in WeeGee House.
item.matko:groups: Guidebooking is from each museum separately. Prices and group sizes differ. More information:EMMA, tel.+358 (0)9 816 30493 (Mon-Fri 9-12), Espoo City Museum, tel.+358 (0)9 816 57052, Helinä Rautavaara Museum, tel.+358 (0)9 816 31435, Finnish Toy Museum Hevosenkenkä, tel.+358 (0)9 816 31830, Finnish Museum of Horology, tel.+358 (0)9 816 30520

item.title: Westerby Gård
item.description: High quality restaurant, manor house hotel and conference rooms situated in beautiful countryside surroundings only 45 minutes from central Helsinki.
item.matko:location: 55 km from Helsinki, 68km from the airport.

item.title: Western Harbour
item.description: There are daily connections from the West Harbour to Tallinn both by passenger ferries and by high speed vessels during open sea. Over three million passengers pass through the West Terminal annually.

item.title: White Hall
item.description: Conference and event location in the middle of Helsinki's most famous Empire buildings, right by the Senate Square and the Helsinki Cathedral. The facilities in three floors consist of the entrance floor reception lobby and 30-seat cafeteria, second floor 120-seat restaurant/cafeteria and the third floor ballroom and lobby. The ballroom is suitable for dinners for 250 persons, cocktail parties for 700 and seminars for 450 persons.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Access to the White Hall possible, easier entry Aleksanterinkatu 3. No access to the restaurant on the second floor or in the attic. Lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Foyer 130m2

item.title: William K
item.description: The beer restaurant William K offers a relaxed atmosphere.

item.title: Wimdu
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Wimdun verkkosivuilta löydät tiedot kaikista asunnoista, huoneista ja muista majoitusvaihtoehdoista.

item.title: WOA
item.description: Work of Art WOA offers top quality designer shoes and bags for ladies and gentlemen from the following brands: Salvatore Ferragamo, Moreschi and Luciano Padovan (Italian), Piatonna and Beatrix Ong (British), Aki Choklat and Julia Lundsten/FINSK (Finnish)

item.title: Ylioppilasteatteri
item.description: Amateur Theatre
item.matko:open: Office: Mannerheimintie 3 B, tel. +358 (0)9 656 969, open mon-fri 12-17

item.title: Yrjönkatu Swimming Hall
item.description: Built in 1928, Yrjönkatu Swimming Hall is the oldest public swimming hall in Finland. The architecture of the building is historically and artistically noteworthy, representing a fine example of Classicism. You swim in Roman-style baths and can even do so naked! There are separate times for men and women. Voted for the best City Break Experience in 2008.
item.matko:open: Different times for men and women, please check webpages. Closed during summer season.
item.matko:admission: Different charges for different floors, please check webpages.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs. Lift, Inva-WC.
item.matko:services: Café

item.title: Yume
item.description: Yume introduces a brand new world with unique flavors, exquisite dishes, extensive sake and tea list, and an assorted variety of sushi in Helsinki. Japanese restaurant Yume brings you the latest in Japanese cuisine. Choose just one of the Japanese favorites or share an unforgettable dining experience with your friends and combine a variety of authentic Japanese dishes of your choice.

item.title: Yökyöpeli Karaokebar
item.description: A small karaokebar close to the Kasarmintori.

item.title: Zio
item.description: Zio specializes in designer and lifestyle shoes and bags. The boutique covers bags and shoes for women, men and children, as well as stylish and high-quality shoes for festive occasions. Selection includes brands such as Muxart, Pura Lopez, Sara Navarro, Camper, Wonders and Converse.

item.title: Zodiak - Center for New Dance
item.description: Zodiak - Center for New Dance is a unique performance, production and event center for artistic dance, as well as the regional center for dance in Helsinki. Zodiak presents the most interesting performers, performances and trends in contemporary dance.
item.matko:open: Office open weekdays 10-16. Closed during summer.
item.matko:admission: Adults 20€, children, students and pensioners 12€. Tickets also from Lippupalvelu.
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift does not meet the spatial requirements of a wheelchair, parking for disabled in the inner yard of the building, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux
item.matko:groups: School and pensioner groups (min. 10 persons) 17/10€/person
item.matko:services: Café open half an hour before performance. Restaurang Hima & Sali in the Cable Factory.

item.title: Zucchini
item.description: Popular vegeterian lunch restaurant. Also gluten-free and vegan dishes.
